BUT, did want to point out, we did the all day eat promotion, and found it to be very money saving.  It is on sale right now ($15 instead of $39).  But even at $39 still a good day.  Especially if there all day.  There are several good restaurants, and we found the wait normally to not be more than 10-15 mins.  You get a main dish, a side or desert, and a drink.  Small catch is that you can only eat once per hour, but even still at that, a good deal.  Most meals are about $15-20, so even eating twice pays for it, and eating 3 times you have save quite a bit.  
Other than that, good coasters, longest we waited was 40 mins, overall good experience.

MY FAVORITE PARK IN FLORIDA! We live in Tampa, bought fun passes and went over multiple times. I care less about Disney... If you like coasters, this is the place to go!! My favorite coasters are Sheikra, Cheeta and Cobra curse, which is my children's favorite (and they are only 6, 9, and 11 years old). Sesame street is also a nice place for little ones. I would strong recommend this park for all ages. Fun passes make easier and cheap to return. Enjoy!!

Busch Gardens es un parque de diversiones ubicado en la cuidad de Tampa. Cuenta con muchas atracciones y se destaca por sus montañas rusas. Fui a visitarlo ya que soy un apasionado de ese tipo de atracciones y no me defraudó. Pero la ubicación no justifica hacer el viaje desde Orlando cuando hay atracciones similares y hasta mejores en dicha cuidad. De hecho, 2 de las 3 montañas rusas de Sea World (Manta y Mako) superan a las de Busch Gardens. La que más disfrute fue Falcon's Fury que consiste en una caída de una torre de casi 100 metros de altura. Esta dividido en zonas con nombres de países de África y también tiene áreas de zoológico, aunque como no me interesan no les presté atención. Tiene un teleférico y un tren que recorre el parque. Además tiene juegos que te hacen acordar de viejas épocas y que se disfrutan mucho. Para los que vayan desde Orlando, hay servicio de micros gratuitos de la empresa Mears Transporation que son muy convenientes ya que permiten disfrutar del parque durante muchas horas. Tiene varias opciones de comida a precios razonables. Cuenta con un sistema de lockers muy prácticos que no utilizan llave (se ingresa un código) y permite utilizarlos en distintas zonas del parque por un máximo de 2 horas en cada locación. Lo malo como en todos los parques de la zona son las molestas interrupciones por lluvia.

Pretty chill amusement park and Zoo combined. I really wish they had the fastpass program here, you can buy a fastpass but we aren't staying that long. They sell a lot of amusement park fare and being Busch a lot of alcohol too.  Too bad I gave up beer for lent. 

You can get very interactive with the animals by feeding them and talking to the keepers. Either way you can't beat the weather right now.

My home park is the Busch Gardens in Williamsburg, VA, but I recently went to the park while in Tampa for a few days.  The landscaping in some parts of the park are outstanding, but in other areas (like beside Montu) it doesn't live up to the standards set in my mind by it's sister park in WBurg.

What this park lacks in landscaping in some areas is made up by the great attractions they have.  Kumba is a ride not to be missed.  It continues to retain it's smoothness while also being one of the most forceful coasters you'll ever experience.  It's fast and it keeps it's speed through the terrain.

One thing I can tell you is that the loaded cheese fries are awesome, but make sure you don't eat them near any birds, they will dive bomb your snack.

All in all, if you get a chance to make a trip here, do it, you won't be disappointed.

A wonderful mix of roller coasters, shows, and animal exhibits!  Truly something for the entire family.

The only down side was the poor organization in all of the food service locations.  Epic wait times all day long anytime you wanted to eat anywhere.  I also wish they had more vegan options.  Almost no vegetables on any menu.

I had an epic time there. Stayed from opening till closing. I did all the rides. Did the safari. Took pictures of the beautiful decorations. The shish kebab was off the chain. The workers were great. My day at Busch Gardens was like Utopia

Great time but  way overpriced! We spent over $500 for 3 of us for admission and the quick pss....a ton of the kiosks and attractions were closed and the park was pretty empty. Food lines were insane. My bf stood in a fast food line for 40 min and the food was undercooked and fries were hard. Don't do the all day food pass! Not worth it. Save ur $ and go to the zoo.

The park is quite good and the staff pleasant. Love that there is a wide variety of activities for different age groups and live animals. However, I would be remiss if I did not forewarn you that the park management leaves a lot to be desired.  From entry to departure we encountered issues that a good manager would have avoided.  It took us more than an hour to get in ...and I had bought an annual pass. We went through one line in Zone A to pick up and print my pass at a self-serve, then we had to go through another to get guest passes (cashiers were tied up dealing with questions - one couple took 15 minutes to sell 2 annuals) where two wickets were closed and then an unbelievable line for bag check where the attendant was looking in wallets, camera cases. Maddening. Arrive at the train station and only after a twenty- five minute wait we advanced ten spots to be advised that the next rain would be around 40 minutes. Only one train was operating on a spring break day when higher than normal winds shut down the skyride.  More maps need to be along the route.
Best rides cheetah hunt and montu!! lots of walking which its ok.

I have an annual pass for Sea World and Busch Gardens. The day after I bought the passes, they offered free Adventure Island passes for people who bought Fun Cards. Their website also said Adventure Island was, included, for annual pass holders. As an annual pass holder, I attempted, the collect my pass for Adventure Island, the CSR agreed that the website gave this pass to annual pass holders, but said there was no way to add this in the computer. He gave me info to contact corporate. Between my visit, and my email, the website was changed. Corporate told me, they were going by their website. Take a look at the pic, before and after.

I am pretty thrilled to add this update! Following my Yelp Review - which followed our family's first visit to Busch Gardens - I was contacted by the BG Customer Care team. They had some good follow up questions for us. Ultimately, we were offered a complimentary "do over" Day for our party of six. Yesterday we visited again, and Wow! What a Terrific Time! We did it all this time - Montu, Kumba, Cheetah Hunt, SheiKra, Cobra's Curse, Congo Rapids, Skyride and water flume. We found the BG staff to be friendly and helpful all over the park. We had a few tasty snacks too! All in all, it was a perfect day and I am a fan! Thank you Busch Gardens!

Despite my initial review on disability accommodations, after speaking to a guest services manager a solution was provided to work with my specific needs. You'll want to talk to a manager if you've got an individual with a form of Autism Spectrum Disorder or a similar disorder in your party, as the advertised accommodations may not help you.

This was the first time I had been to Busch Gardens in over 20 years (11/23/16).  The overall park was great; however, we purchased the All-day Dining package.  Using the Busch Gardens App to get around the park, nowhere did the app show the hours of operation for the various restaurants.  It just said "All Day".  Having spent the day waiting in lines, we had decided to wait until 5 p.m. To eat.  When we got to the Serengeti Restaurant it had closed at 5 and the Pub closed at 4.  We booked across the park to eat at the Zambia Smokehouse and got there at 5:28 p.m. The cashier told us they close at 5:30.  As it wasn't 5:30 she said they go off of their cash registers.  There were still people in line so we asked to speak with the manager, Christian.  He stood back and wouldn't come to talk to us so we walked back to him.  I couldn't believe how rude he was.  He was dismissive and as we started to walk away he said loudly "have a nice day" with a sarcastic laugh.  

We then went to the front where we purchased the passes and asked to speak with a manager.  We were told one would be with us shortly.  After standing there for 30 minutes and not one person acknowledging us we decided to just leave.  So disappointed in the service (being that they are in the customer service business), lack of concern and overall uncaring attitudes, (along with filthy restrooms) we will never be back.  Living only 2 hours south this is unfortunate.  

If you are going to visit, and don't plan to eat every hour, don't buy the All-day dining pass....and if you ever need to speak with a manager?  Well good luck.

I just don't care for Busch Gardens. Probably because I'm so spoiled as disney passholder, but maybe not. 

Gwazi, as others have said, will beat the hell out of you during the ride. This is really shotty workmanship. Shiekra, I don't do, I'm too scared and Yes I will readily admit it.

The animal exhbits are always nice to see but the politcally correct side of me screams out "what are those poor cheetahs doing out at 11 at night under a roller coaster of screaming people?!" "how many antelope died during transporatation here?" Oh..the horrors to be found when one looks.

So put that aside, the food is disgusting here, The drinks limited, although better then they used to be. 

The price, way too much for a small adventure like this. I suppose if your a coaster fanatic and want to ride them all day it might do, but really not more than that.

I have had an annual pass to Busch Gardens for most of my life.

I think that says a lot about Busch Gardens that a person can go there several times per year & still have a great time.
The park has change drastically over the years, which is part of the reason why I still have an annual pass. They are constantly changing & improving.

The Reasons Why Busch Gardens Rocks...
1. The roller-coasters are fun. SheiKra is a 90 degree drop roller coaster that is awesome & so much fun. The Montu is an inverted roller coaster with a lot of twists & flip. Kumba is a traditional roller coaster, but don't think traditional means boring. It is fast & has plenty of corkscrews & flips. I haven't been on Cheetah Hunt yet, which opened in 2011. There is also a new roller coaster I'm very excited about called Falcon's Fury. It just opened a few days ago & sound insane. It is like Tower of Terror in the sense that it drops quickly, but the cool part is that the riders are tilted 90 degrees facing straight down...Can't Wait!
Gwazi is the only one that I'm not a huge fan of. Seats are too small & it bounces my head around.

2. The zoo portion is great. I sometimes go for a couple hours & just look at the animals. The hippos, lions, and gorillas are cool because you can get up-close & personal thanks to some very thick glass. The Skyride gives a holistic view of all of the animals & the entire park. The have a wide variety of animals.

3. They have a good mix of roller coasters, animals, & shows. They have water rides too. It is great for big groups with friends & family. It is also great to pop into for an hour or two. Parking is never an issue.

4. It is centrally located in Tampa & very close to the interstate. It is surrounded by numerous restaurants.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

They used to have a brewery on site that you could tour. They also used to give free samples of beer (2 per person).
No more free beer is kind of a bummer.

Bottom Line: BG is amazing. Every time you go you will have fun. If you live in Tampa, you should definitely get an annual pass.
$20 for parking (and then 20+ min to get in), $100 per ticket to get in, and then you have to wait 60+ minutes for every ride you might want to ride.  What, exactly, is the point?

Pretty awesome park never been and a fantastic experience the animals were beautiful!, the rides even better! But one thing i will say is the staff around the park.. Slow and unorganized first off the food all day pass buy one get one i couldn't tell you how many times they messed it up and charged me twice lol. And then the quick Q pass, that you had to fight the regular lines to not even be directed to a row it was every man to themselves i mean if im gona be paying basically a second ticket i should atleast be directed or have correct organization, also it looks like you guys are a bit short of staff on the rides but pretty awesome park!

Awful inclement weather policy! Family of four, paid about $300 for tickets and in town for 1 1/2 days.  We arrived and stood in line for about an hour before it started storming and the ride was rightfully shut down. We waited in the queue for close to 4 hours thereafter waiting for the weather to clear up. Btw, no other ride was operating. The weather never really cleared up, no rides started operating during this time, and we left. We talked to information services about a refund and all that was offered were tickets for another day. That's nice and all if we had another day, but we don't. In essence, we paid $300 for nothing except waiting around for 5 hours. The service representative only could say "you're not the only one." Never again will I support Busch parks. This is unfair and a rip off.

Having an amazing time. Great rides! Cheaper than Disney and with a lot better rides. We came for the food and wine festival. Had awesome food and drinks. The only thing it's in a destination not through out the park.
Lots of rides, cool animal exhibits, and plenty of great food.  My teenage son loved it here.

Not as epic as Orlando, but a coaster is a coaster is a coaster. The water park next door brings many welcomed slides and that lazzyyyyyy river is always a must have! Blizzard beach has my heart though with that monster tall slide!!!!!!!

We visited Busch Garden's on our last but one visit to Orlando.


 We took the coach which only cost $10 roundtrip to Busch Gardens, and had pickup points along the International Drive area.


 As with most of Orlando's parks, it was very well maintained, and enjoyable to look around. We had a fun (yet tiring day), and would certainly go back to this one again in the future.

I have the 2yr pass.. I had it for a lil over 6 months... and I've been there 3 times or so. 

I love theme parks.. and I think Busch Gardens is a GREAT place! It has everything to do! IF YOU WANT JUST A ZOO... BG is not the answer. This place is more than that... 

It has world known roller coaster, and it's always growing. It has a kid section.. smokers sections.. great shows...

I love it! Specially when I have nothing to do... Its a great place to just walk around and chill... 

Food is pricey like all theme parks, but you can find ur regular theme park snacks.. 
Alcohol is ok.. (Duh its owned by a brewery) A beer is really good when its hot.

The rides are all nice, if you love roller coaster THIS IS THE PLACE. You are gonna find super smooth ones, and rough ones specially Gwazi. 

Overall I love it here.. and they have Christmas, Halloween, Winter and Summer theme days/nights !
I had an awesome first time at Busch Gardens. All the attractions were very good, can't wait to try the new attraction this summer !

Analogy time!  Busch Gardens Tampa is to Busch Gardens Williamsburg as Danny Devito is to Arnold Schwarzenegger in Twins.  It's Frank Stallone.  It's the hot chick's younger sister who's got a peg leg and a lazy eye.

The coasters looked interesting, but either hurt like hell (Gwazi, and I like the Cyclone in Coney Island), made me and my boy sick (Kumba) or were just boring (Sheikra).  Even on an empty empty Monday, it wasn't worth it as so many of the rides were just bad.  

Never to mentioned in the same sentence as Cedar Point or BG Williamsburg, even Six Flags Great Adventure in Jackson NJ is a bit better.  This park is just older, massively laid out with long walks from ride to ride, and the rides themselves are just less than good.  Sheikra looks cool and is great in concept, but once the first drop happens after the hang, it's very pedestrian.  Montu, on the other side of the world, is almost identical to Batman at Six Flags Great Adventure, which first came out in 1993.  

When entering Rhino Rally, the driver said "Lower your heads and your expectations"  I wish I had done more than that for the entire park.

If you want thrills, wildlife, great food and a fabulous time then make sure you don't miss visiting Busch Gardens in Tampa Bay. Great place for all the family, as there is much to do for young and old, couples, singles and those with children. Enjoyable time was had by all and the bbq food makes me feel like Homer Simpson, drool!

Great place to take the kids.  They offer a good mix of things to do for all ages. Their animals are treated with lots of love and care. They are never forced to do anything the don't want to. The rides are well maintained. It makes for an overall great experience.

Way too expensive for what you get. A lot of attraction were closed. No more beer tasting. The animals were cool that's why I gave them a three star. If you don't ride the roller coasters I suggest you go to a different park.. they closed at 5 but, shut a lot of shows down at 3. Very disappointed

I had a nice time here. With that being said I would never pay full price to get into the park. AAA offers member discounts along with a few other places. Spending such an enormous amount of money to get into a smaller amusement park is outrageous. From what I heard some days there are 2 plus hour waits for some of the rides. I rode every ride but I would never wait that long for any of them. Not a bad place to visit once. I probably won't go back it's a one and done type of deal.

I miss Disney, but the wife said 2 years of Disney passes was enough. So this year we will be at Busch Gardens a lot. This place has changed so much in my ten plus years absence. I miss the brewery and the Clydesdales, oh and Mick and Bud. Why would they get rid of Mick and Bud the dolphins?  Stadium priced beers suck! Two bottles of Budweiser for $14??? The animal exhibits are good, my favorite being the Tigers. The park is tidy, and the employees are nice.
 New for me is the "Bands, Brews, and BBQ" which is fricken wicked awesome. Last Sunday we enjoyed craft beers while watching Bret Michaels Band perform. It is a great outdoor stage for bands. Next we will see ZZ Top (for our 2nd time),and The Steve Miller Band. Smokey Bones BBQ was there making great BBQ. The ribs and chicken were fantastic.

My son enjoyed it here. We went early and avoided the crowds,although off season is a lot less crowded then the summer time. Some of the rides were closed d/t issues with the rides. I wish they would of had a sign up indicating that, prior to getting all the way there just to be disappointed. Overall,we did have a good time. You can make your way through the park in about 2 to 2.5  and hit all the rides with a few breaks in between,  if you get there early. We tend to not eat in the parks but on the way out we did get the dibs ice cream,which is pretty good.

this park has the biggest and wettest thrills you can imagine! the highlight of the park is the massive 200ft floorless looping vertical drop coaster (thats a mouthfull!!). it has the rides for younger children. the place is very clean and and the staff are freindly. the animals there are spectacular aswell. recomended for people who likes big thrills

Excellent day out, lots of rides to go on including an enormous roller coaster! Also lots of animals and birds to see and learn about. There's a train ride that will take you around the park. Fun for the whole family!

This park totally deserves 5 stars!


 The selection of rides when I visited around 8 years ago was vast and the sheer size of the coasters was amazing.


 I really enjoyed the animal part of the theme park, but the rides are even better


 Just beware that it gets really really busy, even during September term-time.

I spent many years as a season pass holder until the park changed hands.  Before the park changed hands, prices were reasonable and the parks landscaping was meticulous.  The park had a peaceful African Safari vibe.  Immediately after the park was bought the vibe changed to a carnival like vibe.    Prices went up and quality went down.  The condition of the park makes me think that no money is spent on maintenance.  Wood rotten and landscape not cared for.  The food has never changed and has always been marginal.  I gave the park another try and it has gotten even worse.  And when my family went to get on a ride the billboard was saying it was a 30 minute wait and the girl working at the entrance of the ride told them there was a 45 minute wait.  So they went to a kiosk to see what the cost was for a fast pass and not only was the pass not affordable but as it turns out the wait time was just 10 minutes!  The fake wait times being posted and told seemed like a scam to get people to purchase the 50.00 fast pass.  The employees that work the tram system are rude and treat people like they are breaking the law.  Not a good friendly vibe.   Everything in the park is dirty and low class.  The exact opposite of what the park was when owned by Busch.  I will never be back.

Word of warning to all here, this is not a dig at Bush Gardens as that was a great day out however terrential rain and thunder storms the day we meant closed all the rides so we went for a bite to eat hung around managed to get on a few rides, (the rides close when it thunders for obvious reasons) then thunder storms again so hung around a bit more then the park was closed. They gave people a free day pass to return but as with most people holidaying in florida your days are mapped out like a military operation which doesn't allow for a return in the hoe of a less thundery day.
I'm just glad we managed to get on a few rides and I am glad that I went as it was worth it, I do wonder how much business they must loose especially in the rainy season.

Park was ok. Roller coasters are definitely the highlight. All day food is a total rip off and falsely advertised. They limit food to only a few places that are thinly staffed and therefore time consuming. Even soda and water, which is available at those venues costs extra money (buy one get one free with all you can eat wristband). Definitely not worth $33.

I always enjoy my trips to Busch Gardens! A little expensive if your not a Florida resident though, but it does offer some amazing thrill rides! Kumba, Montu, Gwazi and Sheikra, excellent rides, not for the faint of heart! PS to Florida residents, Pay for one day and come back the whole year for free!

Well out the way of the other theme parks in Florida but if you have a car and like thrill rides definately devout a day to going down and giving it a vist. The newest rollercoaster Sheikra is hands down the most thrilling ride i have ever been on. Mix in a handfull of other big coasters and water rides along with the many animals on display and its great day out. Just a shame its not a bit closer to the rest of Florida atteactions.

A few decent rides when they're not broken (multiple were down during our visit). Most of the stores/concession stands were closed when we were there. The place is just downright depressing and is in dire need of an update. The service was pretty awful as well. Whoever runs this place should be seriously embarrassed. Despite the few decent rides, not anywhere near worth the money.
We had a fantastic time. I absolutely recommend it.

I have been living in Florida for twelve years, and had never been. I know.. you are thinking "WHAT?" but I love, love, love Orlando and its parks, Disney, Universal, Sea World... but I have a new found love for roller coasters (who knew?) and was told this was the mecca. 

Finally we made it here. We got in late - an hour before closing, so we got the tickets for the rest of the season and decided to roam around to get to know the park so we could hit it early the next morning. 

OK, call me an idiot, but I was walking around going "Busch?" and pointing out to my hubby that the logo to Anhauser - Busch logo was on the faucets in the bathroom (bear with me, we had been driving for hours, were tired and it was 8PM). We saw the documentary "Beer Wars" recently and I was like dude, is this an AB park? As I walk around with my Stone Brewery t-shirt that says "Fizzy Yellow Beer Is For Wussies".. I swore I was going to get kicked out. Who knew? Not me. 

So next day I carefully avoided said tshirt..... man, this place rocks. On Tuesday night we did try out Gwazi (not a fan, I realized I HATE wooden coasters) and Montu. Which is now on my top 2. LOVE IT! 

The park is very nice, you don't feel like you are in a 'park' most of the time. More like a zoo. Unfortunately the next day there was a tropical storm in the morning and flooded a couple of things so we couldn't go on the train or the Rhino ride, but hey - NO PROBLEM. 

I got to see the Clydesdales (they are soooo sweet), the animals, and we rode SheiKra, Montu (YAY), Kumba (awesomeness) and the sky ride. 

The park is virtually spotless, and the attitude of the employees is for the most part very good. The food as in any park is overpriced but hey, what do you expect. I do love a park that encourages beer drinking! 

The few cons though, getting around is a bit confusing and long, and the decor is very kitch Lion King 90's. 

Otherwise, I AM A FAN! I will be back very soon to ride Montu and Kumba.
This park is amazing for families. Great rides, great food, great entertainment and fun times. Howl-O-Scream is an amazing time as well. Check it out in Oct.

Really great amusement park
Clean, expansive, lots to do for all ages
Little Pricey- Price for a 1 day adult pass: $92 -Season pass $168
Season pass lets you into other parks; they are connected to Sea World parks

Food: Typical theme park stuff, plus their big buffet house inside the theatre has salads, sandwiches, pizzas, asian noodles, mac & cheese, burgers, turkey legs, desserts

You can purchase a souvenir Cup for approx $12-$13 and refills are $1
This is definitely worth it if you're going more than 1 time and you will bring your cup each time.

Popcorn buckets-worth it on the 3rd refill, or if you're a season pass holder

Adult beverages: many of the kiosks and indoor pubs have beers and also have wine and ANGRY ORCHARD for anyone who is gf, this is terrific

Gluten Free Options: besides the meat/salads they will make a gluten free pizza by request
They cook it inside a paper bag and give you a disposable cutter!
There are cups of fruit (orange, grapes, strawberry)

Shows: all around the show quality was pretty good
Stand-outs were: Ice Show (must-see) and the Animal Show ("Opening Night") pretty incredible

Lights for Christmas Town were very well done.

Cons for Busch Gardens Tampa: 
-Front Gate staff needs to be more friendly and more knowledgeable (know about sister season passes i.e.: Sesame Place)

-Although they do an excellent job with Christmas, There wasn't a SINGLE mention or decoration for Hanukkah.
One of the lines in the show is literally: "Merry Christmas, and Happy Holidays"
Not "and Happy Hanukkah"

Sesame Place mentions Hanukkah, most Christmas themed places will at least throw in a line saying "and Happy Hanukkah" so that all kids feel included.

Took my son and boyfriend here yesterday for thier birthdays and had a great time. Of course it was pretty empty due to being on a week day. The lines for the rides were less than 10 mins. Love seeing all the animals they have there. I have passes and it's a great way to spend a day just roaming.

This is our 2nd trip to busch gardens. The first time i thought why are we going to see a garden but boy was i wrong. This place is like a playground for both kids and adults. Theres a lot of roller coasters to choose from if your the roller coaster daredevil person but we went here with our 2 year old so we end up on the Sesame street section which he loved. He was able to meet the sesame street characters and take pictures with them and he got a lot of loot as well, although be ready to pay quite a lot as the items are expensive.  We also took the train ride which goes around the park but the view is probably better via the skyride.  

I recommend going to this park but if your kids are just toddlers or babies there nothing much to do but walk and look at the park,which to me is enjoyable but to others maybe a waste of money as the park ticket is expensive and you also have to pay for parking. 

We went to busch gardens in May and there was no line ups and not a lot of people. We go to Florida every year so next year we will be back again as we are always not able to see the entire park in a day.

We love BG! And Adventure Island!!!
A whole family is entertained, no annoying characters!
There are adult drinks, food, rides, shows!
The only complaint is to open EVERYTHING when we walk in the park as we had to wait for another hour for Elmo land side to open! 
Also, Safari truck ride should be included maybe not with giraffe feeding?! 
Full body dryers didn't work after we got out of the water ride.
Also parking, if we go to both parks in the same day, we should be able to pay for only one parking lot?!
Again, keep it well maintained with plenty of security!

I love this theme park, always have a great time here. Being a local, it is incredibly affordable ($13 a month for annual passes that includes parking) and always makes for a great day.
Some tips: 
-Quick Queue passes are available *inside* the park near the entrances of most popular coasters-so wait to buy one after you've arrived, you may not need it!
-Don't skip out on the entertainment-the shows are on par with that of Disney, really good productions
-***It rains in Florida in the summer*** Nearly every day! Don't be blaming Busch Gardens if it rains when you visit-your inability to plan and research is not their fault lol
-unless you are carrying a backpack or super large handbag, there is no need to rent a locker-all the big rides have cubbies on the loading platforms that can house small purses, fanny packs (please don't wear these tho-eww) hats, sunglasses, etc...
-have fun!!
Amazing amusement park! I highly recommend the ice show, without a doubt the best part of the park, tied with cheetah hunt of course!

More fun than disneyworld!!! A very relaxed Place with great roller coasters; but three of them were under construction ... that's why I only give four stars!
Very friendly staff
if your kids are into roller coasters and above 50" they will have fun! If they are smaller they better be into kiddie rides... of which there are plenty as well.

Great place to go and have a family day. They have the summer pass card where you pay one price and can come back all summer long. It was better when it was run by the busch family but since being taken over the rides are being updated or brand new. The animal part is great. Gwazi the wooden costed did it's last run last year and now sits to rot. Still a nice place for family fun.

Det här stället är så mycket större än vad man tror! Det finns nog minst 6 berg-och-dalbanor, Nordamerikas högsta fritt fall, 3 st "blöta" attraktioner och så mycket mer där till. Man kan åka safaritåg som tar en tur bland vilda djur och man kan även kika på krokodiler och massor med olika fågelarter.


Blev ganska besviken under besökets gång pga att...

- det fanns ytterst få bänkar runtom i parken, utan i stort sett bara på restaurangerna.

-  det fanns hyllplan precis bredvid attraktionen (ni vet efter kön precis där man ska kliva på), men man var tvungen att lägga sin handväska i ett myntskåp utanför ändå. Hur liten väskan än var fick den inte läggas i facken där uppe... Blev till slut mycket pengar som lades bara på skåp.

- På många skyltar in till restaurangerna står det ett "lockpris", som i själva fallet är endast för personer med förköpta typ "all inclusive"-kort. Nedanför i liten text står det pris som i stort sett 95% av alla besökarna måste betala. Så man blir lite lurad på så sätt.

- det var omöjligt att hitta! Kartorna som var utsatta var alldeles för få, och man kunde inte hitta en enda papperskarta någon annanstans förutom vid ingången till parken. Gick vilse så många gånger, och hade svårt att hitta personal man kunde fråga.

- öppettiderna sög. Usch vad besvikna vi blev när vi drog dit runt 12, och upptäckte att de stänger redan vid 18! Hade vi inte haft quickpasses (som kostade multum) hade vi inte hunnit åka mycket alls. Nu hade vi lite tur för parken var inte alls så fullsatt som vi räknat med men åkbanden kom till användning ändå. 

Men nog med negativitet. Någonstans bortom all kritik tyckte jag ändå om parken. Även om det fanns mest berg-och-dalbanor så var ändå varje unik. En i trä, en var supersnabb, en hade rikligt med loopar och en annan hängde man i bla. Jag gillar variation! 
På en restaurang hade de pizzabuffé/italiensk mat med tillhörande dessertbuffé. Inte helt tokigt när regnet forsade ner precis lagom till lunch.

Anledningen till varför jag är så himla kräsen är för att jag 2014 besökte Universal/Islands of adventures och det är förmodligen ingen park som kommer slå dom två. Men har man inte varit där kan jag förstå att man skulle tycka Busch Gardens var kalaskul!

Excellent day out, so much to do and see. Went on Sheikra firstwhy!! Didnt know what to expect, but couldnt wait to go on again. It is a very fast and exciting ride. They hold you for what feels like 5 mins above a vertical drop before pushing you off the top.Brilliant! Went straight back on and got on the front row.well worth it, very scary.
Other rides very good too, but this was the best.
Enjoyed the train ride through the animals, nice commentary all the way round. Bit of a long wait between trains though.
Very long queue for Log flume, and as you cant take anything on the ride, one of our party fainted from the heat, so take a bottle of water and throw it away before getting on the ride.
First Aid people were excellent though, very nice, polite and helpful.

I loved this place so very much! My family and I will return so enough. But, we will go back when it's not so hot. Customer Service was great! Park catered to my entire family ages 12-45years of age. Love the desserts too!

We tried to go I the Gwazi gliders with our Granddaughter today at 1:45 pm Thursday April 5th 2018. It had 2 riders onit and the gates were still open and the attendant hadn't sat down yet so we asked being they're was no one else in line if she could get on this round and her response was in a very rude tone I've already locked the rides and I don't feel like unlocking them again. I proceeded to ask her name when she bent down so I couldn't see her name tag so I said I would report her as I was walking away she says over the PA system Elizabeth again in extremely rude tone so I walked back over without her noticing to read her name tag and it clearly said Samantha not Elizabeth!! We've been platinum pass members for many many years and have never been spoken to and treated as rudely as she had acted and the worst part about it was in front of my Grandaughter that had to ask me why was she So mean!! Very dissatisfied and disappointed in her actions.. 

As I'm in line with my Grandaughter at the Merry-go-Round writing this review at 2:40 pm Krystal the attendant went out of her way after checking the ride and already locking the gates reopened the gate for a child that had walked up after she was ready to start the ride to let her on. That is great customer service and the type of Person that should be working around kids and the public.. Kuddos to you Krysal

Amazing amusement park great for all ages the best ride I went on was the Sheikra also the cheeta was really fun! My only advice would be to make sure you go on a day where it's not to hot or thundering, because if you go on a hot day you will melt when waiting for the ride, and they might close the rides when it's thundering

Busch Gardens is one of the BEST theme parks we've been to. Way better than that better known theme park in Orlando that begins with a D. They have a great mixture of rides and a zoo atmosphere with fun stuff like botanical gardens to boot. Everyone in the family has a blast here. So much to do it's very difficult to see everything in one day especially if its when tourists come down to visit. They lose a star because they charge way toooooo much to park and for food. Come on you charge an arm and a leg to get into the park do you really have to charge an arm and a leg for food and parking?

I had never heard of Busch Gardens before coming to Florida, and I was not disappointed! The roller coasters, especially Cheetah Hunt, were awesome! Even the carousel was fun! 

It was nice to be able to walk around the park and have a little bit of everything. If you wanted a break from high speed roller coasters, you could cool off in any of the water rides, and once you were soaking wet, you could walk around and see all kinds of animals (my favorite!) From cheetahs, to orangutans, to elephants to penguins! It was a great variety of things to see and experience! Great for all the family, and going during Christmas time was even better! 

Oh! And the food! The restaurants were exciting and the food was good quality. I've been to a number of amusement parks and nothing beats the food at Busch Gardens! Get the food wrist band! Worth every penny! You get to eat all you want whenever you want! AND it's food you want to eat! :) 

If you haven't gone to Busch Gardens, I highly recommend it! Just, be patient when trying to take the tram back to your car. Remember, we're all feeling the same way!

This place has gotten a lot better over the years.  Admission for adults vary depending on the discounts you can find. AAA, Florida resident or Season passes are the best deals if you're into it.  They also hold special events like Howl-O-Scream for Halloween.  I've been a couple times after hours when they close the park for private corporate employee, friends and family.
Now filled with some great rollercoasters, it is definitely a local attraction. Sheikra, Kumba, Gwazi, and Montu being some of the newer ones. All giving you a different kind of roller coaster thrill.  
The zoo portion it fairly attractive and strange to  have in the middle of Tampa, but what the hey?  Its a very kid friendly park with great shows.
The only complaint I ever had was how bad the area smelled late at night (3-4amish) when they are brewing the beer. eew.
Had a great time. You will get soaked on the tidal wave ride and the river rapids ride.

We decided not to go there, because we do not support to make animals life a misery!
Owned by Sea World and earn money with the pain of animals is not what we want to see.
We take the money and spend an excellent day at the beach!
Love that it's close wish they had a phone app with maps, showtimes, and wait times for rides.. otherwise we go often and have a great time!

I have season passes, what else can I say.... I have been going to the amusement park majority of all my life (since school back in the late 80's, early 90's) and never had a dull moment. Everything you want in a amusement theme park and more..... I can't forget the safari feel of the environment.

I liked it. It was less pressure than Disney and did not seem as expensive. Military families get in for free!! At 80 dollars per person that is a great and much appreciated discount. The animal displays were amazing....I have never been so close to lions and hyenas before. Did not do the rides because we were with our small child.  Unfortunately he was a bit too short to thoroughly enjoy the sesame portion of the park. Overall it was a very enjoyable experience.

Incredibly expensive.  Basically roller coasters, a few animals, and kid stuff but not enough to keep kids busy all day. Very much liked the dedication to Christ on Christmas.  They have a beautiful manger scene with everything made out of live plants.  Really nice.  And they have a great 3 Wise Men exhibit.  The Christmas lights are lovely.  Glad I went once, but wouldn't go again.
A decent amusement park similar to Disney, Universal or even Alton Towers in England. It also has the dubious honour of having the Budweiser museum, tasting and shire horses.

Busch gardens is my favorite park. As a florida resident i have been to all of them.and if your looking for fun this is it. Prices are great, if your going at a high volume time invest in the quick queue to skip lines. We paid 250 each for year quick queue passes and 100 each for the fun card which is a 12 month pass for the park. I also reccomend the all day dining deal for 32 whoch allows you to eat a full meal hourly and drinks are unlimited. Ill attach pictures of some of the meals we ate. Our food total for the day was 200 of having paid only 32 each was well worth it. Just make sure you go on a dat where they are open till 9 or 10 and dont forget cafes start clos8ng an hour before the park does so plaj your meals accordingly. L If your getting fun cards dont forget parking is 18-20 extra so have one family member get an annual pass so you can get free parking.
The rollercoasters are awesome my favorites being sheikra, cheetah, and scorpion. But really theres something for everyone there. All ages would have a blast. The critters show is my favorite we watch it everytime. The animals are always nice to look at too. The sky ride is fun to do aswell and a great way to save some walking.

I absolutely love this place!!!! It's perfect for families or by yourself,especially when they do their Halloween events it's perfect for groups.i will say the drink and food prices are on the expensive side,but you can pack sandwiches and water.just a wonderful atmosphere.

By far the best amusement park I have ever visited.  I have been to many parks but this park has some awesome roller coasters like, SheiKra, Cheetah Hunt, Montu, Kumba and the soon to open Cobra's Curse!  I can't wait to ride that new coaster.  This park is fantastic!!

Great roller coasters here! Lots of locals. I purchased a safari (+ ~30$) in addition to our day at Busch Gardens and it was amazing. We got VERY close to giraffes, fed them, and they even kissed some of us :)

Unfortunately we lost our camera at this theme park. We filed a claim and if they find the camera, they would send it back to us for free, which is really nice of them. They ended up finding it, but it was smashed and the memory card and battery was missing :( All I wanted was the memory card because my entire trip was on there. 

Their "fast pass" system can use some improvement though. For about 30 (I think , I kinda forgot the price) you get to cut the line to all their major rides just once and if you want to cut the line an unlimited amount of times you have to pay more.

I visited in early June and arrived when it opened. We purchased the fast pass thinking it was going to be extremely crowded. It was a waste of money. It did seem crowded but the lines were of no wait (barely any) for most of the rides. The only ride you would REALLY need it for is Shreika which  had the longest line. Should probably ride that one first :)

This is the first visit to a Florida theme park that I was able to relax.  Usually you are in a hurry to get there and then in a hurry to complete everything in the park to find out you were exhausted for your efforts and possibly frustrated that you did not get to something.  This time I had an annual pass and would so recommend this option because I realized once I got into the park I did not have to worry about lines or getting to everything.  If something was busy or I got stuck in an area I could always come back the next time I felt like it.  I purchased a two year annual pass that includes parking and everywhere I went in the park I was offered an additional discount on my purchases.  I figured that in the two years I needed to attend the park 3 times to beat the regular admission price.  Which means I can treat it like a park and visit when I want.

The blessing of the day was it was still relatively cool for Florida and the animals were out and about all day.  In the past I had always really considered Busch Gardens a rollercoaster theme park.  The animal exhibits both in the animal area and the ones mixed in the park near the rides really provides a top notch zoo experience with a wide range of animals.  One future event that I have in mind is they offer an encounter with the animals where you get to go out in a truck and get up close  with some of the bigger animals for an extra fee.

This is definitely a side of Busch Gardens you need to experience.

the most best theme park iv been to that has the biggest rides any where. it has the classic woodys and the biggest looping floorless vertical drop coaster in the world. the place is very clean and the staff are really freindly and it is a must go in florida

Busch Gardens is great.  I love their dedication to not only animals and educating the public, but their awesome array of rollercoasters.  You will not find a theme park with more roller coasters than Busch Gardens in the Orlando/Tampa area. I felt that I would need a solid 2 days to see everything, but we also went during Christmas break so the place was packed.  We only went on one rollercoaster since the lines were so long but it was definitely worth the wait. Cheetah Run is totally badass. Sheikra looks really scary too and was one we wanted to go on when we returned. If I was here on vacation I would seriously consider paying for the quick passes because the lines were so long.  Since we have annual passes we will be back but in the off season when we won't have to sit in lines all day.

It's my first time coming here and I leave with a really bad experience from here Really bad service I came all the way from Austin Texas to enjoy the day here at Busch  gardens with my family and there was a rain that lasted 20 minutes then they closed all the rides for 2 hours and 30 minutes am since their policy says no refunds due to weather they should at least open the park for a little longer when this situations happen to keep all the visitors happy but since they don't do that this place get this bad review if I could I would give them no stars not even Disney world does this kind of things
Nobody was able to help me with the lockers.... I used a wrong card and I wanted to cancel but the machine charged me anyway so I paid twice! I asked many workers and nobody helped me.

4 stars for the zoo aspect of this. We did the African safari tour, which is extra money but worth every penny. You walk around with a zoo keeper that takes you face to face with many of the animals there and further teaches you about them. And we loved the free train ride through the safari. It's the closest way to all of those amazing animals that they have there. Loved all of those events, it was a blast. However, we found the rest of the park quite trashy, but that was due to the people not the actual park itself. Definitely recommended to go for the animal aspect of the park!

the best thrill park in the world it has all the rollercoasters you can get from the worlds longest inverted coaster to the worlds firstlooping floorles vertical 200ft drop tower!!!!! it isnt much for the kids but teens love the thrills. some rides are for the littluns but its got the thrills more it is a must do at florida and i recomend it anyday to anyone. you should really consider going there

Chose the day that would be quiet. Locals back to school and cloudy weather. Brits either coming or going home but I am sure a busy day would not have been too bad here. 

Food abysmal and expensive but that's a theme park for you. 

Very naughty to say you need photo ID when it was not required

But clean, neat, pretty and some awesome rides. Better views of animals than the national zoo in DC!

Important:
1. Don't waste $7 on a locker. Just get one near a ride for 50 cents. 
2. Buy ticket through adventure island site for best deals.
3. Take/ buy one souvenir cup and fill that all day and share

I went here is a child about 30+ years ago so wanted to revisit it. Just as fun as I remembered. So many amazing animals with lots of room to roam. We did the Safari where we got to feed the giraffes - and that was awesome. We also paid the six dollars to feed the kangaroo but they were so lazy and sleepy it's hard to get them to eat but so fun to be in there with them. Rides where great too!! Just tough sometimes in Florida with all the rain as a park kept shutting down all the rides due to lightning in the area but glad they kept us safe. I did the tickets online included the parking and the premier parking was only $22.50 - regular parking was $20. Definitely worth the extra $2.50!
ALEXANDRA on giraffe safari was AWESOME! :)

The rides are really good although I was quite disappointed that the Serengeti Train was closed, as I was looking forward to seeing most of the animals that way. We took the Skylift hoping it would compensate, but it sadly did not.  The exhibits which were open were good, although the entire park is showing its age and could use a bit of a facelift. As far as rides, Sheikra from the front seat was truly awesome and Montu's loops were too!!!  We also loved the water rides, although as I write this, an hour after park closing, I am still wet because I truly got soaked! It was also not crowded at all and we had only a 5-10 minute wait for most rides.  We  experienced a lot of food stands and such closing down as with SeaWorld, so that was a bit of an annoyance, but the refill deal is decent. Customer service was pretty good and friendly enough. Our kids said it was a LOT better than SeaWorld and appreciated the shade, mist, and benches throughout. I can tell you that it is not as awesome as I remember from years ago, but could certainly get back to that with a little work.

The rides are fun and its cool to see the animals but the locker system is horrible. They close all the rides even though theres pure sun in the certain areas. The park system is disorganized and some workers are not helpful. Customer service is horrible. Attendants are not helpful and neither are guest services or the call center teams. Wont help you in any way with refunds or concessions.

Really bad service I came all the way from Austin Texas to enjoy the day here at Busch  gardens with my family and there was a rain that lasted 20 minutes then they closed all the rides for 2 hours and 30 minutes am since their policy says no refunds due to weather they should at least open the park for a little longer when this situations happen to keep all the visitors happy but since they don't do that this place get this bad review if I could I would give them no stars not even Disney world does this kind of things

$20 for Parking, $89 for entrance fee, $10 for a 12x12 locker, $6 for a .5oz of sugar water to feed their Parrots. Very few air-conditioned places to duck into and very limited places to sit in the shade to rest (I guess they need you moving to gouge you more).  Remember, this is Florida.  This place gouges you coming and going and for the quality of the place, I'd say major rip-off and disappointment.  I'm surprised they let you bring water into the place but they search your bag for food or flavored drink$.

Another example of how Busch Gardens produces theme parks far above the national average. Every one of their parks is beautiful, convincingly themed, and packed with amazing rides.

The roller coasters are all first-rate: Kumba, Montu, Gwazi, Scorpion, and the newest (which, alas, was added after my last visit) Cheetah Hunt. I found all of them to be thrilling, not too rough on the head or neck (as some coasters can tend to be), and well run (keeping lines to a minimum).

Outside of the roller coasters, there are dozens of other thrill rides from the usual suspects you'll find everywhere else to unique safari-like rides you'll only experience here. There's a really cool safari-gone-awry ride that I enjoyed a lot.

The African theme is well handled and carried throughout the entire park, and actually turns this into a dual theme park/animal reserve. That ensures that even those who aren't fans of thrill rides will have plenty to do and see.

Busch Gardens Tampa is a great park with great rides, definitely worth a visit any time you're in the area or in the mood for an amusement park outing.

Very fun!

When we first got there it was freezing! After getting off the first roller coaster I thought my hands and face were frozen. 

Things warmed up and I enjoyed myself very much. Although a lot of things were closed in the park. Half the park was empty. So I didn't have to wait to get on or wait to see any animals. The gorillas were amazing : )

Loved it! Great place.

Best park I have been too. I am not that much of a "park person" but we went on a good day hardly any lines the rides were awesome, especially the roller costers! 

I am usually not one for animal sancuarys because it makes me feel terrible seeing animals caged, but their set up is wonderful it seems as all the animals have tons of space and clean enclosures its wonderful, i got great views of the tigers, lions, and orangatans which are all my favs to watch!

The best part was I got to feed and pet kangeroos! it was awesome I will never forget it, they are soo soft!:)

one complaint which im sure is a give away, the food is overpriced and its not good! dont get the pizza by the lion king stadum...its yuckayyyy!

:)

Busch gardens is a them park in tampa. it is wuite a drive if you are staying in the orlando area - about an hour+ but it is well worth the journey. They have a lot of reall exciting rides as well as a safari trail with lots of animals to see. They have some of the biggest turtles I have ever seen. plenty parking with the usual trams to take you right to the gates. Quesues here are not al long as the ones at disney but the park is still busy.
Love BG... zoo, rides, animal interactions, feeding the giraffes and kangaroos.. every florida tourist should spend a day there

Busch gardens is fun and entertaining for the kids and family, It's worth going and riding on every ride they have. The Cheetah ride is so fast, and those so many turns that at the end of the ride it left me marks on my shoulder. Other then that, everything about the park was good!

Very cool park with lots of animals.  I like how you were able to get a lot closer to the animals than at Disney's Animal Kingdom.  Really great rollercoasters but there aren't too many "normal" rides; it's nice to have something educational when you are looking for a bit of a break.

The food is also better here than at Islands of Adventure or Universal Studios.  Makes the all you can eat day pass that much more worth it.

My boyfriend and I have annual passes. We get access to Busch Gardens, Adventure Island, and Seaworld. There is a small, and very affordable monthly payment, and no down is required! If you are a theme park enthusiast, I highly recommend getting this. It's called E-Z Pay. 
Along with entrance to the parks year 'round, pass holders get preferred parking. This is awesome because no one wants to get out of the park after a long hot tiring day of riding coasters to have to walk a mile or two to your car. Preferred parking leaves you basically in front of the theme park entrance!
The customer service here is AMAZING. All the employees and managers are understanding and want to accommodate you so you have the best experience possible. We went one time and it was raining cats and dogs so all the rides were closed. Worst part? We had purchased Quick-Queue tickets. Busch Gardens had NO problem issuing us a credit to get new ones on our next visit. (Unlike SeaWorld who has NO customer service and refused to credit us or give us our money back).
Okay, onto the adventures and rides! Their roller coasters are SICK! I love them all! Montu is all crazy twists, Cheetah is fast and all over the place (I love the side to side simulation as that of a predator running after its prey), Sheikra has a TERRYFING 90 degree drop, but after it you will LOVE it, I promise! That's just 3, there's many more! 
Everyone seems to love Falcon's Fury except for me. I don't do drop rides! But my boyfriend always loves the thrill of riding this one.
Cobra's curse is new and I had the awesome pleasure of riding it recently!!! The entrance and wait area are amazing. They don't have anything like this in Busch Gardens. There's all sorts of fun things to read and look at. The ride itself was too short. :( But it what we did experience was nothing we have ever experienced before!!! It goes up, sideways, backwards, all ways! It was definitely a thrill!
Of course, there are also many rides, playgrounds, and shows for the little ones, including a Sesame Street performance!
I love that they sell all sorts of beer. This just makes the experience THAT much better. I'm not a huge fan of theme park food, but I have to say that their food isn't all that bad!
Then, they have special events every now and then like Howl O Scream, Food and Wine, and Summer Nights, where they open Gwazi park and there is a giant stage with incredible entertainment!

You get what you pay for. While it may seem Busch Gardens is a better deal than Universal Studios and Disney the upcharges, subpar park, and poor customer service prove otherwise. After visiting Busch gardens probably 50 or so times in my youth they have instituted a mandatory locker policy for all loose items. This is becoming standard for the industry but while universal and other theme parks offer free rentals for your time on the ride, Busch Gardens has seized the opportunity to upcharge you by $1-2 a ride. They claim this is a required by their rides' manufacturers but I find it funny that the rides I rode as a kid 100s of times,which still have areas for you to place your belongings when you enter, now suddenly require Busch Gardens to milk a few extra bucks out of you.

The park itself is in poor shape. Numerous rides are down due to maintenance issues with no communication to guests about when or if they will be up working again. Of course Busch Gardens offers no refunds on the bags that you are paying to have locked up so you can stand in line for a broken unrideable ride. Hey we have your money the rest is on you seems to be their go to response.  In fact, their customer service is pretty atrocious. We came to the park to attend a concert during their food and wine fest. The tram operator stated that the concert started at 7pm. When we asked why the website said it started at 530 he stated that that was when you could start grabbing seats but that the show itself wouldn't start until 7. Imagine our surprise when we arrived at the concert area at 630 to find the band we made the trip to see finishing their set. We were pretty furious about the situation but received nothing but generic responses from Busch gardens. 

The food and wine fest in particular is a huge rip off. Their sample sizes are incredibly small and at $6-8 a pop the cost is absolutely absurd. They have a sampling pass that brings the cost down to around $5 an item but are you really getting a good deal spending $5 on bottled water or a soda?

In short, I'm sad to see one of my favorite theme parks of my youth run in to the ground due to greed and a general disdain for the customer. Luckily there are plenty of other great options in Florida.
Really nice park, lots of space in the park. Its a real white knuckle day. The park is in a weird location, in the middle of tampa bay.

Hadn't been to BG for about 14 years and will probably not make the trip again.  Animal habitats all looked average which was sad. It was actually depressing. Don't bother paying for all the add ons, just not worth it. 

Maps are a complete joke!  Hard to follow and very little information about what's in each area. Plus the print is so small!

All about the roller coasters and not the animals anymore. Tram and train were good but that's all we ride. 

We had lunch at the barbecue  place and it was very good but you had to yell to get your order heard and condiments ( salad dressing and barbecue sauce were impossible get. 

Staff was very friendly throughout the park and very polite. 

Trash cans were overflowing by 1:00 and got worse throughout the day. 

Highlight of the day was seeing the Frankie Avalon show. He was very interactive with the audience and still has great moves for a 70 year old man.   Truly had it not been for his show I would have felt the day was overpriced. 
 If you like Roller coasters then try it but anything else, save your money.

EZ Pay Scam!!!
Do not sign up for their EZ pay service!!! They continued to charge me monthly after sending me an email stating my passes were going to expire. I did not renew and they continued to charge my credit card monthly from september of last year until 3 days ago. They never sent me new passes, emailed me a confirmation of renewal, sent me a receipt for the new charges or otherwise indicate at all that they will keep billing my card. Even after I emailed them they waited 7 day to reply so they could charge my card one last time!!! I called to have them refund the money and they refused even though I never went to the park after my passes expired. They are hoping you will forget to call to stop them from charging your account after the year pass expires and probably make a ton of money with this shady practice of peoples oversights. It makes me sick that a family orientated company of this size would resort to this kind of snake-like behavior to make an extra buck off the backs of working people trying to do something nice for their kids.
Boycott this place and let them know they are crooks!!! Spread the word to your friends and family.
Very disappointed ride lines were very long and food was not that good and cold. And the prices were outrageous example a bottle of water was $3.00

I have never really been an amusement park person until I moved to Florida a year and some change ago. I think previously in my 20 plus years of Adulting I have been to maybe 5 amusement parks. In the last year I have been to Busch Gardens at least 6 times.  I love this place!  The rides are endless.  Yes there are lines but the rides are fun! The park is huge.  So it's not only a park but they have shows, special events, and a zoo!  The have this cool train that takes you all over the park to make navigating it easier.  They have so many different animals.  There are benches for the old or old and/or tired like me all throughout the park.  The different themed areas are cool too like Egypt and Congo.  Lots of food and shopping there as well.

I don't remember when was the last time I had this much fun at a theme park.  But ok, I think we were EXTREMELY lucky.  First of all, my husband and I have annual passes.  So we basically know that we can walk out of the park if the line was too long, gets too hot... start raining etc.  Anyways, we went the weekend that the weather forecasting a huge storm coming lol... but it didn't bother us cause we were gonna be in Tampa that weekend anyway, and we figured, it it starts to storm, we'll just leave the park and come back another time.

Ok, that out of the way, the day we went, the weather was BEAUTIFUL.  We got there when the park opened its doors, so we were among the first to go in and get on any rides we want.  And with the weather forecast and school just started, there were hardly anyone there.  The line was less than 20 min at most!

We are both huge roller coaster fans, so we, of course, went on all the major rides and then went on them multiple times.  The roller coasters were soooo much fun.   Our two favs were the Cheetah (for it's smooth and quick speed ups) and SheiKra (hanging and dropping straight 90 degrees).  We must have gone on both rides about 3-4 times each.  For both rides, especially the SheiKra, it's well worth the wait to sit first row/cart.

Our annual passes ran out, but I think we'll have to revisit Busch Garden in the future.

Had a good time. Great idea in having a full zoo in the theme park. The elephant walk and obstacle course was great as the trainers were very knowledgeable and interactive. Did not venture on to the roller coasters as was with two infants but they looked awesome. Will definitely come back.

This place is the best! We came to Florida for a short vacation & I had promised my daughter a trip to Universal Studios. I had no idea it was going to cost over $600 for us just to walking the gate. That was just not a option. I was so glad to come across website for busch gardens. She perked right up after looking at all that was offered there. Cost right around $320 for all of us to get in & parking. There was a free tram to take you there & back to parking lot, which was wonderful. Prices on food & souveniers were comparable to there tourist attractions. Highly recommend.

This is the one annual past I'll probably never get ride of. The rides and attractions are all fun, it has areas that are kids even pre-school age and under, and, with all due respect to the local zoo, we enjoy the zoological area and attractions much more. They always have month specials for pass members, annual food and wine festival, seasonal events and attractions for Holloween and Christmas, and concerts that cover most every genre of music. We enjoy ourselves everytime we good.

We live in Southern California and we are annual pass holders of most amusement parks. This is our first time in Busch Gardens and we are quite impressed.  Our hotel had a discount:  we purchased discounted tickets: half day pass for $60.  Although in the ticket is said entrance is after 12pm; we were in at 11:40am. The family loves the rides but the shows were something else.  We also appreciate that they provide free iced water if you have a container and 99cent free refills if you purchase a bottle- and refills are even for the life of the bottle.   Busch gardens had everything for everyone in the family.  Animals and animal education and conservation, rides, shows, gardens and garden sculptures.  It's not as crowded as we expected.  It was a fabulous day for the family, a great deal at that $60 from 11:40 to 6:55 (park closed at 7pm).

Busch Gardens is an amazing place to pass the time. I personally always try and get the wristbands for the food, which comes out cheaper than lets just say, buying food every 2 hours or so. Some rides do have huge Wait times, over an hour, for most rides, which can be annoying, as well as the carnival games, that are well rigged. 
Good environment, never personally had an issue, other than the pricy food and carts, as well as wait times. Animals seem happy which is always a plus.

the best thrill theme park in the world it has the best of the best rides there it will give the needed adreniline rush to anyone. they arent that many small rides but enough to keep them happy. the animals are funny and cool there. the place is clean and the staff are nice and the place is werll maintained.

This place sucks. We were here for four hours and went on nothing due to lightening miles away. I completely understand that. But the communication was awful. Not No staff even knew we were in a code or what was open or closed. We spent four other days at parks with constant closings and the communication and assistance was much better. The show at the end of the day if you can procraStinafe long enough was great. The animal exhibits to break up the rides (hah) is unique for an amusement park. The meal plan is worth it. That's about the best thing we did. Eat b

I don't know how many times have been to Busch Gardens in my life but let's say it's in the three digits. Certain times of the year I love going there for their evening concerts. I love the animals and a small quaint little shops they have.

I think Busch Gardens is the best amusement park in all of Florida but that is just my humble opinion. On the other hand I also think it is gone down and quality since I have been going to visit it for so many years. The rides are not my thing except for some of the specialty ones so I'm going more on the quality of the overall park.

Yes I like that they have the beer and some nice restaurants but I wouldn't say I've eaten at any restaurant there that is a five star quality but once again that's my opinion. Personally I think the animals and walking around in nature and enjoying yourself with friends and or family is a wonderful way to spend a day or an evening. So what better place to do it if you're in Tampa then Busch Gardens.

It if you coming to Florida it's definitely something to put on your must do list because its so unique. Some of us that have been around for years no the changes and noticed them but it's not going to stop us from going or at least not me. I do regret some of the changes I see but, that's not my decision to make, its corporate America.

What's a girl to do if you want to go see some giraffes and beautiful scenery and other animals and maybe have a few beers, Busch Gardens is your place to go.

I do not recommend using their monthly EZ pass - if you have any billing issues their phone doesn't work and they just keep emailing you to cal the phone number that says... Sorry our system is busy call back another day. Spent 2 full days getting issues resolved and had to do complete work around to get it - their phone # never worked. Very frustrated

We are previous annual passholders from 7+ years ago (when we lived in the area) and we LOVED this park.  This weekend was our first visit since then.  We were celebrating our son's 8th birthday and decided to go with the 'Kids Play Free' vacation package.  You pick one of their preferred hotels to stay at and you get admission, parking and discounts on food/merchandise for your entire stay (kids 3-9 for free).  GREAT DEAL!  We chose the Holiday Inn Express New Tampa and while it was further away than the other hotels, it did not disappoint.  Great quality and value.  

As for the parks, while we noticed that there were a lot of new rides and areas added since our last visit, much has not been updated either.  For example, the bathrooms were exactly the way we remembered them.  The log flume ride is looking really worn and wasn't even running the day we tried to ride.  My favorite water ride, Tidal Wave, has since been closed and abandoned and the Congo River Rapids was promising until they closed it down for 'technical difficulties' right after we were buckled in to ride. :-(  Most of our visit the rides were closing down while we were in line or before we could even get in line due to inclement weather in the area.  We understand that the weather is unavoidable, but it's still discouraging.  Especially, when it's sunny and there is no rain in sight. The summer nights food stands were also a disappointment.  The food we ordered was dry and bland. Also, the computers went down right when we tried to pay.  We also bought a refillable souvenir cup to be used for our entire trip.  The price is comparable to Universal's, however, we were expecting more freestyle machines around the park.  They mostly have regular soda machines with just a few choices.  The employees we asked about freestyle machines were clueless as to what we were talking about.  Also, be prepared to wait in line to scan every time you refill.

On a positive note, we really enjoyed our experience at the Serengeti Overlook Restaurant.  Our son loved watching the zebras and giraffes while eating his meal.  My husband loved the buffet and took full advantage of everything they had to offer.  Service was pleasant and friendly, unlike many other places in the park.  We loved the new rides Cobra's Curse (great for the entire family), Falcon's Fury and Cheetah Hunt.  These were all great, when they were actually open and running.  For those wondering about wearing bags, I was able to wear a fanny pack on most of the rides without a problem, but on Khumba, they asked me to take it off.   We avoided using the lockers for our entire visit.  It's nice that you can still cubby non-valuable items when you ride, unlike Universal, where they make you put EVERYTHING in lockers for the big rides. Our son was able to get a birthday pin from Adventure Outpost to wear on his special day, although only one employee acknowledged him the entire day.  

Overall, it was an okay experience for the valuable package we purchased.  If we had paid full price, I would have been sorely disappointed.  I feel that with a few upgrades (bathrooms, more freestyle machines and cups with chips), tighter reopening times on rides and better training of employees, this park could be a '5' again.  We still love the theme of this park over most others, with the animals and plethora of rides for everyone.  Here's hoping that the current owners do something to turn it around.  'Til next time...

Ah...my old friend Busch Gardens.  I loved it here.  The lines were short on a weekend!  We rode a ton of rides!  I don't think that has happened in the existence of theme parks.  The weather was terrific, the crowds weren't obnoxious and I saw other Asians in Florida!  I didn't think they made it that far down south.  

The ride, which I call Shakira, was awesome, shakira, sharika, what a beautiful liar!  Just kidding.  We paid $50 for the season pass and went twice in a month and the rides were still awesome.  And how about the animal reserve.  Well....I did fall asleep on that one from drinking the night before, but it was a nice nap.

Busch Gardens leaves me feeling a bit conflicted. I'm a huge fan of roller coasters and thrill rides but zoos really bum me out. And keeping wild animals in captivity so close to roaring roller coasters filled with screaming riders, well, it seems particularly cruel. 
   BG is a decent value for the money, at least compared to A-list Florida parks like Disney and Universal. It's big and sprawling, but the layout can be confusing and hard to navigate, even armed with the map. I recommend taking the skyride as I love riding cable cars and most parks lack them. They also have a train, if you want to wait for it and expose yourself to too many species of animals living in conditions that are foreign and unnatural to them. Call me a bleeding heart or whatever but I did not enjoy the "Serenghetti plain" portion of the park. 
   The theming in other areas is pretty fun. The fat mummy on display in the Egypt area is a hoot. And the food, given that amusement park food has a reputation of being unhealthy and untasty, could be worse. Lunch from the eatery near the Sheikra coaster actually wasn't half bad. It was fun watching the splashdowns from the coaster, too. 
   I even caught part of a musical performance in the Stanley Theater - a tenor by the name of Fernando Varela. He had previously opened for the Beach Boys and Lionel Richie and both my parents and I were surprised by what a top notch act he was. His style of music wasn't quite my cup of tea but I was trying to do some family stuff with the fam instead of just riding coasters all day and man, does Fernando have a set of pipes on him. He held notes on Gloria for an extremely long time and did a very classy cover of the late Leonard Cohen's Hallelujah. We only stayed for 4 songs as we only had until 5pm on an abbreviated Wednesday in February, but don't sleep on the music shows at Busch Gardens. 
    Busch Gardens has a respectable, if not elite coaster collection, though not much in the way of flat rides apart from the ferocious drop tower Falcon's Fury. Dive coaster Sheikra was hands down my favorite and the rest, though lagging behind, were nothing to scoff at either. Even Scorpion, something of a relic and not too far removed from something you might see at a State Fair or travelling carnival, gave a decent, invigorating ride. Lines were wonderfully short, too. I've given each coaster, apart from Cobra's Curse - which was closed for maintenance, individual reviews if you wish to delve into my opinions even further. 
    I was kind of disappointed in the oh-so-early closing time of 5pm, especially since their website billed Busch Gardens as being open til 6, but myself the the 'rents crammed quite a lot into 5 and a half hours here. And if I wasn't so adverse to seeing wild animals forced out of the wild I would be a lot more keen to go back.

If it were possible to leave a review without selecting any stars, this would be the time. We were first time guests at Busch Gardens this past weekend and I can say, it was the worst amusement park experience of our lives. For a park "known" for roller Coasters, it was unexpected that rides were periodically shut down without rhyme or reason. We thought it was odd that some coasters would close and then re-open without warning. Frankly the place seemed very understaffed!! The result of the closures was a backlog of "fast pass" holders that caused the lines of regular ticket holders to increase from published wait times by an additional one-third. (I.e. Published 60 min wait was really 80 min). Staff would pull us out out of lines on some rides (as the rides were being closed) while other staff allowed guests to remain in line. Staff seemed really confused. The overall park appeared run down and "tired" --we saw fountain tiles, signage and landscaping in disrepair. We had the worst day. We were so disappointed and morn the loss of money we paid for 4 people. It's a tragic waste of money! We just don't have anything positive to say about Busch Gardens in Tampa Bay. Please don't bother visiting this park.

Busch Gardens truly has something for everyone, whether you're a thrill seeker, animal lover, or theater buff (I happen to be all three). 

Some park highlights for me:

Sheikra. This is the scariest rollercoaster I've ever been on (yet I still always go on it, and I'm still just as scared every time). The coaster cart is 3 rows of "stadium" seating. This ride is short, but it is really about one 7 second stretch that seems to last forever : when you're precariously hung over the edge of a very high 90 degree drop before the cart drops. Sitting in the front for this one ups the scary factor by a million. 

Lion exhibit. They are usually lounging right by the observation window, so this is probably the closest you will ever get to a lion without losing a limb. 

Iceploration. An ice show featuring figure skaters, pair skaters,  incredible puppetry, and animals. It's a really cute story with some beautiful set and costuming. A nice 30 minute break from the heat, too!

I typically feel overwhelmed at theme parks but since I have a season pass I don't feel pressured to fit a ton of stuff in every time I come. Sometimes I just go to see shows, other times I just ride rollercoasters. I actually think this is the best way to enjoy the park. Don't try to do everything, but instead just pick a few must-dos and fit in whatever extra activities you can.
