This is a great park! We attended the park on Sunday, 6/21/15. It was a very hot day & the park was pretty busy. 

PARKING & GUEST RELATIONS... Parking was very organized and there is a nice tram that will take you to the entrance. Just make a note of where you parked!

   Once inside the park, we stopped at Guest Relations to pick up a medical fast pass for my son who is type 1 diabetic & can't stand in long lines due to the heat. They happily gave us a pass which is a slip of paper with a list of all the big rides where the ride operators can write down a time to come back to avoid standing in the long lines. This pass is good for your entire group. We actually ended up not really needing it because there was never more than a 15 minute wait on the rides and sometimes no wait at all! 

THE RIDES... We started at the very back of the park and the 4 roller-coaster riders in our group rode Kumba, which they all loved. Next was Shreika, which they also said was awesome. They rode the Montu, which looks very similar to Batman the Ride (Six Flags) but they said it was way better. But their favorite ride was Cheetah Hunt because it is such a long and smooth roller-coaster. They decided to skip Falcon's Fury.

   There are digital signs throughout the park that list the wait times for the rides which was super helpful, & I also highly recommend using their interactive app called Busch Gardens, which will tell you the wait times, as well as how far of a walk you are from the ride, & will actually navigate your steps to the ride. It will also tell you the thrill & splash level, as well as the height requirement. 

THE ANIMALS... And for me, the non rider (& mom) of the group, my favorite part of the park was the built-in zoo! Yes! Lots of animal exhibits throughout the park & the animals all seemed to be enjoying the attention. Be sure & stop by the Tiger Tunnel & Tiger Viewing area. The tigers will come right up to the window! There is a walking safari in Edge of Africa where you will find lemurs, meerkats, lions, etc. Also, don't miss the walk through bird sanctuary. My son stuck out his finger and the bird walked right up on his shoulder. My daughter tried it with a different bird and it bit her but she said it didn't hurt. I didn't discover till after our visit that there are a lot more animal attractions that we didn't get to (Walkabout Way, Jambo Junction, etc.) So if you're really into animals, be sure & check out the website before you go and make a note of the animal exhibits you don't want to miss. 

THE STAFF.. I also found the staff to be friendly and professional throughout the entire park. Any of the food stands & kiosks happily filled our generic water bottles with either ice or ice water, depending on what machines they had, so we were all able to stay hydrated on this hot 98 degree day. (If they only had ice, they would just point us to a nearby water fountain.)

FINAL WORDS... My group had 5 people consisting of 2 parents and 3 kids ages 15-20. We ALL thoroughly enjoyed this park and it was a refreshing change from what we experience back home at Six Flags St. Louis which is always rude people,  overpriced, disgusting food, and no free water or ice to speak of. We would definitely return to Busch Gardens and recommend it to family and friends. 

TICKETS... We purchased our tickets online and saved $85 per ticket by purchasing the Busch Gardens/Sea World combo. Check online & buy/print your tickets ahead of time to save money and skip the long lines at the gate.

It had been 30+ years since the wife and I had been to Busch Gardens, the daughter has never been, so we made the 3 1/2 - 4 hour drive to visit.

We were well aware that this isn't WDW and to make that comparison would be unfair, however, it was extremely evident that the majority of the employees that WE encountered acted as though this was "just a job" and it didn't matter if you were there or not.
An example would be the way guests are handled when getting on to and off the Cheetah Hunt coaster. Now, a 40 minute wait really isn't that bad, but it was every bit of 40 minutes if not longer. This time could have been easily reduced by adding 2 more employees to unload/load the coaster cars.
I mean, when your crew deals with one car at a time while 2 others are "stacked up" behind it waiting to unload...WDW would have been all over it.
On the other hand....the roller coasters themselves were outstanding!!

It would have been nice to know up front that the animal viewing train was not running during our visit. 

As noted in another review, pay the extra $2 + tax ($24 total) to get the "preferred parking" and save yourself from having to wait for a tram.

Just a note to someone who has not been here.....in the summertime when lightening is a very real possibility and danger, Busch Gardens doesn't play around and WILL shut down the rides if there is inclement weather potential in the area.
AND if it does start down-pouring, there are not many places to duck into to get out of it.

Finally a suggestion for the technology experts with Busch Gardens, fix your mobile app to show wait times for the rides.

Awesome Park, and if you're a Florida resident then the 'pay for a day and go all year' deal is just the best. Today we rode all the coasters and I'd have to say that Sheikra is awesome. It takes you to the edge and holds there about 3-4 seconds and then it drops you STRAIGHT down. And the thing is, is that you can't see the track so you get the feeling that you are free falling with no net. It's an unbelievable rush. 
Kumba is very fast and is one of the longest lasting coasters around. No real quick ride here. 
Montu is really cool. Your feet are just hanging in the wide open (the coaster is railed from the top, instead of the bottom. 
The shows are world class., literally. Most of the performers are from different countries from around the world. 
Sesame Street section is great for the kids. They get to meet the Sesame Street crew and there are different rides for kids to ride on, 2yrs and up. Our daughter loves the Grover Roller Coaster. every time we go there we have to ride it at least 3 times in a row. 
They have animals, mainly themed after Africa. Gorillas, Giraffes, Lions, Zebras, and the tigers that are in the Jungala section are really cool to watch. The Tiger Tail Trail really allows you to get close to the tigers, including 2 white tigers. Of course you are separated by glass or some type of netting.

The roller coasters are quite exhilarating here at the gardens of Busch.  That's about it though.  The Sheikra coaster is my fave, as it dives 90 degrees down.  Love it!

This is definitely a second rate amusement park as the service is lacking.  Every employee looks miserable here and they let you know it!  Huge difference between the attitudes displayed here and with a Disney World/Universal Studios.  Turn off!

The food is boring and simplistic as you would expect a second rate amusement park's food to be.  Nothing new, nothing exciting, just blah!  

If you're looking for a full theme park experience, go to Universal Studios or Walt Disney World.  If you're just looking to kill some time with some cool coasters, come to Busch Gardens for one day @ 
$74.99 and get the rest of the year free.  Although, they do make you wait in line before you leave to get the rest of the year free.

Entry is a ridiculous process - its easier and faster to get on an airplane at JFK (and yes i pre-bought my ticket online and had a barcode on phone). Staff is not helpful, and there are not enough of them (betting they are grumpy bc they are overworked and undermanaged???). Park is filthy and tired. Lines are loooooong, and I find the idea of paying even more for a shorter line revolting in principle (clearly theres the capability to speed things up so why not just DO it for all?). Definitely will NOT return.
Spring break at Busch Gardens is packed. Even Florida residents are out for the Sun and fun. Everything is expensive so bring lots of money and patience. Fun for everyone

Absolutely loved this place. So did my bf and 2 kids aged 19 and 10. Seeing the animals up close was so cool! We also paid an extra $20 per person to feed the giraffes. Such an amazing experience to be that close to a giraffe and be able to feed and pet them. Now the rides, loved them too. We were there for 6 hrs and that wasn't enough time. Highly recommend Busch Gardens.

If you love love, love roller coasters, live near the park, are a zoo fan, and don't crave cleanliness, then this is the place for you.  Me - I did not inherit the roller coaster gene (though it was passed down to my kids), I don't live anywhere near Tampa and I am a bit of a germaphobe - and don't like seeing animals outside of their native habitats, so...

Seriously, this park has seen better days, but it was still crowded. The food and wine fest area was by far the nicest spot - but that is not really the experience you come here for - at least not all year 'round.  The safari experiences are really not my cup of tea. The escorts are kind and knowledgeable but you basically ride around in a large pick up truck and see a few animals in a field.  Giraffes can be hand-fed - cute but also a little sad. The animal experiences are quite pricey, so be prepared.  

Speaking of pricey, the quick queue tickets to avoid the lines are like $80 a pop if you want more than one repeat ride and a shorter wait time. I was unprepared for that only because the park as a whole is not as nice as Universal and Disney - where you expect to pay those crazy amusement park prices.

Concession foods are - yuck.  But, again, you don't come here for that. The roller coasters are the main attraction, and there are quite a few really good one (so I am told). The folks in the park are also very attentive and super helpful - at least those we met. 

The annual pass is a good deal - again if you live nearby and love love love what there is to love here and can look past the rest.  Hope this place gets an overhaul soon - it can really use it.

My family and I, we go to Orlando a few times a year since we have a 5 year old that always wants Disney Disney Disney! Well, the last 2 times we decided to jump to Tampa and go to Busch Gardens for a little change. Best decision ever! We ended up buying the Annual Pass. The park is so complete with things to do for kids and adults! The playground for the kids is amazing! The little roller coasters are awesome too! It gives them a chance to experience the "adult thrills" but for their age. And as an adult, you won't get bored with so many rides to choose from! I think is the perfect combination for the price you pay so that the entire family can have fun. And the prices inside the park are ok, not cheap, but not overly expensive like Disney. :-)
I love Busch gardens. The food is great, the rides are amazing, the shows are spectacular and the animals as well. One of my favorite places to go in Tampa.

Had a great day today! Weather was prefect and park was empty. We got to ride everything we wanted, some things twice. No wait was longer than 5 minutes. All the employees we interacted with were very nice and helpful. Got to see the cheetah run today which was cool. Nice to have minimal crowds. Much busier on the weekend though, espically with the holiday stuff. Will be back.

It's a tun of fun with roller coasters thrill rides.   Busch is always a better value for the money than Disney or Universal. Park is clean and service is great.
Maybe my soft side coming through but got a bit depressed looking at the animals in the zoo.  Some were clearly not loving the Florida weather.;v)  Do understand the educational importance though.

It was the first time in about 15yrs and we had so much fun we got an annual pass. They have way more roller coasters and thrill rides than any of the amusement parks in Orlando. My daughter loved her super close encounter with the cheetah (the cheetah came right up to the glass that my daughter was at and she was in heaven) after that she went on cheetah hunt coaster and said it was the best! My hubby got his thrill on falcons fury. Even my 2 yr old also had a blast at the Elmo landing area. The lines weren't as bad as I expected.
I love busch gardens fun rides good food somewhat good priced items but it gets very packed over summer and it is miserable

I still give a 1 star. I'm glad for the review back for your concerns but still really have not seen any return of money or a phone call from management for the regards of this matter. Very discouraging

Halloween theme event, best for mature audiences only. Opportunity to ride roller coasters at night, exciting Halloween themed shows, walkthrough haunted houses, the street come alive with DJ's , you never know where or when you made have someone or something try and scare you.

This review is specifically for Christmas town. We have been attending  Christmas town for years. It used to be amazing with many snow based games.  You could also pay separate admission of less than $30 and go for the night. Very disappointing this year.

i think that this park has gone downhill in the past 10 years.  i've purchased yearly passes a few times and the last time i said that i am finally done with giving them any more of my money.  because of the "buy one day and come all year" is used by many of the areas residents, it really has ruined the park for many of the out of state visitors.  if i was from out of state, i would be so upset.  the place on the weekends (especially) is like a zoo within a zoo.  people yelling at their kids and its totally crowded and you have to walk long distances from one place to another.  they play really loud rap music in the elephant cage...poor elephants!  its just all wrong..smh

The hubby and I went to BG the day after Valentine's Day without the kids. We just happen to go during the Beer and BBQ Festival. Needless to say I was stoked! They had over 100 different beers to try from local brewers to imports. I especially enjoyed the Woodchuck tent with hard cider! My hubby loved the Shocktop tent. My only complaint about the beer is that it was only available 12-5. They had a variety of BBQ and the places they had were Smokey Bones and Outback. We chose Smokey Bones and basically got a sampler for $10! It was enough food for both of us! It was delicious which is what I would expect from Smokey Bones. The entertainment was not bad either! Earth, Wind and Fire! We will definitely go again next year when they have it.

So the park hours state 10 - 6 today yet over over half of the park wasn't open.

If you're vegan you can forget about the workers making accommodations. I had issues at both Zagora and the Crown Colony. Extemely poor customer service.

Busch Gardens, you are acting like you're the only game in town. Orlando (Disney & Universal) only a stones throw away. I'm a season pass holder but can easily spend my dollars over there where they seem to "get" excellence.

Rides are great.  A wide variety of things to see for every age group. Enjoyed the kangaroos., too, and the elephant presentation, too  The children's section safari something is really nice for the toddler crowd. Food  is awful;, been awful for over twenty years and hasnt improved. Attendants very friendly and helpful all over the park. My son says the beer is also awful. The Mobile interactive map is a joke. No help to me. Doesn't tell me where to go, and now it won't uninstall. Come on, Busch. Stop starving your customers and get a better interactive map; you can do it.

The park is clean, that's the only good thing I can say about Busch Gardens. It's business practices are mercenary at best. I've visited several times in the last two years and I must say, this so-called family excursion destination leaves much to be desired. The food costs are beyond ridiculous, bordering on outright larceny. Parking rates continue to increase even without any noticeable improvement to the space itself. What is the thought process of raising rates to $22 for general parking or $28 if you have small children and want a spot closer to the entrance? GREED. These are not replaced or shady spots with family areas, nor are they more easily navigable - they are simply closer to the entrance. This is a cost that continues to rise from year to year for no other reason than profit. Tacked onto the already hefty admission costs per person, it's blatantly obvious. There are too few rides in the park to accommodate the number of guests that are there on any given day, so the wait time for every ride is in excess of an hour. BUT, if you pay extra to jump the line, your wait will be shorter than those less fortunate left sweltering in the heat. That's ok too, because, you know, profit. Let's talk about how the weather forecast closes the rides and leaves families nothing to do but walk around and spend money on food and drinks. Yeah you can get a re entry pass good for 30 days, but meanwhile, you are spending money. And when you come back, you'll be spending more money. Because the weather in Tampa is like that. Busch Gardens is not doing you a favor by giving you a free ticket, they are making money off of you every time you pull into their parking lot. Simply said, Busch Gardens is a huge tourist scam and unfortunately, they choose to scam Florida residents as well. They know that they don't have enough rides that run on a regular basis to accommodate their guests on any given day: they're counting on the weather to screw up your visit, they offer a free return visit to lure you in to spend more by giving you the line jump options before the weather kicks off. I was there today, sunny and clear, yet a single cloud later in the day suddenly closed all the rides. We arrived at 10.30am and left at 4pm. My granddaughter rode one ride in all that time... And that ride had over an hour wait. Since I didn't cough up the extra money for her to jump the line, she had a disappointing day. Me? I'm a disabled senior who spent those hours with my 3 year old grandson in Sesame Street in the Splash area. Was that worth the cost of the full price tickets I had to pay? Ummm, no. Busch Gardens does not have a  dilineation for Grandparents or other people who are unable to take advantage of the rides or some of the walking attractions. Again it's just about the money. Moving here from the north, I am truly appalled at the mercenary nature of this place. Busch Gardens could easily charge a nominal fee for seniors that would preclude them from certain rides and activities, but they don't. Just like handicap parking should not be considered as preferred. I had to pay extra because I'm handicapped? Understand in most cases handicapped means social security, like me. Again, this is a fail for Busch Gardens. This entire day, this experience at this so-called family friendly destination left me with a horrible taste in my mouth. I would NEVER recommend this to anyone who wanted an enjoyable outing, either with an equal partner or their grandchildren. Bush Gardens, is sadly just another place that's not worth the hassle or the hype.

Pleased they have designated smoking area's. Park map is very accurate. Rollercoasters are fun and exciting. Like the use of the locker rentals and how you can change locations. Dislike when they have to close rides and attractions due to the bad weather.

I know that theme parks are money makers due to the cost of admission but I would have to say that yea it cost $90 dollars for admission but if you live in Florida a lot of times you get admission into the park all year which is awesome. 

I love the animals and the shows they are of great quality. I think that people should come check out the shows. The ice shows are my favorite because of the costume. 

I also like learning about the different animals. There are experts that describes the animals life , facts, and health patterns. I think they do a great job to share how they care for the animals. 

There are also rides if you go when it's not peak time you can get on the rides by if you go when it's busy than you will wait sometimes two hours for a ride.  I think that it is a good experience and safe. 

They are always adding new events, rides, and restaurant. I love the fact that we can taste different foods from different areas.

We came here to try it out since we had never been here before. I guess it's worth it if you haven't been. As someone who enjoys theme parks and lives close to Six Flags and Dorney and goes to Universal, I was not impressed with this park. The layout is ridiculous to navigate and everything is super spread out. Many of the roller coaster entrances are not easy to find. We got so frustrated the first few hours we were there, we decided to ride the train around the park. 

In regards to roller coasters, once I found the entrances, I had 2 favorites: Cobra's Curse and Cheetah hunt. Cobra's curse, their newest ride, is definitely unique. First off, a platform takes your car to the top of the first hill, elevator style, and off you go! The first 1/3 of the ride is forward, middle is backward, and last is freestyle where your car can spin. (I noticed full cars spin more!) Cheetah hunt is also a unique ride, using the force of rebelling magnets to shoot you from 0-60mph. The rest, in my opinion, were forgettable. Luckily none of these rides had more than a ten minute wait anyway (probably since it's about an hour and 15 minute drive from Orlando!). That was definitely a plus to not wait and basically walk on the rides! 

There are also animal exhibits throughout the park. If you have children, there's a section for them that was not running while we were there. As for food, prices were typical for theme parks, but some places (not all) offered some healthier snack options: orange slices, grapes, carrots and ranch dip, side salad, etc. I purchased an All-Day Dining Pass and feel like I got my money's worth. You can literally get a platter and snack/dessert every hour as well as unlimited (non-alcoholic) drinks all day. I purchased mine online for about $30 I think, but if you buy in park it's $35. 

For me, it was a once and done thing. We got there at 10:30-11 and by 4:30, we were ready to leave (which never happens!).

We love to visit the Garden Garden. There is always something interesting for every age. We like traveling by train, visiting animals, watching shows or just walking around. Do not forget about roller coasters. Lots of fun.
Kids had very good time alot of new roller coasters and plenty animal exhibits. Iceploration show was very entertaining. Great place to take your kids.

this is a must stop in a central florida (orlando) vacation if youre a thrill seeker (although the rollercoasters arent bad). cheetah hunt just opened up and its a very smooth and fun ride that was longer than i thought it would be. for a lim coaster i was surprised it flipped but that was cool. there are a bunch of other cool rollercoasters especially shiekra which is the first vertical roller coaster ive been on. we probably should have waited for the front row but whatever. lots of interesting animals also but damn we missed the train by a minute and it takes an hour for it to come back.

folks..what happend to good ole bush gardens?
sadly...just another  total disappointment ..
save ur time and money..

head for orlando an disney or universal
This park has it all for a reasonable price. Great rides,  scenery, animals, food,  and holiday events.  All in all, this place is one of my favorite theme parks.

Busch Gardens Africa was the first major theme park to open in Florida back in 1954. Over time their amount of attraction grew into the South's best park for thrill-seekers. You first arrive at a massive parking lot and take a tram underneath the road to the front gate. One particularly cool idea is the had stilt-walkers dressed in native clothing to meet the kids outside the front gate. Upon 10 am we were off and running to Cheetah Hunt (8/10), an Intamin triple launch coaster, we waited about five minutes for the front and the crew was cranking out trains. After that we visited Cobra's Curse(7/10), the parks newest roller coaster, it's a custom Mack Rides spinning coaster with a rare elevator lift a well themed queue (sadly the projection mapping was broken), and a continuous loading station we waited about 20 minutes. Onto Montu (9/10), the B&M invert, it was about a five minute wait for the front and it's the best inverted coaster in North America. After a busy morning we ate breakfast at Sultan's Sweets, they have cinnamon rolls, muffins, doughnuts, and plenty of other pastries. When we finished chowing down on breakfast we began our walk across the park to SheiKra, (9/10) a B&M dive machine featuring two vertical drops, and a splashdown finale, the crew was cranking out trains so we walked onto the front row. Afterwards we rode Congo River Rapids (6/10) a very standard Intamin rapids ride, with a waterfall cave, and geysers, a five minute wait. I then rode one of the parks large coasters Kumba, (9/10) it's my favorite traditional looping coaster and has 7 inversions, I waited 15 minutes for the front row. After that we walked over to Pantopia and rode Scorpion (7/10) a small but forceful Schwarzkopf looper. We waited one hour only because of one train operations, and the grouper, Shawn, was dispatching trains with up to seven empty seats. After that we ate lunch at Dragonfire Grille, an indoor restaurant featuring a show stage, the food was decent, but nothing special. After lunch it was time to brave Falcon's Fury (9/10) a massive 335 foot tall Intamin drop tower, and the only one of it's kind in the world 90 degree tilting seats. You fall face first down to Earth. In addition to rides Busch Gardens hosts a vast array of animals. There is a massive Serengeti Plain where you can take a train or sky ride and see rhinos, zebras, giraffes, wildebeest, and antelope up close. Scattered around the park are various other animals such as elephants, tigers, lions, hippos, gorillas, alligators, and orangutans. As we walked out at the end of a fun the theme from The Rocketeer played over the speakers. However, it will not be receiving a perfect score due to slow operations on Scorpion, as well as 3 standing but not operating rides (Gwazi, Tanganyika Tidal Wave, and Rhino Rally) Then there was the problem of having a 50's rock 'n' roll show inside an African theater, you would expect native African music not American rock. I recommend this park for coaster enthusiasts, and animal lovers.

Since I am from California and have Disneyland so close to home, I would go to Busch Gardens any day over Disneyland. The park is clean, beautiful and so much to do! My family and I had a great day there with short lines for rides. You can get up close to many animals at the park. We did get the all day dining and was well worth it! You can also get free bottles of water at different locations instead of having to get soda. Enjoyable park to visit!

been coming to Busch Gardens for over 5 years and never been disappointed there's always something to do something to eat and great attractions and probably one of the best roller coaster rides there is the Cheetah Hunt and don't forget about the new Falcon fury and the new serpent Run coming in 2016..
Park was awesome...thought they shut the rides down for to long after the rain..the tram car left a quarter of the way full with people walking up..just rude

Today I tried the Dragon Fire Grill & Pub Market place for the 1st time at Bush Gardens.  I usually only eat the brisket at the smoke house. Because it's sooo good. But today I ate a Mexican salad you could put on what you wanted- with a side of guacamole & salsa & chips. The salad was plenty & pretty good & presented nicely. The salsa was good & the guacamole.The restaurant had other themed foods, American, Asian, Italian & the Mexican food choices & it had theater shows & most importantly in the air conditioning:) I live within reasonable driving distance & get season passes. Bush Gardens is a nice day out & has awesome food options for a theme park!!! The rides are Elmo's world for the wee ones & roller coasters & others for adults & shops, restaurant & games & animals which the educate on these animals. Which is invaluable to many of their survival. A bit of something for everyone. I like all the air conditioned spots for guests & the relaxing eye appealing landscaping. The shows are nice to go see & they change it up routinely. A good family day something for everyone & there's plenty of shade:) The train ride through the Serengeti is always fun & also can help you get around the park quickly, it has a few different pick up & drop spots. One of my favorite parks!!!

Really surprised that they didn't open till 10 am and then  close at 6 pm on a Saturday and on top of that they shut the rides down for almost 2 hrs due to light rain. Definitely not worth the $388 to get in ( $97 per person)

Fun time! Great Value! 

We got a special on-line meal deal when we visited with a bunch of family members and it was awesome! We got to drink and eat all day - anytime for FREE! There were a few things that were excluded but it really didn't matter. 

Ordinarily when you go to a big amusement place like this you pay through the nose to get in and then double that to eat. This was a welcome surprise and much appreciated! 

As for the park and rides! Great fun for all ages, something for everyone. I agree with Steve B. stay away from Gwazi...looked easy hurt like crazy! Sheikra on the other hand our party rode it 3 times!!!! 

AND I want to give a special shout out to the park staff, they were spectacular...We lost are car at the end of the night in the monster size parking lot and they calmed our fears and found it for us! 

I highly recommend a visit - but check on-line for discounts before you go!

A great place to take my kids again and again mostly because it's super close for us to drive to!  We truly get our money's worth.  The park is loaded with exciting rides and is big enough to explore.  It has many exciting features such as the safari and sky rides.  There are animal exhibits all over the park and it even has bird and kangaroo feelings!  Rides  are a blast and the Sheikra is freaking scary! (For me). They have that new ride where it drops you from Mt. Everest.....forget it. I'll pass.

Busch Gardens hosts different festivals throughout the year...from the Food and Wine festival to the Christmas one....it's an awesome place to take the family for a fun-filled day! 
Take advantage of their drink and popcorn cups.  But once and take it with you for $.99 refills.  There are also other options too! 

I have been living in FL for over four years and have purchased the yearly passes for three of those!  We love it.  It's worth it!!

We are having a blast! Great for the Kids or for adults. This was not our first time here and we always have a good time riding rides, playing games, and seeing the animals. Season passes are reasonably priced and if you live in the Bay Area it's a nice and quick day of fun for the whole family right here local.

This is the best theme park for the money.  We have season passes bc it's absolutely worth it.  There are many perks to buying a season pass... free parking, discounts on food and merchandise, free pass for a friend during your birthday month, etc.  I love taking my 2 and a half year old here.  They have an area that is Sesame Street themed with a really cute show where the kids can meet the characters after.  They also have rides, rope bridges, bounce house, interactive water fountains, etc for toddlers and kids a bit older.  My daughter also loves the ice skating show bc of the lighting and music, and the show where they have trained rescued animals (opening night critters).  We also walk around to see tigers, giraffes, elephants, hippo, etc.  
     I have also taken my mother in a wheelchair and have had no trouble getting her around the park.  Some sections of the park are a little hilly, so I get a little tired but it's not bad.  You can also rent a motorized wheelchair there if you want.
Sheikra - scary, cheetah hunt- fun, kumba - fun, montu - underrated. Whole park atmosphere was sweet. Animals mixed with coasters , and there were minimal lines day we went. Recommended

If I could give no stars I most definitely would. Let me start by saying I'm a veterinary student and my fiancée, a nursing student. We both go to school and work full time and never have time for each other. This week we finally had some time and decided to try Busch gardens out...yeah garbage. We got into park and already the rides shut down due to weather so we waited and decided to buy the quick pass so we don't have to wait in line too long when everything finally opens. We waited around, sitting in the rain , for two hours when they finally announced that the rides have opened. We decided to go to one ride and I asked some attendant if I could take my bag with me and she said yes at my own risk of losing it so I went in line as I was walking up some girl that is working the line yells out loudly that I have to go pay for a locker that I can't get on the ride didn't even take that joke of a pass. We didn't use it once. And in order to get money to pay for that freaking locker was at the front of the park to then carry change around. We just paid to sit in the rain and get scolded at in a embarrassing nasty way. I got my money back and will NEVER be returning. This place is a joke and a horrible time. I rather go to Santa's enchanted freaking forest than stepping into this place ever again and that is hard to say. But it's cool go at your own risk people. You will regret it.

As a true Floridian I am not about the touristy venues that this sunny state has to offer...I just know better than to venture out near outlets and amusement parks during summer.  Well I decided to take my partner and niece here for a day and ride some coasters.  I actually am a platinum pass holder and used to frequent here and Sea World quite often.  The pass entitles me to many benefits including free preferred parking, discounted admission for friends and family, discount on food and merchandise, and ride again privelages on certain coasters.

We went mainly due to the opening of the new roller coaster Cheetah Chase.  This new coaster is amazing!  It shoots you out at around 60 mph, gives you loops and turns, and does some crazy zig and zag maneuvers.  It is a smooth ride from beginning to end and is all around another great addition to the theme park.  Before this addition was Sheikra, the 90 drop coaster, and I was okay with that.  Cheetah Chase is crazy good in comparison.  It was definitely worth the wait.  All in all we managed to ride all the coasters and get soaked on the Congo River Rapids...we totally needed it though due to how hot it was that day.  

My only advice is to steer clear during summer months...we had half of all Brazilian citizens in the park with us chanting, screaming, clapping, and singing...it did not make for pleasant waits in lines.  That is not the park's fault though so it does not take their rating down for me.

Oh...definitely buy a souvenier cup for 99 cent refills!  It is worth it for a day in the park.

The plants, trees and gardens were really nice. We enjoyed all the animals. I would have liked to see more rides.  My husband said the men's restroom smelled like urine. The women's bathroom was ok. We really liked the gardens, they were really well kept. I was very amused about how they cattle the people in with parking and getting you to the gates.  Very well organized.  We had a nice Valentine's Day!

We went here during Christmastown so our experience isn't the full experience.  It was dark so when we rode the train around the park we could only see silhouettes of the zebras and giraffes.  It was pretty neat to see the silhouettes against the dark sky with the moon in the background.  To make up for the lack of animal sightings, they had everyone sing Christmas carols as they rode.  FUN!

We also rode three roller coasters.  I'll start with the worst one:

Gwazi...  I knew when I heard the 'clank, clank clank' of the track that I was going to hate it and I was right on!  Talk about Whip Lash. My body hurt when I exited the ride!

Shiekra...be ready to scream!  The hills are very tall and you go straight down a couple of times.  I'm pretty sure my heart was in my head a few times!  I was shaking when I exited this one.

Cheetah Hunt...my favorite.  Right when you get on the ride you hear the sound of air being pressurized and then it shoots the cars out like a cannon.  After that is one large hill and then the rest are tons of small hills closer to the ground and an underground tunnel.  I would much rather ride this than any of the others.  It's fast, and I felt like a Cheetah for the whole minute I was on the ride!

Unfortunately for our family the park leaves us so disappointed. Every single time we go to the park the workers treat you bad - rude and they look like the absolutely hate their jobs. Unfortunately for our family we are stuck with a year pass for an entire family. Please save yourself time and money go to Disney if you have little ones. If you have older kids Universal Studios. The park is a dumpster with rude workers and rides being shut down all the time. It's not worth for your hard working money .

Great park with tons of animals and rides for all ages. First time here and we bought tickets ONLINE ONLY for 50.00 each for a weekday visit. We went on monday and the lines were very short, my kids waited no more then 10-15 mins for the roller coasters. Seeing all the animals were great and up close too. We ate at the nicest restaurant they have and used the counter service. The upstairs has sit down service. My shrimp salad was fresh and great for a amusement park. We really enjoyed our day here and would go back if we are Tampa again. We saw two shows, one ice skating type and one madagascar and both were great espically to get out of the 90+ weather or rain. We ate dinner at the smoke house and the food was really good. I would recommend this place to everyone. A lot of young/teens people here and it can be a little ghetto at times but over all we enjoyed our time here. ""One tip"...... it can rain/thunder around 3:00pm so go on any roller coasters before that. They do close them when it rains/thunders as all the parks do in florida even Walt Disney World. See a show during the rain/thunder or eat at the closed in restaurants. The rain actually cools down the high heat which can be great once it stops raining.

We just come back from Busch Garden
We spent the entire day , we had a blast.
On a busy day ,buy the Quick Queue it saved our day.
I liked the refill policy for the soft drinks and popcorn.

If I could give zero stars I would.....Talk about deceitful business practices! These folks knew the park had no power on the morning of Saturday, May 12th, 2018.  and instead of being honest with the customers they continued to let folks pay and go inside only to find out THEN that nothing was operable including food! I was livid! My 4 year old who has special needs was sitting in a stroller along with the rest of the thousands of disappointed toddlers waiting for the Sesame Street  area to open wondering why they couldn't ride anything! Do you think these people had the decency to even offer water? Nope! They just shrugged their shoulders and said that they have no clue if it's coming back on or not. Totally unacceptable when I paid almost 400 dollars for tickets! I stood in an hour long line for a full refund and here is the kicker......they say it will take up to 45 days! WHAT? It took two seconds for them to take it and I have to wait over a month to get it back? Not even an offer of free tickets for  next time we are visiting! Not even an apology! This whole experience was terrible and could have been prevented with a little honesty at the gate and some good ole customer service. We traveled from Maryland for the Sesame Street weekend and left with my son very confused and upset! The only good thing I will say is that they brought out the characters for pictures once they saw all the kids getting ready to lose it......SAD EXPERIENCE.....should have gone to Disney. I will be informing ALL of my moms groups, school groups, travel groups, and ALL of my social media groups about this debacle. They do not DESERVE our patronage operating like that!

It's been about 10 years since I was at Busch Gardens Tampa and a few things have change. The restaurant over looking the safari is not open as much and there are certainly more rides. Falcon's Fury was hands down my favorite!! If you have the guts, definitely jump on!! My grandfather was upset that the restaurant was not open. If you have an extra $30, get the Quick Queue!! It's beyond worth it and allows you to hop right on all of the major rides one time. We used this and it did not disappoint. One thing that I would not buy again is the Photo Key. This would have been much more useful if there were some staff stationed around the park taking photographs once in a while, but we only saw one place where this happened. So all of our photos are only of 3 people out of the 5 in are group that went on the roller coasters. Definitely loved the kangaroo petting area and next time I return, I will pay to feed the giraffes. It is a little hard to navigate around the park... if you want to go on a ride on the opposite end of the park then you have to walk the entire length (unless you take the train, but that would be just as slow, if not slower...) so it makes it harder to navigate to where you want to go and have time for all of the rides. If you're in the area and have a free day, Busch Gardens is worth checking out. I only got to see the animal show and it was GREAT! So even if you are not a ride fanatic, there are still things for you to do at this park.

Side note: If you forget your handicap sticker for your grandfather (or whomever) just ask the parking guards and they will be very lenient with letting you still park in the handicap area.
I absolutely love this place this place is so wonderful to visit great place to take families at coming to town the animals the rides everything is so amazing here I will take my family here anytime

Had a great time and some great animal encounters
The holiday lights were very pretty and worth checking out.
The food and drinks we are around the park were good.
Lots of pretty landscaping and architecture.
We didn't ride any rides cause my son is too young by we managed to still have a great time.

Get the city pass. It's a great deal and this along with some other great attractions are included.

Pay the extra $6 for preferred parking- it's worth it
Also get there early, especially on peak season days or you might not get in!

Some things I wasn't super excited about:
1. They changed some things over the years that I really enjoyed so I was bummed not to find them(like a bird show)

2. The layout is very weavey and windy and slightly confusing and signs aren't a great help. Get the app-it will help a lot.

3. The most popular show there is small and if you don't get in you have to attempt to catch the next one. This means possibly waiting in line for over an hour. They need to make that shows seating larger!

Overall we had fun

I would say that 3 roller coasters are worth repeat visits.  
They are: Sheikra, Kumba, & Cheetah Hunt.  

The Least Thrilling: Montu
The Hidden Gem: Sand Serpent
The Most Dangerous: Gwazi
The Most Relaxing: Sky Ride

Hint: Pay the extra $10 to get the All-Day dining if ordering online.  It cost $35 at the park.  I probably grabbed 8 drinks the 8 hours I was there.  It was over 90 degrees and humid.

The Iceploration 30 minute show was beautifully choreographed with sharp and stunning bright colors and lighting.  I Loved it!

Fun place when the rides are open. Constant ride shutdowns for mechanical problems also they shut rides down for any bad weather eight miles away for an average time of two hours at a clip. You will spend more time waiting then riding. When it rains the park has poor drainage and you will soak your shoes. Was here in July four days in a row and they could not keep rides open. A black cloud hovers over the park and rides are always closed for inclement weather spent 600 dollars for my family what a waste. Think long and hard before you spend a weeks pay here. Even my kids finally gave up and said they wanted to go home.
Physics Day in the park.  Fun with a bit of education.  Nice to see kids engaged in schoolwork, but having fun and good at what they were doing!
The staff at Bush gardens especially the security staff at the entrance are very rude. They need more training.
Love busch gardens! You hardly wait more than 15-20 (if that) to get on a ride. One of my favorite things to do!

I recently visited Busch Gardens (BG) after a 5 year absence
 Last time I visited, it was in 2008 with a Mallu priest. lol.

I used the 50 dollar special for me and my gf. I really love all the animal exhibits, especially the elephants, apes, giraffes, flamingos
. And who doesn't love the Coasters? (except MI patients and my gf)?

Coasters:
Cheetah Hunt and Sheikra were the two new coasters added since my last sojourn. I loved Cheetah Hunt even if it was a bit short. Sheikra scared me away for the moment.
My Favorite coaster is Montu. I like the feeling of your feet dangling through the air, and I feel safer with the steel harness over the body. It has a lot of inversions, but It's very fun. Kumba is a little old , but solid. Scorpion is decent for smaller kids or families.
I cannot recommend Gwazi. the wooden construction gives it a jerky quality, and it does put strain on your neck area. I rode it once circa 2004 but never again.

BG is a great place , but I have  some nitpicks:

Parking is 15, which is standard for Disney. but BG isnt that big. I think they could knock it down to 10 honestly.

BG is 1/2 zoo, 1/2 amusement park. Many people , like my parents or gf, dont enjoy the coasters, and wont go on them. I tend to favor the rides more than the animals.
Honestly the optimal thing would be if you like both and go with people who like both. 
For people shy of death-defying coasters, the value of a standard ticket (85-90 approx) is a lot less. I would recommend getting a Fun pass if youre from FL. One full ticket , and you can go repeatedly throughout the year

--I went at an atypical time, but be wary of going during Tampas "rainy season" - July-Sept)  BG turns off rides at the first drizzle and may not reopen them that for hours.

-- The park closed at 5pm (in December), Universal  and Epcot closed at 7pm. Try and get there early if possible.

The park was very beautifully decorated for the Xmas season, which was nice. The employees were friendly, and the park was clean. 

I had a fun time overall. Maybe I can take anti-emetic meds before going on Sheikra.

Been here twice and loved it. This park is very clean and both times we have not had to wait long for any of the rides but then again, we have gone on a weekday, out of season.
If you ride anything here, ride Falcon's Fury.......one of few rides that has really scared me!
One tip, get the extra ticket for unlimited food at several restaurants in the park, it is well worth it!

Great park. Better coasters than Disney, and better prices. I went in October, the off-season, but enjoyed perfect weather and zero crowds. The only line we stood in all day was 15 minutes for lunch at Bengal Bistro. Disney moves people much better, and passengers wait for too long to board rides...but the rides themselves are so much better. Two days later, my shoulders and collarbones are still sore from riding the coasters and being tossed upside down. I must have ridden 30+ times. Sheikra is amazing, Cheetah Hunt and Mantu are world-class. Do Disney if your kids are all under 7-8 or so. Do Busch Gardens if the kids are bigger.

Busch Gardens makes me feel happy. It's a reminder of my first ever foray to the USA. I came to Orlando to sate my appetite for roller coasters.

I had been based in Orlando and enjoyed the Disney and Universal parks but was looking for bigger coasters to ride. I had planned a day trip to Tampa to Busch Gardens and at the time, it was my longest drive in the USA

The parking lot is huge and a little confusing at first but I've since got the hang of it. Busch Gardens has a nice feel to it. Slightly less corporate than Disney though that may just be an illusion.

I wasn't disappointed by my wish for larger coasters. On my first trip, I truly my brain truly scrambled by multiple rides on Kumba, Montu and Gwazi. Since then, I've also returned to ride the awesome drop coaster Sheikra, which is probably now my favourite ride in the park as I love that drop sensation.

There are also gentler rides and I love Rhino Rally, which is a cross between a safari jeep ride and..... SPOILER ALERT...... a section where the jeep is swept away down a river by a flash flood. Great fun.

Besides the rides, there's also an interesting zoo, which is well worth a visit as well as shows. It's a nice family park but with some big rides to interest coaster addicts like me.

Excellent experience (again) in Christmas town 2016, we had a blast and seems to be the greatest time to visit, great weather not too packed. We had a blast, totally recommend if you're looking for some Christmas Spirit! Definitely going back in 2017!

We liked the rides and most of the animals were great.  We were devastated when we saw the kangaroo park though.  There are about 2 dozen kangaroos and wallabies  in a sliver of the park with no grass or space to rome.  Maybe two of them were standing up.  We just told ourselves that they had a big space in the back for frolicking.  This is a common problem for us when we go out to zoos and similar places.  Busch Gardens seemed like it was a safe bet with the funding that they have so we were shocked when we saw it. They charge $7 for beers that the company makes for ten cents so you would think that they could get the kangaroos some grass and not charge people $5 for a hand full of food pellets.

It's been years since I've gone, but I remember it as an overall pleasant experience. I mean, animals and roller coasters in one park? I'm there! 

Up until X opened at Six Flags Magic Mountain, Montu had been my favorite roller coaster of all time. It's such a smooth ride. As many have pointed out, ones like Gwazi aren't as smooth. 

If it's still the same, they've got a tent where you can get free samples Busch beverages: spanning from Bud to O'Doul's. I was underage at the time, but not being much of a fan of Busch's drinks these days, I don't think I was missing out. 

The zoo aspect was OK, but I remember there weren't many animals out on the summer day we were there. Since hoof-and-mouth disease was a concern at the time, they frequently made patrons wipe their feet before getting on certain attractions. 

Overall I liked Busch Gardens more than Disney's Animal Kingdom, specifically when it came to rides and how many animals we saw.
Clean, and the animals seemed well taken care of.And in the Bengal cafe they had veggie options..Thankyou Busch for taking care of us military types

1) the admission price was very high.  too high.  - docked one star.  About fifty bucks a person if you're not doing rides seems fair.  

2)  plethora of animals in natural habitats.  extraordinary.

3). the african savannah was great.

4). birds awesome.

5). the overhead rides and train rides are great ways to view the park.

6) they have music.  felix pappalardi of the rascals was playing today.  

7). the rides, if you have kids, are amazing.  

8) plenty more of food & drink. 

9). we liked the primates area.  

10). lots of benches & shady areas.

and, alligators & pink flamingoes, elephants, hippoes, and tortoises, and kangarooes!!!!

very neat.

we had a fun day.
Best theme park in Florida! Very up to date with new roller coasters and very friendly staff.

We got the pay once and come back for the rest of the year. I think it was a great option for Florida residents. Especially now for the summers they are open until late and they have a fire works show. O can't wait to come back and come to the park at night time. The only down side it's the parking cost.

So I'm at a Busch Gardens after I've graduated college. I'm actually at one right now. Lots of advertisements for craft beer. I'm very excited, since I've ridden every roller coaster here growing up and I'd like to just relax here with my cousins while my nieces and nephews ride a few rides. We go to the Crown pub, which is supposed to have a large selection of craft beer--it's closed. The "craft beer" on tap is a holiday Sam Adams, shock top and bud light--your typical shit bar selection. The "craft beer" at the area near Falcons fury are all big brand name hoppy IPAs on tap, but barely what I'd call a selection. No porters, no Browns, no ambers and no stouts. Anywhere. Not even a Guinness in sight. In the entire park. This park is owned by a beer company that was bought by a beer company, and somehow mucked it up. They got rid of its free beer option in favor of more expensive tickets, two or three new rides that aren't nearly as fun as the old rides, and a fast pass option that you have to buy if you don't want to sit in line for two hours, because fast pass customers can ride twice in front of you, get in line again and keep you waiting. It's dark now and I've barely been on two rides, I got here at 11. Everything about the new park sucks, including their $9 bud lights. Count me out, Busch Gardens. This'll be my last trip here, I'll try to keep my family away from this horrible place, and I won't be recommending it to anyone visiting me either.

Busch Gardens is a very unique theme park and a must see for any family visiting Tampa.

We got a two day ticket to Busch Gardens and visited on a Friday and Monday in early May.   The park was pretty crowded with students on field trips on Friday, but Monday's crowd was extremely light.   On of the park employees told us said they were only expecting 5000 people and the weather was beautiful. 

There is really something for everyone here - very thrilling roller coasters (maybe 6 of them - not sure because we didn't ride them).   A good third of the park is a big open park area with all the usual zoo animals.  The grounds are very well kept snd it seems to be a pretty decent setting for the animals.  We were esoecially impressed with the space set aside for chimps and gorillas, but it was all pretty impressive and comparable to the best zoos I've been to (including Sand Diego, St. Louis and Omaha, all pretty well-regarded zoo's).

OMMGGG this place is uhhhhhmazzzzzing.  We did the Giraffe feeding and got to use my Sea World, CA pass to get 10% discount and we got to go on the "safari" and see the animals up close.  It was pretty unreal.  There was a zebra following our truck right behind us and the giraffes are literally up in your face!!!  I'd totally recommend this place if you are ever in Orlando, Tampa area.  

Didn't ride the rides because they're rollercoasters and my kid's only 5, but they looked pretty fast =P

Ps.  I read reviews comparing this place to Disney's Animal Kingdom, but it is SO different, IMO.

Busch Gardens is a great park/zoo.  Busch Gardens parks always have great roller coasters.  They have plenty of rides to go on both for young kids and adults.  The zoo part of the park is nice also for younger kids.  The major roller coasters, Shiekra and Cheetah Run you may want to try to hit those first because the always have long lines.  I love Shiekra it is by far one of the best rides in the park, Cheetah Run on the other had is long and pretty fast but if you like thrills loops and cork screws then you would get bored of this ride.  Overall this is a great park and I love coming here.

Howloscream? Waste of money and time. Busch Gardens does not care one iota about your experience. Tickets are oversold. It took 40 minutes to just get into the park. Attraction wait times are 1-2 hours. You can pay an additional $65 for a fast pass and although we can afford it, I feel tremendously sorry for the ones who scrape up enough just for the regular ticket and then are forced to wait 90 minutes in line in the heat with their children. For the life of me, I don't understand why anyone would want to go and be subjected to any of this. I wouldn't go back if you gave me a fast pass.

Overall a great experience. 

Arrive at 915 930 to park, get on tram and get to park entrance. Get through metal detectors. 

Then... Pass Morocco and beautiful gardens as you go to left and get to Sheikra area by the flamingos. They make you wait til 1030 but RUN to Sheikra so you can ride it once early in the day with a limited line. 

This park has less open hours than Disney and Universal. If you like roller coasters though... It's a MUST. I'd recommend coming here for a Day 1 of a trip if you are also going to Disney or Universal because it is not as nice (what can compare to Disney?!) but again so many roller coasters so it's totes worth it!

My kids loved it and dining pass it worth it. My only bad experience is with my Broad shoulders the seats can be uncomfortable and I have to sit in the seats designed for bigger guys and even then it's tight on me. Make the rope on buckle longer for us guys who are bigger than a pole.

Um lugar tão bom quanto a disney, é muito grande e divertido, tem montanhas russas radicais e outros brinquedos tanto quanto, também tem um zoo meio safari, a cervejaria da bud, e muitas outras coisas onde o dia passa muito rapido pois tem muitas atrações, vale muito a pena ir para conhecer este parque, principalmente se gostar de animais e atrações radicais.

First off this park is more of a zoo if your not a thrill seeker but great if you love roller coasters. would have rated it fours stars and if I wasn't as nice as I am would have given it two because of the obviously rigged claw machines. Two times I got the prize exactly in the claws and yet it let it go....absolutely asinine ...if your going to do rigged games then put more carnival games rather then stupid claw machines or increase claw strength . Shame on you.
Yippppeeee!  It was physics day here!  Kids happy to be doing physics homework in the park.

We stopped in on a cool Friday. We were hoping there would not be a ton of people here since spring break was over. We paid our $20 for parking (ouch) and were flagged down to parking lot C. Easy parking and polite attendants. Some people were driving all over the place being super picky about where they parked but given it was a high of 70 it did not really matter where we parked. 

Walked up to the shuttle and it took us straight to the front doors. Our tickets were marked Gate C so off we went. Walked through the metal detector and zapped our tickets and in we went. 

There were maps of the park so we grabbed one and we took the left avenue for our day's adventure. Most people were going right so we figured why fight the crowds and go the other direction. 

Some of the restaurants were not open yet (11 AM) weird so we had to walk a ways until we located a place that was open. We opted for the BBQ place which turned out to be very good. 

Walked throughout the park all day and left by 6 pm. It was a great day. Not too busy and the weather could not have been any better.

We mainly went to Busch Gardens for the Lunch with Elmo that they offer. 

We hurried threw the park to find the Elmo and friends area and then realized that we had scheduled the previous Thursday, we talked to the manager and they had no problem getting us in to the lunch that day. 

I felt like they helped out really well in our time of need. 

The lunch with Elmo and friends was incredible, Both my daughter wife and I loved it tremendously. 

The food was great and the characters were awesome. They really took a long time in the heat and everything to spend time with all the kids. 

On to the rest of the park, I love roller coasters and this place has plenty of them. Unfortunately I didn't ride any, I had a serious headache from a sinus infection, but the ride looked totally awesome. 

The one great thing we did was ride the Train ride around the park. 

I think the one thing I was not into was the lack of merchandising, the lack of things to look through was ridiculous. 

Other than that I loved Busch Gardens and would definitely go back.

Having an amusement park near by? There's nothing better than that!

Amazing roller coasters and events. Lines can be long during the peak seasons but it's not bad if you go when it's not so busy. Besides all the rides there's also animal sight seeings and shows to watch. It's great for kids and also fun for adults. They have a lot of different places to eat at inside the park too!

it was a very nice visit, at least it started like that. We went there and bought 3 visits entrance, by 4 adults and 2 kids. It was a nice experience, the train,Xmass events were all nice...until we decided to eat something to continue our experience..

we stopped by Zagora Cafe and bought burgers and chicken nuggets (kid's menu), and guess what happened? immediately after trying a french fry, I noticed a taste difference. Later I tasted all of our fries (6 menu totally), and they were tasting the same..for burgers, it was not that good at all. but the terrible parts started when chicken nuggets were eaten by our kids. They did not even  finished them, just 1 little part each of then..and now, both of them are throwing up, still, and food-poissoned. 

My brother in law also threw up on the road back to Orlando. He said he tried one of the nuggets, that is why he strongly threw up. We did take care of the kids, and now it is 6.43am in the morning, I will go to hospital because I now suspect that this place may have GI INFECTION, and everybody can be sick after eating there. I am working in the medical field more than 10 years now, and I am expert about infections. I am pretty sure that this place is spreading viruses and bacterias. 

stay away from this place, if you are willing to save your kids' lives. Just a note, if your kid is 2 years old or smaller, then it can be life-dangerous to get such an infection. ALso note that this does not mean it will be easy to handle the infection after they are 3 years old. EVen my brother in law (more than 34 yo), it is quite difficult to handle the infection. 

stay away! I am going to take also an action against these people who are not putting efforts for the hygiene. They dont respect people..they dont respect people's lives.

Busch Gardens used to be one of my favorite amusement parks in Florida. With that being said my experience with them this past weekend altered my opinion. It was my boyfriend's first time attending and I was excited to show him some of my favorite rides at the park.Unfortunately that wasn't possible because the majority of the rides were experiencing technical difficulties and none of the workers were able to tell us an estimated time. 

Initially we went to Cheetah Hunt and the "estimated wait time" was 10 minutes. As we were next in line to get on the ride they announced that they were having technical difficulties and since we were so close to getting on, we decided to wait. In total the wait time was 30 minutes which we didn't mind at first since it was only our first ride. Afterwards, we walked over to Falcon's Fury. The estimated wait time was 10 minutes as well but as we are waiting in line they announced that they were having technical difficulties and none of the workers could give us information about what was going on or how long it would take so we decided to go to another ride meanwhile. We ended up going on Scorpion and afterwards Falcon's Fury was working so we decided to do the line once again and we finally got to go on it. We hoped that it wouldn't happen again but our luck fell short. We walked over to Sheikra and the workers rudely told us that the ride was closed due to technical difficulties so we couldn't go in. That is when we got frustrated because Sheikra is the most popular ride which I was excited to get on and it wasn't possible. We tried to stay positive and we remembered that we had yet to go on Montu. So we walked to Montu and once again the worker tells us that they are experiencing difficulties and they wouldn't know how long it might take. Right after that we just decided to leave the park. 

The whole experience was unpleasant, and quite frankly I feel like I wasted my time and money.

Buy the All Day Dining Plan, even if you only eat one meal here. 
Read more about it at the bottom of my review.
Came on July 5th. Arrived at 9am. parked slowly filled up through the day. By 1 or 2 pm we started feeling the press of people. All the staff, including the food service staff was very friendly. 
We ate at three different restaurants, Colony House, Zambia Smokehouse and the Desert Grill. Unlike a lot of parks, the food at each restaurant was good. Not OMG Great! but good - much better than I expected. Each place offers a different dining atmosphere. 
Zambia Smokehouse - says it has A/C. If they did it wasn't working. 
Desert Grill - Great A/C! Large open area with picnic tables lined up in front of a stage. We escaped to here when the rain came.
Colony House - This has the best view. You can look out onto the grazing range and watch the Giraffes, zebras...etc. Good A/C and it has a full bar.
For the most part they are pretty effficient at moving people through ride lines, but it is what it is. They tout that the Cheetah rollercoaster can move almost 1400 people an hour. The line does move quick. 
The Montu coaster (in the Egypt area) is hard to get to because of the inefficient way the park is laid out, but it is well worth it. It is my favorite coaster in the park.
The log flume ride is one of the longest waits - tight, cramped line and hot. Not worth the wait if you ask me. 
I think the MOST IMPRESSIVE part of this park is their animal exhibits. I'm not a big fan of zoos but I have to say I am impressed with the focus on the the animals and the habitats they have for them. It is obvious they love and care for their animals as well as the best of zoos. DO NOT PASS UP the opportunity to take in any of the "animal closeups" where the keepers come out and tell you intimate details about their animals. Not just information about the species but about the animals, their names and their individual personalities. The Elephants, Cheetahs, tiger and ape exhibits offer multiple points of view of the animals. 

The bad. The layout of the park. There is no shortcut through the middle of the park. You do A LOT of walking. The Egyptian area where the MONTU coaster is (about the only thing there really) is more or less a spur off the main park loop. 

ALL DAY DINING.
For an extra $10 dollars a ticket you eat free as much as you want at all the major restaurants in the park AND HALF PRICE at all other food vendors in the park. When water is $2.50 a bottle, you save quick. For 4 us us, we spent maybe an extra $20 on food-drink and that was out of convenience. We could have spent less. BEER IS HALF PRICE TOO. We paid $6.00 for two 20oz. beers intead of $12.

Busch Gardens is a nice theme park and the rides are awesome, they also seem to treat the animals really well and give them a large area to roam. 

Cons:
Long wait times for rides (still better than Disneyland wait times).

TIP:
If you go here buy your tickets online rather than at the gate, it will save you money, I also highly recommend you get the wrist band to eat at the park, totally worth it!

Go with someone who is local and knows the place otherwise you might waste time not knowing where to go. When we started, we went to the left and everything was closed except the kangaroo and bird sanctuary. Rides, all the food places were shut down and it was frustrating because they didn't have any signs or people informing you what was open and what was closed in the front. The map gives you a layout, but the signs are poorly placed; hence why you want to go with someone who knows where the rides are. I'd recommend going when they open to ensure you can get through everything because we got there around 1 pm and we missed a couple of the rides at the very end. During the spring, they only stay open until 7 pm and when it's 7, they are extremely quick about shutting everything down and pushing you out the door. They do leave all the shops at the very front open for last minute purchases.

My son and I were waiting in line for cobra's curse and the rest of my group took off to ride the Montu roller coaster. We were waiting in line for a good 30 minutes and after the first 20 we stopped moving. No announcement made but slowly people started coming from the front of the line and walking out. After a few more minutes, more people started leaving so we just took off with this group. The ride stopped for some reason but they never announced it to all the people standing in line. The other group was able to get through the Montu twice and I went with my other son again on that in less than five minutes.

We walked over to the Falcon's Fury and a couple went to get in line for that ride. They were at the front after 20 minutes and they closed that ride. It wasn't until 30 minutes later we noticed it back up and running again... a little concerning when they have to shut rides down.

It's definitely not clean, but can be enjoyable with less crowds and more affordable if you want to ride roller coasters. They have a couple water rides, which are in the back of the park. There is a safari ride, I don't know if that cost more money and a train ride which would be nice if you want a small break from walking around the park. They do have several animals throughout the park you can stop and watch (Kangaroos, birds, alligators, penguins, elephants, cheetahs, and more in the Safari section). The the number of kangaroos they had, it looked miserable in the small space. Maybe there is a larger habitat they get to roam after hours...

If you live there it's worth the extra to purchase the annual pass. It makes no sense to purchase a one day because of the price different.

We had an extra day after our cruise in Tampa so we decided to the park.  We got there around noon and the park was packed with school bus kids.  Getting in the park was a pain.  it had scanners that were self service that took forever.  There were 25 people in front of us and it took about 30 mins to get in.  This is why it only gets 4 stars not five because of the worst front gate of any park i have ever been to.  Once in though it was great.  The lines for the ride were really long so we paid the extra money to get the quick passes.  It is well worth it if it is a busy day and you only have half a day to do the park.  The park has several really good coasters and then others that are ok.  I would still recommend you do them all at least once.  The train is a must do to see all of the animals.  We had a fun day at the park and i would go back again to get the rest of the stuff done we couldn't during that trip.

I went to this location for the first time this year.  I have to say that bad part about going to parks now-a-days is that it can be super expensive.  I love animals and I have always wanted to go to this location.  Now here is the issue, I am on the busty side and we read all the weight and size information on the rides and everything before we waited in lines. 
We get to one of the rides and read the measurements and my husband and I were both in the clear. After we waited for under a half hour (which isn't bad at all) it is our turn to get on the ride.  My husband and I sit in the seats and we don't fit. ANYWHERE.  We went into the larger lines (4 and 5) just to be on the safe side. 
I actually had to have 2 people push down on the harness to get it clipped and it still didn't actually clip well.  They said that is ok but I couldn't breathe.  I was so uncomfortable and had to get out!  I was so embarrassed because they kept wanting to try. I finally got of the ride and walked away mortified and crying.  I understand they were trying to help but when I say I am done then that means don't try anymore.  I have never been that embarrassed before in my life.  
The other good thing that came out of this day was that the weather was perfect.  Most of the animals were out yet a lot of them were sleeping.  I did get a lot of good pictures and the park really wasn't that packed so that was an added bonus.  Of course I will come back to this location but because of the prices and the fact that we couldn't get on the rides, it won't be any time soon.

When I was in high school I used to work at Busch Gardens Williamsburg in Virginia. This is not nearly as good. Don't get me wrong its still nice just not as good as it's Virginia counterpart. I did have a good time overall though and they run a great deal with the pay for a day and get the whole year.

I've always loved this park.  I've been here plenty of times, and this last one was a little disappointing.  It's still a great park, but after paying $77 to get my three-year-old in, I wish there were more that a three-year-old could do.  I was also a little disappointed that I couldn't find the free beer they used to have.  It's possible that I missed it, but I looked pretty hard.  It was pretty expensive to buy beer (you'd think it would be cheaper, you're basically buying it at an outlet store, although maybe that's different now that they don't have the brewery anymore), so I went without.  Food was also expensive.  It felt like they were nickel-and-diming me after I had already paid $250 to get in.  Next time, I'll find a Florida resident to go with me.

A while ago, I went to Busch Gardens on a school field trip. I enjoyed my stay. Even though it rained, and it was still pretty fun. The rides were exhilarating and the live shows were excellent. The park was not the cleanest, as I could tell it was a little old. But, otherwise, a very wonderful experience.
Why in the world the half the concession stands CLOSED during Spring Break!! Someone needs to be fired. Will never come back.

We ate at Serengeti overlook buffet. Food was blah. We weren't told that we have to pay 6 dollars extra for buffet even if we paid for all day dining for more than thirty dollars per person. The only thing good at that place is the server,  Cristalys, who was very professional and very courteous to the customers. Manager Richard something was not friendly at all and was rushing while talking to us giving us the impression that he was wasting his time with us. Cristalysl handled our situation much more professional and was very accommodating.
Great park LOVE animals. We had lots of fun...food is pretty expensive  but I expect that from a theme park.

I planned a trip to Busch gardens and was not happy with how it went. First off two of the roller coasters were not working, Cobra and kumba. The roller coasters are the main reason we were going. After that when we were in line for the log ride twice it was stopped for reasons unknown. That can happen but it caused an extra 45 minutes wait time. Then while waiting for montu the ride was stopped to retrieve items that customers dropped! This is unacceptable! There are many signs warning you not to bring loose items on the ride. Are people dumb? If this is your policy then don't bother putting signs up saying not responsible for lost items. Those items being retrieved added another 35 minutes to the wait time. The other ride that stopped for a good portion of the day was the sky ride. Again we were disappointed. We still had a good time but will not be going back anytime soon.

DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY!! Purchased tickets for my family on a trip from NY via the buschgardens website.. Including unlimited quick pass. Upon arrival I was informed that the quick pass I purchased was for sea world?? Didn't even purchase seaword tickets. Purchased through a website progression when I purchased the park tickets. HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!! CONSIDERING IT WAS THEIR WEBSITE THAT THE TICKETS WERE PURCHASED FROM! Never coming back here again!! NEVER WOULD HAVE HAPPENED AT DISNEY OR UNIVERSAL!!

If you're spending the money to go to an amusement park - don't come here. We spend our first two hours here in line for rides that stopped working when we were almost to the front and spent 45 min already in line. Then we rode the Seikra and it stopped and we were stuck on it! Spent about 25 min in the blazing sun at a 90 degree angle as an alarm was sounding, which really doesn't help the atmosphere up there. My brother was crying and my mom and I were about ready to have a panic attack. All we got out of this was ONE fast pass. The managers and park really didn't care. We looked up the Sheikra online later and this seems to happen a lot, maybe they need to take better care of their park. Pretty sketchy - especially since multiple rides had to close for malfunctions. 
The park is somewhat hard to navigate and it's hard to find all the animals because of how poor it's set up. But the animals are interesting to look at, but might as well just go to the zoo since they're probably treated better. 
Then it started pouring and everything was shut down, they didn't even keep open the animal pavilion so everyone had absolutely nothing to do and they don't have any sort of compensating weather policy so if you do come, come when there's for sure no rain
We were planning on finding a manager to discuss these issues and how disappointing it was to spend $700 on a crappy day. But by the end of the day we were so sick of it and done we just went home.

What a shame!  They have taken the ice skating show and turned it into yet another routine song and dance show!  As if there were not enough already.  People are looking for adventure and previous skating shows did just that.  Now, just another boring show.., we just keep walking past now days...

Overall the rides were great, wish they had more options for individuals who don't like intense rides. Besides the rides the overall experience was horrible. The workers all had an attitude when asked a simple question or when purchasing an item. The food selection was horrific, there was a hair in my food but luckily I got a refund hassle free. You would think for the countries they have around the world they'd have food relating to that country but they do not. Also this park is every confusing to get around. Overall, I would not come again and I would spend my money on a more promising park such as Disney World.

Busch Gardens Tampa earned a new level of respect from my last visit last November - see, I had always looked upon it as a theme park not quite themed as well as its sibling in Williamsburg, VA, but not quite as lowly as say, a run-of-the-mill amusement park.  However, as I exited the skyway ride, we came upon a covered area that detailed the history of the park, through the years (I am always a sucker for retro stuff) which showed its progression and changes - bascially, the park it is today is a result of changing attitudes, tourist cycles and ownership - it's almost like an evolutionary canvas that is yet to be complete.
