While that might sound new-agey and weird, it did give me a better understanding and made me look beyond the sometimes forced-feeling as you pass from the different 'African' themes in the park.  I had never realized how old the park was, and when I learned that, it actually made me appreciate it a lot more.

Sure, most visitors are going to just sprint past the smaller details en route to Sheikra (which is pretty neat in itself) - if you have the time and patience to really tour the park, you'll see the love that's in the construction and landscaping...I mean, I had thought of the giant Plantation house as ostentascious, but when I looked further into its history, it didn't seem quite so random!

As other area attractions go, don't be disuaded by nonchalant theme park workers - they're good and bad ones, all not paid enough to do the hard work they have to do - and just go and enjoy!

I went to Busch Gardens Tampa in February 2015 and was blown away. I didn't have high expectations coming in to the park, but I was pleased coming out. 
SheiKra-is a great dive coaster and is really fun. The drop is thrilling and is solid ride!
Cheetah Hunt-is the most "fun" coaster in the park. It's a long ride, and packs a punch. It goes on forever but you still don't want it to stop.
Montu-this is one of the most intense B&M inverts out there. It really set the mold for other inverts out there and is also a long ride
Kumba-a great old school coaster that is overlooked. It's a great ride and not ever a long line. 
I recommend this park to all coaster lovers!

Coasters!!!! This is the best park I have been to if you want to hit up awesome coaster after awesome coaster. 

SheiKra is AHHHHmazing! The most thrilling, terrifying, awesome coaster ever. When you are ascending to the drop you are literrally looking up at the sky. The climb is a 47-degree 200-foot lift hill but it feels like 80-degrees. The train then makes a U-turn and approaches the holding brake, which suspends the train for about 6 seconds at 90-degrees... it's crazy!!! And it def feels more than 6 seconds. 

Cheetah Hunt is the newest of coasters and is okay. Not my favorite. 

Montu was my favorite, so smooth and floor less. You get to enjoy the excitement in its entirety because it's not jerky in the least. Love it!!!

Skyride is a nice relaxing ride that taps you along the sky of the park so you get a nice bird's eye view of all surroundings. 

Rhino Rally has gone down hill. I feel like the tour guides take it a little too far with the jokes and are basically laughing at how lame the ride it. I used to like it but they made it a bit smaller due to some construction. 

SandSerpent is a kid roller coaster but Oh. My. Word. We felt like we were going to go over the edge at any moment. It definitely has the feel of a boardwalk coaster and going from being secured in shoulder straps to a lap bar, it's just a little frightening. Nice adrenaline rush though!

Oh, and they have Woodchuck on tap in the pub, Done!

I have been coming to Busch since the early 90's... and almost always enjoy it. Lots of things to do, and the rides are fun (I do miss Qwazi! :( )  Animal environments are the best in Tampa, far better than the local zoo.

Food needs some serious improvement... it is terrible.

Smoking sections need to be made child free, and moved somewhere where the smoke won't stink up the traffic areas. And smoking outside of the smoking areas need to be enforced!

Parking is fine. Service is usually good when you need it. All in all, fun... just don't eat there!

I love this park.  There are several great coasters.  There is also enough good stuff to do with the smaller kids.  My daughter loved it. This park has something for everyone.  

Overall, worth the trip from Orlando to hang out.  Great for kids of all ages.

I have passes here and I LOVE IT!! I really don't understand why this park isn't advertised like others here in Florida. It has GIANT rides and a BUNCH of animals!!! It's like Animal Kingdom at Disney but with more rides!!! I recommend it for all ages because they even have a Sesame Street Place!! They have shows with characters, a big water playground, kid rides, and all kinds of stuff!!! The food is really good and for all day drinks it's like $10 and with the cup you get $1 refills for the rest of the year!!! How could you not LOVE IT!!!

Havent been to this place in nearly 20 years.. and WOW.. what a huge differnce in the place.  From the live petting zoo areas to the interactive animal tours and then all of those AMAZING roller coasters.. this was a great family vacation!  Highly recommend going when the gates first open - and pass up all of the rides to head straight for the kangaroo petting / feeding area first... most people are rushing to be first ont he rides - and you will get a very private one on one feeding with these remarkable animals..

I am a Florida Girl and this is my main park for fun and thrills. I know it may not compare to the top 10 coasters you see on the travel channel and stuff, but I don't like those crazy rides all the time, so the roller coasters here are a nice ride. So what do I love about Busch Gardens...1. They have animals and coasters. 2. They have howl o scream 3.Their prices are reasonable. 

1. I like the fact that I can see animals and ride rides for one price. The animals you may find include alligators, flamingos, primates, cheetahs, tigers, rhinos, hippos(I think) and giraffes. They also have a cool bird area where you can feed these pretty colorful birds, I forgot their names. My favorite rides are cheetah hunt and sheikra. They also have an ice skating show, but I never have time to watch it.

2. Howl o scream is their Halloween themed nights. There are zombies walking around, people hiding trying to scare you, and haunted houses. I hate hunted houses...I scream and laugh with my eyes closed the entire time. I hate things popping out even though I know its not real. I don't know why I even torture myself with them. You can also ride the rides during howl o scream and there are discounted prices on certain nights. It's really fun.

3. You can pay less than $100 and get in the rest of the year free. have you been to Disney or Universal lately? If you have, you know that less than $100 for a year pass is GREAT!

BTW: Parking is around $17

From the POV of a tourist / parent of two girls, ages 7 & 8: we had a *great* day at Busch Gardens.

Jungala was a BIG hit with my kids. They easily spent 2.5 hours climbing around. They rode the treetop zip line gliders a dozen times. And the animal experiences in this area are *amazing*: Get face-to-face - literally - with a tiger, just inches away behind a thick plate of glass. Ditto for a gharial (like a crocodile), flying foxes (huge bats), gibbons. Really, really cool.

TIP: if it's hot and you have kids, have them wear bathing suits under their clothes. There are two water play areas in Jungala - one for tots and one for older kids.

The park was really quiet overall, especially (I have to guess) for spring break. Granted, we weren't going on big rollercoasters, but our longest wait for anything was under 10 minutes. Many things we just walked right on. My advice would be to arrive later (10-11ish) and stay til close. Ride operators indicated that the crush of "Orlando people" tend to come at open and leave by 4. There was literally " -0- minutes wait" for even the big roller coasters toward the end of the day.

OTHER TIP: Safari experiences cost extra, and they didn't look worth it. After having spent $300 on admissions & parking, we were not interested in dropping another $50 on a jeep ride. No one in our party had a lesser time because of it. We felt we got good peeks at the "Serengeti" animals via the skyride & train.

Only downside was that the entrance to each "land" is not super-obvious, and the wayfinding leaves a bit to be desired. Pay good attention to your park map, or you could really miss a lot or waste tons of time seeking out bathrooms.

Great overall. Clean, well maintained, beautiful greenery & lots of shade, Jungala area fills the bill for ages 6-10. Yay, BG!

PS: Yeah, brewery appears to be gone, and your no-longer-free Bud will cost you $7. The Clydesdales are still there, though, which are the only bits of the Busch legacy that my family was interested in.

Busch Gardens is the best amusement park in tampa area. Very affordable with their monthly plans to addition parks. Fun areas like the kiddie area for smaller kids and they have fun things to do in that area with adults.

I have wanted to visit Busch Gardens for a very long time. Finally for my birthday, the treat was to visit Busch Gardens. We drove 7 hours down I-75 from Atlanta to visit Busch Gardens. The drive was worth it. We had a great time, mostly riding coasters, but we did get to see some animals.

I love the roller coasters. Sheikra was my favorite. Then Cheetah Hunt, along with Gwazi. Montu made me and my friends nausea. We didn't get to ride Kumba and Scorpion. Kumba was closed and Scorpion didn't have the quick queve and the line was long. We did Rhino Rally and that was cool. I was a little disappointed that it was very short.

Speaking of Quick Queve, Quick Queve is something I would purchase, you can bypass the lines with it. Also get the food special deal, or diner deal (what ever they call it) you can go inside the restaurant and get whatever you want, and you could always go back to get more food. Quick Queve will come in handy for Cheetah Hunt. When we went back in February, the lines were very long.

Also the reason I like Gwazi was that was the first ride we rode, because it was the closest to the entrance. It wasn't the painful bumps you have on some wooden coasters. So ride this one first.

Finally, don't ride the river rapids during the winter time. We went in February and it was breezy and 65 degrees. So the water was freezing. So the lowest temperature, that is good to ride the rapids would be 75 degrees. 

That's about. Busch Gardens is a must place to visit in the Tampa area. So have fun and enjoy Busch Gardens like we did. I hope to return to Busch Gardens again very soon.

Ok this park is amazing without a doubt, lots of fun stuff to do all day here, the prices are fair the food is good and its so big that you have to go back time after time just to take ot all in.  A must do if you visit florida.

I love this park...  Oh how I love thee. Let me count the ways.
1. I love you because you are not afraid to shake up or scare your guests
The Howl O Scream is so much scarier than Universal it is scary.  The roller coasters are fantastic unlike the wimpy things at Disney and the few somewhat anemic ones at Universal.  And they serve beer and liquor all over.

2. I love you because there are no cutsy singing animals.  
You have real lions, and tigers, and well no bears but almost.  And I stared one in the eye and it tried to eat me.  Awesomeness!  And don't worry, there was a fence in the way.  Now the rhinos chasing the train is another story.

3.  I love you because of the free concerts.
And they get some good bands too.  Real classic rock banks like Lynard Skynard (sorry for the spelling if it is wrong) are there all the time.  And did I mention that they don't cost any more?

4. I love you for being reasonably priced.  
Unlike any other amusement park, I can get an anual pass for a reasonable price.  As a local it makes sense because I get discounts of food, beer, booze, souvineers, and get in any time I want.  When going to the Park to drink and look at the African Savannah costs me less than going to Ybor or Hyde Park, they are definately doing something right.

5.  I love you because of the coasters.
Did I mention that they are not afraid to shake you up?  The coasters are awesome.  Even the wooden one will make you want to kiss the ground and then hop back on for another ride.  And frankly the only one I don't love is the new Cheetah Hunt.  It is BORING since it is long and fast with few turns, drops, or loops.  

Really it is hard not to like.  It lacks the polish of Disney and Universal but that is actually what makes it fun.  It is not antiseptic like other places.  This is real and raw and, well, fun.

I had an annual pass last year.  I will get another this year.  I think that it is money well spent.

After you outgrow Disneyland/world, you come here. The coasters are sweet and all have their redeeming points. I believe I did them all and had a great time. Lines get long starting in early afternoon, but we didn't wait longer than 30min during peak time. I suggest getting there early, doing as much as you can, and when things get crowded do the gondola, and or enjoy some food. I like that you can walk around drinking a beer. 

Speaking of beer, I would also suggest signing up early for the beer tasting class offered. This caps out later in the day and you usually have to sign up on session in advance, but free beer! Also, at the main hub you can get 2 free mini beers. Careful hitting the coasters after both of those...

Great fun!  Went on a Wednesday -perfect!  No lines, no crowds.  Used a online coupon from Retail me not and got a child's free ticket.  Bring your own water.  Ask the worker bees for directions.  Todd from maintenance was a God send. When the rain came he showed us the quickest way to the exit, no muss no fuss.

Being both a roller coaster and animal enthusiast, it made perfect sense for me to visit Busch Gardens when on vacation in Florida. 

What must have been the hottest day of the year didn't bode well for my English acclimatisation or my pale skin but I did manage to stay in the shade as much as i could. 

The roller-coasters here are epic! If you like big thrills, then this is the place to visit. Cheetah Run was one of my particular favourites, and i also stuck around for the animal demonstration where you can see a Cheetah chasing it's dinner - very impressive. 

The safari and giraffe feeding experience was definitely not to be missed. Being that close to a giraffe was amazing - not so much when i got saliva all over my hand! Haha. I wouldn't hesitate in returning to Busch Gardens!

Nice place. Didnt ride roller coasters.  I didnt feel like having a heart attack. Like all other parks, its expensive but what the hell, youre not doing this everyday.   Spend money on the meal plan, the express pass for the rides....its worth it....

Who doesn't like Busch gardens??? It was exactly the same great theme park as it was back in the 80's with some fabulous upgrades. Clean,fun, family friendly!! Just a great day last Friday s I chaperoned a field trip. Great new rides and a zoo that would rival big city, stand alone zoos. I went for free since I was a chaperone, but I believe the prices for admission were pretty competitive for the Florida theme park extravaganza. Food is expensive. Water, soft drinks and adult beverages are expensive as well. Just had a great day at Busch Gardens!!

i'm completely disappointed from Busch Garden! Today we visited this park. We pay $17 for parking and $95 for entrance. And than are 4 or 5 of the best attractions closed!!! Addionally are the most railroad crossing closed,too! So we can't get easy to the remaining attractions like the hippos. Because that problem we can't see the meet the keepers of the hippos! Because that things all together,I'm really very very angry about that and really disappointed about the whole park and service for the visitors! The maintenance and addionally build up pf the park is very great,but not with this service and on that way! Why must I pay the whole price and get the half of attractions and don't have fun at the moment! Can I get my money back, to invest in better things?!
I hope you invest my money for the animals! For the great reserve for the animals to live,you get the two stars!

It's a roller coaster park on top of a zoo, I do miss when Budweiser owned it, I miss free beer. Incredible amusement park definitely get the season pass and go in the afternoon you can hit the rides one after another no line.
Great coasters!   If you go on a rainy (drizzling, not pouring) day, then skip the Quick Que pass.   Otherwise, the pass is well worth the money so you can jump to the front of the line!

Fun times. Plenty of rides for the family. If you are going to go more than once in a season get a season pass it pays for itself as you get discounts on food and drinks and for the spring they have food and wine month on the weekends with concerts. Good family fun.

Worst place ever.  Do not go.  2 hour wait to get in.  2 hour wait for a terrible cheeseburger.  Nothing but lines and zero fun.  Looking for water? Wait 2 hours.  Need to pee? Wait 2 hours.  DO NOT GO.
Great amusement park! Even better to go during Halloween for the special scary stuff. The Sheikra ride is awesome! I think the "pay for one day, go for the whole year" still exists, doesn't it?

I decided to take my boyfriend to Busch Gardens for a belated birthday gift. I even paid extra for the fast passes. He loved every bit of it! Yes there are not a lot of coasters. Yes the price of admission is a tad high. Yes the food options are not comparable to Disney World. But, if you can look past all that this park is incredible! The animals are amazing (especially the hyena). The vegetation throughout the park really gave a zoo-like feel. The Cheetah Hunt coaster was by far our favorite ride. I appreciated how convenient the locker rentals were as well as the cubby holes placed near the rides. My boyfriend and I decided to ride the Falcon Fury ride (for the first time). IT IS NOT FOR THE FAINT OF HEART. Falcon Fury was probably the scariest yet most exciting thrill ride I have ever been on. Don't forget to stop by the gift shops for cute souvenirs (appropriately priced). Definitely would go back!!!! Hopefully it won't be as hot outside this time.

We purchased tickets in advance to the elephant insider tour. The instructions indicate that check-in starts at 10:15 and the tour starts promptly at 10:30 AM. The park opens at 10 AM and you have to go through bag check prior to entering the park. Given that the lines are terribly long and the bag checkers aren't the fastest (In fact the bag check her in our line continuingly joked and converse with the people ahead of us delaying our entry even longer). That leaves you exactly 15 minutes to go through baggage check, go through the ticket line, and also get to the check-in station in the middle of the park. We arrived three minutes ahead of The 1030 deadline only to learn that the tour left early prior to 1030 and we would not be able to participate in the tour. The check in person refuse to contact the tour guide althoughThe other check in people volunteer to walk us over to the elephant area. After 10 minutes of prodding, he finally called her and by then she refused.

Very disappointing, given that the other insider tors also state that the check-in is 15 minutes prior and the other tour guides were willing to wait for the other participants until they arrive and also the tour started after their designated start time

If you can imagine that you are there for vacation, are only there for one day and this is your only opportunity to complete the tour, it's the first tour of the day and you only have 15 minutes to get from the entrance to the middle of the park and find your way there, it's pretty frustrating when the tour leaves early and they are not willing to accommodate you given that it's their fault that they left early.

When the tour guide arrive to approve the refund, she didn't not even acknowledge my presence.

This will contain both negative and positive points of my visit but I will deal with the negative first!! 

I returned to Busch Gardens after visiting around a year ago with my wife. When I was here in 2015, I LOVED IT and would rave to everyone about how much there is to do at Busch Gardens for an amazing day out. 

I was there the other day and I was totally underwhelmed. The staff at the rides do not even entertain a 'Good Morning' or a 'Thank you'...simply the standard "How Many?" question and a finger pointing to where they would like you to stand. I'm not at the park for a friendly face, don't get me wrong, but it really helps. I heard many people comment about how rude some employees are. 

Speaking of the attractions - many of the attractions were closed and up until around 2pm (I was there at 10am) I could swear I was walking around a closed park. In fact, it wasn't until around 4pm that Sheikra opened. However it seemed that the closed Falcons Fury to counter balance this. I will say though that many of the roller coasters do look like they are in dire need of a refurb.

Some of the cafes were closed, most of the concession stands were covered and not in operation and even the stores which were open didn't seem to be properly staffed. We had to wander around and look for a member of staff to ring through our soft drinks

Prices seem to have soared for things like food and drink, and also the Serengeti Safari etc. I was disappointed as I was looking forward to this. 

Finally, I was a little taken aback to see that one of the hyenas looked pretty injured on its back which had left a huge scab. I didn't expect to see this and it stuck with me. 

AND NOW THE POSITIVE!

The park does still have some redeeming qualities, the roller coasters are still fun, the animal viewing areas are excellent and diverse. I especially love the tiger viewing window that lets you put your head inside the tiger enclosure. I was lucky today that one of the tigers chose to fall asleep right at this window and I felt really close. It was amazing. 

The Ice Skating show was fantastic and thrilling, with different scenes, scents and interactive weather effects as a part of the show such as snow and bubbles etc. It also had beautiful animals as part of the stage show Luke huskies and exotic birds. 

Lastly, the gorilla enclosure is always a treat. Especially with the little baby they have right now! 

All in all, I would say the day was fine.

I grew up visiting Busch Gardens on a regular basis. I love that some parts never change. The landscaping is gorgeous and provides many photo opps. Since it had a been a few years since my last visit,  I studied their website and watch videos of the rides on youtube. For what it costs to play for the day, there is no way I am going to be unprepared. This was probably the 50th time I have been to the park, I kid you not. I was impressed with everything. Being a Floridian, I checked the weather and saw scattered rain but decided to give it a shot...I was pretty pumped after watching Falcons Fury lol. It was the perfect day! Little to no sweating and plenty of cloud cover. Granted they did stop a few rides but some ran in the rain which was fun. It wasn't pouring of course so it was still safe. The only ride we didn't get on was the Kumba, everytime we went by it was down:( Besides that we had a blast and I can't wait to go back. I do wish the decent food was a little cheaper. We ate at the Smoke House and split their biggest plate. We also were reminded that they close at six so reluctantly headed to the gate only to find that the cafe was still in full swing! We warmed up with a cup of Starbucks Coffee and shared a slice of chocolate truffle cake. Coffee was excellent but the cake was mediocre. I loved the rides! Falcons Fury.....I can't even describe it. Scariest ride I have been on and I am def a thrill seeker. We rode that one twice. What an experience! We loved Montu and Cheetah Hunt too! What a day! We even rode the several times in a row since there were no lines! It was a Tuesday, maybe that was part of the reason. I think a lot of people gave up when it started to rain. Not us! We even went to the pet show which was a really nice break from the non stop excitement that the coasters provided. We got there promptly and 10 am when they opened and loved how they play the national anthem before they open the gate too! The weather can be tricky sometimes you sweat like a pig of get rained on. I have a blast either way but was definitely feeling favored by the theme park God's on that day. #luckylady #flogrown #rideordie I have been to all of the theme parks in Florida. I have had year passes or more to each at different times. BG is by far the best value for the money! Dying to go back!
The new Cheetah ride is  smooth. I loved it! I felt like I was 8 again.  They have 3 cheetah cats on exhibit. the park is well manicured and the lines are not too long.

The overall park was nice and clean maintained park. What I liked was that it incorporated shows, zoo, and rides into one theme park. The staff friendly that you can speak to to ask for help or places to go. Some places have rude staff or staff that did want to be there. Not Busch Gardens, most if them greet you. We took the train ride that was relaxing and took a break from walking. Had lunch there which was expensive but that was expected at any heme park. The Pantopia Grill had entertainment and air conditioning. It was the nice park to visit in he Tampa area or if you want to take a ride from Orlando. The rise was 1-1.5 hour drive which was not too bad.

This is a fun place to spend the day, but I could only give an overall rating of Four to to the food quality at the park restaurants. Unless you wanted to pay exorbitant prices for better quality food you were stuck eating less than desirable tasting food. However the Ice show is a must see.

Great animal displays and interactions. Fantastic roller-coaster and water rides. My only negatives are a few areas of the park are a bit dull and showing their age and there are some long walks between attractions. Some of the shows like the ice skating show  'IcePloration' are horrible, only go see it if you want to get out of the hot sun. If you're going in October check out Howl-O-Scream! Great scary fun.

If you're looking for fun under the sun with your family or friends, this is the place to go! Be prepared to wait in line to get in if you're coming on the weekend. Various rides for kids and adults. Almost every stand I went to ran out of turkey legs but they're worth the struggle!

Out of all the amusement parks in the area, from Disney to universal studios...bush gardens remains our family favorite.  

Rides for all ages, from flume rides to
Bumper cars, carnival style rides for kids all the way to roller coasters of every shape and size, this is the best amusement park Florida has to offer.

Their corks and coasters event boasts many national musical acts all included in the admission price alongside booths filled with gourmet food. 

The food isn't fantastic unless you find the place that sells different grilled meats in a pita.  This most closely resembles real food.  Italian sausage pita with peppers and onions is sooooo good.

Fav rides are the cheetah hunt, the log flume, and the sky ride which gives you a full view of the park from up high.
Busch Gardens is owned by SeaWorld, so if you care about animals you might want to avoid these parks!

Our disappointment started while heading into the parking lot. Total chaos,  no one directing traffic. We were stuck in merging traffic over 30 minutes.  The park has fallen down in quality  since we last visited over 20 years ago. This park is running on a skeleton crew. Purchasing something to eat was not going to happen. The lines were so long...all day.

Great experience with my daughter! The only reason why I'm not giving Busch Gardens five-stars is because I wasted an additional $66.32 on two Quick Queue passes. We waited in a number of lines but there was not one attendant or separate line for those who purchased the quick queue - a complete waste of money on top of the expense of park admission.

I really enjoyed my stay here with family. There tons of games, rides and attractions. The only thing I did t like was the looooong lines. It was almost impossible to see everything because we were standing in the lines for rides the majority of the day. The only ppl really having fun we're those who had purchased a fast-pass for rides. I did like seeing the animal, but somethings gotta be done about those lines for them rides. Especially if I'm paying $100+ admission. Also, the food wasn't all that great and the associates who worked in the food department and in the stores had almost no customer service skills. They didn't know how to talk to people at all. 

I'd return and maybe try to bring my own food and a jug for water since everything was so expensive.

From the parking to the rides, every employee was professional and very friendly! The Sheikra was the scariest and fastest ride I have ever been on, definitely not for the faint of heart! 
And, unlike Six Flags, I really liked how even if you didn't have the extra time or money for the safari, you could view the animals from all over the park.

EXCELLENT. Perfect.
 I rode every single roller coaster they have and i just loved it. The "Sheikra", with a 90 degree fall, is absolutely frightening.
i also love the animals they have ( tigers, crocodiles...)

It REALLY is a nice place to visit with a group of friends or with family members. You'll definitely have a lot of fun.

I suggest you get the "fast pass" .The regular line lasts about 90 min. With the pass you get ahead of the line and it takes you only about 10 min.

I like Busch Gardens, it's just that I remember it being a bit funner. I've been going since i was 3 years old, and I still think it's fun, I just think they really need to take a while and remodel. Repaint everything, redo rides, redo restaurants.. Lots of stuff. The people that go here are quiet rude too. The staff is OK depending on what day you're going on. I have an annual pass, but it feels like it's almost always in construction or in the middle of being redone? Well I know they're improving it, and adding new stuff, so I'll give them a break.

Good place to go if you love roller coasters or you're bringing a child. 

The children's area is great, and it's great for adults, but if you're under 21 (yet over 10) years old and doesn't like rollar coasters, then I don't think there's much to do..

Basically, if you have the money/time to go to Disney World rather then Busch Gardens, then I highly recommend doing so.

So I went to Busch Gardens for the first time (ever...I think) for hero's appreciation weekend and had a blast! I was able to get myself and family free tickets for being in the military. The restaurants were great; especially the bbq one. That was our fav! I think the best ride there in our opinion was the Sheikra. Talk about thrilling. I think my stomach was still in my throat when we hit the second dive. While I did not get on the cheetah, it does seem like an amazing ride. At first glance it doesn't seem like much but once you see it on the map you see just how much thought was put into. The engineering behind that is simply amazing! Will definitely go back.
I haven't been on any rides here, I really enjoy seeing all the different animals that are here. This place is so much fun and amazing. My favorite is getting to see the giraffes.

My very first time visiting,  part of the Tampa City pass attractions. I enjoyed every moment of the park, the rides were extraordinary.  The food was fantastic, I purchased all day dining, because I was going to stay till the park closed. I also purchased quick queue, (was worth the money. ) I purchased the safari tour, was able to feed the giraffes. I didn't like that the park had designated locations for people to smoke.  Didn't appreciate the second hand smoke. Because I went on a weekday, the park closed at 7pm. It worth going. The attractions my kids were able to enjoy. The animal attractions were worth watching. If in the Tampa area, definitely a spot to visit.
This place is always amazing. They really take care of the animals. I love watching the animal docs. It's spread out to where the crowds do not feel so overwhelming.

This was an awesome experience.  My wife and I took our 9-month old daughter, who loved the animal show, Critters!  Since we had our little one with us, we only went on one roller-coaster ride- I can't remember the name but it was awesome!

I'm a Six Flags kind of guy, but Busch Gardens is was better for families with infants/toddlers.  The train that went through the park and highlighted the animals was great!  Giraffes, rhinos, gazelle, tigers, elephants, bald eagle- we saw them all!  We also got to feed the flamingos! 

I had purchased the Tampa City Pass and we got 5 attractions for $100, which is not bad.

My one criticism is the wait in line to get out city pass changed into a park pass took forever.  They need younger people working the computers because Danny took forever!  All in all though, it was a super experience!

Let me first say we were in desperate need of a vacation as my daughter is eleven and never been on a vacation... Sad I know!!!! Busch gardens was out first venture out that week. Thinking it would not take much to impress us and surely we would have a blast. I was seriously disappointed and sick I had spent money that was not easy to come by on a day at Busch gardens. Let me start with the good things. The employees were super friendly and eager to help. The ones who were spraying water on customers who asked were upbeat and kind. That was  unique as so many employees in today's society as well as those over the company are not affected by customers who aren't satisfied. Busch gardens defintely nailed the customer service department and gets a A+!! Secondly, the animals were awesome to watch and as close to being in a natural habitat as possible. I liked that they were not being trained and were roaming free for visitors to watch. Loved loved the gorilla family. Third, OUR VERY FAVORITE PART WAS the shridesat included dogs, cats, birds, pony, and a pig. As one who has worked animal rescue for years I thought I would not like the show. Because after all animals are just that. However I was really impressed by the love and affection shown for the animals. With rescue it is almost impossible not to domesticate an animal. Anyone who says different isn't being honest. As announced during show, all of their animals have been rescued. They seem to live the life of luxury. That said I did have one issue with the animals. I noticed all animals constantly received treats through the show.. Anyone who owns a animal knows they will get tired of their treats if given too much. This had me wondering how they continued to use treats to get them to do what they wanted. Looking closer I watched the cats after they performed their act, such as running on a high rope etc... At the end of each act was a small silver bowl filled with something that EACH cat INHALED as if they were starving. They ate it so fast it seemed they were swallowing whole and would choke. That concerned me making me ask if they were making sure the cats were really really hungry so they would perform. I did ask trainer's what cats were eating and was told hot dogs. My sister has two cats and says her cats lap up hot dogs as if they have not eaten in a while but did admit not to that level. Even after seeing this I will still say they really acted as they are loved and are very happy. I will give the treatment of the animals a 10 after taking all I saw into consideration. I loved that they stressed the importance of adopting from a shelter versus buying a dog or cat. Now to what I didn't like. If I would have had a really young child I could have entertained on the tree house which and sprinkler area. If a 17 year old entertainment could be found on the rides. If they are into that kind of thing. However my eleven year old who is terrified of rides was only entertained for the thirty minutes we were in the show. She wanted so much to do the safari visit and have a up close visit with the giraffes but sadly had to tell her no as there was an extra charge for this part. Busch Gardens definitely has the right idea but I feel has many gaps to fill. We walked a lot to get one place or other and upon arrival at our location there was a huge wait. Surely their must be something they could do to fill in the gaps in between the areas. I would not recommend this to someone who doesn't ride rides. After all I could see the same animals at the zoo.... But again let me stress if you are like me and believe in awesome customer support you won't find a place any better in this area.

Rides are great IF they are running.  They don't run if there are thunderstorms nearby, which is extremely common in Tampa in the summer.  

The park attendant said that most days the rides shut down for 30 minutes to 90 minutes.  Many times they close more than once.   I spent $100 a ticket and have ridden one ride during the brief time there was no weather.  

If you come in and can't ride any rides, sorry, no refunds.  I feel pretty ripped off.  

I do know that Busch Gardens can't control the weather but there should be some consolation for the people when rides are down practically the whole day.  

Next time I'll check the weather but I'm sure about 10,000 more people will have the same experience as me so it's too bad.   It is a great park normally, though very expensive.  The rides are top quality though.

Today just was a very bad day and left a bad taste in my mouth.

Theme parks can be tough to get in and expensive but this one doesn't have to be. Busch Gardens does a good job of making the place reasonable if you are strategic. I got annual passes for myself, kids, and gf. We always have a great time and because we got the annual passes we don't feel like we have to stay all day, quite often we go for just a few hours. That keeps us from having to purchase $100 in food. The park is always kept in very good shape and the staff is amazingly cheerful.

I love coming here with the family! We have annual passes so we come often. Every month, they give a special for pass holders and we got 10% off on all good and ddinks! Its a great place for people of all ages. The kids are riding the water rides today and the adults are inside in the nice cool air conditioning.

Busch Gardens was the best experience of my sons life!! We did the safari tour which was awesome James and the whole staff treated my overly excited son with so much care!! We went during spring break which is a stressful time for amusement park staff... we went to Disney and university early that week and were very upset with the staffs at those parks having grumpy staff can ruin a magical day.... the staff at Busch Gardens went above and beyond for every guest making sure everyone was having the best day ever! We have gone to magic kingdoms safari tour before and Busch Gardens is a million times better you get so up close to the animals and have once in a life time experiences that are unique to every guest!

We had the worst experience! We are annual pass members. The first time we visited the park, our credit card was skimmed at a food kiosk. We informed customer service once we were made aware by our bank. They did nothing and did not apologize. This second time, the park was excessively crowded and wait time for rides was insane! We attempted to wait in three different lines and we were unable to actually get on any rides because the rides broke down before we could get on them! There was one ride that didn't break down, however we couldn't ride it because you had to store  belongings in order to ride and all the lockers were sold out. We found the staff to be very rude for the most part. We successfully canceled our annual passes. Customer service offered no apology and didn't even ask why we were cancelling. They must be used to dissatisfaction. The worst part is that my 10 year old and 4 year old were terribly disappointed at having not gone on a single ride. Won't  be back.

Ahh Busch Gardens. It has been years since I've been here. I don't even remember it as a child, besides the fact that it was very fun and had a lot of roller coasters. I had such a great time here. The great thing about Busch Gardens is that it is not in Orlando. What does that mean? Way less people. We went on a Saturday and we opted to not buy the fast pass in the front. We arrived when I opened and decided to feel it out to see whether the lines would get long. Overall, we barely had to wait. The longest wait was 45 minutes and that was only for one ride. The rest were all 10, 15, 20 minutes.
I love that the park is separated into different countries and has all the animals. If you take the train you can see many of the animals on the plain-giraffes, rhinos, gazelles, wildebeest etc. You can add an additional tour for extra and fed the giraffes and see the animals up close.
The park has very fun roller coasters. Sheikra is he one where you can drop at 90 degree angle. Falcon's fury you drop also and it tilts your body forward to give you that feeling of actually falling forward which is an intense adrenaline rush.
In the area called Pantopia you can see and feed the kangaroos which we were able to do. There are several restaurants and food stops along the way where you can buy food. Everything is overpriced, but that is definitely to be expected.
We were there from opening to closing!
Would 100% come back here again!

I love the zoo and theme parks. So naturally this would be a great mix. This park is very nice but feels a little underwhelming when compared to the local zoo which is amazing and the theme park standard in Florida is pretty high. This is a place you should visit at least once but don't really see a reason to get season passes unless you have little ones who love it.

Save your money! This place is not worth it. First, they were having power issues and the park delayed opening for 2 hours. They don't tell you this until after you pay an additional $22 to park. Then they let you stand in long lines with no shade for another 45 minutes. Once inside, the clouds started to form so all the rides were closed down. Ok, understandable if there's thunder and lightening but concession stands too? The only things left open were the extremely overpriced gift stores. Get back in line and wait another 40 mins. Not for a refund, oh no, there are no refunds. You get a rain check, good for 30 days. Never again Busch Gardens!
We had a great day at the park you can get tickets for 50% off after noon (12) at the ticket counter at the mall.

We took our daughters 18 and 15 there for MLK holiday from school.  We live 2 hours away.  They have season passes to Universal but love Busch the best for the roller coasters. They rode them all and said they loved them - their only complaint (and that was mild) is the wait time for some rides.  Most were only 15 minutes or so but the Cheetah coaster wait was 90 mins (it would've been 15 mins shorter but it broke down so they had to wait through that). They convinced me (and I don't do roller coasters) to go on the Montu.  It was my 18 yo's bday so I had to give in.  Scared the living day lights out of me.  But it was kinda fun too.  It is said to be one of the world's longest inverted rides.  You go upside down through 3 loops.  I survived.  My husband and I mostly like the animals which is another great thing about Busch Gardens. Kids get to do what they want and there's still something for us oldsters.  There was a great cheetah demo where we got to watch one of the young cheetah's chase some bait along with her "brother" which is a dog!  Also a MUST see is the Cast-a-way Critters show.  We saw it and then had our daughters meet us for another one.  The animal trainers have taken pets from shelters along with some exotic animals and trained them in an amazing way!  Absolutely amazing.  And cute.  And fun. There's even an opp at the end to pet an owl and the other animals.  I love the way the zoo part of the park is.  If I were an animal, I'd want to live at Busch Gardens.  It is beautiful.  The animal settings are idyllic.  Other things we got to do: pet a kangaroo and a wallaby, watch the ape family and about a hundred pink flamingo, ride the train where we saw (up close) the new baby zebras, see the alligators and the funny little otters, see a replica of King Tut's tomb (very nicely done). I have read other reviews of unfriendly staff.  Didn't see that.  Staff was smiling and friendly. Except on one occasion in a cafeteria line when the oblivious and annoying teens in front of us didn't notice it was time to order because they were screwing around with their friends too much-I was all for it when she yelled "It is time to order now!"  Ha ha.  Hints: Definitely buy the meal pass if you are going to be there all day and if you plan on 3 meals (it makes it worth it and very convenient for not having to pull out money or the credit card every time you want to eat or drink).  Wear comfortable shoes that have been broken in because there is a LOT of walking.  If you don't buy the meal deal, buy the refillable fountain drink cup for 99 cent refills. Download the free app for a map - it takes you there, gps style.  Now the complaints: 1) How I hate people that don't pay attention to where they are walking! They don't seem to realize that you walk on one side if you're headed one way and walk on the other if you're headed the other way.  You don't form a huge group and take up the entire path! You don't walk backward while talking.  So, so annoying.  2) The rides that are down all day!  We didn't get to ride the sky ride because it was shut down.  I don't know why.  And I love the sky ride.  3) The food wasn't that great.  The hamburgers tasted like fish and you don't get the choice of onion on your burger.  Everything was just so-so otherwise.  We ate at Zygora Cafe twice and Bengal Bistro.  I think they're run by the same company.  Don't get the burger.  The cheesecake was great.  The orange slices kind of dried out.  The chicken and fish strips overcooked. A meal will cost you about $12 with a drink.  That's the adult price.  That's without a side - just the platter and a drink.  4) Shopping is probably best not done there.  It is expensive and for some of the same things you could get at the Walgreens down the street.  Yes, local Walgreens and CVS usually carry the themed t-shirts, sweat shirts that they sell at the parks.  Much cheaper.  For example, a Busch Gardens sweat shirt is $60.  I guess if you're a tourist and you want a remembrance, that's ok.  But for me, I wouldn't pay that much when you could get the same thing without the logo for $30 or $40.  All and all, Busch Gardens is a good deal for the money and a great family park.  There are designated smoking areas and so you don't have to walk through second-hand smoke everywhere.  I didn't hear much cursing at all.  No make-out sessions like you sometimes see at Magic Kingdom.  Busch Gardens is a nice family park.

We go to Busch Gardens every year and LOVE IT! This is one thing that my kids never stop talking about. The employees are kind and helpful. We love that there is a variety of things to do for everyone. The safari train, roller coasters and the 2 kid areas! 

The kids love the great kid rides and their favorite is Sesame Street place. The people working in the children's areas are extremely kind. I was blown away by the way they treat the Kids and families. The people dressed as the SS characters were so kind as well! Honestly, the SS experience is one My kids don't ever stop talking about! 

Our last visit we did the food plan too - and that was a great addition! I do wish there were more places spread throughout the park on the meal plan, and that they all were open the same times. 

Overall, busch gardens is a great place! Great value, tons to do (you need multiple days to finish everything), and tons of fun! So many great family memories made here! Thank you Busch Gardens!

It became a joke at how many rides were closed or closed while we were in line. The park is obviously not kept up which is scary. The meal deal worked out but the service appeared to be intentionally slow.

Save your time and money and go somewhere else.

We love Busch Gardens because they have something for everyone. Extensive fun for kids of every age, from seeing animals to kids rides that keep them entertained. Nice, friendly staff. The food is actually pretty good for an amusement park and there are tons of different options. The annual pass makes it worthwhile for us to go when we have a free day - ask for stroller parking if you have small kids, it's the equivalent of free preferred parking.

Great rides.....the big coasters will make any enthusiast happy.

The addition of the animals here just adds to the amusement park experience. Keep your eyes peeled because ther are big animals tucked away everywhere.

My only advice is to stay away from the old wooden coaster. It will rattle your teeth out and leave you begging for your chiropractor.

Family of Four - Visited July 2nd b/c tickets were "free" as part of vacation package we purchased. We aren't necessarily lovers of theme parks but we do love zoos. It was unbearably hot, and we left 100 degree weather back home in TX - temp in Tampa was 90 but the humidity made it feel like 102. This place had so many people. We didn't ride any rides b/c lines were 1+ hour waits - for everything. All the food places had extremely long lines. The animals we saw were neat. We stayed 2 hours mainly just walking around, then we high-tailed it out of there. Too hot, too many people = no bueno.
I didn't realize there were so many animals at a theme park.  super fun and december = no lines no waiting!!

Busch Gardens has great deals for admission. It's a great place to see some cool animals, drink beer and waste a lazy afternoon; however, if you're not a little guy, don't expect to ride the roller coasters! 
We took advantage of their annual pass promotion, so the ticket price was fairly inexpensive. We have found their meal plan to be a great deal if you're planning to spend the entire day at the park. For about $25/person, you can enjoy unlimited food and beverages at designated restaurants and eateries.  It was worth the $25 alone just for unlimited bottles of water!
The animals in the park are kinda cool to see and if you're a beer drinker there's a vendor on every corner, but the shows are kinda lame - I found the pirate show to be a joke. The roller coasters are very plentiful, but they are NOT designed to fit everyone. In fact, while I looked around the park, there were MANY, MANY people who did not fit in the seats of the roller coasters - Disney needs to give them some tips on designing rides! 
The wooden roller coaster hurt to ride - roller coasters shouldn't hurt. I had several bruises on my legs from the wooden coaster.
Overall, I am really not impressed with Busch Gardens....but Disney on the otherhand, now there's a park!

Food is mediocre and worst of all. They won't let you take your purse to the coaster and leave it up there while you ride. You are forced to pay 50 cents for every ride to lock your purse away. WORST THEME PARK EXPERIENCE EVER. Extremely overpriced and they shut rides down for hours on end when it drizzles just a little bit. They open late and close early even on Saturdays. Save your $100!
Pretty good park.  I'm spoiled in California with 6 Flags, but this isn't too far of a step behind.  They just need that 1 super big coaster to seal the deal.  A lot of pretty good rides tho.
Rode the Cobras Curse which is not a big deal. But the cable car is close for this season I guess. I enjoy each time I would go there.

Busch Gardens always an amazing time from their shows, to their animal exhibits. Their special events during Halloween and summer are always top notch. 

Picking up wheelchair from Guest services was surprisingly quick and easy, though expensive and over priced.

My only other complaints are the wait times for any of the rides are very long. Also many of the rides will not fit everyone, meaning if you are over a certain size, you won't be able to take the ride.

This place has gone down hill. My family and I used to love it. Now the bathrooms are always disgusting, staff members seem disgruntled and rude, and parking if you have a family and stroller is a f@#king joke. My family and I got there 1 hour after the park opened and they claimed they were all out of stroller parking. So after parking way the hell out in their lot and taking their crappy tram, I saw three vehicles pull up into stroller parking. I was so pissed I waited to see if it was perhaps handicapped and it wasnt. 3 families that pulled out strollers with kids who were just fine. I asked the manager who simply said they shouldn't have allowed that. So I come back the next day and same thing happened. I was beyond pissed. Then I waited 45 minutes to get through the front gate. That crap is a hot mess. They don't know how to get people in fast enough. Needless to say...... we ARE NOT renewing our fun cards. We will be going to Disney for a while! Hopefully in about 5 years they will get their crap together.

I love the food and wine festival that Busch Gardens puts on.  Comparable and cheaper than epcot for sure and closer.  I've had the pork belly   Beef short ribs,  duck taco.  Everything was great and they had some nice strong ipas.

The only thing that's keeping this review from going lower is the food deal. If it wasn't for the get an entree, drink, and dessert every hour, this place would be in the negative if it was possible. I don't know even know where to start with this place, this park is a mess! The map and signs are confusing, we've been lost multiple times throughout the day, locker directions are misleading with one sign saying 2 hours max for a day? Like what does that even mean? OHH and don't even get me started on Cheetah Hunt. If you want to read about my fun experience on the ride, find my review on the ride Cheetahs Hunt or whatever. The lines for the rides are the most atricitous/ridiculous I've been in for an amusument park. For 12 hours, I've rode a total of three rides with each ride lasting an average of about 60 seconds while I spent the majority of my time eating and waiting in line. Stay away from this park, unless you don't mind wasting your time and money waiting in lines. In my experience, the worst amusement park I've been to. Roller coasters are just cheap knock offs of other coasters, there's nothing original about their rides except for the safari tour and the tour isn't all great, because they didn't let me use the bathroom before we went and forced us to stand fpr 15 minutes throughout the tour. This park is honestly just a front for a zoo with fake stuff to fill up the park with lines that aren't worth it in the end. I mean 60 bucks for a quick queue?! Now you're just making it obvious. -50 or lower/10 would not ride again. Can't find anything good about this place so don't say I didn't warn you. This place seriously sucks A

My family and I went to Busch Gardens over Christmas. We got our tickets through AAA, which included a free meal one day and an extra day for free. We actually went on both Christmas Eve and Christmas Day, trying to gauge when it would be the least crowded. Despite the time of year, the weather was nice and definitely doable- not scorching.

The good:

- Roller coasters. Sheikra and Jungala are probably the best coasters in the park. Sheikra is definitely terrifying, but the front row is worth the wait!! Same on Jungala- which was my favorite by far. It's less flashy, but definitely a very intense ride- do NOT ride it if you are prone to getting sick on rides, it is not forgiving. The Cheetah Hunt is the newest, and the longest wait. Try it to experience it, but you'll find others that are better. Walk over into Egypt and ride Montu. There is almost no wait, and it is a better coaster, though not as good as the first two.

- Foliage. I know it's Busch "Gardens" but the entire park is LUSH. It is very well done, and if you stop to notice once in a while, you'll see carefully done scapes featuring exotic plants and some very creative displays. Overall, it's just nice to walk through an amusement park that features such opulent, well-planned and well-taken care of landscaping.

- Serengeti train ride. It's awesome to see captive animals live this way and most animal attractions should feature this imo. The train ride through the park takes about 30 minutes, but the best part is riding through the open enclosure, African Serengeti plains habitat. Herds of different varieties of antelope, giraffes and even some rhino roam free in a beautifully designed exhibit. There's even a pond with some hippo, I believe, but they weren't out when we rode through. 

The bad:

- The zoo. The enclosures are nice, and well-planned for the most part, but I question the placement of exotic animals right next to massive roller coaster machines that do nothing but zoom around full of screaming people all day. The animals seem not to care anymore, but it doesn't seem like a calm environment. 

Wildlife should not be thought of as a theme park attraction, and Busch Gardens isn't doing much to dispel this idea.

One thing that stuck out at me was the gorilla enclosure. It's WRONG to keep animals that share more than 97% of our DNA as captives for our viewing pleasure. Wrong. There's the argument that this is the only way people will see these animals and care about them, but these exhibits aren't educating the public about these animals. (I watched people bang on the glass walls of the enclosure like they do on the outside of a fish tank, and a girl ran up to the glass and screamed "monkey!") There are a few plaques on the walls with some facts about the animals that obviously no one reads. There's no biologist, no handler around to provide information. Nothing. People walk on through on their way to the next ride.
Busch Gardens also makes a few mentions of its dedication to wildlife conservation, and while that may be true, keep in mind this is the same theme park conglomerate that owns SeaWorld. And the same corporate methodology of profiting off of captive killer whales (if you saw Blackfish), applies to profiting off of captive cheetahs, tigers, gibbons, gorillas, and so on.

- The food. Busch Gardens is hands-down the WORST food experience at an amusement park I have ever had. On both days! Almost every food vendor features a cafeteria-style eatery that will take an enormous amount of time to wait through. Even with plenty of hands on deck, the staff are incredibly slow and apathetic. The food sucks obviously, it's an amusement park (!), but I would avoid the big eateries if at all possible and try to grab lunch at a stall. Better to spend your time enjoying the park you came to have fun in, than in one of its mismanaged, shitty cafeterias.

Busch gardens is a blast! So many roller coasters you can't do it all on a really busy day. It doubles as a zoo and triples as a state fair. There are restaurants on site with all sorts of dining options. Theater shows to get out of the sun happen perpetually throughout each day. Lots of merchandise by the entrance. An giant bird enclosure you can walk into and a train that goes around the entire park with multiple stops (free). Water rides will make you wet on and possibly off as well. There are splash zones. This place has a huge area for the little ones (Children..) Check out the annual pass options and call local hotels for ticket deals. I think publix sells tickets too.

Wonderful theme park located in Tampa, FL. Lots of fun and crazy rides that is great fun for all Family members. Also many events, besides just theme park happenings, occur after hours for continued entertainment! The fast pass to skip waiting lines is recommended to make the most of your day when doing rides. And also the dinning pass can ensure you will be well hydrated and well fed while at the park. The best part is the wildlife, and all the animals that are housed on this facility. The Safari train is a great way to get around to see them all...a great option for a day or more of fun for visitors and locals alike.

My girl and I went to bush gardens on a hot Wednesday morning. There were not many people there and it was seriously awesome! We did not wait for rides and we got to see all the animals up close! I really enjoyed the cheetah hunt coaster and falcons furry vertical drop. Falcons furry was seriously scary and probably the biggest adrenaline rush I have had in years.  I will go back if I have the chance!

Having a really good time here- 
Great "CRUISE" shows - as in - if you've ever been on a cruise and seen its shows- this is like that. 
Not bad at all- fun and enthusiastic! Being a music teacher for years, it takes a little more than just fun to really make me go woohoo yes! But it's definitely nice- 
The animals are beautiful - and they have made a nice "habitat" for them as pleasant as can be. The rollercoasters are the best and you can come here for a year for only around $100 whatttttttt???? That's a crazy good deal for the YEAR! So- yes come over for fun, thrill rides and animals:)

Busch Gardens didn't deserve a 5 star in my opinion because there were many things closed down, including the one ride I really wanted to get on.. Manta. Another issue we had was figuring out the map, the park has many hidden spots and caves with animals in them so it gets a bit confusing to follow through. Overall, it was a fun experience and all the other rides were worth it!
Great place, very clean, animals were amazing. Fun day for my family.

I spent the day at Busch Gardens last week with my mom and sister. It was a lot of fun-- the roller coasters are awesome, and the lines went pretty quickly. The park is pretty big, but walking around it did not seem so bad because there are always things to stop and do along the way. Be prepared for heat, but there are these little ice cubicles that you can go in to cool off if it becomes too much. The park's staff are super friendly and helpful. 

The one big let-down was Cobra's Curse. My mom was super excited to try the new ride, so we got in line and made it almost to the front before an announcement said the ride would temporarily shut down due to "technical difficulties" but would be up again soon. So we waited some more, and then a new announcement said the ride was closing indefinitely, sorry. So disappointed and having wasted an hour, we left. Later in the day we came back to Cobra's Curse, and the guy said the ride was shut down due to "technical difficulties." Naturally we were pretty aggravated because it's not every day we get to come to Busch Gardens-- we're from Boston for crying out loud. But anyway, at that point we didn't really want to ride a roller coaster that reportedly has all these "difficulties."

My other qualm with the park is the animals. I think it's really cool that Busch Gardens is an amusement park and a zoo all together, and for the most part the enclosures were decently sized. But i wondered whether the animals were bothered or stressed by the nearby sounds of people screaming on roller coasters, particularly the gorillas and the cheetahs. (The gorillas and the chimps have a very nice area, however-- very cool and shady if you're looking for a break.) also, some of the animals seemed to be pacing unhappily, notably the white tiger, a hyena, and one of the elephants. It made me wonder about the emotional state of the animals. 

Because of the Cobra's Curse let-down and questionable status of the animals, Busch Gardens did not earn 5 stars. But I would still recommend checking it out, as it's a lot of fun, no matter how old you are. I would recommend trying the Skyride at some point during the day-- it's peaceful and you get to see the animals from up above.

If you're not into standing in line to ride the roller coasters, there's not a lot to do or see at this park. There are animals in the zoo and the exhibits are well designed, but they are so spread out that it's tough to maintain a focus. 

The kiddy rides are also tough for children. Size requirements mean kids can be too small for some and too big for others, with disappointment on little faces after standing in very slow lines. In fact with breakdowns and gate locking procedures by attentive operators, the lines can take almost as long as the adult rides. 

Finger print entry for season ticket holders is always slow and though we've learned to walk to the far end of the park after first arriving and then working our way back toward the main gate, the experience always feels a bit confusing - especially if you take in one of the scattered shows. Now that the cost of parking is approaching the cost of admission, we've decided our last visit to this park was our last.
Parking is climbing fast but can't find an alternative. Good amount of rollercoasters at a better price than anything in Orlando. If anyone knows of a parking alternative let me know please.

We live about 30 minutes away so we are annual pass holders. During the rainy season in the summer months it can be very hot and humid. It's better to come when the park opens, you can hope on your favorite ride with little wait. The great thing about this theme park is the grounds. It's nice just to walk around for exercise and enjoy the landscaping and the animals. There is plenty of shade and numerous benches to sit and relax. Take an umbrella in case of rain in the summer months. The rain comes and goes. Another reason to come in the morning is that sporadic rain usually starts in the early evening. Busch Gardens is quick to shut down rides if it looks like rain.

So many rides were closed.  Stopped at 3 different stands and they could not serve me, no pretzels or sorry hot dog buns are still frozen and another stand no pretzel again. And this was at 4 o'clock.  I have been to the one in Virginia and this park should not be allowed to share the name.

Awesome place. Awesome time. And half the price and wait times as going to Disney or Universal. They literally have something for everyone there. They have some pretty awesome animal habitats for the animal lovers and zoo goers. They got kiddie ride sections for the kiddos. They got good rides for the modest thrill seeker. And they have some epic rides for the adrenaline junkie. Mix in a fun little train ride that tours the whole park and takes you through a safari land, as well as an aerial tour ok the sky ride gondola that travels across the park. Some water rides for those hot days. And plenty of fun and games in between. Really had a blast here me and the whole family. So happy I opted for Busch gardens annual passes instead of Disney. Saved a ton of money and had a blast and still so much more haven't done, can't wait to go back for the rest of the year!!

Definitely not worth what you pay. Customer Service is terrible, had several rude interactions with people working here. It's outdated and overpriced. Several rides were closed for the day and not scheduled to re open. On top of that several rides that were working, got shut down for scheduled maintenance. We could've went to Disney for just a little more. Never coming back again.

I can not say enough good things about Busch Gardens Christmas Town.  They do not hesitate to make this a special event that is all about the real meaning of Christmas.  The Nativity topiary is so beautiful and you must see the show that takes place with the Magi.  The lights and caroling just make you feel the true "Christmas Spirit".  Since we have season passes we went in the late afternoon and saw some of the Christmas shows so we could take advantage of the night activities.

This place is amazing! It is a zoo and amusement park, you can't beat that. If you plan on eating I would suggest getting the all you can eat wrist band.  I would also highly suggest the safari where you feed the giraffes, it is very worth the $33!

I really do like Busch Gardens and always have a nice time. The roller coasters are great!  Parking is $20 but you probably get that at any amusement park these days. Also every time I've gone at least one major coaster was out of operation and several times I've had them close the ride while I was standing in line due to technical difficulties. Other than that, it's a bunch of fun. So glad it's in my city so I can frequent often.

Busch Gardens delivers what it promises; thrill rides and an awesome zoo. Good for the little ones and adults alike. Expect to spend a full day if you want to experience everything they have to offer. If you're planning to go on a summer day, wear sunscreen and a hat cause it's HOT. They do have refreshments stands everywhere with souvenir cups that cost you a buck each refill so highly recommend getting one! Overall, it's a great park, it's clean, and the best zoo I've ever been to. For a quick look of their most famous rides check out my video here youtu.be/wAFDjFs1CyM or search Day Hopper on youtube.

Highly recommend this place, have a great time!
Cheers

We had a blast this past weekend at Busch Gardens. It was my boyfriend's birthday so we decided to take the kids and check it out. We ended up getting the Busch Gardens and Adventure Island Florida Residents pay for a day pass. How great is it that we can now go anytime we want! What a great deal! We also opted to purchase the fast passes. It was so much better to have the passes because the park was really crowded.  Even though a few rides were shut down, it was still a great day!

We really enjoyed the park. The cheetah ride was our favorite, and we enjoyed the shows. The food was pretty good for park food and reasonably price. The only complaint that I had was the line jumping. It was awful. People with fast passes were allowed to simply walk to the front of the line by saying I'm with a group at the front. It was very irritating.

Buschgardens ist eine perfekte Mischung aus Freizeitpark und Zoologischem Garten. Der Park ist nicht nur was für Kinder sondern und für Erwachsene.
Buschgardens ist kein Zoo im wie man in hier in Deuschland kennt. In ihm werden die Tiere nicht in kleinen Gehegen, sondern in riesigen natürlich Anlagen gehalten.
Die Freizeitparkattraktionen sind nicht separat angesiedelt sondern direkt zwischen den Tiergehegen. Insbesondere Achterbahnfans dürften voll auf ihre Kosten kommen, da drei der größten und schnellsten Achterbahnen der USA.
Sheikra ist eine geniale Achterbahn. allerdings geht sie 90° senkrecht nach unten oh man. das ist genial!!
Dann gibt es noch die Holzachterbahn und eine der schnellsten Achterbahnen der Welt 150km schnelleinfach genial.

As a Tampa native, I've been coming to this theme park for the last 20 plus years and this place has only gotten better. The rides range from ones that little kids can enjoy to huge, scary rollercoasters that adults will find fun and thrilling. The food is pricey, like with any theme park, but there are plenty of options, which is nice. If rides aren't your thing, the animals throughout the park are so wonderful to observe. You can even take a 'safari' ride and go all around the entire animal sanctuary. They have a few indoor places where they put on shows, so it's a nice time to cool down when it's hot outside. For Florida residents, if you buy a ticket for the day, it's good to use the whole rest of the year. Guaranteed to have a fun day!

Had lots of fun with my 6 year old but super confusing layout. I had to stop 5-6 times and ask how the heck to get to to the entrance after going in circles several times when we were ready to leave. Even with the paper and post maps where no help. Every thing is super spread out. It was super frustrating when it's towards the end of the day, your tired, and you just want to to leave. 

Park is $20 which kind of sucks too. 

Otherwise lots got fun. Great rides for both big and small.

My journey of this park summed up: 

- long lines. Too many long lines. The wait for the coasters which I don't do, but my family does were more than an hour long. Hell, a ride I actually like, the rapids ride was 70 minutes. Absolutely not.

- too much humidity. Too much walking. All you'll do is sweat which forces you to purchased overpriced theme park water bottles and food.

- arcade in the park runs on tokens. Which you get TWO for a dollar. Ripped off and spent way too much trying to win stuff from the claw games.

- it's cool to see some of the animals, they looked well taken care of. I was jealous of the penguins because they get to go in a pool.

- they should start selling gallon jugs of water in the gift shop for a couple bucks. That way you don't run out of water so fast, and don't have to shell out too much cash for a Dasani that you'll go through in mere seconds due to the insane Florida humidity. 

I was pretty much done an hour into the place. At least there are cool people walking around spraying you with mists of water. 

If you're into long lines and sweaty people this is the place for you!

Also, not many food options besides the few stands and the restaurant that is near the Cheetah coaster.

My worst fear happened today. That's why I'm giving Busch gardens 3 stars and not 5. My husband and I rode all the rollercoasters using the quick queue (super awesome and worth it!) and before we left the park we decided to ride Shriekra again. The concept of the ride is a roller coaster that rises to a platform at a 90 degree angle, then dangles before dropping straight down then twisting then going to a second platform and going through more twists then a tunnel and ending. What happened to us is we were going up the 90 degrees to the first platform and we were supposed to dangle and all of a sudden a super bang went off and we went so fast and everyone around me is panicking because something is obviously wrong. They were able to stop us at the second platform (which is 200 feet in the air) and we waited there for half an hour while sirens were going off and everyone is freaking out. Eventually they got us down to the bottom where they had to make a floor for us to be able to get off. It was awful and to top it off they gave us passes to re ride any ride but the park was closing and they were ushering us out. Ok? 
Anyways the park is great, the animals are cool, and the quick queue is great. You don't have to rush and you can enjoy your beer while walking around the park. The dining pass is awesome too because you get free food at the restaurants, and at the vendors you get two for one! And it includes beer! We had a great day except for the bit at the end, and I might come back once I get over it.

I haven't been to Busch gardens since I was a child, So my memory was pretty spare of this place. In the month of December, there are so many pretty holiday decorations. At night all the lights glow and it's just amazing. Although there weren't that many rides to offer, they satisfied us as each ride only had a very small wait, with Sheikra being the longest at 15 minutes. I think my favorite was the Cheetah Run, since we went on it twice with minimum wait. The restaurant options are decent but my burger bun was cold sadly. I expected there to be more animals. But they seemed to be lacking. Definitely come here during off season, especially during the holidays.

Came here on labor day for some fun in the sun, which ended up being fun in the rain. Because of the light rain there weren't many people in the park, which translated to very short lines. We were able to ride all of our favorite rides without waiting more than 20 minutes. I recommend Cheetah Hunt and Montu. Cheetah Hunt is a fast paced roller coaster, with few drops or flips. Fun for the whole family! It does shoot you out pretty fast though, about 60 mph. Montu is a floor less roller coaster. It has a lot of corkscrews and flips and is very fun!! If you want to cool off on a hot Florida day head to River Rapids, beware you may get soaked! The food in the park was great, head over to Zambia smokehouse for some good BBQ or Pantopia for some good pretzels and brews! The bacon pretzel is a must try. Busch Gardens also has a great tiger exhibit, where you can see them very up close. They also have many other animals like giraffes, zebras, ans even a hiplo! All in all a great experience, there is something for everyone in the family to enjoy. Roar!

Just got season passes for the family. We haven't been in years, but still had our souviner cups and popcorn bucket.. If you have one, bring it! It will save you alot of money! .99 cent refills!! Awesome! It just sucks that they closed down the hospitality bar years ago, I really miss that... They did add a lot more stuff since if been. Cheetah hunt, jungala and Sesame Street.. It was a lot of fun, the kids love it.. That's all that matters..

Visited this past December and had a good time. Was a bad day of rides closing for stints for undisclosed reasons but still rode enough rides to be satisfied.  
     One thing I was not a big a big fan of was all the Christian nativity scenes etc. To each their own but with the way Christians are trying to cram backward politricks onto the rest of us, I'm getting tired of ppl pandering to these folks. Keep your religion to your home and away from politics, deal?

This memory is never forgotten.  One of the best places on Earth. Staff is wonderful.  The animal center is wonderful.  We watch Wildlife Docs every Saturday morning.  Conservation of the animals, the history and love for the animals is close to our hearts.  I cannot wait to back to the safari and to Busch Gardens.

Busch Gardens is a blast! The lines are not always too bad and if they are you can purchase a fast pass, skip the lines! Fun family shows although they are mostly for ages 10 and under I'd say. One complaint is I specifically asked at the entrance parking gate, are the rides ready to go based on some hovering clouds and the lady said "yes, the clouds have been hovering all say" well...while taking the tram to the park entrance we noticed no coasters in motion...NOPE rides closed due to weather until further notice! What?!? They really should communicate better at the parking gates. So we grabbed an ice cream watched Madagascar and got soaked coming back to our car. We checked weather channel ap and said cloudy, we had to laugh! Other than that BG is a clean park with great animals to visit. We love the bird area, kangaroos and the fast Cheetahs!

Our family wanted to do something different this Thanksgiving, and Busch Gardens, as we were told at the parking gate, is open 365 days a week (now you know why she was a parking attendant).

My kids loved Busch Gardens Williamsburgh, but we all agreed that the Tampa one was even better. Not only did it have some of the best coasters we've ever been on (Skeikra and Montu), it is also a dynamite zoo. The Critter show in the bird aviary was the best trained animal show I've seen anywhere, with lots of exotics and a humorous and funny musical. They had a parrot that loved to play football. Guess what position? The ball!

You can pay 25 cents to feed the long billed birds, who eat out of your hand, or you can pay $5 or so for a tray full of food, and have the gull swarm you when you leave the checkout stand. That made the kids uproar with laughter.

The people were all nice but not sickly sweet. They were sort of self-deprecatory in a funny way. On one ride, the Rhino Rally, the driver said "Lower your heads, and lower your expectations."
