Then "If anyone drops anything, raise their right hand. Then, I'll raise my right hand. Then we'll both wave goodbye to it, because we don't stop to pick up anything. See all those big animals to your left, those are called people. Then we'll come up on some elephants."

With killer roller coasters, wonderful shows, great kiddie rides, lots of exotic animals that seemed well cared for,  beer served everywhere (and a full bar at one of the places on the right when you first go in), there's something for everyone here.

Having been an annual pass holder at Busch Gardens Williamsburg for years, we've come to expect a certain level of customer service from their parks. In fact, years ago Busch Gardens completely outshined Disney in customer relations. But apparently, no more. The park is beautiful, the animals are fantastic and the rides are great (the ones that are working...) But almost to a person, the mood and attitude of the staff was terrible. They acted as if people were bothering them when asked for information or even at cashier' s counters. This was with every person I observed, not just us. Eye rolling, no eye contact, short curt words, even raised voices!! What a terrible experience for customers who chose this place as their annual vacation destination. The park was not crowded at all, especially for a Saturday... maybe that is why!!

(I'm writing this as a Universal Studios' biggest fan)

The coasters at Busch Gardens are top-notch! All the other rides are so-so... You'll see the typical splash rides, bumper cars, 4-D shows, rope climbs... the best part is that the park is actually good for the entire family. There are two great sections for kids (with rides and other ways to spend their energy), thrill seekers, and casual observers-- don't forget, half of Busch Gardens is a zoo with some excellent animal exhibits. In addition to the entire east area, smaller animal exhibits are scattered throughout the western side.

 the entire park loosely fits under an "African" theme... but don't expect well-done themes that surround entire rides (like Disney). This place also has some well-done shows.

PRICE: Ticket value is best of any Florida park. A pass good for the year is the SAME PRICE as a full-paid one-day ticket. No blockout dates. 

Normally, the lines are also 30 minutes or less everywhere (BG doesn't get as much love).

Maybe it was because we went there on the 4th of July but our experience was less than thrilling. The staff seem to not want to be there and it showed. There was a few concession stands where they were training new hires (on the 4th!?) Other concession stands had 4 or 5 people standing around when there was maybe 1 person in front of us and we waited 5 minutes to pay for gouge priced drinks. One person was actually making believe she was drying the counter when in fact she was just moving a wet rag around  in slow motion! The park dfid not have clear signs and we spent the majority of the day running around in circles always stopping and ask directions. The wooden roller coaster was the worst ride ever! The sky ride was not working Falcon Fury should have been open and even finding the parking area was confusing. Between me and my wife paying $600 between gas, hotel, admission, guik queue, parking, and concessions to spend one day here was not worth it! We were so disgusted and disappointed we left before the fireworks show!!

I went to Busch Gardens as a kid about 3-4 times. I loved the environment and I like how wide open the areas felt. I didn't feel like a sardine in the amusement park, which sounds insane, I know. It's no Disney World but it is a great place to bring your kids or to spend an evening with your hot date. Also, I don't like Busch beer. Just throwing that out there.

My husband and I visited yesterday on Monday 3/20/17, during Spring Break. We elected to do the "Quick Queue" which was quite expensive, but saved us a couple hours. The 30 min behind the scenes elephant tour for $29 was amazing! However, to be there on time, you have to be at the park AT OPENING. It's a tense 15 min trying to get to the front gate to the meeting spot.

We saw the 30 min Icesploration which was mostly beautifully costumed figure skaters. The hall was quite empty, surprisingly. 

First star off - afterwards, we went through the lion exhibit. I was sick to my stomach to see that the poor guy was frothing at his mouth and chewing on his tail while a huge group of people gawked/tapped at the glass. It made me sick to see. I really feel like an employee should have been watching for signs of stress and took that poor guy back. 

With that said, all the other animals I saw looked quite content and like they were being given their best life possible given the circumstances. The elephants had a great relationship with their trainers which was so wonderful to see. The poor lion probably just needed a break and the staff should have been more attentive to that.

Second star off - the Cheetah ride required that any loose items HAVE to be put in a locker that you pay for ($10-$13), but they had the regular cubbies when you got onto the ride to temporarily set your stuff? It felt like such a scam and such a slimey way to make a few extra bucks from your customers.

We saw an awesome Du-Wop group perform in one of the "cafeterias" which made lunch a lot of fun. At the end of our day - 4:30pm - we did the last Safari tour for $39/pp. It was AMAZING. The staff was so knowledgeable and I always felt safe. 

Overall, we had a great time. The rides were awesome and the zoo portion was a blast. I just wish they would've been a little more sensitive to the stressed lion and not tried to nickel and dime so much (as you can tell, I'm happy to pay for extras, but goodness, REALLY, making you pay for a locker to ride a ride when they have places to put your stuff for free at the ride itself? The purse they made me put away was literally a clutch. This is just unfair to those who budgeted for their tickets to cover their rides, as they very well should have).
Come on. It's Busch Gardens. Get yourself a ticket and come back all year for no additional cost. The coasters are pretty good overall and the best in central florida.

This place is awesome. It may seem pricey but for how much you get it's incredible. I highly suggest paying the extra 10 bucks to get the unlimited food passes and avoid going on a weekend due to the amount of people.

hands down best rollercoaster rides @ FL...only drawback is the Busch Garden employees don't warn u that at times, "handicapped" children (i.e. those who can't wait in a regular line) will be able to go thru rides 2 times successively (despite ur preferential queue line pass)! so u may be bumped outta line MORE THAN ONCE/miss rides when inclement weather shuts rides down, etc...still a great collection of rides tho'

Okay so I visited this park 3/20/16-3/22/16. I purchased the fun card which was $111.92 including taxes and fees. With the fun card you get unlimited entry into Busch gardens until 12/31/16 along with unlimited access into adventure island park until October something. Exact dates are located on fun card. 

PARKING: on 3/22 we decided to park which was 12$ at adventure island and visit that park, started cooking in the sun then left and parked in Busch gardens lot for FREE. Just by showing our parking receipt. The other two days we did uber which cost (10$ round trip)which was much quicker and didn't have to worry about the shuttle to the lot. We lodged at a hotel which was literally in walking distance to the park. But didn't want to walk since we will be walking around the park all day. 
If you request uber tell them to come to front entrance of park via employee parking lot. My uber got lost a couple of times. 

ENTRANCE: Once at park entrance there is a line to the far right if you have no bags for them to check. Moves pretty fast.

INSIDE PARK: if your electronic devices are on their death beds lucky for you there is a charge station located between the dragon fire grille and scorpion roller coaster ride. FREE OF CHARGE.

If you invest in the all day dinning plan, you eat once every hour and if you buy snacks in the park u get the second snack FREE. 

Overall it was pretty hot and cold those days but me and the kids had a blast anyway. Parks weren't too crowded and we manage to get on some rides two to three times with less than 20min wait.

I'm going to keep this review brief. There's not much I can write on here other than I had a great time. This is one of their major theme park locations. They have already built enough of a reputation for themselves to where I need not say more.

I'm not sure how people give BG 4 stars. Probably closer to 2.5 for me.

They have four good rollercoasters, and one child's mouse coaster. Five coasters. $90 ticket + $18 parking.

That's terrible value, but I suppose Floridans might be accustomed to such things.

We did the all-day dining pass as well, and none of the food was very good.

All of the restaurants had the same sides and desserts. The "bbq" comes with.. Packetized bbq sauce. The Thai stirfry/Asian noodles was the worst thing I've eaten in my entire trip. You're restricted from getting things like Powerade, snacks, and icees. 

The rides.. As far as the coasters, none were bad, but also none really exceeded expectations. The Cheetah Run was probably my favorite.

The atmosphere was nice.. But overall, I was just very underwhelmed. Hard to fill up your whole day here with what there is to do here. It's definitely not Cedar Point.

Busch Gardens is a nice change from Universal Studios, which is where I go every single time I visit Florida. 

Definitely in my top 3 theme parks in terms of rides and attractions. All of their rollercoasters were unique, so I didn't feel like I was wasting my time by going on all of them. When I got bored of rollercoasters, I visited the zoo components of the park. I'd say this is the best zoo I've been to, just an outstanding variety of animals. The train tour around the park is definitely worth it, if you have 45 minutes to spare. Staff was friendly, and food was decently prices at $3 for an order of French fries, and $5.50 (or so) for a funnel cake. 

However, BEWARE: The only concern I do have is the following. I purchased my ticket for Busch Gardens & Adventure Island before actually visiting, It was a two parks for one deal. I just printed them out. I purchased these tickets from the Busch Gardens website. I assumed that by "Adventure Island" they meant the park in Universal Studios, but when I got to Universal Studios (before I went to Busch Gardens), they told me that Adventure Island is in Busch Gardens, and the Universal Studios Park is called "Island of Adventure." I had purchased Busch Gardens and Adventure Island tickets under the assumption that both parks had collaborated to offer some outstanding deal, and the deal was just too good to be true (and it was). So I called Busch Gardens before actually purchasing, and asked them if this deal was in fact for Busch Gardens + Islands of Adventure in Universal Studios (at the time I didn't know that Busch Gardens also had an "Adventure Island" park. The Busch Gardens representative told me that the deal is exactly as it sounds, so I went with it. As I stated before, however, I later realized that Adventure Island (The Busch Gardens park) and Islands of Adventure (Universal Park, what I thought my ticket was for) were two very different parks. I can't help but feel that I've been ripped off. First of all, there's the fact that the Busch Gardens representative didn't properly answer my question, "The deal is exactly as it sounds." Second of all, I find that it's a bit coincidental that Universal Studios already had "Island of Adventure," and Busch Gardens conveniently named their other park "Adventure Island." Feels like sort of a scam, to get people to believe that the deal is too good to be true. So I wasn't sure if it was just me or not, but like I said, beware.

I really do like this park... when the rides are open. If it rains in Orlando they close everything. Nine out of ten times we have been there we've had to leave because the park turns into a waste of time due to wind. WIND!!!! You are located in TAMPA!!!! If your rides don't have a high wind rating why the hell are they here! If this happens again we will not be renewing. Safety is one thing but the frequency that this occurs is ridiculous. The only reason we have tried going is because we live next door. But even then, it seems a waste.

We headed here the day after Christmas. The park was rather clean and decorated nicely. Tickets are reasonable considering what other parks are around. $99 for a day or a year!  

Food was okay. Lots of fried options but the do have a buffet option as well. We got the daily food deal and was able to eat unlimited at any restaurant all day for $17 per kid $35 for adult!

Employees were friendly and helpful!  And the overall attractions were nice. The big coasters are awesome but get ready to wait. Some cues were 75 minutes which can be longer if the ride shuts down for technical difficulties. This happened to us twice which was rough since we only rode 5 rides throughout the day. 

Overall a GREAT day spent with family!

We went here yesterday with our family of 5 (11, 9, and 4), and we had a great time!  Not so centered on the characters as Disney parks are.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.

We had good food at the Smokehouse restaurant (don't remember name of it, but it was a good location for a stop for us).  We also are at the Colony Cafe at nighttime; yummy fare there as well.  There is a smoothie/icee place that we also had good options at.

I loved the Christmas decor for their special Christmas time events.  The train at dark turned into a sing along train, which was fun.

We were able to find rides to suit everybody's tastes and need for speed.

I was able to save $15.00/ticket by purchasing the tickets online that morning on Busch Gardens website.  Make sure you can print the tickets out though before you go to the admission area; I had to turn around and wait in a long line only to have them print my tickets out for me.  I find it odd that in the day and age of smart phones, they won't let you scan a ticket from your smartphone.  Another option for hose purchasing ahead of time might be to have a "print your ticket here" kiosk of some sort.

Although my favorite amusement park will always be Cedar Point in Sandusky, Ohio, this was a definite good time!

ZOO mal anders.hier besticht das Wildlife hautnah.der Park ist so angelegt, dass natürliche Barrieren errichtet wurden, statt Zäune, Gitter und Mauern.auch leben verschiedene Tiergruppen zusammen.so wie auch in der Savanne.wunderschön zu beobachten. Auch in diesem Park gibt es Rollercoaster für den persönlichen Fun-Faktor.
Bei einem Besuch in Orlando sollte man diesen Park gesehen haben

I might be a little biased in my review.  I grew up only a few miles away from Busch Gardens and have always enjoyed the park for its thrill rides and zoo animals.  
With the recent updates to the children's area, this park has a spot close to my favorite park amongst my family.  
The Sesame Street play area offers plenty of activities for children.  From a splash park (Burt and Ernie's Watering Hole) to the Tree Top Climbing nets, there's enough activities to keep the kids content with adventures of their own.  
Meanwhile, rides like Sheikra and Cheetah Hunt will have age appropriate guests screaming with excitement as they experience some of the best coasters available in the United States. 
Their zoo exhibits are some of the best I've experienced.  The Myombe Reserve features all the fascinating primates in a walk thru experience and the Serengeti  hosts the African Lions, Giraffes, Antelope, Elephants, Hyenas and more.  There are even additional tours available to guests who want an up close adventure.  
The food in most areas is typical theme park fare.  However, the Smoke House near Sheikra has some great BBQ.  I definitely recommend scheduling your lunch stops at that eatery.  
The shows are entertaining and engaging.  Our two favorites are the Madagascar show (for kids) and the newly redesigned animal show near Timbuktu.  
With new attractions and themed events added every so often, this park guarantees to impress and provide entertainment for patrons of every age.
If it weren't for the shortage of nursing stations for new mothers, this park would be at the top of my list with five stars.  
Providing comfortable, convenient locations for mothers to tend to their small ones would be the icing on the cake.  Unfortunately, many of the park benches provided in shaded areas are marked for "smoking sections".

great coasters, great animal experiences, but the park itself and those who work there aren't worth any more stars. I'm sorry, but this park needs some serious help.

 The employees are unprofessional and cynical, the layout of the park is ridiculous and subjects walkers to long stretches of nothing and in the summer sun in TAMPA, the last thing you want is to exert a lot of energy getting from place to place. 
There are NO themed restaurants that serve African food. The food they do serve is horrid and bland. 
The whole park shuts down in the rain, and I don't know if they know this, but tampa averages 104 days of rain a year. 

Poll the people in line on any given day and they are all locals. BG will never be able to compete with the big guys until they get their act together and start hiring better employees (they share the tendency to have great staff for the animal care and entertainment positions and leave the operations, food, and merchandise to people who stopped caring the moment they got the job with Sea World) and work on the layout of the park a bit and get some INDOOR rides so people will have something to do in the rain and do it up Epcot -style with a couple of good restaurants so locals with passes can come again and again to eat dinner and spend some extra money in the park.

Love busch gardens! It is so pretty and fun, way better than your average theme parks. It is a combination of garden, zoo and adventure park. There are only two in the US, the other one is in VA. 

Had an awesome time there from watching the animals, shows to riding the roller coasters. I was told they had the larggest wooden roller coaster in the country. Note most roller coasters are made of steel but this one was built with all wood. I had so much fun riding, very unique experience. You get discount if you are a Florida resident. Wish I visited it more often when I lived there.

This was our first time to this park. It reminded me  little bit of Disney's Animal Kingdom. The parking wasn't bad at all but it was the beginning of Spring Break. The rides were fun and the lines weren't long. I would wait until you got to the park to purchase the lie version of the Fast Pass. I bought ours online and only used it for one ride. Also you need to download their app to get exclusive discounts that you won't find online. It also has a map of the park the latest hours of the shows and much more. Now I didn't rate a 5 because of some small issues of the parks areas but it was fun. Two days at most is all you need to see the park. 

As for the food well it's a park so don't expect much but do expect to pay double for everything. It's a park

It is a nice looking park with lots of stuff.  However, the one day passes are probably not worth it.  Numerous breakdowns make it very difficult to fully enjoy it for the price.  Mantu, Cobra, Congo river ride & cheetah all had issues by 1:30.  Skip it unless you have a season passes or super discount tickets.
Can't remember the last time I had so much fun! Loved the shows, rides and animals and the wait times for the rides weren't too bad. Will definitely go again if I ever find myself back in FL.

Hello my family and I visited your park on Friday. Generally we had a good time. Unfortunately though my wife (former Busch Gardens employee) and I got stuck on Sheikra. Things happen, we get that, but we both felt that the situation was mishandled. For starters the communication was poor. We didn't know what was happening until thirty minutes into the ordeal. Even then most of the communicating was done via a manager screaming as far as I could tell. We were in the last "car" so I'm not sure if she was coming through on a speaker or not. Once it was determined that we would have to be manually disembarked employees began coming around us to get their safety equipment and the rescue platforms, which was a relief, but they only communicated with each other. There was no check to see if we were ok, had an emergency or if anyone was having a traumatic response. Ideally you would want some reassurance and want someone to take care of those that may be at higher risk for issues. But we got none of that. We weren't properly communicated with until the ordeal had almost ended. Then we were told to see the manager and that she would give us something for enduring this inconvenience. As we walk toward her, she does apologize, however we had to ask her about this "something" before she gave it to us, which is problematic from a customer service standpoint. She should've proactively given us those passes. Other customers stopped at guest services because they realized they hadn't been given anything. Also a fast pass for a subsequent visit means nothing for someone coming from out of town or just there as a one off. I could think of tons of better ways to make your customers feel better about Busch Gardens. Like I said, we enjoyed the park for the most part, but this is something that I won't forget.

So this is my first time back here in 30+ years and wow have things changed. So much to do and enjoy. Rides, arcades, safaris, lots of food options and shops. Surprised at the prices being lower than most amusement type parks. Food fairly reasonable and not charged $4 for bottled water. Lockers everywhere to access as needed and certainly before going on some rides where you cannot have anything that you carry. Lockers only 50 cents which is really cheap for some sense of security. 

Parking was $17 which I thought was kind of steep.

I found this park to have many more attendants around always asking if you need  help or directions. Guides placed strategically throughout the park with microphones giving directions. Makes it easy when you are looking for directions. Live music and dancing engaging the audience so people feel part of the shows. 

The one big drawback is the signage. If there is any suggestion for improvement would be better signs and directions. We walked past the same kiosks 3 times trying to find the exit. No exit signs in the park till you get closer to it. Well darn it I needed to know a lot sooner than that as it was starting to rain heavy and frustration was setting in. Small thing with all the good things but definitely an easy improvement to make life easier for the customer.

Definitely will be back as we just couldn't see and do everything we wanted.

Buy weekday tickets online as much cheaper and just print them off so no lines to stand in. Need 24-48 hours so tickets can be sent via email. I decided to call for the deal and got them sent within 1 hour so best way to get them if you leave it to the last minute.

My goodness I can't believe I have been living in Florida 7yrs and this is the first time I have ever been to Busch gardens. There is a little bit of everything to do here and it really was a lot of fun. We got to see a lot of animals that are in various locations while your walking which is neat. There is also carnival games and a couple of water rides which were refreshing as heck since the Devil was outside smoking a cigarette. My kiddos are different ages so my little one played mostly on the kiddie rides and he was quite content with that. We also saw a show that was an ice show and it was 30 mins long and super cute and fun, I was in there dancing my bootie off lol loads of fun and the prices are very reasonable. I think it's 69.99 and for military families they get a free ticket and 3 extra for there family members which worked great for me I didn't pay a dime yippee (thank you Air Force) if you go with someone that has an annual pass you get a discount of 50 percent off now that's a dang deal people!!! Definitely recommend it!!!

I've been a Busch Gardens pass holder for several years and have not regretted it one bit. There's always so much to do there! Somedays, I just go to grab a beer and watch giraffes if I'm not feeling in a mega coaster mood. And when I am experiencing coastermania, they have so many types of coasters for me to get my fix. 

In addition to coasters, they also have some cool shows. I ran into Iceploration to hide from the rain once, and it was quite good. The skaters were very talented. The concerts are also really good and included with your admission. They plan so many different events that I feel like there's always something new to do. 

In terms of food, it's generally pretty affordable. I think the best bets are the Smokehouse, pretzel place, Crown Colony, or the other restaurant in Pantopia. The one in Pantopia is a great place to take a breather, as they have lots of seating and entertainment, too. 

Overall, it's a great park, and I will miss having it super nearby. BG treats annual pass holders well and provide lots of nice discounts/promotions. I look forward to seeing what they come up with next.

So much FUN! Kumba (my personal favorite), Montu, Cheetah Hunt, and Sheikra are definitely the highlights of our trip. 

The "Summer nights" concept is very interesting and unique. We went on all of the rollercoasters at night and it was such a different experience than riding them in the daytime. Cheetah hunt and Kumba are the best at night, in my opinion.

We also highly recommend Zambia Smokehouse for delicious BBQ (try the brisket!).
Lots for everyone to do. I do not like roller coasters but still have a great time. Worth the annual pass so you can come and go as you want

I was not impressed at all! The food was good and I liked that my beer was bogo with my food pass. I'm military and used my one free pass to this place and spent $70 on a quick queue pass and still had to wait an hour to get on some rides and I wasn't even going to the front rows. The bathrooms we not well kept, employees were rude or so soft spoken that you couldn't hear instructions for ride safety. The park in general was disorganized to the max. I had a great experience at sea world the day before. I would like to add 2 roller coasters were closed as well, I just feel let down. Happy new year.
You'll need a few visits to thoroughly enjoy this park. The animals are amazing. So much to do!

We got there early Monday. We wanted to be pretty much the first people through the gate when the park opened. 

We went to Cheetah Hunt. It was shut down because of tech difficulties. We went to Falcon's Fury and had the same problem. 

We went to Stanley Falls...same thing, and Tidal Wave was shut down for renovations. Throughout the day, they opened up some of these rides, but by then the lines were long and it defeated the purpose of getting there early. 

$400 entry fee. Entertainment Worth $200.

I love this park. I went for Thanksgiving weekend and had so much fun. We went for today passes and paid for the safari trip to feed the giraffes and see the rhinos up close. It was amazing. The weather was great, the parking was easy, even the food was good for a theme park. We took great pictures of the animals and did the beer tasting.
My favorite exhibit was the Lori's Landing. Those birds are crazy for nectar. They were all over my head arms and shoulders. I am an animal lover so this was a dream come true...I recommend coming here it's lots of fun!

I liked Bush Gardens, but did not love it. Having gone to both Tampa and VA, I prefer the one in VA. The train is out as they appear to be building new track. The aerial tram is quite nice, but unlike the one in VA, this one is not a loop. Rhino Rally was a big dissapointment, even before I rode the same type of ride at Disney Animal kingdom (Disney does do it better). I enjoyed the shows most of all at the park. The power stilt carnival workers were very colorful. The Tiger enclosure was quite spectacular and were were able to insert our heads into a glass enclosure next to which a white tiger was sleeping (very cool!) The Africa walk was ok, but seemed to lack something I can't quite put my finger on. The three water rides were fun, and I noticed that outside one of them is the equivalent of a person size dryer where you could step into the middle of it and get dry. While it was hot enough we felt good being wet, that was a nice option I have not seen at other parks.

I've been here several times as a child and as an adult and I just LOVE this park. I love how lush and green it is and that there's animals as well as rides and shows. As a kid growing up in Ohio, we would make trips to the Cincinnati Zoo and King's Island each summer. Busch Gardens is like the best of both of those parks in one. 

My favorite animal exhibits are Lorikeet Landing, the walk-thru aviary with the tiny dikdik deer, and feeding and petting kangaroos and wallabies in Walkabout Way. 

Kumba, Montu, and Cheetah Hunt are probably my favorite roller coasters ever. Cheetah Hunt is unlike any coaster I've ever been on because it "launches" you. There is no hill to go up, you just shoot forward. It's VERY unique. All 3 that I mentioned are appropriately terrifying. I always ride in the front row too, because seeing what's coming makes the entire experience even MORE terrifying. Scorpion is a fun smaller coaster and Gwazi is enjoyable but a bit more jarring since it's wooden. I haven't ridden Sheikra yet because we couldn't find the entrance (park is really DARK at night!) and rides like Falcon's Fury tend to dislocate my hips...but I hear it's super scary. 

The only complaints I have are I wish that there were a few more unique food offerings (Chicken tenders and fries in Marrakesh? Really?) although the BBQ is pretty good. I also wish that they had a few of the "intermediate" rides. The rides are limited to 100% mild or extremely wild. I believe the Sandstorm and the other 1-2 "scrambler-esque" rides are gone. 

Christmas lights are neat to go see but be aware if you go during ChristmasTown, most of the animals are asleep or their exhibits are closed. 

This is the only park my grandma will still attend with the rest of the family because she knows she can chill at the Colony restaurant, ride the train and skyride, and it's very wheelchair accessible. Even non-thrill-seekers will enjoy a visit to Busch Gardens.

Our family took a vacation to Tampa for Labor Day weekend. The main reason for going was to take our 16 month old to Busch Gardens. This was our second time taking our daughter to a theme park since she has been able to walk. The park itself has a lot to offer. I think my husband and I would have enjoyed it more if either it would have been just the two of us or if our daughter was a little older. She wanted to walk everywhere. It was difficult trying to make sure she didn't run into people. We started her off in the kid section but most of the activities were a little older for her. We were going to let her play in the water but forgot to bring her ear plugs. She wasn't interested in the animals or characters.
 My husband and I were grateful for the parent swap. We were able to ride two roller coasters a piece. We both rode the SheiKra and the Kumba. The SheiKra will take your breath away. My husband rode it first. All I asked when he got off was how it was. I didn't ask what it did. I was able to get right on the ride with the parent swap. I didn't realize it had the 90-degree drop until the ride started. I must say that was the scariest ride I had been on in a long time. The Kumba was okay. It couldn't out do the SheiKra. 
For lunch, we ate at the Orang Café. We both had the turkey wrap. It had a lot of meat in the wrap, along with tomato and ranch dressing. My husband got fries and I had carrots. There were three different fruits to choose from and three of us shared grapes. 
We decided we needed to sit in the A/C to cool off. We found the Pirates 4-D theater. Believe the sign outside when it says there are things that will startle young children. My daughter was sitting in my lap when we got sprayed with the water. She was just at the right height to get the water in the face. It scared her to death. 
I think Busch Gardens is a great amusement park. It is a lot to do whether you enjoy roller coaster rides or seeing animals. I think we might wait until our daughter is a little older to take her back so she can really enjoy everything.
best theam park in florida, if you like roller coasters and beer, this place is awesome, variety of animals as well. Mon tu is the besttt, definitely coming back

We went here over spring break (three adults and a five-year-old this place is wonderful!
 Clean, reasonably priced, not crowded, and there is something for everyone... All ages...! Animals, rides, areas for younger kids, a tram ride to the parking lot (which is sort of far away), train through a safari, and the ride lines were all less than an hour.  We loved the bird sanctuary where you can feed colorful lorries out of your hand and take pictures with them on your shoulder or head...we LOVED it!

We went on a Monday in July. We hadn't visited a Busch Gardens park in 3 years and a lot has changed. 

It took over 90 min. just to get in the park. You have to: pay for parking, park, take a tram, get in line for tickets, get in line to get your bags checked (this really took forever), and finally, get in line to get your ticket scanned so you can actually enter the park. 

I carried a small, zipped, cross shoulder purse. This is no longer allowed on rides. You have to either have someone hold your things or pay for a locker. I would have planned differently. This proved to be very inconvenient. 

Once we got past these obstacles, the park is clean and beautiful. Lots of big coasters. Great staff. 

We paid for the quick que passes and we were very thankful for them. They allowed us to ride all the big rides with no wait before the afternoon FL thunderstorms started and all rides were shut down.

This park is a roller coaster junkies dream come true! But! Even though this park has an awesome line up of thrilling attractions there is sadly a horrible way of operating them. During our visit we experienced longer then usual wait times not because of the amount of people but because of the excruciating slow speed in which they load the ride vehicles! They could lower the wait time by 30+ minutes if they were more diligent when loading. Florida calls for rainy afternoons but never have I seen all the attractions at a park close due to it! Even with just a drizzle and a small dark cloud or 2 they would close every single attraction in the park leaving you with no option but to leave the park and either A. Come back later or B. Return another day! This happened every single day during our visit at least 3-4 times a day. The wait times? Extremely inaccurate! Expect to wait double the time shown on the board or longer due to ride closures! The customer service in the park is lacking significantly. The crew that work the attractions look miserable. Too much empty space! It takes a hike to get from one attraction to the next. Can't they add any shortcuts or at least more attractions? Those carnival rides and games need to go! Seriously for the price of admission I'd expect something a little more epic then some bumper cars. It makes the park look cheap. What's with the old defunct wooden gwazi coaster? It's still standing and a bit of a let down to see it standing there rotting away. Gives off a bad image. There isn't much to do at night here. Leaving me with no other choice but to sit in my hotel room watching re runs of old tv sitcoms. Wouldn't hurt to add some more nighttime entertainment and events. Now! The theming of this park is beautiful! The landscaping is amazing and the sheer size of the park is jaw dropping! The new Cobras Curse coaster should set the new standard for all attractions that should be built in this park in the near future! Wonderful queue! Wonderful ride! Up to par with the Orlando parks! LOVED LOVED LOVED IT! Also there are some great deals here if you look for them so it can lead to a pretty affordable trip if you take the time to look. I give Busch Gardens a 3 knowing this park can and hopefully will be a 5 after they add in some more well themed attractions. Not just some run of the mill roller coasters. We will be back and I hope to add some more stars to this review and update.

First Time visiting this park.  Got the military discount here which means Myself and kids got in for free.  Wonderful day in Florida for under 50 bucks.  Lots of fun to be had on all the rides and shows.  The Pirate 4D show is very old but still enjoyable. (No respect, No repect at all line worked well for Rodney Dangerfield in the 80's and Early 90's but he's been gone for a long while. No young kid or parents of Young ones understood it and didn't laugh)
Such a great time! We bought the unlimited meal plan and fast passes! Clean and relaxing but also lots of fun!

We live in the Orlando area so we have passes to all the parks. I would recommend Busch Gardens to adults or teens who like roller coasters and are on a budget. The food is really bad, though. Even worse than Universal for food. Which is saying something. The Sesame Street area is good for kids over about 3. They don't allow really young kids to go on anything, even in the kids area! For kids under 3ish, pay the extra and go to Disney so the youngsters can ride.

I really love this theme park. They have some of the best roller coasters and a fair amount of them too. Although  it isn't  Disney World or as big as it,  I still had tons of fun. The food is pretty expensive but tastey, and not to mention a good portion. We ate at the Zambia Smokehouse and i had the brisket sandwich. The ribs and chicken are also very good. Aside from the rollercoasters you can go on a safari, observe the animals, pet kangaroos (one actually licked my hand :) , watch their cute little 4-D pirate show, etc. This is definitely a must if you are in the Tampa area.

Normally like the park. It's close to home and we have season passes. Our boys are getting older and can stay up till the park closes so we decided to hit the park later in the day and do the Summer Nights fireworks. Got the  all day dinning pass which ended up being a huge waste of money because most of the food vendors were closing way before the park closed. It seemed the only food available past 8:30 was at the very front of the park.

After a recent visit to Busch Gardens after not having gone in years, I remember why I like it so much.

Yes, it does need a revamp, mostly in the aesthetics department and yes, its a bit annoying having to park so far from the entrance on busy days.

However, there is a TON to do here. It's like Disney's Hollywood Studios plus Animal Kingdom. I've gone to the Williamsburge Virgina Busch Gardens, its definitely a lot smaller than this one.

This is an all day park if you've never gone before, meaning you need to spend all day here to actually see and do everything.  There are the attractions (rides), shows, plus the animal habitats and educational encounters.

LOVE:

Roller Coasters:
-Kumba
-Montu 
-Scorpion
-Cheetah Hunt-It was fun, not amazing, but fun for one ride, but since its one of the newest ride its the busiest and breaks down the most as it did when the hubs and I rode it. It broke down for 20 minutes with us still on it and in a horizontal position close to the exit (thankfully).
It took a while to exit but they gave us an express pass for one ride and water...so that was nice at least!
-Falcon's Fury-Also a new ride, also breaks down. However it was fine for us, super scary and fun looking down from the top but doesn't last as long as I hoped.
-The Animal Care Center-A great place to cool down and check out live animal checkups, treatments, and maybe even a surgery.
-ALL THE ANIMAL HABITATS-Seriously, we just didn't have time to see them all.

If you're local an annual pass is definitely worth the price since you can get Sea World and Aquatica as well!

Best Park Ever! All the animals was out to see all day long. The rides was AWESOME! The staff was friendly and nice. There wasn't any craziness going on. I really recommend coming out to this park. I like this park way better then the others
Good old Busch Gardens! Amazing safari and very cool rides. I have off and on been a season pass holder for 10 years or more and would recommend everyone visit this place at least once.

This is a superb theme park with something for all ages. High octane rollercoaster rides, great water drenching rides, high quality entertainment  and an animal park too. Did I forget to mention that smokers are treated as tax paying human beings in designated smoking areas and not pushed to the edges of the park hidden behind a small forest of bushes?

We went as a family during Spring Break. Two points if doing business I would like to give people a heads up. 
One the day we spent money to get in they posted as you handed your tickets the team was down.  This is a major park of the parks appeal for the safari.  
If they posted this on the web site to call and see what was down you could plan around it.

They do list that some rides have height restrictions but never say what they are. My granddaughter missed out by a half inch and her disappointment and tears was enough for me to write and caution other people who pay close to 100.00 to check first before you waste your money to make your kids cry

We go here about once per month and love all the family fun things to do. The annual pass for this, combined with SeaWorld Orlando is very affordable and there's always something going on. The animal keepers really know their stuff and take great care of the animals!

Ein etwas in die Jahre gekommener Freizeitpark. Geöffnet seit 1959

Jetzt,  Ende Oktober schon recht ruhig; damit verbunden aber auch geschlossene Einrichtungen. 

Bei den Speisen tut das nicht weh. Bei diesen Preisen und dem Angebot kann man auf das Essen getrost verzichten. Getränke sind aber auch extrem teuer. Reinnehmen darfst du nur ein Wasser. Das ist bei 30 Grad nicht ok. Kleine Wasser oder Coke kosten am Automaten 3,99 $. Für eine Durchschnittsfamilie kommt da schon eine Menge zusammen.

We just love this place.  If you play your cards right you can cash in on the fun.  I would definitely recommend an annual pass.    A one day ticket here is $80 pp.  apparently there is no such thing as a child ticket lol.  It's $80 3 and up.  Value days for families with a few members on Wednesdays it is 65 if that will help.  See I promise an annual pass is a better value $99 at Costco.  You can go to Aqaitica and Seaworld or miss and match parks or get a pass for all three parks.  Of course we have all three.  The best thing about that is we go all the time.  The meal pass is $49 for three kids but $32 pp for adults.  It's all you care to eat and works at select restaurants throughout the parks.  The fun is unlimited but don't let the prices kick you running.  Any family can afford to come to Bush Gardens.  You can also take advantage of their ez pay and pay less than $20 a month pp. for an annual pass.  Now if that doesn't grab you just save up and come any way.  You will love it.!

A true gem for the Bay area. World class amenities right here in west central Florida. Top-tier roller coasters, an African zoo, well organized, and properly maintained. If you skip the Orlando park scene, then give Busch Gardens a day. On the other hand, if you do visit the Orlando theme park machine, Busch Gardens deserves your opinion. Either way, you won't regret it. 

Born and raised in Tampa. I've watched this park grow and evolve. From literally a garden on the grounds of a now defunct brewery, to a world-class roller coaster theme park, Busch Gardens has always entertained every age, class, creed and taste. 

There is way more to do at the park then you can fit into a day, which is one reason why locals like me keep coming back. The roller coasters are a blast, but if the place is busy go see the animals or a show. Bring the young kids to the sesame street themed kids park or treat the family to a meal at the crown colony house with it's safari based decor. Albeit expensive, but even the shops have unique gifts for the folks back home. 

Whether you're in town for the weekend or live a couple miles away, the park does a fantastic job of mixing it up and keeping the entertainment fresh for families of any size. Don't hesitate to give them a try if you're thinking about having a great day of fun!

Go early for the new rides. We made the mistake and went towards Gwanzi when we arrived at 11am (past Sat). Gwanzi was closed so we made our way to Sherika and got right on with no wait. We then went to Kumba and there was not a single person in line. We thought to ourselves this is great. We can ride all day and not have to wait in line. We we found out whey there were no lines on the side of the park we went to. Everyone was in line for the Falcon and Cheeta. both of those lines had a 70 min wait so we did not get a chance to ride them.

 My advise is also to avoid getting on the train and the sky mover at a different location other than where these new rides are. We decided to get on the sky ride (don't know the name of it) that is right next to Cheeta and we had to wait for 30 min. We could see empty pods coming in but all of them were full when they left our station (by all means ride it from the other side of the park and you will not have to wait). 

We did get the all you can eat meal ticket. Wow, I could hardley move by the end of the day. All of the food we had was good except for the pasta buffet. I won't eat there again. I should have known something was up when there were only a few people in the entire place. The only think I liked there were the meatballs. 


So pros: nice and cool, park was not crowded other than by the new rides, the meal pass was great (get the brisket and the bread pudding from the smokehouse, yum), good entertainment. 

Cons: The following were closed, Guanzi, the gorillas exhibit, the Madascar show, and a few other animal exhibits. 

We will go again but not anytime soon. We want the new car smell to wear off of the new rides and then we will go again.

I made the trip to Tampa specifically for Busch Gardens.  I used to come here frequently when in college but haven't been here in a while. What a great time we had, and it is nice to see many of the same qualities still are existent today.  The park has wonderful staff, a clean park, and offers something for everyone. It is also nice to see that they continue to invest in unique quality thrill rides. Anytime I visit Florida I will always try to make some time to visit the park!

I am a season pass holder, so I frequent Busch Gardens often. I enjoy the perks of all day dining pass. Being a season pass holder I have no blackout dates. I am not really big on riding so I cant tell you much about them. I can say that Busch Gardens is constantly improving its park. My kids love the splash pad (kid area in general). There are plenty of restaurants, shows and thrills. I highly recommend for individual or family fun.

Individual with a disability in your party? AVOID THIS PARK.


The services offered for individuals with disabilities are atrocious. Busch Gardens offers a "virtual queue system", which requires individuals with disabilities wait the same amount of time as individuals whom don't have disabilities, by use of a "return" system. This type of system is extremely ineffective for individuals with Autism or Anxiety Disorders who are unable to wait in-line. Busch Gardens offers, for sale, a pass that allows you to bypass lines called "Quick Queue" which is "...Valid for UNLIMITED front of the line admission...". This theme park is capitalizing on individuals with disabilities and putting them in the same category as people with money to blow who don't wish to wait in line. Absolutely abhorrent! Until a better system is in-place for those with Autism, we will be sticking with Disney.

I used to be a big fan of this place, but recent changes have totally ruined my experience! Busch Gardens now nickel and dimes you by forcing you to have to put any bags, regardless of size, in a locker & they now charge for the lockers! Plus, they sell you a beer cup at a higher price, saying you can fill it up at a discount, but I have yet to find another spot in this god forsaken park that will refill my cup at the discounted price. Lastly, with all this nickel & dining, the rides still look outdated.... Very disappointed with my experience!

I have not been to Busch Gardens during the day in about 6 years, every year I go to Howl o scream. They have really made this place into a top amusement park. My sons first trip and he loved it, from seeing all the animals to riding some of the child rides he had a blast! 
I recommend this place hands down! Do not miss out on all the great animals.

If you come to Tampa, you have to come here. An awesome adventure park for all ages, especially kids. The roller coasters are top notch. They're surrounded by other rides, amusements, and stores from the same region of the world and theme. Lots of parking. Accommodations for those with mobility issues in the parking lot and in the park. The price structure is a little strange (one ticket was same as season ticket last time I went) but that's my only real issue.

FINALLY was able to visit this awesome park. I guess I came on a great day because the wait for the rides was under 30 minutes, and the majority only took 15-20 minutes. Was able to get on all the major rides in a decent amount of time. My favorite ride was Sheikra followed by Chettah Hunt. I definitely had one the best adrenaline rushes during both of those rides!

BUYER BEWARE!! FYI-- If you use the EZ Pay services for an annual pass they WILL automatically renew. If you contact guest services with in hours of noticing the renewal they will cancel the annual pass for you but they will refuse to offer a refund. You must cancel the EZ Pay annual passes PRIOR to the auto-renewal charge being taken out. Keep this in mind as you make entertainment plans for the year. We will not be going back.

**UPDATE 6/24/17 - Even when you fulfill your commitment of the one year payment on the EZ pass, with the automatic renewal (which you will not receive a notice of that you have reached one year) will occur and if you contact guest services within HOURS of noticing the charge, they will still refuse refund. They will cancel for you, but refuse refund.
a nice park, not as good as williamsburg though.  this park is africa-themed, and it has some great rides as well.  went there after christmas for my bday and it was tons of fun!

Love Busch Gardens but I went there yesterday, my app said it was open til 9pm, but they closed at 6pm!  I wouldn't have minded that much if there wasn't a four hour ride delay from a big storm. We spent a ton of money on beer and only got to ride two rides!  Plus I'm still upset that they keep the depressed looking kangaroos in such a small area. Poor little guys. But yeah, it's a fun place for sure.

As a native, I've been coming to BG since I was a wee little lad. I like roller coasters but I wouldn't spend the money to go unless I'm taking/going with someone for the first time. I would suggest that you DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME IN THE SUMMER!!! Holy Jesus, I mean there are so many tourist (long lines, welcome to summer in Florida) and with the heat it's really not worth it. 

When it comes to cost...I sold my left kidney to enjoy the day. 100+ ticket, 22 to park, 20 for lunch, etc etc etc...I feel bad for you people that have kids, you'd probably have to take a second mortgage! 

At the end of the day though, (if everything is functional), the park is a lot of fun. Lots of variety for everyone, rides, animals, shows, games, play areas...it's got it all, just be prepared to drop dollars. Enjoy!

OMG YELP! Thank you again for a wonderful experience. I had the opportunity to visit Busch Gardens for their Christmas Town event that is held annually in December. Thanks to Yelp, we were given free admission to the park, free parking, a complimentary snack and drink and front of the line passes for all rides. 

There are several things you can do at Busch Gardens and its appropriate for people of all ages. They have several shows located throughout the park. There are rides specifically for small children and a Sesame Street/Elmo themed section of the park for children as well. If you love animals, Busch Gardens is great. There is a safari type ride and several exhibits with different animals located all over the park. 

The roller coasters are my favorite part of the park. They are FANTASTIC! My ultimate fave is the Cheetah Hunt. Man oh Man! Talk about roller coaster heaven. The ride was just perfect. Longer than most roller coasters and the track looks like a long cube, so Im not quite sure how the seats stay on the track but they do and it adds to the trill. Complete with speed, several turns, drops, and loops this coaster is the ultimate thrill seeker's dream ride. We also got on Sheikra, which is a close second to Cheetah Hunt complete with two 90 degree drops, be prepared to scream. Scorpion is an oldie but goodie with its super speed and quick turns it will definitely give you an unexpected thrill. Last but certainly not least, the new falcon's fury ride. Sitting in a seat and being slowly raised up, up, up...and up. I remember thinking, ummmm...okay, how far up are we actually going to go?! Then your seat lifts leaving you face down looking at the ground and finally, without noticed, you are DROPPED AT FULL SPEED! I'll just let that thought sink in for a minute lol. It's so fun! 

The Christmas Town was extremely nice. There were several areas where you can take Christmas and winter themed pictures, lots of season inspired foods, a cute train ride and several shows to watch. Very family friendly and a great addition for the Christmas Season! 

So thank you Yelp for this fun and HIGHLY recommend if you're in the Tampa area to try this theme park

Whenever I visit my grandma and cousins in Tampa, we usually come here, and it's always a fun time! The roller coasters are really fun and we went on a weekday so the lines weren't very long.

This theme park sticks out from the others because it's kind of like a zoo as well. I was able to let birds walk all over me. I was able to pet kangaroos. I watched a trainer feed an elephant, and there were many more animals I saw! The coolest thing we saw though was the white tiger! We were able to go into one of those bubbles and see the tiger up close (refer to my video, it's AWESOME).

I really just wish the food was better and cheaper but hey, what do you expect from a theme park?

I can't believe after having lived in Tampa as long as I have, that I've never had the opportunity to write a review until now.  My most recent adventure at the park came during Christmas when a group of co-workers and I visited Christmas Town.  Overall it was an enjoyable holiday outing and the lighting done by the park in the Christmas Town area was amazing.  

As far as the park itself goes, who doesn't like going to a theme park and letting all of their worries go by the wayside.  There is plenty do here for anyone of any age.  There are kids areas with kid rides all the way down to various safari adventures and insane roller coasters.  The only coaster I have yet to try is Falcon's Fury as that one seems a bit much even for me.  Otherwise I've been on all of the coasters and had a blast.  Gwazi is the only one I would ever complain about given that you may need to see a chiropractor after taking a ride on it, but that one should be closed by February.
Overpriced for what you get. Rides not working. Food way overpriced. A lot of sections closed. What a waste of money and gas. Not what it used to be for sure. Wish we hadn't bothered.

Our family planned a day out at BG.  4 roller coasters are down for technical difficulties....they were the first 4 we came to.  The entire park is pissed.  Call first.  They seem to have a lot of old azz coasters.

THE FOOD IS DISGUSTING, we ate at the dragon fire grill and then at the twisted tails pretzels and both experiences were highly disappointing. The dragon fire grill food has little to no taste. The food is so bland for example the mixed vegetables in the Italian platter tasted soggy and as if they came from a can. Then at the pretzel place, the bacon pretzel was so salted it was unbearable. And I promise you the cinnamon sugar pretzel from the mall is such much more yummy than at this place. I feel that the employees pay little to no attention when preparing the food. I wish I could get a refund on the food. I'm not picky but a level of quality is expected from an expensive theme park, especially if since the prices for the food are high.

If there is ANY chance of rain, don't go to this park. They were literally shut down for hours on 30% chance of rain and "lightening in the area". Very disappointing, especially after spending $89/ticket to get in. Thankfully we got a CityPass and enjoyed two other attractions too. Park would've been fun otherwise .
Just left howloscream. Fiends was hands down a MUST SEE. The scare zones were terrifying yet you could interact with them. I am a pass holder but this takes the cake. Love BG!

Ich kann toffifee0660 im Wesentlichen zustimmen. Sehr schön ist die Tigerstation: unter einer Glaskuppel kann man mit etwas Glück die Tiger aus allernächster Nähe beobachten. Weniger Toll ist das überall beworbene Jungala. Auf den Werbeplakaten an den Highways sieht man einen Jungen, der voller Begeisterung unter einem Flugdrachen hängt. In Wirklichkeit sitzt man unter einem Minidrachen und fährt ein Stahlseil 5 Meter vorwärts und rückwärts. Da haben manche Kinderspielplätze mehr zu bieten.
It was just ok but that shakiera ride is awesome.  This is one of those places if you are in Tampa I would venture too.  If you are military you and your family get in for free.

With 2 young kids I've frequented all the local parks from Orlando to Tampa. Typically what's assumed is a lousy overpriced lunch. However at Bush Gardens I finally found a good park lunch. Although pricey(expected) the Beef Brisket at the Smokehouse restauraunt next to Sheikra was very good.  I will be back on my next visit.

I love Busch Gardens Tampa. The whole atmosphere of the park is pretty amazing, from the great thrill rides, to the vast selection of animals to observe and take pictures, to the tasty food. I would say if you are a local resident, then the annual pass is definitely the smartest option. For less than two full-day prices, you receive unlimited entrances to the park, as well as free parking (saves you $20 alone right there). The annual perks for the pass members are also well worth it, as well as the perk of the month. If you haven't been yet, definitely check it out, and if you are planning a trip to Tampa Bay or Orlando, be sure to add Busch Gardens Tampa to your itinerary.

Busch Gardens has some of the best roller coasters in the world.  Gwazi is the most underestimated and underrated roller coaster.  Riding it at night is absolutely thrilling.  It's the only wooden roller coaster and it really offers big thrills.  It's the most thrilling aside from Sheikra.  Montu is well renowned for being a great floorless coaster with alot of twists and turns.  Scorpion and Kumba are solid coasters also. Sheikra is the most terrifying thing I've ever been on, especially at night.  Hanging with your face down 200 feet in the air waiting to be dropped is very intimidating.  It happens twice by the way.  The park is very large and one of the more difficult parks to navigate around.  I highly recommend Rhino Rally or the safaris.  They also have a whitewater rafting ride and a flume ride.  The railroad can take you from one side of the park to the other and offer great views.  Busch Gardens is one of the greatest parks ever especially if you love roller coasters. Not as much as a reality turning special effects festival as Universal or Disney but definitely scarier more intense rides.
Awesome place to have fun just make sure you are over 48 inches . Rides run even if there's rain and if you have an annual pass parking is free!!!!

This is a great place to have fun. My family and I love to get there All Day Dining armband it is so worth the money. There summer nights is to die for, the fireworks, the music, just everything is perfect. We can't wait to come back!!!!

I did not wanted to leave this review but here it goes. 

Got to bush gardens with the kids at 11am, we were super excited, before going to the rides we got some food. After lunch all the rides were shut down due to lightning, so we decided to wait and see if it passed however after two hours with no rides the sky got darker and lighting started with a heavy downpour, we said ok, this was bad enough so let's go out, on our way out there was a huge line on the customer service area which was not covered except the part close to the cashier, I knew they were giving rain checks there but with a heavy downpour and a lightning show on the sky, it was obvious standing there was not the best use of my time, in addition, I was with a 4 and 6 year old so this was really not an option for me. We got to our hotel and we called Bush Gardens and I was amazed that they don't do anything unless you do stop at the park customer service, really very impractical for people and on our case very dangerous, sorry to say but I did not feel like a wanted customer.... would likely not come back.... They need to change this ridiculous policy, is not like they cannot just verify what time we got into the park and that all the rides were down.

Busch Gardens is the best all around Amusement park in FL. You can't beat the price for an annual pass that includes free parking! They are GREAT working with Autistic kids and are very family oriented. The park is well signed and easy to get around. My son and I go weekly during the summer and monthly the rest if the year. Love this park!

Wear good shoes! We walked almost 8 miles within the park. 
We were there about 10 hours on a Tuesday & had time to do all we wanted. The longest line was 50 minutes. 
Cobra's Curse was our favorite ride. Sheikra, Kumba, and Cheetah Hunt were great too. 
The Opening Night Critters show was super cute - various animals doing tricks. The Cheetah Run was a brief demonstration but neat to watch the cats run up close. 
Friendly staff throughout the park. 
After reading other reviews about expectedly high food prices, we decided to picnic in the car. If you're thirsty ask for a cup of ice water at any restaurant within the park (free).
Parkings costs $20. There are trams from the parking lot to the main entrance.

I have to say, while I love Busch Gardens, I was pretty disappointed today. I understand that it's spring break and the park is trying to make money but when you try and charge $60 ($60!) for a ONE time skip the line is INSANE. I had a small kid with me and we waited 90 minutes for one ride because I refused to pay that kind of money for a ONE time skip in line. Needless to say, I wasn't going to wait in any more hour and a half lines after that. Maybe you should take a page from Disney's book and do fast passes. No cost...which makes sense considering I'm already paying hundred of dollars to go. And eat. And whatever else comes along.

Great park, but so spread out. Lots and lots of empty areas to walk past, so bring walking shoes. 
Food: mostly fried fast food. Buy the wrist band to save on meals. One meal at smoke shack paid for wrist band. You get unlimited soda and a meal every 60 minutes if you want. Only to be used at certain food places. Did not see any healthy eating options. :(
Rides: mostly thrill coasters. Not much to do if you have back or neck issues, mainly for teens and thrill seekers. 
Employees: some care, but alot do not. We encountered some friendly employees though. 
Decor was still holiday, but it is very dark at night. Not lit up very well after sunset. Park closed at 7, but all in all was a great day.

Long lines and many times the rides are broken and they won't tell you when you buy your tickets, and the food is quite dated.   

The animals look depressed,  we are not imposing blame on Busch Gardens, when mammals are confined to a small area as such, the mental deterioration and potential inner struggles is not salient to the average visitor nor can they be quantified, nevertheless it cannot be ignored.  Do they have memories of their previous home?  More evident is the natural instincts  that are lost.   Of course Busch Garden cares, why wouldn't they?  The animals are part of the for profit attraction cloaked with the whole caring overture thing.  


As a consolidation they get one star for keeping them alive.

Wir hatten mit der ganzen Familie wirklich eine tolle Zeit. Der Park ist gepflegt, sauber und echt gut organisiert. Die Kombination aus Zoo und Freizeitpark ist perfekt und etwas für kleine Kinder, große Kinder und auch die Erwachsenen.

some of my fondest memories are of riding roller caosters and visiting zoos and here at Busch Gardens you can do both! I was amazed at well decorated the grounds were during Christmas time and now spring time. This place is amazing can't stress enough that this is one of my favorite places in Tampa! Great prices fun fro the whole family!

Wish I could give zero stars. Friday night, we went to see Rudolph. 
We were quoted 25 min wait. 
An hour and 15 minutes later, we finally went inside. 
While we were waiting, a kid hit my son in the head with a rock. The parents did nothing. 
I tried to find a manager. No one would help me or find someone. 
It was so dark inside that none of my pictures came out. All too dark. 
By the time we finished, it was too late to see Santa since the kids were melting down from the Rudolph wait. 
We came back today, Sunday, to see Santa. 
We waited an hour. Not a bad wait, the week before Christmas. 
I asked the elf if she would take a picture of all 4 of us. She said, "no, I will not," opened the curtain and said we could leave. 
However, I spoke with another friend that came just last week and she said the elf happily took her entire party's picture WITH HER CAMERA. 
So, now I have NO pictures of us with Santa after an hour wait. 
I didn't know the elf wouldn't take our picture.  They have taken our picture the past 3 years. 
I went to guest services to talk to someone. Marilyn wouldn't help me. She sent me to Jon. He was rude and told me to buy the $99 CD. 
So, they are losing 9 pass holders when all they had to do was take our picture. We have been pass holders for the past 3 years. We have the platinum pass with 3 parks. Very disappointed in their customer service.

We visted Busch Gardens as part of a trip to Orlando.  We really enjoyed the park.  It was a tad crowded, and some rides have long wait times, but overall the park was great and we really enjoyed seeing all the animals and the roller coasters.  Had a hard time finding the pengjin exhibit, so missed that, but really enjoyed feeding the birds.  The photographer got a funny shot of me stunned when 3 birds landed on me immediately upon entering with the bird food.

We have visited this park for years. This time was a bit of a let down. There were not many animals in view. One or none for some exhibits. There were not a lot of animal species. We couldn't feed the wallabys because they were full and overheated. Won't go back again.

If I could give it less than one star I would. DONT SPEND YOUR MONEY HERE take your money to universal or Disney where they have quality customer service and workers who are actually HAPPY to work there. First of all, there are only three kiosks to get your fast passes EVEN if they are pre bought. The line at the front is always long and the attendant there told us to go to the kiosk near Cobras furry or another one. So we went to the kiosk and I waited 30 minutes in the scorching heat, which is fine I understand there would be a wait but once I was second in the line THE MACHINE BROKE and the attendant told us to find another kiosk. He took the people in front to print their tickets so I thought hey we all deserve this privilege after waiting so long!!!! So I followed him back to the very from of the park easily a 10 minute walk and when I confronted him and told him I waited a long time also and want to have my pre bought tickets printed he proceeded to tell me he didn't have time for that and walked away!!! It was ridiculous I've never experienced worst customer service in my life.

This was a nice way to spend my 30th birthday. It's been a while since I've been to an amusement park and I have to say this was a nice way to re-introduce myself :). 

It wasn't too big where we felt overwhelmed and like we couldn't get everything done. But it wasn't too small either. I liked the aspect of it being part amusement park and part zoo. We got to see some beautiful animals. I hadn't seen an orangutan before and they had one here. I saw the most exquisite white tiger..o my; the eyes on this creature were stunning. I'm sad I didn't get a picture, but it's ok. I'll just have to come back. A

I liked the fact that they had a designated area for children. It was called the Sesame Street Safari of Fun. It had age appropriate rides for the kiddos and a really nice play place area suited with a huge bouncy area and obstacle course. I kinda wanted to go on myself lol. 

I rode a couple of the coasters. The one that gripped my heart every time I heard it was the Falcon's fury. If you're a thrill seeker, you will NOT be disappointed. I did not have the courage to try it. Every time I heard that noise to signal the drop, my heart just sank. I did enjoy the water rides and the cheetah hunt (which was enough thrill for me lol) and they were all fun. 

Beware of overpriced food (but that goes without saying at any attraction like such) 

We'll be back though. It was a pleasant time.

Wonderful place for kids ages infant to 99!  Park attendants visible and accessible throughout the park for advice, help and directions.  Activities and lines are shaded in places which is a plus, not having to be in the hot Florida sun 100% of the time.  Wonderful opportunities to take in the beautiful plants, animals, gentle rides and thrill rides.

I love spending the day here, especially since I live a few miles away.  The park has some amazing roller coasters including Sheikra and Montu.  My favorite ride, as funny as it is, is the Sandstorm.  Great mixture of rides and animals.

I'd have to say out of all the amusement parks in North America, this would have to be my favorite just for the scenery. It is mainly a roller coaster park. 

What makes this place stand out for me, is that as you walk between rides, it feels as if they put a roller coaster park, inside of a zoo. As you walk between rides, you actually have something nice to look at, and not just concrete walls and/or fences that have been painted goofy colors/designs.

I love this park more than most because it is roller coaster heavy. However, their overly restrictive lightning policy makes for a longer park experience than expected, due to waiting around. They claim it's if lightning is spotted within a 10 mi radius, but I've seen rides get shut down just for clouds. I look up and see nothing but clouds and mixed sunshine. I check the weather sites and it shows clouds and sunshine, no rain or storms. I ask how long and they say when the storm passes (what storm again?). Maybe they need to update their weather equipment and personnel? I don't know... I'm guessing someone got struck once, somewhere, and it cost someone a lot of money :). Still, even if a quick que ticket can bypass long lines for a little extra money ($50 per ticket), the clouds in the sky will slow you down for sure. It is central florida after all, so plan accordingly!

I remember when it was pay 50 and go back for the year for free if you were a Florida resident?? What happened Busch gardens was sold and prices almost quadrupled? A family of four is 600 for the year? Other then that we always have a great time!

Not the best park... But possibly the most expensive. The roller coasters were fair...the sherika was lame after being intimidated all day by it's 90 degree face first drop...the kumba was the fast scary surprise of the day...ummm...won't be back..
Park is not being maintained well and it smells horrible.  Don't waste money on the quick queue.  The lines are not very long.  It used to be such a wonderful park.

As annual pass members, we visit Busch Gardens quite regularly.  My three children (ages 12, 8, 3) love it there. The Sesame Safari offers a safe place for the younger ones with preschool friendly rides and play area. There are two splash pads "spray grounds" located in Sesame Safari and Jungala which are great ways to cool off on hot days.  Pack swimsuits and towels!

For the thrill-seeker, the rides at Busch Gardens are like no other. Cheetah Hunt will blow your spots off!  Sheikra will make your shreik with delight as you dangle from high above.  With one swooping drop, your stomach will be left behind.  Of course, Busch Gardens is also known for its amazing animal habitats and shows.

Season passes are the best deal by far but you can also purchase a Fun Card, pay once and visit the rest of the year.  If you buy a Fun Card, buy one annual pass to save on money.

I'm super lucky to be so close to this gem. I love coasters, and it's great to have em so close to home. Yea, three of em suck bad. So? Have some more beer and ride again, it gets better. You pansy. 
For a parkful of better rides,head to Ohio. Our Florida weather, and  Southern Hospitality make this place great. Oh, and turkey legs and BBQ dont hurt either.

Only giving 1 star because I have to! Do not waste your time here! Way over priced and there isn't much to do! I came today for the first time and was so disappointed! Wait times for the rides are close to 2 hours and that's if the ride is even open! Today after standing in line for over an hour, the ride was cancelled for technical issues. This wasn't 1 ride but 2 different rides! I was there 6 hours and got to ride 1 thing! I will not be back.

Immaculate park, gorgeous animals and buildings, plus the MOST FRIGGIN AWESOME ROLLERCOASTERS!  The day we were there it was not busy at all, so we were able to go on a few more than once.  And while they were all good, SHEIKRA (or Shakira, as we called it) and the wooden rollercoaster (I forget the name) were by far the best.  I was just sad the "safari train" wasnt running that day and so we didnt get a chance to take advantage of that.  Food is decent but typically overpriced as most amusement parks are. 

Seriously, you like rollercoasters, this is the place for you.  I almost cried coming off of Sheikra it was that flippin bad-ass.

Ok, so maybe expectations were set too high for this adventure. Took the family here for a day trip. First off, I just spent $320 for 4 people on admissions and they nickel and dime me for a $20 parking spot. Ok, positives-the park setting is nice, beautiful flower sculptures throughout. Make sure you spend the $10.95 for a refillable soft drink cup. Negatives-long, long, long lines for rides-plan on waiting an hour for a ride. After we waited forever to ride on Shireka, we went to purchase Que Passes (fast lane passes) but they were sold out. Food was typical amusement park fare and very expensive. The Sky Line ride was short and not worth the wait. From a value stand point, I left feeing I got ripped off. Live and learn. Disney World would have been a better choice.

This place is great, lots of family fun. It's worth getting the annual pass, you get free parking and discounts on items inside the park. Almost all of their roller coasters are GREAT!!! I swear I ended up praying in the shikra hahahaha , and the cheetah run will have you asking for more!! Food is a bit pricey so be warned. It's good to go during the weekday, weekends lines are longer. Kids had fun especially in the Sesame Street zone. The ice skating show is amazing. Take comfy shoes, lots to walk and make sure to get a map.

More reasonably priced park, especially the annual pass. Great rides fir all likes from tykes to dare devils. Cheetah Run is one of my faves. Park has rides, entertainment, food and animals!  May not be as pristine as some of the Orlando parks, still worth the visit.

If you love roller coasters than Tampa, Florida has a park for you.  I don't get the thrill unless you are in town and have an annual pass or love love love coasters.  That's all this park really is...and there's nothing wrong with that. It doesn't appeal to me but if you don't get enough thrills from the other parks Florida has to offer definitely go. Unfortunately there is no place on premises to get something decent to eat. No matter where you go it's all just standard fair fare. That can really dampen your day to have a lousy burger or tasteless salad. But to redundantly repeat myself - go for the roller coasters.

Busch Gardens ist eine tolle Mischung aus Zoo und Freizeitpark. Die Eintrittspreise sind ziemlich happig, aber dafür kann man sich hier auch mit der ganzen Familie einen ganzen Tag (wohl problemlos auch länger) beschäftigen.


 Der Zoo-Teil an sich ist schon sehr interessant. Bei den einzelnen Gehegen, die in den meisten Fällen ziemlich großzügig angelegt sind, kann man den Tieren trotzdem relativ nah kommen, wenn diese grad in Fensternähe sind. Bei der Rundbahn, hat man auch einen tollen ausblick auf die Flächen auf denen Giraffen, Zebras, Nashörner und Co. leben.


 Zusätzlich gibt es dann noch diverse Achterbahnen, 3 (!) Wasserbahnen, bei denen man dank des ganzjährig warmen Wetters ruhig auch mal nass werden kann, einen Teil mit Kinder-Karussells, einem Kirmes-Bereich, in dem es die typischen Kirmes- Fahrgeschäfte gibt und vieles andere.


 Bei Kostenfaktor ist noch zu erwähnen, dass das Parken am Park mit 14$ und z.b. das ausleihen eines Buggys für Kinder mit 15$ ebenfalls noch mal ordentlich zu Buche schlagen.
Positiv ist allerdings, dass das Essen für Freizeitparkverhältnisse noch relativ günstig ist. Außerdem können die Tages Eintrittskarten an einem 2. Tag innerhalb von 7 Tagen zum Wieder-Eintritt in den Park genutzt werden.
Für ADAC Mitglieder gibt es übrigens auch immerhin einen Rabatt von 5$ auf den Eintrittspreis.


 Insgesamt war der Park sehr ordentlich, sowohl auf den Wegen als auch in Restaurants und Toiletten waren fast ständig Angestellte mit Reinigungen beschäftigt. Außerdem gab es an vielen Stellen im Park Spender zur Handdesinfektion!


 Da wir im März, nach den Frühlingsferien in Florida und in der Woche dort waren, war es insgesamt angenehm leer, so dass es nirgendwo übermäßig lange Wartezeiten gab.
