It's not a big of a deal in practice, but a huge operation like that should be able to have an accurate price on the website. I highly recommend the meal plan option which adds about the cost of 1.5 meals to your ticket but it entitles you to (as of this writing) One entrée, one side,  one dessert, and one beverage every hour from open till close. There may a few people that would be able to actually achieve that, But you could theoretically eat $600 worth of food in a day there on your meal plan. I think we paid about $30 for it. Unless you are absolutely not going to eat anything, you pretty much cannot go wrong buying the meal plan.  If you buy your tickets at least three days in advance online you should be able to save enough money so that the ticket plus the meal plan ends up being the same price as if you walked up and paid entrance fee at the gate. Realistically this means if you buy your tickets in advance you pretty much are eating for free all day. The meal plan works at any of the restaurant type places but it does not work at the small little's ice cream stands etc.  Unless somethings very much out of the ordinary happens I can guarantee you that if you go there you will not be disappointed. One last thing before I close: if you were there many years ago you will remember the brewery tour. They Close the doors to that brewing facility in 1995 as it was their smallest facility. When it opened in 1959 the brewery served five states but by 1967, even though production at the plant had doubled, that facility was serving only Florida. When it closed it was the smallest brewing facility owned by Anheuser-Busch.  Maybe I am "geezing" if I say this but in my opinion it would've been nice to leave it open and connected to the park as it could've certainly remained at least somewhat profitable and would've been an interesting insight into brewing. Even if it's not a super efficient plant it would have been something nice for people to be able to see

I love this amusement park! My daughter never gets bored here. The dining package is a must especially if you don't feel like spending a ton of money on food. The employees are always in a good mood and I never have received bad service here.

My review is for the Busch Wine & Dine Fest and free concert series. Bravo Busch Gardens! This event was better than the brews and beers series. The best deal to taste wine or beer and food is to get a pass. I spent $48 for 5 food tastes and 5 drinks. My friend did the same and we shared all the food and were able to try a lot more dishes this way.  We were actually full after 5 plates so saved the rest for after the Kenny Rogers concert. My absolute favorite was the Grilled pound cake sandwich that had a cheesecake filling and raspberry dipping sauce on the side. The recipe is on their website and I plan to save it and recreate it! The smoke beef brisket was quite good and so was the coconut shrimp. As for the drinks.. I had korbel champagne, a rose champagne, chardonney, Pino Noir and a frozen drink called a Dreamsicle. It had vodka in it and was refreshing as it was warm out. It tasted just like the ice cream bar.. With a kick of course. :) There is also a ton of beer to try for you beer lovers. Watch out Disney! This food Fest was just as good in my mind and less expensive AND.. For me.. Close to home. I hope they also do the Brew Fest this fall. I'll be there if they do!

My family went there this week.  Paid $300.00 to get in.  Per my brother, all of the animals were inside because of the heat.  That's fine, I don't want anything to happen to the animals because of heat exposure. They shut down all of the rides, there was a storm 13 miles away, again fine, you don't want anyone struck by lightening.  Those of us who live in Florida know how fast a storm can develop.  Shouldn't there have been a disclaimer for ALL of Busch Gardens' action BEFORE someone pays $300.00?  So the only thing left to do was to eat.  For their credit they did return their admittance fee (after an argument).  After all of that, S-I-law spent the night puking.  Food poisoning.   Thanks Busch Gardens!

I went to Busch Gardens for the first time with my friend last month.  I had a blast!

The zoo portion of the park is really cool and there are all sorts of neat animals to look at.  I think the best part was the kangaroo area, where you can feed and pet the 'roos!  So much fun!  Also make sure you go to the tiger enclosure - there is a tiger there that will ham it up for the camera all day long!  We got some great photos because of that.

The roller coasters here are awesome!  Shiekra is probably the one I found the scariest - the drop is literally 90 degrees straight down.  Extremely intense!  I also liked the Kumba coaster a lot.  The new Cheetah Hunt is pretty neat, though not as fast as I was expecting.  It does, however, cover a lot of land, which is cool!

If roller coasters are your thing, make sure that you get Quick Passes - and get them early in the day, as the price goes up as the day continues.  They are WELL worth the money and you are easily able to skip the majority of the long lines.  We never regretted buying them for a second.

The skyride is fun - be sure to check that out!  The train is also neat.  Both rides give you some really cool views of the park.

I would definitely recommend a visit to Busch Gardens!

I really loved Busch Garden 2008, but now it is only a big disappointment.
Full entry price, all shows were closed, they are indoor, the rain would be no problem.
A lot of animal areas closed, of course with the thunderstorm the rides closed too, no problem at all for us, we not go in Rollercoaster etc. 
My husband bought a dinning packed, a lot of areas you was able to use. With this packed were CLOSED. At the map the information were wrong, the food areas they have according to the map the dinning program tell us NO! 
We are not big eaters, but to pay $ 35 a person for cold Asian food, a drink and then after 3 hours we tried again something, that was okay. 
The Serengeti Safari was nice, you saw a couple of animals, not a lot, it cost per person $39, not cheap at all, but it helps those in the program to breed animals.
Unfortunately, many of the enclosures are not really close to an European standard, they are much too small and often not really species-appropriate.
A lot of money for NOTHING!
And we had to drive 1.5 hours each way!
We will not go back to this park.

Honestly, just spend the extra 2 hours and $50 to go to Universal or Disney World. They don't have enough workers, we weren't able to go on any rides due to the weather and we weren't refunded for any of it. A waste of my time and money.

Great theme park in the Tampa area. Busch Gardens is like a zoo and a theme park since they have both animals and rides. One of my kids' favorite ride is the train ride. The train takes you around the park and the best part is being able to see the animals up close. The park is huge and lots of things to do/see. I love their "Waves of honor" program which they offer free and discounted tickets for military and their family once per year. If you're in active duty definitely take advantage of that. I'd definitely be visiting Busch Gardens again even without the military discounts. Check the park out and you will be glad you did.
Just a theme  park nothing impressive here to see. Not a fan of roller coasters. Not much else there
Rides are fun. Getting around the park is ridiculous. Spent more time walking around in circles than on rides

I'm giving it four stars because we didn't get to ride any roller coasters because we were traveling with little kids who were too small to do them with their parents... and we only had about 6 hrs at the park.

I think the kids area, Land of the Dragons, was incredible for the itty-bitty set!  My three yr old LOVED every minute there.  If your traveling with little ones, make sure you bring their bathing suits with, there's a little water park in there too... we didn't know that so our little ones didn't get to partake... 

Anyway, this is a great park to visit and we do plan on going back!  The most disappointing part was that one of the ride we could actually take both of our kids on, Rhino Rally, was in part broken down... the water wasn't working on it so we didn't get the full effect.  But the kids loved seeing all the animals on the rides!

We will totally go again when the kids are older and can enjoy much more of it!

I really enjoy bringing my family here. They have wildlife and rides all in one.  I'm not a roller coaster enthusiast. But my husband loves all the rides they offer. (I enjoy the craft beers and carny food more.) Bush gardens is opening up their new ride called the Falcons fury which is Americas highest free  standing drop tower. Lifts up to 300 feet and drops at a 90 angle at 60mph. I think I'll pass on this one as well and head to the toddler Sesame Street play area while enjoying a fresh made waffle cone filled with mint chocolate chip ice cream. Even though I'm not a thrill seeker you can see there is still always something for everyone to enjoy here.  FL residents can pay a flex pass and it breaks down to $10 a month per person for a year. Unlimited admission, free parking and 10% off food and beverages.

Eating at sheikras sweet treats. Not a happy place today. I get it- holiday crazy!! But I brought my whole family. 3 car loads. B Happy! We are here for a good time and waiting in a long line for happy!

This place is nothing compared to what it was when it was owned by Anheuser Busch. It has definitely gone downhill. The park seems rundown, the bathrooms are a message and need updating. The customer service is pretty much non-existent here. Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere if you are looking for a theme park.

I have loved Busch Gardens for years, even more when they added SheiKra! Just went today and felt like a kid in amusement park (literally, lol). Plus, they are somewhat cheaper than Disney in regards to tickets and even food. I spent about $11 on a heavy/big sandwich, with chips and a drink. 
It was super packed today though, so after waiting for more than 45 mins in line for 2 rides, we ended up getting the quick queue and it was life changing. (We actually asked if they offered single rider, but they do not) Our wait time went from 45 mins to about 5 mins, real quick, and we were able to actually enjoy the rides and go flying past everyone else. We even had time to fit in a last minute ride, before having to get to our bus (we had like 25 mins left). The quick queues can be a bit pricey, we paid $42 (day of), but we thought it was worth it since we were able to ride all the rides and probably wouldn't have been able to without it. I would definitely recommend buying them in advance if you can cause they are like half price. 
Also, just a side note, beware that the people that attend this theme park are not always the classiest.

Busch gardens!! Personally, I love animals and natural-looking/natural surroundings over fake man-made colorful buildings. This place is so beautiful! The rides here are far better than the rides at Disney. Disney is AWESOME of course. Each park is great in its own way. This park is more geared towards wildlife, animals, and ROLLER COASTERS. There are different themes in this park such as Morocco, Egypt/desert, jungle, African, etc. 

Now, ROLLER COASTERS!! If you are a thrill-seeker like me, here is a list of rides you need to go on: Sheikra (must go at least twice lol), Kumba, Gwazi (awesome wooden coaster), and Montu. Those are my faves in that order. Yes there are more rides to choose from, but those were my faves. Scorpian was alright...I went on that last and after the rides prior, it was nothing.

Another ride I would recommend is more laid back compared to those coasters...Congo River Rapids. Expect to get a little wet or maybe a lot..depends on where you sit and how lucky you are haha.

There was an area in the "Edge of Africa" section of the park where you could go to the large glass window, and tigers would come right up to you as if they wanted to take a picture with you lol. There are several areas in the park where there are animals around you as if you were at a zoo. You can go on safari rides (one for an additional cost). 

There was a show we watched --I think it was at the Marrakesh Theater--not sure...but it was spectacular! So many different costumes and settings, colors were amazing, music was great, dancing and singing performances were beautiful. I think they change their shows every so often, but the show we watched was about old folk tales. We also watched a 4D movie at the Timbuktu Theater. It was cute. 4D=3D movie with glasses and getting lightly sprayed/misted with water.

We ate at the Desert Grill. There were live singing and dancing performances here. It's basically a huge place with a stage for shows and picnic tables for the audience to eat and watch. There is a section for choosing/ordering/buying your food...kind of like a cafeteria.

If you are sick of Disney and want to shake things up a bit, this is a great place to go to! I really enjoyed this place and I've been to all the Disney parks..this place is refreshing! =)

Oh and here's a tip...this place has sister parks: SeaWorld, Aquatica, Discovery Cove, and Adventure Island. Go find discounts if you plan on going to more than one of these parks!! =)

Fun times to be had, just plan more than one day.  We got there shortly after three parked opened at 0930.  Parking was fine in the standard area, no need to upgrade, especially with the team that takes you right to the gate.  I figure if you are heading to busch gardens where you will be walking all day, you most likely don't have any issues that would require the extra $5 to park preferred, and if you do you will likely get handicapped parking in the same area, without paying extra.
As for the park, there are plenty of awesome rides.  Unfortunately my son was an inch too short for the larger coasters, and me daughter was literally 1/4 too short for dinner of them. Needless to say they are strict on the height rules, 1/4" precluded her on numerous rides.  
As it does commonly in Florida, bad weather did roll in, and they did shut down the rides a few times.  This is an inconvenience, however I would suggest staying in the line when everyone else bails.  Typically the storms cone in and are gone within 10-20 minutes.  If you stay you will likely be at the front of the line or pretty close when the ride opens back up.  You can wait out the rain for 20 minutes and get right on, or leave the line with everyone else and come back when the wait will be more like 45 minutes.
We stayed at the park till it closed at 9:00pm.  We ended up only getting to ride like 5-6 rides. Beware the train takes 45+ minutes to do a round trip, so either use it for transport around the park or realize it will take a chunk of your day to get all the way around.
We paid for the dining plan, and let me tell you, worth every penny!  Not only do you get to eat whatever you want for the most part, but you get buy 1 get one free on all snack cart items.  When a churro is $5 and you want 4, $10 is way better than $20. Also the deal extended to souvenir cups and we received an additional discount.  So one trrip to a cart and I got two souvenir cups, two churros and two dippin dots for $18.  Considering the regular price of one souvenir cup works have been $11.99 plus tax you can see how good of a deal it was.  You also get free refills on the souvenir mugs anywhere all, or a 20oz bottle of dasani.  
We ate at the smokehouse restaurant and it was delicious. Best brisket outside of texas I have had.
The rides we ride were fun and other than cheetah hunt, the lines were short!

Definitely would recommend.  Military can use the wave of honor program and get free admission for themselves and there direct dependents.  But a bad way to spend a day with your family.

Busch Gardens is definitely a fun place to go with family! Currently they have Summer Nights, which means they have a firework display from Thursday-Sunday when they close at night and more Summer Nights shows/mini performances during the evening time leading up to the park closing time. Of course, like many other theme parks, the lines for the rides do get pretty ridiculous, but it's still well worth the wait. I'm personally a big fan of the loops so my go-to rides are Montu and Kumba.
Best theme park in Florida.  If you like rollercoasters this is the place.  Always clean and an amazing time.
Great park.....loved riding SheiKra. That coaster is amazing!
Disappointing experience.  Long lines and broken rides.  Very expensive day for only 2 rides and a lot of frustration.  Seems like it is getting worse each year.
Long waits, high priced food/drinks, limited Florida resident discounts, high cost parking and limited air conditioned buildings. Rides break down a lot!

Great Place to take the kids. You like safaris? you like animals? you like African theme parks?, then Busch Gardens is your place. Lots of wholesome entertainment for the whole family. Its a lot cheaper than Disneyworld, that's the truth!

I was excited to go to Busch Gardens because I'd gotten tired of riding kiddie rides at Disney World. It's time for some roller coaster actions!! Yeah!!! I didn't mind having to drive about an hour from my hotel in Orlando into Tampa Bay.  I went on a Monday so the park would be open by 9:00 AM and close by 7:00 PM. My plan of attack was to get there as early as possible so I wouldn't have to stand so long in lines because roller coaster lines are ALWAYS long, mmkay?  

I had purchased my tickets online because it's actually cheaper by $10 per ticket. Also, you get a 2nd day entry ticket for free. However, I didn't opt for the 2nd day ticket. Instead, I decided to pay an additional $10 per ticket to get the "All Day dining" deal.  I checked inside the park and the all day dining coupon would cost you $32.95 + tax per person. So this was pretty awesome. You. Yes, you. Take note. Check online first before buying tickets at the gate.

Anyway... me being me, and my sister being her... we left our hotel kind of late. So we didn't get to the park until around 9:30 AM. No problem, right?? We paid $14.00 to park, and then we took the tram to the gate. We redeemed our tickets and on we went into the park!! FUN TIME!  I (tried to) ran to the first ride, Cheetah hunt. But my sister kind of slowed me down because... well, she's slow... so by the time we got there at around 10:00 Am, the wait time was approximately 70 minutes. No worries... I knew I was going to be waiting in lines. However... after around 20 minutes waiting in line, I heard that dreaded announcement over the loud speaker, "Cheetah Hunt is experiencing technical difficulties and will be temporarily closed. We don't know how long it will take until the problem is resolved. Yada, yada, yada, blah, blah, blah"

Dissapointed, we decided to ride something else... so we went to the closest coaster from there, Scorpion. We waited in lines for 10 minutes... and then we heard  the announcement, "due to incoming weather, Scorpion is temporarily shut down" At this point I was like, "WTF?!?!?! Seriously?!?!?!" while looking up to see perfectly clear skies with the sun shining down on me, giving me a butt-ugly tan line on my arms and on my face in the shape of my sunglasses!!

Anyway, this weather crap goes on for around, hmmm let's see, FOUR HOURS!!!!!!! Yes, I had to wait for four hours before I actually got to ride anything!!! Yes, it finally drizzled a little bit, but there was no storm, no high wind, no nothing.  Okay, just to be fair, there were some lightnings, but I didn't think I was going to get zapped on the ride.

We didn't get to ride our first ride, Scorpion, until around 2:00 PM. And at this point, I knew that if I wanted to ride all the roller coasters, I'd have to get the quick queue pass. Another $35 for each rider.  However, after this point, everything was great. No more waiting in lines. Each ride took us maybe 10 - 20 minutes max. However the park was pretty big, and the sun was scorching. We stayed until closing time. Of course, I wanted to make sure that we took advantage of the dining deal so we had carrot cakes, lots of bottled water, chicken strips, grilled chicken sandwich, etc.  The dining deal also gives you 50% off the food vendors all over the park. But I only wanted free food so no, I didn't get a churro even though I wanted one. A half price churro would still cost you $2!! It's only $1 at Costco, mmkay?

Anyway, except for the rides being shut down and the fact that I had to wait four hours before my first ride. Tampa is pretty fun for roller coaster rides. It's no Cedar Point, but it's goof for now.

P.S. The wet rides WILL get you SOAKED!!!! I'd save these rides for last.
Awesome amusement park! Rollercoasters,water rides, safari! Great selection of things to do. Awesome kids area!! Howl O Scream is fun also!

Ah, Busch Gardens. Bring your excited children, pack your patient pants, and don't forget your wallet. 

I've been to Busch Gardens twice now, October 2015 and October 2016, both times our family (overall had a great time). Because the park is oh-so big, allow me to lay out the yays and nays.

Yays:
-If your kids remotely like Sesame Street, that portion of the park will delight them. Beyond the show itself, there a ton of rides and activities for kids 2+. My 4 year old was jazzed to go on the bigger girl rides this past year. Don't miss the Cookie Monster jump pad...but know that getting your kids out of there can take a Herculean effort, despite the staff being on point!

-BBQ Grill: Possibly the best food option in the park. If I were rating just that restaurant, it was earn 3 stars. Brisket is pretty solid! 

-The train is really fun and it's amazing to see the animals up close! The staff are really sweet too.

-Every restroom I popped into was very clean and well-stocked.  

-It's such a giant space that you can certainly find something for kids and adults of all ages.

-Beer garden. They have beer.

-The bird exhibit (that you can walk through) is immersive and cool.

Nays: 
-The best food you're likely to eat is so-so and, to no shock to anyone, really expensive. 

-While it's really nice to get some family pics taken, you'll pay an arm and a leg for the digital copies alone. 

-Kids meals don't have a ton of healthy options for sides. I'm not advocating for kale chips, but maybe some whole fruit instead of fries? 

-It's hit or miss with the animals, but this isn't really the park's fault. Some we were able to see closely and catch some interesting tidbits and others the enclosures we set up oddly and we couldn't see very much. 

**********

Pro tip: Pay for the VIP parking. You get so much closer to the park!
It's really too bad that EVERY time we buy passes, they are screwed up. The whole point of buying a pass before arriving is to avoid the lines.

Awesome park! You're sure to have a super great time here! Dress comfortably, bring cash, sunshine protection, and get ready to have fun! 
Lines for rides are to be expected. Thousands of people go everyday; what else can you expect? Luckily, we went on a day that was relatively slow, so we were able to get on all the rides without a problem. We only ate once at Zagora Café, and the food was pretty good! Pricey, but then again, in what theme park isn't the food pricey? 
The rides were super cool and were sure to fill you with adrenaline and excitement. I especially loved Montu and the Cheetah Hunt. Rode on them twice! 
Will always come back to Busch Gardens!

Save your money!! Go to a park where they actually care! Being in the customer service industry, I'm very hesitant to leave a bad review. Coming down from Chicago I was excited to come to Busch gardens because I love roller coasters. It was my last day in Florida before I headed back home and decided to spent it here. After one ride it started raining horrible and everything in the parked closed. I went to customer service where I was told that this is basically what happens "when I decide to vacation at Florida where it rains every day!!! " thanks Catelyn! Maybe next time I decide to spend 319$ on an amusement park ticket I'll go to Orlando!!! While there's limits to what certain people can do, I was never told to wait while someone else who maybe could help me better came.

Im not sure what all the hype is about this place for 100.00 or more a ticket I expected a lot more.  Sure they have a few rides (nothing spectacular that will knock your socks of) but the line wait to get on the rides are ridiculous.  They have some animal exibits but youre better off going to a zoo and its cheaper.  The bierfest beer garden was smaller than expected and really didnt have a huge selection.  We had a mixup at the front gate as well.  Richard accidentally linked my card to another account and used it to pay for a bill that was owed.  My friend who has a season pass should have been able to get me a comp ticket but richard didnt seem to understand that so he charged me full price even though I showed him my retired id card.  So I paid for a full ticket and 20.00 that someone else owed to busch gardens.  I visit tampa once or twice a year.  I wont be coming back. You can find better more fun and cheaper ways to entertain yourself while in tampa than coming here.

Well now I know if I want to go to a Busch gardens I will move to Williamsburg as they treat people with respect. My nephew and I are platinum members and this year wanted to go to howl o scream. I read the website before going and it said the first weekend and the dates of the 20/21/22. When we got there after driving an hour and a half on the 22nd we were told that there was no event that night. A security guard even mentioned that a few more people had said it was supposed to be that night. I am extremely dissatisfied as this was a treat for me and my nephew as we are not able to afford to go because we can't pay the high prices and be able to eat or even shop. Thanks Busch gardens for ruining what was supposed to be a fun trip and wasting gas in my. 
Update and response to bg  
I had reached out to you via email as well and you pretty much just said sorry and posted a screen shot of the calendar. I wish I had taken a screenshot myself of the info I had from before. I'm not happy with Busch gardens and I won't be for a long time.

Just wasted $330 to go on 4 rides. Traveled all the way from Colorado for this disappointment. Kids had researched all the great rides online just to wait in 2 hour lines for each ride and was only able to go on four rudes. After how bad the lines were decided to suck it up and spend another $100 for the fast pass, but they were sold out of the fast past. We'll never waste our money on this park again,  should have gone to the beach instead.

I have been coming to Busch Gardens Tampa since the Budweiser factory was still running in it.  Sadly this is not the same park it use to be and not in a good way.  First the employees don't care.  Watched numerous ones walk by trash and not pick it up, their knowledge of the park is not extensive, and ride operators don't care.  Three different rides a family who greatly abused your RAP program held up lines for atleast 2 cycles while family members rode it twice and hopped along to front and back seats.  One employee saw it and attempted to stop them and say they could only ride it once and not abusing the program until another told her it's not her job or her waiting, who cares.  Saw a man on the Congo rapids who was heavy set and struggling to get his belt on. Employee stood by and watched instead of getting the belt extension out which I know they have.  He looked very upset and uncomfortable by the time he got it buckled.  On the same ride the employee in the front let a man in an electric chair rented from the park into the general admission line and always ran over my kid! Training goes a long way. Yours seems to be lacking greatly.

Quick queue has ruined your park and all others.  Unless you spend the additional money for quick queue you'll be lucky to get in 4 rides during the day.  We were able to get on Montu, cheetah, cobras curse and the Congo river rapids.  Wait times were all in excess of an hour. Between that and walking that's all we could fit in.  If anything limit quick queue, I saw more stands selling those then drinks.

Went to the theatre to eat and the food quality is worse every year.  Lunch hour saw minimum cashiers working.  One show during the lunch hour kind stinks cause we missed it bc of the long lines elsewhere.

Oh and $25 for parking. Yeah I'll just leave that alone.

Might be time for leadership to look hard at how they operate.  Heck go be on undercover boss as a regular no extras general admission guest, to ride operator , to food employee.  I'd love to see the reaction to that episode!

While in Tampa after a cruise my parents decided to treat us to a day at Bush Gardens. So glad we did.  Parking is easy , they have a tram but we chose to walk to the main gate. It's a bit of a walk for my parents but manageable . We definitely used it after walking the park all day. 

Park is clean , was not crowded at all and was easy to get around.  When we first got there we did the sky ride, which gives you an overhead view of most of the park and the animal safari.  We were glad we did that first as it got shut down after due to wind. 

Lots of great roller coasters, I only did one of the smaller ones with my son. But if roller coasters are your thing you won't be disappointed. But the main attraction are the animals. The safari was cool, the apes and elephants were cool. The bird experience was awesome. You enter a netted area that the fly all around . You can also feed them. They landed on my dads head and shoulder looking for food . Kids thought that was great. 

Lunch was great , we choose a big hall type cafeteria style with 5 or 6 different types of food. Great choices. 

So glad we made a day trip there

Busch Gardens ist leider sein Geld nicht wert, wir waren gerade dort. Ein Teil der Fahrgeschäfte waren zu und der Park ist schon ganz schön ins Alter gekommen. Sind vorzeitig gegangen, denn auch der Burger für 13,- Dollar macht uns nicht froh.

C'est le paradis des fans de coasters il y en a vraiment pour tous les goûts du plus basique au plus hardcore comme Sheikra.

En plus de ça il y a une partie avec des animaux et d'autres attractions plus relax ce qui permet d'apprécier ce parc même si vous êtes pas amateur de sensations fortes.

A savoir que le parc est assez grand et de manière circulaire donc les déplacements peuvent être assez long.

Il y a des navettes gratuites pour s'y rendre depuis Orlando et pour les billets le plus économique est de prendre une offre qui combine plusieurs parcs.

Annual pass member here... 
Awesome monthly freebies, discounts on food and store purchases. 
My son is IN LOVE with the Sesame Street area... we always stop by to watch the live performance and meet Elmo and friends. 
My daughter is getting to be tall enough for almost all the rides and really enjoys the Scorpion coaster and the live performers. 
Christmas town is an amazing experience... absolutely MAGICAL. We go every year to see Santa. This last year we paid a little extra to avoid the line and it was WORTH IT. We got our Santa experience (like no other) and we still had time to stroll through the park to enjoy millions of Christmas lights, hot cocoa, and all the other amazing things this park has to offer. 
Every time we go we do something different. Always fun!

Great rides and lots of fun... offset by two huge negatives...  #1 Negative.  A lack of watering stations.  This is Florida.  It's hot as hades here and staying hydrated is a must.  The water fountains are so well hidden, we had to ask staff where the closest water fountain was.  Not just once, but three times through the course of the day.  That's a life safety risk.  #2 Negative.  We had a small backpack.  Most rides we went on had a cubby we could place it in while enjoying the ride.  But we were denied entrance to one ride with the backpack. (No cubby's on this one.) We were told we would have to rent a nearby locker (minimum $8 to rent). So FU to the fun-hating accountant at Busch Gardens that caused our family to split up on that ride so one of us could hold the bag.

A zoo with rides! We had SO much fun here and we were able to see animals up close.  Being pregnant and having a toddler we couldn't go on any of the adult rides so my review is geared twords the animals and kid areas.  

Some of my child's favorites were the elephants, the birds, and the covered sand box.  He is only 1 so even in the kids area there are rides he us to small for but he could do the merry go round, the flying elephants, and the sand box.  We watched the Elmo show and he enjoyed it even though he has no idea who Elmo is, he loved the energy, colors and movements the staff did during their proformance. 

I loved the steam train, I think it is so cool that you can get that close to animals in an open environment (no cages). Such a great way to get to the different areas in the park and cut down on some of the walking.  We had a great time!

It's not too far away from my home, so I went to there 2-3 times every year. The food is delicious, but you'll have to fork over a ton of money for it. My favorite thing to get is the corn dogs and french fries in Timbuktu with a drink, which can total seven to ten dollars. They also have a restaurant inside this huge establishment that is pretty good, though still pretty expensive.

Ein sau geiler Tag in dem Freizeitpark.
Besonders hat mich beeindruckt, dass wir als Soldaten kostenlos in den Park durften.
In Deutschland wird man höchstens schief angesehen, wenn man in Uniform in der Freizeit rumläuft, dort wird man umarmt und mit den Worten
Thank you for the service herzlich begrüßt.
Der Park ist viel besser als Disneyland.
Ein Paradis auch für große Kinder

Date Nite was a HIT!! We had an amazing time. So grateful for the nice weather today. It's been raining a lot. 
Here are my thoughts on hitting up Busch Gardens. 
1. Going in the evening is a good idea. It's not as hot. 
2. Make sure you wear comfy shoes. How do people wear flip flops? Lol
3. Tigris is All That. It was amazing. Loved it. Make sure you try it out. 
 4.  Cheetah Hunt... always my Fave. Sit in the front. And hold your hands high. 
5. Funnel cake. The disappointment of the nite. It was HORRIBLE. I was so sad. Will not be getting it ever again from there. 
Overall great evening. So awesome to have an amusement park in our city!!

A very very cool place to visit. If you are a theme park kinda person then this is the place for you, but if your not there are a bunch of other great attractions for you as well. The combination of animals and gardens is just beautiful. Sometimes the attraction where load and noisy so it was nice to just look at the animals for a while.

In my opinion, the best part about Busch Gardens is the pay once and come back all year deal for florida residents. The parking is always very organized and staff seem courteous and helpful. There are much better rides at other amusement parks where I am from such as Cedar Point, King's Island, etc., but Sheikra and Cheetah Hunt will keep thrill seekers coming back for more. I think that the "zoo theme" is the best attraction. Even better than the Lowry Park Zoo down the street, Busch Gardens showcases a multitude of exotic animals in a family friendly setup. My favorite has always been the tigers due to the super close proximity to the animals. 

The only real negative that I can think of is the crowd at times. Definitely avoid Friday-Sunday at all times and try to stick to during the week. Sometimes, you will see busloads of nonnative speakers who are extremely rude and break a lot of the posted rules there. Just make sure to watch your belongings and hold little ones close so they do not get trampled. My family once had a few of these kids steal our food while we were not looking and then deny what they did to their chaperone. I simply reported them to security and had them tossed out of the park. You can avoid these situations just by going earlier in the week during the day. Overall, Busch Gardens is highly recommended and a must do down here in Florida.

We went because the admission was included in the package we got with Discovery Cove.  We were there for only about 3 or 4 hours before we got bored and left.  Certainly not worth the 2 hour drive from Orlando.

One good thing about Busch Gardens is that if you have a mix of rollercoaster enthusiasts and chickens in your group, everyone will have something to do.  The downside is that everyone will only have something to do for a few hours.  There are only a handful of rollercoasters, all of which are pretty tame compared to 6 Flags Great America and are REALLY short.  Then, once you've taken the Serengeti Express to see the animals, you've pretty much done it all.  There's an aviary and a cave and a few other exhibits tucked around the park, but definitely not enough to fill up the entire day.  
This park is HUGE, but most of it is filled up with carnival games and souvenir booths.  So you have to walk forever through the sweltering heat to get to anything of any consequence.  There's a 4-D theater, but it's cheesy and the sound didn't work half the time.
Whatever you do, DO NOT go in May.  This place was SWARMING with school groups... you know, 30 kids supervised by 2 adults, hopped up on sugar and excitement, running around with giant carnival prizes, cutting you off, screaming, jumping around, running into you...  

This place is probably a blast if you have little ones and want to play with them in Busch Garden's giant (and really cool looking) kiddie play areas.  But if you want to ride rollercoasters, just go to 6 Flags... there will be more and better rides, and you won't get bored so quickly.  If you want to see animals, go to a zoo... you'll see more animals and you won't have to walk around such a sprawling park to see them and you'll be far more comfortable. 

Bottom line:  Do it once, if you must (just not in May).  But otherwise, I wouldn't recommend it.  There are better theme parks out there.

It is a great place for animal preservation participation. A lot of stuff you buy goes towards animal preservation along with entrance fee. The food is good. Rides for all ages. All rides are free except the safari ride where you ride out to feed the animals. I won't lie there is a lot of walking. There is long lines sometimes.

I am Livid!!! We payed to get into park and since it the weather wasn't great, they closed down ALL RIDES. I had also purchased the All DAY DINING PASS and it had no refunds. I went to customer service line which was a mile long for them to give me the lame excuse that since restaurants weren't closed there wouldn't be a refund.... WHO THE HECK WANTS TO REMAIN IN A PARK JUST TO EAT?! Makes NO SENSE!!! I FEEL TAKEN ADVANTAGE OF!!!!!!!... it's not fair to take people's money like that!!!! SCREW BUSCH GARDENS NEVER EVER AGAIN!!!!!!!
Very expensive park for the money: $110.00 per day; understaffed and mediocre rides, small children can't stand the long lines wait and the workers are not "all smiles" like in the Disney Parks.

We were there 9/28.  It was overcast, but it was also empty.  Lines were small (except Cheetah Hunt) and we could go on rides over and over.  My personal favorite ride was Kumba.  It's long, fast, and had plenty of strong g-forces.  It was enough to almost make my wife pass out.  Sheikra was also very fun.  Falcon's Fury was amazing.  When it turns you on your stomach, that feeling of not having a seat and all of your weight is on that harness, it's just awesome.  The drop is a little short though.  But since it was empty, I could ride over and over with no wait.  Scorpion was a little rough, so I wasn't a big fan.  Cheetah Hunt was cool too.  The inversion ride (I forget the name) was fun.

My only complaint?  The people working there sure didn't seem like they cared to work there.  Just bored faces.  They weren't rude or anything, just an observation.  The area leading up to Busch Gardens was kinda run down, but whatever.  Also, if you can, pay the extra few bucks and get the closest parking spots.  I recommend this place.

There are a lot of great amusement parks out there, but for so many reasons, this is my #1 all time super greatest most favorite one of all.  Why is it so great?  In no particular order: (1) the rides (2) the atmosphere (3) the animals (4) the food (5) you can go all year long!

(1) The rides:
Montu (one of my top 10 steel coasters - when there's no line, it's like heaven for me)
Sheikra (awesome thrills and theming - even better than its big brother, Griffon at BGE)
Gwazi (lion and tiger and rumble rumble rumble rumble until you've gone silly)
Kumba (one of lots of people's favorites - great layout and so smooth)
Python (RIP)
Cheetah Chase!! (I love wild mouse rides!!!!!!!)
Water rides - Congo River Rapids, Stanley Falls, Tidal Wave (that cold water feels so good during the summer)
Scorpion (a little rough but fun)
Rhino Rally (the drivers are sort of cheesy, but I love this ride through the animal habitat)

(2) The atmosphere: this park (along with its sister park in Williamsburg) is so well-kept.  The trees and plants are gorgeous, the walkways are clean, the bathrooms are as clean as you can expect when thousands of people are using them, the animals and coasters are well cared for, the staff is generally friendly, there are lots of shows, etc. - happy happy happy

(3) The animals: these little (and big) guys are probably why this is my favorite park - combining two of my favorite things (roller coasters and animals) was GENIUS.  The habitats are really nice - you don't feel sorry for any of the animals at this park - and there are lots of learning opportunities for the little (and big) ones in your group.

(4) The food: man I don't know what it is about the Desert Grill, but that turkey sandwich with potato salad drives me crazy!  It's the greatest thing to keep you going during a long day at the park.  The food isn't cheap, but you get A LOT.  Other food in the park is also really solid, but I usually hit that smorgasboard (and avoid the Crown Colony) for lunch.

(5) You can go all year long!: I was born and raised in Florida, so I love some warm winter weather - especially if it means more time to ride coasters!  Almost every time we're visiting family in Florida, we make the short trip to Tampa - it's always worth it!

Great for kids & adults, but not for toddlers.

This isn't the park for you if you've got toddlers (below 56" tall). The only ride for them is the merry go round in the Sesame's Street area. You basically spent almost $100 for a zoo. (Save $67 a head by going to the Tampa Lowry Park Zoo).

Also the service, grounds, amenities don't stack up to Disney standards.

Great park with so much to do from coasters to seeing animals. All the coasters where amazing especially the Cheetah ride. Shop at beginning of park is amazing as sells a lot of homemade arty things, jewellery and other unique stuff. I brought a lovely metal art picture that was made from a man in Haiti some of the proceeds go towards helping people in Haiti as well. All animals seem happy and they have great space to roam in. 
Tips: feed kangeroos in morning whilst hungry and active, feed birds early whilst hungry, visit animals in morning whilst active, don't miss the hippo amazing seeing it in the clean clear water, there are so many squirrels about that are tame so you can feed them by hand, book the Serengeti tour (get to meet touch and meert giraffes)

I love this place because the people there are nice and that's is important considering its a tourist attraction. Though I live in Chicago, I've taken my 2 year old to BG 3 times in 2010 alone! There is a lot of construction going on, but there is still lots to do. I'm not giving it 5 stars because there were one too many downed rides EVERY time we were there. Other than that, it's a nice place to visit...go to the shows and return the next day if you can because it adds to the experience by helping you to feel that the park fee you paid is worth it. BTW, the parking is extra of course but if you attend sister parks the same day, you don't pay for parking there if you show your receipt.

Christmas time @ Busch Gardens is a mad house....
Parking lot full, you have to park in water parks parking lot on next block & take a tram.

I don't know where to begin. The 90 min wait times for a ride, or the rude staff. I will not be going back. This place is a tourist trap, and not worth your time and money. We waited in line for one ride for 45 mins and didn't even halfway through. My son started getting too hot waiting in the long line and we had to get out of line. The park frankly is sort of run down as well. All the paint is faded. Lastly they have an absurd rule if you buy a buy one get one beer they have to open both and hand them both to you so by the time you get to your second beer it's hot and flat. I enjoyed six flags GA so much more.

When I hear Bush Gardens, I immediately think roller coasters.  I had absolutely no idea they had a zoo of sorts. We only came for a few hours on our weekend trip to the Orlando Tampa area. My sister scored some free tickets and I thought this would be the perfect time to see what this place is all about.

Now, I do not like roller coasters not even the kiddie ones, so I do not enjoy riding them. They have many of them, some even go underground and you get to see screaming people pass quite close. Fun to watch, but alas  I did not try any, so I cannot include any of that on my review. I can include however is that the animals  we saw,  look very well-maintained and taken care of. Their habitats are spacious too.  but they don't have as many animals as an actual zoo,  And they are quite far apart so you need to do a lot of walking without seeing anything before you get to see another animal. You can ride the train that goes around the park and you get to see some of the more tame animals in their habitats from station to station. Although they did have the rhino who could have  just charged at the train at any moment. That was a little bit scary because he happen to be very close when the train rode past his section. All in all it is a great place if you enjoy nature and the thrill of roller coasters. I myself wouldn't necessarily be back. I would just go to the zoo to enjoy animals, but it is a pretty neat place.
TIP- buy the City Pass as it includes 4 other museums/attractions in the Tampa area (aquarium, zoo, Chihuly museum...). Well worth the money if you have a few days!!! Busch Gardens was great.

We fell in love with Busch Gardens after coming here for the first time in 2010. There's really something for everyone to see- expansive safaris, animal shows, roller coasters, and pizza. 

Military discounts? Yes

Buschgardens was wonderful! I loved the attractions and the natur. The best rollercoaster was Sheikra. Watching it is amazing, but riding is much better. You can ride a hundert times and you still think: OMG, this cant be! If you love rollercoaster, you HAVE to go there.
Also for children Buschgardens is great. Watching animals from arfica and having a big adventures are just some great things to explore.

I love spending having a day at Busch Gardens! Living in Orlando it isn't that far to travel every few weekends or so...plus the deal I got was great. $15 a month for Sea World and Busch Gardens which included free parking and disocunts off merchandise and food. This I believe was the 1-year passport paid by EZ Pay. 

When I went I bought the all day dining deal for $30 per person and $15 for kids. My fiance and I definitely got our moneys worth from this. We had lunch, a snack, and later on a dinner....just a lunch and drink for two people is already $22 or so. Not to mention in other places like the ice cream shop, Dip N Dots, and other stands you'll receive 50% off the bill! Thats a bargain. 

My new favorite roller coaster here at Busch G is the Cheetah! I have been waiting a whie to go on this and I had such a good time. The wait was about 30-40 minutes but definitely worth it. I believe the fill up 3 coasters at a time so the line movies quite fast. The best part was the first hill you go up when it just shoots you up. 

The other best coaster I have always loved is Gwazi, even though I think over the past couple of years its gotten a lot more intense and rough. It really slings you around and has you all over the place. There wasn't any line for the longest time so we kept going on about 3 times. 

Sheikra is also amazing. The thrill just to stop just as your about to go down you see everything beneath and see yourself drop seconds later. Short coaster but still FUN! Loading time is fast as well because of the 8 people per row. 

Next is the animal exibits which I LOVE!! I believe they added a new part which features kangaroo's. This was one of my favourites because I was able to reach in and touch them..surprisingly they are very soft. The elephants are absolutely beautiful along with the lions and tigers, its amazing to see these animals with only a glass wall separating you.

I'm the kind of person who loves roller coasters and zoos. I can watch hours of Netflix's "Planet Earth" without fatigue and if youtube is on the menu, I'll watch roller coaster videos in 4K all night. Thus, Tampa called my name and I wasn't disappointed. The whole park is eloquently themed with beautiful gardens and flawless design that makes every square inch a convincing part of a wild experience. Usually the time between rides is the worst part of an amusement park but my wife and I found that we couldn't take our eyes off the beautiful orangutans or fearsome tigers that were literally inches from our faces. If that wasn't enough, amazing coasters like Sheikra, Cheetah Hunt, Kumba, and Montu provided such intense and unique experiences that we couldn't ride them just once. I love to walk away from something, not being able to decide what the best part was and that was my experience at Busch Gardens. Word of advice, secure your phone on Montu or it WILL fall out. Time to buy a new phone.

Busch Gardens is home to award-winning coasters, exotic wildlife, and excitement for all ages. This beautifully maintained, African-themed park hosts several events per year and has rehabilitated thousands of animals. If your adrenaline starts flowing at the thought of exhilarating rides, look no further than Cheetah Hunt, SheiKra, Kumba, Falcons Fury, Cobras Curse, and Montu! 

Perhaps you're not an adrenaline junkie but you enjoy site seeing. The Sky Ride launches from the same entrance as Cheetah Hunt, and drifts across the entire park at a few miles per hour. Convenient travel option for avoiding walking through crowds on your way to Stanleyville. Fantastic viewing of the vast safari scape with hundreds of animals roaming.  

Busch Gardens is also a zoo that exhibits hundreds of animal species, many of which you can feed. Tiger Lookout is a little scary. One person at a time climbs up into the tigers den to watch them from an enclosed case. The safari tour visits giraffes you can feed lettuce and take photos with. You'll be lucky to score Will as your tour guide! Walkabout Way features adorably friendly wallabies and kangaroos. The animal care center gives you an inside look at the veterinary services provided. You may even witness treatments in session. 

Families with small children venture to Sesame Street Safari for the water play area, swing ride and Grover's rollercoaster. The park has traditional carnival games and an arcade. Not to mention fireworks, ice shows and dance performances. 

During the holidays Busch Gardens transforms into Howl-O-Scream (for those into Halloween) followed by Christmas Town and New Years Eve. The ambient Christmas lights illuminate the park at night. I recently attended a work party in one the function rooms. What a nice surprise! Open bar, freshly carved turkey with mashed potatoes, stuffing and veggies. Hands down the best meal at Busch Gardens. The park food in general is greasy stadium-grade junk. Ultimately this park lacks quality concessions outside of Food and Wine Festivals. 

Parking can take up to a 30 min. The yearly pass with VIP parking is worth it for frequent visitors. There is a tram available in most sections or walking takes 10-20 minutes. 

Besides Sesame Street there are no commercial attractions. The crowd feels less chaotic than at Disney and Universal. Tickets under $100 are still obtainable. Busch Gardens may lack modern conveniences such as air conditioned stations and fancy wrist bands but its authenticity outshines the competition.

We go to Busch Gardens ALL.THE.TIME. It is our favorite Florida park. Tonight we went to the brand new Christmastown, and BG did not let us down! The lights were fantastic, our favorite rides were open (Cheetah Hunt in the dark is A.M.A.Z.I.N.G.) and our 6, 7, and 8 yo kids got to touch snow for the first time ever!  And there were virtually NO LINES! I'd certainly go back! @BuschGardens

Park is outdated. Located in the middle of nowhere, definitely not magical. Parking is hectic, nowhere near as organized as the other parks we visited in Orlando. Lots of mechanical issues causing delay on rides. If there weren't any mechanical issues there were just simply long long lines. The park wasn't as clean either...and customer service at the gift shops is filled with teenagers who'd probably rather be somewhere else because they're always rude. 
Does the park have thrilling rides? Yes. Did I personally go on them? No- for the fear of having one break down midway or worst. My friends went on the ones they could get through with the long lines and all.

The attractions and animal exhibits are great. The only reason why I wouldn't give the park a 5 is because of the food. With the exception of BBQ, turkey legs, and the Food & Wine Festival items, the rest of the food is bland, often stale and over-priced. The fresh fruit or salad is a decent option, but don't waste your money on sandwiches, burgers, pizza, etc.  
I recommend bringing small food items ( I have seen sandwiches allowed in). 
The park restaurants are better than the smaller stands, but still not worth the price.

Aside from having a great time at the park.. my boyfriend's cell phone fell out of his pocket on KUMBA.. we knew his phone was still working because the location kept refreshing. The supervisor of all people, NICK, is THE MAN! He went above and beyond to make sure that once the ride was officially closed to go searching for the phone.. and guess what... WE GOT THE PHONE! Out of great luck, the phone was in still pretty good condition. Can't speak for everyone that works at the park BUT Nick was really great on handling and approaching the situation the right and safe way. On another note, great drinks and rides.

I had no idea how big and entertaining this place was! One of the perks of having the Sea world annual pass is having Busch Gardens as another great option for a fun filled family day. We decided to spend new year's eve here and bough the all day dining passes which worked out amazingly. there's fun things, entertaining, decorations and food/drinks everywhere. We specially loved riding the train around the park and getting a close look at the animals there. great job BG!

We came here for Howl O Scream. The town that surrounds it is feels like an unsafe old area. Parking is $20. There was 7 houses, 5 scare zones, & 2 shows (1 mind reader), with rides open. Suggest going in Sept, we made it thru all houses/scare zones/1 coaster with no fast pass. 1 house you got a gun to shoot zombies. You can rent a locker for $1 or $10 all day choose your own 4 digit code, takes cash or credit. Universal has better costumes, but we got a $30 deal in August totally worth it.

The first time my two son's visit Busch Gardens on our family vacation we had a wonderful time.
Busch Gardens was the best family theme park that my two kids and I have ever visited.
We took a lot of family and magical photos at Busch Gardens theme park and resort.
While we were on one, of the huge water rides my camera got soak from the water and all our family photos from Busch Gardens were gone.
I was so hurt and in tears, that all our family memories of Busch Gardens was gone.
And then with comfort, my two son's told me we could go back to Busch Garden during their Christmas Town to create new family memories and new family photo's.
My two sons' and I are looking forward to returning back to Busch Gardens during the holidays.

I keep forgetting how many times I've been to Busch Gardens and am surprised it took me this long to review it, but here I am, finally.

Busch Gardens provides the stomach-dropping fun of several roller coasters. Some are better than others -- AKA don't put me on the rickety wooden coasters (those really hurt, actually) but instead put me on Cheetah Hunt! Woo hoo. Montu is also great.

Sheikra has to be the most terrifying ride I've ever been on in my entire life, and I consider myself a bit of a thrillseeker in theme park land. Those few seconds seem to last forever when you're at the very top of the coaster, looking down at Tampa. 

The park also boasts a lot of animals, which is really cool. You can hop on the tram and jet across the park and see all the elephants and other animals just hanging out. 

Prices are good, the entertainment is great. Busch Gardens also has really fun events like Howl-O-Scream and Christmas Town, which lights up the whole park and is one of the coolest events I've been to at a theme park.

OMG what a painful experience. $375 for 3 adults and one child for what ends up being 1/2 a day of finding parking, standing in line for tickets, and buying lunch. No maps are provide so there is little help of getting around.

The rides a marginal at best and the attractions limited. It's like a poor mans Disney, except the price is the same and the value far less.

I truly detest Disney, but in comparison, this park is run by money grubbing gutter slugs. $9 for a burger in a fast food restaurant is not my idea of family friendly.

It is clear why small children are free. The park leaves the wanting. No treasure hunt. No Disney characters for pictures,

6/9 here again... why? Why ??? Why????  80 mins for Cheetah....   upstairs of the outpost reserved.   What a joke... 

1/27 here again.    This time the bar is all out of everything.   It's 11:30 am and the lines for rides are 55 min wait lol...    yeah...   just spent an additional $300 so my family can "enjoy" the day.   Smh...   this park.... why do I keep coming backv


11/11 - Here again.   After last incident BG gave us skip the line passes.   Only good for one line jump per ride (not quick que unlimited).   We used them yesterday and it was an ok day.   Today the kids were in line for Cobras Curse.   Estimated wait showing?  65 mins.   Actually time? 2 hours 5mins!!!   Yes my children spend half a day waiting to ride a ride !!!!    Why?  Lightening?   ZERO.   It was Busch Gardens favorite recording "Due to technical difficulties".   

Yesterday they removed the Platinum parking without notice.   That was a total nightmare trying to navigate two handicapped folks about a mile to get into the park.   I sent a message to guest relations...   (nobody cares.).   We will purchase quick que unlimited for the kids tomorrow ($150.00 extra) because without it the Park is a complete waste of time.   Unless you want to spend all day waiting in line.   





Completely awful!!!!   I can understand weather but holy sh!t...    every single ride "Down for technical difficulties...".  Omg....   we've been here two days and our children have got on 3 rides.    Between weather and "technical difficulties."   We paid $1500 PLUS HOTEL for me, my husband, and 3 children.    This park has gone down hill BIGTIME!   

Also our kids went to get on the SHEIKRA and they were in the seat and the ride shut down.   The tech workers are there working within a few minutes but it too ma few hours.   They tried to go back and they were told NO too small.  I've posted photos.   It's close but NO....   

I am headed to customer service to voice my complaints and I bet they don't do crap!

My girlfriend, her brother and I came to the park and it was really fun. All the attractions are amazing. The best one was Falcon fury. It's crazy. My heart came out flying. I had to get on it twice to believe that feeling and wooow. I also liked Montu and Kumba a lot, these are a must!! 
What I didn't like was that sheikra was closed for maintenance, and the cheetah hunt was not working. But I enjoyed the rest of the rides a lot.

I'm a Gold Pass member and I'm a tad disappointed. First off, as a Florida resident, I'm well aware of "weather" conditions (trust me). However, I was disappointed this last time because after buying a Quick Queue ticket ($80.00) the park decided to shut their rides down due to possible lightening in the area. Now been there done that, usually I'm understanding. This time my friends and I had only managed to go on 1 ride before this happened. We then waited a full 2 hours hoping the rides would reopen (it was sunny, but we get that safety comes first). We decided to leave and attempted to go back later or at another date, which the park was fine with. They gave my friends who paid for their tickets new tickets for another time. However, they refused to refund or replace our Quick Queue tickets, which were the most expensive items. We each paid ($80.00) for them. Again, would have been fine with giving us a "next time" ticket rather than a refund, but they refused. I find this wrong honestly. Considering the money people spend here, they should be more understanding to this issue. Again, I get weather happens and is out of their control, but guests won't come back after spending almost $400 on tickets they couldn't even use while at the park, especially your annual pass holders who are paying monthly for your benefits etc. It's definitely disappointing.

I'm absolutely crazy about Busch Gardens.  As a Florida resident living in the ultimate theme park state, I would have to say Busch Gardens is one of my top favorites of all the theme parks, if not my number one favorite.  I like it, because in my opinion, it's just the right size- it's not too huge that it can't be conquered in one day, but there is just enough to keep you on your toes.  I think it has the perfect mix of everything that anyone would be looking for/ expecting in a theme park!  They have plenty of high intensity roller coasters for those, like me, who love the rush that comes with such rides.  They have plenty of activities, games, arcades, rides and attractions for children of all ages.  They have animal habitats, plus viewing and petting areas so it provides that zoo feel.  They have beautifullly manicured grounds and lush gardens that add to the overall appeal of the park.  There are also a good handful of water rides so it also has that water park feel as well.  There is also no shortage of bathrooms, stores/ shops, concessions and dinning areas, which to me is also just as important as the big attractions.  To me it has all the elements of a good theme park.  P.S. Sheikra is the BEST roller coaster!!!

Visited November 6, off-season, many things were closed, attractions not open, but still charged full price? Please comment Busch Reps! the kids area was a far walk to get to, it could be the first and the closest thing because kids are kids. And where's the beer stands? Few and far in between. BUSCHHHHHHH... I see 100 commercials about that dude in the woods on every TV... Employees were helpful, pretty cool rides. Family of 4 (2 adults, 2 four year olds) $440 admission, $25 parking. Not really worth BUSCHHHHHH gardens. Peace

Have lived here since 1994 and have had passes up until about four years ago. Decided to give it a try again this year, got really good deal on fun card and that is where the fun ends. We have come to Busch Gardens and adventure Island on three different occasions and each time understaffed with lines hundred minutes plus for the main attractions, food lines 45 minutes plus. Bought the all you can eat wristband but literally standing in line for an hour to get a burger. They have summer nights which of course happens during the rainy part of the day so all the rides are closed the entire time we are here and would think they would keep all of the restaurant lines open since people have no place else to go but to eat... But no, again barely staffed and slow as heck. Complete waste of time and money. Very disappointing. They have taken away all the little things about this park that I loved. There is virtually nothing here for kids who are in between the kiddie rides and don't like roller coasters. Absolutely nothing. Wish I could get my money back for the money I spent. In my opinion they have made the ticket for Florida residence so inexpensive that too many people are coming and no one is having fun. Not sure what the solution to that one is but we won't be investing in these again and I would highly recommend you think twice about doing it as well. And we tried the park several different days and several different times including middle of the week, evening and weekends

I am being generous in giving 3 stars. This park does not live up to the admission price. Go to Disney or Universal instead.  Got here every coaster is 90 minute wait. So had to buy the fast que for over $100 each.  The food lines were ridiculously long. Then all they had was junk food that didn't look particularly good.  They need to hire a better food vendor.  Busch Gardens in Williamsburg has this place beat. Much better food selection and ride selection. .
We love Busch Gardens!  Christmas Town is beautiful!!  The roller coasters are great!  It's a great place for kids and adults of all ages!

Busch Gardens is an absolute blast. We spend most of our time in the kids section...it keeps them busy for hours! There are fun tree houses to climb and lots and lots of rides to keep the kids busy. Lots of shade. Theres a huge pillow to jump on and a sand pit. Lots of food to chose from. Picnic benches around the park to sit and eat. Lots of refreshment stands to keep you nice and cool. The train rides are a fun way to take a break and see the fun animals...the splash pad is an awesome bonus!! A great place to cool off. They have some great events planned through the year. You can see flamingos and giraffes...all sorts of fun animals! Love this park so much!

Went to Busch Gardens yesterday on Christmas Day.  Overall we had a great time.  Purchased the all day meal plan.  This is really a money saver.  We were pleasantly surprised in the many food choices we had.  The staff in the animal exhibits were pleasant and informative.  We always love learning new things about the animals.  The only downfall to the day was when we were trying to leave at 6:00 pm. The chaos of the free for all of guests trying to board the tram to get back to the parking lot was complete madness!  I saw elderly people get pushed aside while younger people and families forced their way in front of them. All this taking place in front of Busch Gardens staff.  Disgraceful!  Busch Gardens:  you must do a better job with this!

I was born in Florida, and spent a lot of time at this park. It was a great loss to leave it behind for the snow ridden lands of northern Michigan, let me tell you.

But upon my return some fifteen years later I realize it has not lost any of its magic. The shows that they run around the clock are wonderful from the bird shows to the Celtic dancers. I wouldn't have had it any other way.

There is a train that chugs you around the grounds, gondola that shows you the animals from the a bird's eye view, and roller coasters that will blow your mind. I spent a lot of time waiting in the lines, but trust me, they were worth it. 

Make sure you go with some friends, especially ones that will wait in lines with you (my brother bailed quite early), so you don't get bored, but other than that, it's a fun filled time.

(P.S. They're day to day prices are great, but their season passes are even better!)

I went to this place for Howl-o-Scream with my best friend and it was packed! We were directed to park our car in the adventure island parking lot. We then took a trolly to the main entrance and it was a quick ride. Getting into the park was pretty fast as everything was organized and every employee did their job that night. My only complaint is it was difficult finding the haunted houses because the map wasn't much help to be honest. I think there should be a better way to identify where the haunted houses are at. There were two houses that I walked by towards the front of the park which I ended up going once we made our way around the park.

Just concluded going to the Busch Gardens Music Series for the season. Again, it was excellent. It now includes Acts instead of just music and that is good. But, it had the same act twice, although it was excellent, a different act or another Country music, would have been better.

Being in the military the tickets are free once a year so I appreciated that. We came June 1st for the first time and my family enjoyed it. The longest wait time was about 40 minutes for any ride on average 30 minutes. It was not busy at all the day we came. My favorite ride was Montu and Cheetah Hunt. The food was expensive $60 for 3 people not super great but it's an amusement park. We were able to fill up our drink cups free water pretty much anywhere in the park. 2 rides were closed not bad. Backpacks were an issue with a couple of the rides I recommend getting a Fanny pack and rent a locker. Our free hotel shuttle dropped us off and picked us up right at the front gate so no hassle parking. (Quality Inn)

Came all the way from Denver and they shut the park down 30 minutes after we entered.  Long enough for us to spend $70 on three bbq sandwiches with hoards of flies.   Waited and rides didn't reopen.  Leaving now and truly disappointed.  Park is old, dirty, and is sadly unable to give you an immersive experience like Disney can.   Not worth coming in from Orlando for.
Always fun...good food wrist ban isvyhe best eat every hour on the hour. Great customer service

We love Busch Gardens! Love the sesame street for my littles and my big kids (and husband) love the coasters! Tons of cute items in the gift shop! Love the white water rafting ride! And all the precious animals big and small are great to learn about!

This was our first time to the park. We went on a Thursday in January and there was almost no line for any of the rides,including the big roller coasters. 
We ended up finding discount tickets on line before we went so we ended up saving 80 bucks total which was nice. 
We definitely made up for it in the park. The food is very pricey and not that great but you kind of have to expect that at an amusement park. 
My only wish would be that there were more rides that all sizes could ride. My oldest was .5 inch too tall for the bouncing section in sesame street and other smaller rides so there was very few rides that my two boys could go on together. We were all able to ride the Grover roller coaster which was our first roller coaster. 
The park has many many animals exhibits which is awesome. I thought the train would bring us closer but we ended getting closer to the animal just by walking the park.
Great Place!! We had a lot of fun !!! I will definitely visit Busch Gardens again very soon!!

Just got back from Christmas Town!  First off the stench of toilets overwhelmed you everywhere you went!  Pay for premium parking only to be told lot was full-no $5 refund offered.  Staff walking around like zombies more concerned with when their next smoke break was.  Speaking of smoking, was it really necessary to have a designated smoking area right where the stroller/ wheelchair ramp exits  Zagora's Cafe?  Wouldn't surprise me if this park is closed in the next 5 years!  It's more worth it to make the longer drive to Disney!!

One of my favorite amusement parks. This was my first time back in 5 years, and I absolutely missed it! I am obsessed with Sheikra. I honestly don't know how I stayed away so long! Kumba is also 10 times more awesome than I remembered. Montu is also a favorite of mine. This time around I got to try Cheetah Hunt which I thought was really fun, but not very thrilling. I didn't get to try Falcon's Fury as everyone in my family chickened out and I didn't want to wait in line for over an hour by myself. I am highly considering getting a season pass so I can come enjoy these rides again and again.

Tip for future visitors: do not go anytime around Christmas. All rides have lines over an hour. Cheetah Hunt's line was over 2 hours long!!

This is one of those places that's a diamond in the rough, so to speak.

Being in Tampa it's not exactly close to Disney.  Maybe that's one of the good things about it.  This wasn't crowded on our weekday visit, which makes it even better.

This time we made our first stop at the safari.  We've always had a great time riding in the back of the truck and feeding the giraffes.  This was no exception.  It has changed slightly from years past though.  No longer do you feed the Ostrich or Bongo's.  While sad, the overall experience is still worth it.  Seeing some of these animals up close is, to me, the single best experience in the park.

The next best would be feeding the Lorey's.  These are hungry little colorful birds that, with a cup of nectar in your hand, flock all around you to get something to drink.  And if they leave a little present, that's a bonus.

There are coaster rides here, but that's not why we come.  For us it's really the animals and nature experience.  What I found missing are the Clydesdales.  We used to stop by their barn to see these gorgeous, mighty beasts.  Not this time.  I'm not sure if they cut that out or if we just couldn't find our way there.  

This will always be on my list of places to visit every time I'm in Florida.

Ok so I decided to trek my family 5 hours up to this place the weekend after July 4th. We arrived at the park to long long long lines and finally got in around 11. We got to get on two rides as the lines were insane and then all of a sudden all the rides stop as there was a huge cloud in the distance. We waited about an hour but nothing would reopen. Then it started raining. I had my 4 year old with me so we quickly rushed out. I was told that we needed to visit the ticket counter because I had just paid $164 for a one day pass for one of the children and they said I had to go to another line which was like a line at the trump poles back in 2016 and I was not having it. As my little one was wet already and irritated. So we got back to the hotel, I called Busch gardens and they told me they can't reissue the ticket over the phone that I should have waited in that line to get one. I was so upset. Spent over $1000 for a weekend and couldn't even go on any rides. This is not how customers should be treated. As my first visit there, it was very unpleasant. Now I wish I didn't buy two annual passes.

I understand why they closed. I get they don't control the weather but not being able to help me get tickets for another time was messed up and unprofessional and without sympathy. So they wanted me to drive the 400 miles back to the park to get a rain check? Insane.

Very nice park & well designed but today they dropped the ball.  The power went out around 3pm, I get it things happen so we waited around 2 hours & decided to leave. At the exit their was an Team member with a "may I help" flag.  He said don't go everything will be up in running very soon, he even gave us 4 fast passes.  Okay, sure we'll wait a bit, we'll another 2 hours go by & still no rides running.  Quite an expensive day to be cut so short.

Busch Gardens is a fun place to visit.  It's got thrill rides, animal encounters, entertainment, and decent food.  All the things you look for in a good amusement park.

Today we noticed that the rides were moving a bit slower than normal.  This was because the employees were wiping down the roller coaster trains (at least 1 row per ride) in an attempt to keep them well sanitized.  I thought this was a great thing to do given what's been going on.

We always take our refillable drink and popcorn tub with us.  We get free ice water throughout the day, and polyps only $1 when we refill it.

The all-day dining plan is well worth it.  A couple of meals, water every hour, and a snack here or there has you coming out ahead each and every time.

Today we did the Serengeti Safari tour.  It was so much fun, and our 12:30 tour guide was awesome.  If you ever get a chance to do it, jump!

Busch Gardens is fun.  We will continue to go back time and time again.

I grew up going to Busch Gardens... 

We almost always had season passes, and I began to take it for granted. I went a couple times during college and fell in love with it allll over again. 

BG is pretty much like an above-average zoo that also has roller coasters. It definitely feels quite a bit less "fake" than the parks in Orlando. 

I DO have to get on a soap box for a minute: 
There used to be an actual Anheuser Busch brewery in the middle of the park! I have fond memories of smelling the sweet malt exiting the smokestacks and taking the tour and watching the tremendous canning/bottling lines. 

Then they closed it to save money. 

You could still get 2 free samples of beer at the park though, which was quite nice. 

Now, as of a few weeks before this writing...that too, has ceased. 

Anheuser Busch's new owners (InBev, a Belgian brewing conglomerate) saw to it that the free beer samples were nixed. The "beer school" is over now too :( I hear they are now looking to sell Busch Gardens. 

What a sad story of what used to be the biggest American brewery. They used to have notices posted throughout the park reminding you that they were the only 100% American-owned large brewery in the US.

It's a safari/ amusement park / garden it's really fun place to take the family when your in Tampa Florida. There is something for everybody here. I almost feel this is better than Six Flags. Plenty of wild roller coasters and wet water rides and their plenty of kiddie rides for the little ones.  

There is a Sesame Street section for the little ones and throughout the park a safari zoo to check out the animals and different sit down shows throughout the theme park. It's easy to walk around they have plenty of restrooms and good deals on beverage where you can get free refills all set amazing! We got a lot of Icee's. 

The adults can enjoy the Wine and Food festivals on weekends through out entire month of April. Really cool place to come and the services are great!

Signage was kind of an issue but everything else was GREAT! Loved all the animals and getting food there was convenient.
Just wished the fancier restaurant had been open when we went.

While the hubs and I were in Orlando, we decided to take a trip down to Tampa to check out Busch Gardens.
