We're huge fans of the Williamsburg location, and knowing that the one in Tampa has tons of animals, I was even super excited!  We were actually a little disappointed, as there weren't that many coasters T____T  We got to ride the Cheetah Hunt, the SheiKra, the Kumba, the Montu, and the Scorpion.  Honestly, the coasters were a little lackluster, as compared to the VA's counterpart, there was less of an adrenaline rush; maybe it's because it wasn't as fast enough?  Either way, I did enjoy seeing some of the animals, however to be up-close-and-personal, you would have to pay additional for the jeep/guided tours.  There were some shows that you could catch (such as 'Opening Night Critters,' 'A is for Africa,' etc.), and exclusive park experiences (at an additional fee; 'Serengeti Safari,' 'Penguin Insider,' etc.).  On a side note, beware of the aggressive seagulls!  The hubs ordered his usual funnel cake, and the seagulls were just at him (kind of scary!) - even the employees on staff were a little freaked out T____T  The park itself is also not well-kept (especially the bathrooms), so try to avoid the restrooms as much as you can!

+beware of the aggressive seagulls! :O
+not-so-clean restrooms T___T
+minimal coasters
+animal viewings at an additional charge

We 4 friends spent the day at Busch Gardens. We were there for 7 hours and still didn't see all there is to see in this 335 acre fun place. 
There's a tram that takes people from the parking lot to the park and returns you to the parking lot when you're done. 
After going thru security...you are free to roam, ride the train, shop, eat in the many restaurants, take or watch the rides, enjoy the variety of entertainment and...see the many animals in their spacious habitats. 
The park is clean, well laid out and has staff to answer questions or give information. What a wonderful place. 
I took many pictures of animals, snakes and birds...awesome.

A lot of technical difficulties during my visit. I waited an hour and a half for the Tigris, but I was told it needed to be closed due to technical difficulty. Cheetah Hunt and Montu were also closed in the morning. That was disappointing.

My family and I had a great time here yesterday even though there is great need for improvements. We have a good time in everything we do. 
The park is not nearly as clean or well maintained as other theme parks sadly. Many areas smelled like spoiled trash. The ride workers do not communicate well and most are not very friendly. We found many times they'd stand around socializing with one another and we had to ask things to clarify that they should be informing you of. The restaurants or food vendors also rushed you, acted like they could care less and we're not thorough in simple acts of service. 
Parking was easy although over priced like everything else on the property. Preferred parking is not necessary as they offer a shuttle. Food is VERY sub-par!! 
We bought the souvenir cups the day before at their Seaworld property (2 for $25) then refilled all day, $1.06 each time and that was great! There were lots of locations to refill there but not as many at Busch Gardens. But still recommend it. 
Bring a backpack with cup inserts makes it easier. 
We had so much fun on the rides! Our favorite part of the park. 
The 'quick queue' is worth every penny to go straight to the front of the line on rides. 
We rode three times the amount we would have without it! The 'Cheetah' ride was our favorite and best was riding it at night while the fireworks were going off! 
The animals are adorable but if it rains (not sure if it's the lightening or possibility of) but they'll shut all the rides down and put animals away so plan accordingly. 
I hope they spend time and money to rehab this property soon. There's great elements about it but could be so much better!! 
Training for their employees on excellence that other parks obviously expect would be a fantastic place to start!

1/27 here again.    This time the bar is all out of everything.   It's 11:30 am and the lines for rides are 55 min wait lol...    yeah...   just spent an additional $300 so my family can "enjoy" the day.   Smh...   this park.... why do I keep coming back!!???


11/11 - Here again.   After last incident BG gave us skip the line passes.   Only good for one line jump per ride (not quick que unlimited).   We used them yesterday and it was an ok day.   Today the kids were in line for Cobras Curse.   Estimated wait showing?  65 mins.   Actually time? 2 hours 5mins!!!   Yes my children spend half a day waiting to ride a ride !!!!    Why?  Lightening?   ZERO.   It was Busch Gardens favorite recording "Due to technical difficulties".   

Yesterday they removed the Platinum parking without notice.   That was a total nightmare trying to navigate two handicapped folks about a mile to get into the park.   I sent a message to guest relations...   (nobody cares.).   We will purchase quick que unlimited for the kids tomorrow ($150.00 extra) because without it the Park is a complete waste of time.   Unless you want to spend all day waiting in line.   





Completely awful!!!!   I can understand weather but holy sh!t...    every single ride "Down for technical difficulties...".  Omg....   we've been here two days and our children have got on 3 rides.    Between weather and "technical difficulties."   We paid $1500 PLUS HOTEL for me, my husband, and 3 children.    This park has gone down hill BIGTIME!   

Also our kids went to get on the SHEIKRA and they were in the seat and the ride shut down.   The tech workers are there working within a few minutes but it too ma few hours.   They tried to go back and they were told NO too small.  I've posted photos.   It's close but NO....   

I am headed to customer service to voice my complaints and I bet they don't do crap!

Had a great time here yesterday. We got there early (10am) and there were practically no lines at all. the longest wait was probably 10 minutes.We rode the Montu, Cobras Curse, Cheetah Hunt, Kumba, Stanley Falls Flume, and the Skyride. We had lunch at Bengal Bistro ( a little $$$ but decent enough), and we had two free beers each at Garden Gate Cafe !!! There is something for everyone at Busch Gardens in Tampa. They keep the park very clean and obviously take pride in presenting such a lovely day for everyone. The resaon for that missing 5th star is the Kangaroos. Very depressing to me- they are all just laying around looking hot and miserable...maybe they rest during the day and play at nightime - just skip the ineteractive Kangaroo exhibit. Enjoy yourself and treat yourself to a fun day at Busch Gardens...dont forget your sunscreen.

Don't buy an annual pass from this company and sign up for their easy pay.  They continue to charge your credit card even if you buy another pass. Of course this is in fine print, however, it doesn't take much common sense to realize this should be very clear in the terms and is a scam they've already settled in law suit previously.  Decent park but I'm not dealing with that kind of company.
had a great time but there are lots of groups of minors just walking around .no adults to supervise. looks like parents drop there kids off . like they did at the mall years ago.

Just wanted to add this review about this Slushie. It's called the Fireworks Slushie. Simply the best Slushie I've tasted. Went well on my visit to Busch since it was a typical hot day in Florida. Although there are other flavors as well, this one in particular caught my eye and didn't disappoint. You can buy these around the Gwazi Plaza and its surroundings. Just keep you eyes on the look out and you will find them.

Busch gardens is always a good time! The animals are so cute and I enjoy observing them. Last time I spent a day at Busch gardens, there was surprisingly not a huge crowd which was pleasant. It could potentially be a bit cleaner/add newness

We went on a Saturday and in July so I'm trying not to be too negative on my poor planning but we rode no coasters due to the 1-2 hour waits. We chose to do the train skylift shows and see the animals. We still enjoyed the day no worries. The park is huge and do not attempt to skip the shuttle it is a long walk to the park. We did the dinning because it was a special only $15 a person. Good choice the food is pricey and we ate at the smokehouse which I recommend highly. The animals were amazing so upclose even on the train ride. I will be back in cooler less crowded weather to ride the coasters this place is worth the drive

The entertainment here is amazing! I wish they had more shows like they used to. They used to have this awesome stilt show in jungala!
But the spritzer squad is great during the summer, and Tigris was so fun!!!

I haven't been to Busch Gardens in years. I ended up buying the season pass since it's just shy of an hour to get there. What a great time. Let me say it was a great decision we both made. We had such a great time. We honestly only waited on two rides for 30 minutes. Other then Cobra and some other ride that I can't remember, we never waited more then 10 minutes to get on any ride. We had lunch and to our surprise there was a show that started the minute we bought our lunch. The performers sand songs from the 50's and they were absolutely great. Honestly we could have not experienced a better day, It was a beautiful day. Recommend!

I haven't been in years, so I wasn't sure if I should rate overall or on my recent experience. Now I know sometimes things get closed for maintenance or weather or whatever, but this time like 4 rides were closed, including my favorite Montu. There were 3 rides I had never seen before but I think only one was under construction and the other two just weren't open so I missed a chance to ride them. And the ice skating show arena was closed and that was always my favorite place to watch shows. Partially because of air conditioning.

The animals are nice to look at but there's a lot more kid play areas than I remember. I imagine it's cheaper than grown up rides. Basically if you don't want to do water rides in January, I had Kumba, Scorpion (which is tiny) and Shiekra (which is scary tall). There wasn't a whole lot of thrill rides that were open. But I had a niece and nephew fully entertained. I know no park gives discounts if they have stuff closed, but it is pretty disappointing. This place with everything open and the desire to go on water rides is better in the summer.

Oh and before they were purchased by someone, they used to give out free small beers. And of course now that I'm over 21 I never got a chance for that. Damn!

My chief complaint is how all the rides are operated. There is not a line for single riders and therefore the space for each ride is not completely utilized. There are not attendants at every ride to place people into rows or if there is they do not properly do the math to make sure the ride is full every time it goes out. I think it's ridiculous that you have to pay practically an additional ticket in order to not have to stay in the lines. The locker system needs to be changed, if every person is required to use a locker then there needs to be more and the first hour should be free. The machinery for the lockers needs to be updated as well. The bathrooms are not kept neat or clean. The food is priced way to high. The facility overall needs an updated.

Great place there's so many rides my favorite is cobras curse and cheetah hunt and they also came out with a new ride Tigris and it's really cool and there is so many other ride there they also have souvenir cups you can buy and it's a good place there's also a kids area where you can take your kid to play and they have average food
Don't go when it's thundering or a slight chance of thunder (which is all summer in FL). They close ALL the rides and attractions indefinitely. The shorter the line, the slower they move.

Fun amusement park, especially if you're into thrill rides as this park has very little in the way of rides for kids under 48" or those adults who have back, neck issues, fear of heights or roller coasters.

With that being said, we took our 14 year old and two of her friends and they loved it!

Positives: 
-excellent variety of roller coasters - all fast with lots of twists, turns, loops etc.
- they have 3 major water rides
- great opportunity to see a large variety of animals
- they have beer and in a few places, full bar
- they offer all day dining plan which allows for unlimited meals and soft drinks/bottled water/snacks at about 5 restaurants and buy one get one food and drinks at other spots (we learned this applies to shots of alcohol as well so if you order a drink it upgrades to a double for free)
- Zambia smokehouse food is great for an amusement park - and best bang for your buck on the meal plan (ribs not included)
- you can buy a fast queue pass either for a 1 time use at their most popular rides or an unlimited use.

Negatives:
- the rides are really far apart from each other which makes for LOTS of walking with little reward in between
- the restaurants that take the meal plan all close at 7 or 7:30 except for one. So if you're not on line by say, 8:15 at the Zagora cafe, you'll be lucky to get your food by 9:00 when the park closes. And the lines at the places that close are just CRAZY starting at about 6pm.
- SLOW SLOW SLOW service in many restaurant spots - especially Zagora Cafe. The workers here have zero enthusiasm - it's like they're walking through mud when they move. It's chicken fingers and hamburgers for goodness sake - why should it take so long?
- because there aren't that many rides, the lines are incredibly long - many times even on the fast queue line so paying $60 per PERSON for the unlimited  fast queue was not exactly worth it since there was really only enough time to go on all of those rides once with maybe 2 roller coasters a couple of times.
- the food, with the exception of the smokehouse, is not great.
- very little shades spots to sit. The sun blared all day long - it was hot and really not much relief - not even in the gift shops - they all felt like they were unairconditioned (except for the one in the area with the birds). 

All in all a fun day but I still prefer Universal and Disney parks over this one as there is much more variety and much better customer service.
Expensive and crowded. You have to get a quick queue pass unless you want to wait 1-2 hours for a ride. But even with the pass the lines are long.

First- we love Busch Gardens... it's always very clean and when it's not busy you can usually get through all the lines with minimal waiting.  This time we went with our 2.5 year old and focused mostly on the animals.  He LOVED it!  It is definitely a long day for little ones.  We got there right when they opened and he made it until about 2:00.  We were able to see all the animals in that timeframe but that's about it.  Great activity for kids and adults!
Super rip off once again build you up and let you down buy fast pass to stand in line to pick up your fast pass more to come.

Overall had a great time here. We rode all the rides! Most of the rides are new and up to date with a couple of old wooden ones. The cheetah is by far the best! Super fast and fun ride. The kumba and Montu. The map layout is easy to follow and walk through. The park is always well groomed. Also the animal  safarin is a nice added to break up between all the rides. 

Bottom line...great place for rides and to see safari animals!! We found it to be a good day trip to get some fun in especially when the weather is nice in Tampa

Got some nice animal shots at Busch Gardens yesterday.  Overall the experience there was horrible and my phone was stolen.  One of the big advertisements of Busch Gardens is the Safari experience, little did I know if was an additional $40 per person to do it, it's not part of the entrance fee.  Not that it mattered much because they wouldn't let the kids go so we couldn't go.  As we contemplated want to do next they have a little covered seating area right next to it so we went there to sit down.  Because we didn't pay for the Safari they kicked us out, they wanted to charge us more money to get the kids out of the heat.

Last year we went to Animal Kingdom and that Safari ride wasn't an additional cost and the overall experience was much nicer.  We still have a trip to Sea World which is part of the family of parks that includes Busch Gardens, Sea World and Aquatica.  I have a feeling everything is going to cost extra.

I'm sure teenagers will love the coasters (which I was kicked off because I had a camera) but next time we come down we will stick to the Disney Parks.

Busch Gardens really is an amazing place. But there are some areas where it just falls short of it being able to be compared to other parks in the Florida area. The first problem with Busch Gardens Tampa is the food options. Most theme parks have overpriced food but that's to be expected. The problem here is there lack of variety. When I go to Universal I can get way better food inside the park. At Busch Gardens inside one of the main dining places there are only 3 or 4 food options. The food was just hot only because it was under a heat lamp. They lined up food and drinks. This made the food not fresh at all. For how expensive it was I could easily go over to Burger King and get better food. I am not even talking about price. The portion sizes are pretty small. When you go to Disney or Universal you can go into restaurant and order many different types of food inside the park, while at Busch Gardens you feel like you are in a queue for another ride. The rides at Busch Gardens are amazing and I am excited to see there new hybrid coaster. Overall I give this park 3 stars simply because of the food options and just simple dinning. If you can get over that this park is easily 4/5 stars.

We love BG!! The season passes are such a great value if you live locally. It is always fun to enjoy viewing the animals, watching the shows, and of course riding the rides! The lines are never too long, especially during weekdays. The refillable cups are also a great value to beat the heat.

Of course the one day I go it decides to pour so we were given new tickets because of the weather which is super cool considering the circumstances. It was my first time and I only got to go on 2 roller coasters but both were very entertaining. Definitely have to use those tickets before they expire!

Two stars for not being Disney... but the experience was numbing... Today the power was out often at Busch Gardens. 2-4 people in the party would head to a rollercoaster only to have it close for technical issues after 30-60 minutes on queue... all day! We think that the electricity was being split between the rides and the ineffective concessions... lines for funnel cakes were one hour long and they were literally only capable of making 2 or 3 funnel cakes per hour. Someone in line quipped that they wish that they had that job because you just stand around looking confused for $12/hr.

Likely the electricity was going to the trees... because nothing was running... funniest notice today: Santa's House experiencing delays... maybe Santa had the runs.

I even started up a butt kicking attraction and almost had a line. People were desperate for some working attraction.

Don't forget to check out the Whiskey Wonderland... might make the $90 ticket per person bearable.

The park has the potential to be something great, but the customer service, lack of supervisors and all of the "traps" to get more money out of you made my trip miserable. 
They make you pay $8 to put your backpack in a locker, you must do this or you will not be able to get on rides unless you have someone who will stay off of the ride while you go on. 
My experience was that it took a very long time to find my way back to my locker to get my stuff when I wanted to go home. Then, the locker wouldn't open despite it not being expired yet. None of the staff knew what to do. They called someone who said they'd be there in 15 minutes. I was extremely dehydrated and staff said they "couldn't help me out with that."
I ended up having to pay an additional $2 for no reason just to get my stuff out of my locker. 
I'm not going back to this place. It is a corporate cash-grabbing park that does everything it can to get more and more money out of you, it does not care about its customers.

They changed my pass without telling me and then gave a bunch of block outs. Who blocks out 2 full months in the summer to use a free pass. You spend so much money on a season pass for your family (we r 6) and then they r so cheap back!!

The park is clean and pretty, but not worth the time.  We went 2 years ago and the rides were constantly closed due to weather.  I get that.  But today we went again and it was sunny and hot and still the rides were closed. The park "opened" from 10-9, but we were only allowed 1/2 way through the park until 10:15 or 10:30, and had to wait for a guard to let us pass.  When we got in, most of the rides were still closed.  The flume was "waiting for water."  Congo River Rapids was "closed for annual maintenance."  (The wettest ride.  In July.  In Florida.). The Sky Ride opened at noon and until dusk, and when we finally got on it, there were "technical difficulties" which left us sitting in a cart for about 10-15 minutes.  One of the train stations was closed all day.  Other than Sheikra, most of the roller coasters were closed most of the day. (I think all were running by 5 or so.)  The rocking ship ride (I can't remember the name) was closed all day.  No cheetahs, hippo, or a few other animals were on display at all.  (The orangutan, gorilla, and tiger displays were great though.). Unlike in the past, you can't take a safari ride for free anymore.  Now it's an additional $30 charge per person for a "Safari encounter."  One of the theaters had no show playing at this time.  Several attractions and a few rides closed around 7, though the park was open until 10.

The meal plan was good and we got our money's worth being that there wasn't much else to do but eat. Again, MUCH later, the roller coasters seemed to be up and running, but even then they were very slow...one "cart" would go up and there would be quite a wait until another went.  (The only exception seemed to be Sheikra.)  Falcon's Fury ran consistently all day, but that has an extremely slow-moving line for an extremely quick ride.

Overall, it was nice to see, but we won't be going back.  I'd rather ride the additional hour to Orlando and go to Universal or Disney.

Busch Gardens is pretty good for what you are paying. It's not at Disney's standards but has its own set of fun too. The kids land has a REALLY cool play area - big safe space where kids can just jump and climb and be kids. 

I am a bit of a scaredy cat about the big roller coasters but if you're into that you definitely want to check it out! They have a great deal usually at the beginning of the year where you can get a fun pass, where you pay for a day and get to come back all year. Definitely worth it!

This theme park is always a fun experience if you love animals and roller coasters. I've gone a handful of times. The cost of a Florida Resident ticket is not bad, and this last time we had a friend who works at Busch Gardens come with us so we were able to get 40% of the Serengeti Safari tour, where we got to feed giraffes romaine lettuce! Definitely had a blast with that. Overall, I love coming here. I would say, however, if you don't like roller coasters, there's not much else to do except look at the animals. There are a few lectures on how animals are taken care of and stuff going on at certain times, but there aren't really any 'shows' like at other theme parks (at least from what I've noticed). Also, when it starts to rain, it's definitely hard to get on any rides because almost all of them have to be shut down until the weather gets better. So, if you're going, try and pick a bright and sunny day!

We went to see the Holiday lights Saturday before last. We went super late arriving at 8 pm the park closes at 10 pm.. We took an Uber to avoid parking dilemmas. We truly enjoyed ourselves. If your going for the lights asked to ge directed yo the tunnel of lights. We also enjoyed the violinist who played classical Christmas songs.

2/19/19 10:30am Preferred and handicapped parking SOLD OUT once again.   Wtf is the point in preferred parking?  What is the point in Platinum Passes???  Why pay all the extra money!?!!  Busch Gardens has changed in such a bad way in so many ways.   They changed their menus.   The lines are beyond long for EVERY single thing.   And when you call to complain....     ... it's pathetic.   They tell me I can go wait in line at the customer service center but that's an hour long wait too.   Really?  I need to wait an hour to complain?   Not a good way to make an unhappy customer happy.   

Oh and yesterday the rides kept going down and down and down multiple times.   



6/9 here again... why? Why ??? Why????  80 mins for Cheetah....   upstairs of the outpost reserved.   What a joke.

1/27 here again.    This time the bar is all out of everything.   It's 11:30 am and the lines for rides are 55 min wait lol...    yeah...   just spent an additional $300 so my family can "enjoy" the day.   Smh...   this park.... why do I keep coming back!!!


11/11 - Here again.   After last incident BG gave us skip the line passes.   Only good for one line jump per ride (not quick que unlimited).   We used them yesterday and it was an ok day.   Today the kids were in line for Cobras Curse.   Estimated wait showing?  65 mins.   Actually time? 2 hours 5mins!!!   Yes my children spend half a day waiting to ride a ride !!!!    Why?  Lightening?   ZERO.   It was Busch Gardens favorite recording "Due to technical difficulties".   

Yesterday they removed the Platinum parking without notice.   That was a total nightmare trying to navigate two handicapped folks about a mile to get into the park.   I sent a message to guest relations...   (nobody cares.).   We will purchase quick que unlimited for the kids tomorrow ($150.00 extra) because without it the Park is a complete waste of time.   Unless you want to spend all day waiting in line.   





Completely awful!!!!   I can understand weather but holy sh!t...    every single ride "Down for technical difficulties...".  Omg....   we've been here two days and our children have got on 3 rides.    Between weather and "technical difficulties."   We paid $1500 PLUS HOTEL for me, my husband, and 3 children.    This park has gone down hill BIGTIME!   

Also our kids went to get on the SHEIKRA and they were in the seat and the ride shut down.   The tech workers are there working within a few minutes but it too ma few hours.   They tried to go back and they were told NO too small.  I've posted photos.   It's close but NO....   

I am headed to customer service to voice my complaints and I bet they don't do crap! 

2/17/19 here again.   Got here at 10:00am and preferred parking and handicapped was FILLED.   So that leaves me 7 months pregnant and my handicapped daughter to walk and walk and walk.   I tell the guy directing traffic but he just screamed at us.   I call customer service and they recommend I can pay $50 for the motorized scooter!?!  Whaaaat?! I pay $200 per month for 5 platinum passes.   The like wait right now for Cheetah is 70 mins.   Thank God I bought skip the line for $1000.00 yeah that's right $1000 additional otherwise my kids would get to ride on 5 rides all day.   What a nightmare this place is.... oh yay I just
waited 1.5 hrs to get a Cuban sandwich in the Dragon Fire Grill and "sorry we are all out.." so I go to get a pizza "15 min wait.."

Back in the day BG's wait times looked more like Disney's, but now you'll rarely wait as long as 15 minutes-- and the rides are as awesome as ever. 

There are tons of rides for the kids, and the staff is super helpful. Lots of roller coasters for bigger kids and adults. 

Two critiques/requests: more non-coaster rides for adults. I'm pregnant and can basically only go on the merry go round. And more vegan/gluten-free food options at the restaurants. 

Pro tip- get the reusable drink cup and popcorn bucket. Refills are $.99 for the drinks and $2 for the popcorn.

It had been awhile since my last visit to Busch Gardens and almost forgot how great it is. 

As with many of the themed attractions in Florida, it can get pricey--be sure to check for online and advanced purchase savings. Having done so, we were able to bypass the lines and enter the park without much wait. 

Our first stop was the Cheetah Hunt! One of the newest attractions at the park and with a wait of 50 mins, it was still well worth it. 

My favorite of the rides-- Sheikra, definitely on another level of heart-stopping fun! I was not ready for the adrenaline rush this ride provided! 

I enjoyed seeing the animals: the lions, the tigers, the dancing elephant, all super cute!

What you really have to look forward to is the four huge roller coasters here- the best part.  The mix of animals is such a cool and different concept. My kids went nuts when they got to feed baby kangaroos and tropical birds. What a unique experience!

So much more shade and ways to stay cool than at Disney.

Went to Howl-O-Scream last night (Halloween) and had a BLAST!! There were zero line...zero wait...tons of fun. It was scary when random "dead people" jumped out of the bushes to scare you - but not overly scary. The haunted houses weren't too scary either. I would say anyone over 13 could enjoy the haunted houses. The rides were AWESOME and Cheetah was my favorite.

So much wrong with Busch Gardens I will have to make a list. For one thing we have not been been to this park in over 15 years. I recall it being a bad experience but not as bad as this time.

They offered for $99 the park and adventure island a pass that would last until the end of the year. So you think this is too good to pass up.

Well please pass this up.

1. When you get off I4 it should take 15 minutes to get to the park. We got there at 10:30 but physically got through the gates at 12:00 basically 1.5 hours just to get there from 6 miles away. Remember its Saturday they open at 10:00 why it gets hotter?

2. They post online parking $20 which is a ripoff but it actually cost $22 for a dirt lot I expected this.

3. You wait on line for everything here. I doubt this place has changed in at least 15 years maybe even longer.It appears no money into this place
So we get on long line to get through security I get up there and they say because I have a pocket knife on my keys I need to go back to car or pay money to put in lock box and get in line again. I  could not understand the security guard I asked him a few times to repeat but could not understand him. Just like Universal they mumble.

The pocket knife is basically smaller then a key. its more of a finger nail file. But these they act like its weapon just like Universal. Disney doesnt think so but BG does. I hide knife and got back in line this time new guy didnt even look at keys.No signage again.

4. So by the time we get in park its 12:30. We get a map and try to find someplace to go, the map is like a map you get at dennys. Its cartoonish and useless completely useless. I am usually the best person with maps this thing was useless. 

5. When you finally get a human to point you in a direction and you try to follow the signs you walk in the heat until you hit a crossroad and no signs again. You finally find someone tells you where to go. All through the park its like this. 

6. Ok so we finally make it to the skyride, I figured it was hot as hell we  could get on that thing and go for a cool ride. We get there and there sign and a cone says closed due to weather. We had no idea walked for 20 minutes to this place.

Its like 1:00 by now the sky is overcast. We hear on a speaker that is playing fake animal noises all the time a small voiced person saying due to weather they are closing all the rides. You can barely hear this person.

7. Every ride is closed down no rain yet just overcast skys. I mean everything closed bumper cars, train, carosel, everything. This was like this for like an hour and half. You know what was open the carnival games, gift shops and restaurants. Anything they can suck more money out of you was open.

8. We finally get on train they took 20-25 minutes to get people on the train. It was already full just adding like last 10 people that alone took 20-25 minutes 10 people.

9. They have obnoious guy on the speaker when you are on the train, who makes you want to jump off the train. You are forced to keep listening 20-25 minutes before we leave station. They also pump out spanish for a long time in case you really want to go nuts.

10. We finally get on a raft ride after waiting 1 1/2 hours in line for ride.I had been on this thing 15 years ago no different no storage on the raft so pay locker

11. We get on bumper cars its ok line normal, not a big ride.

12. My family gets hungry we stop in for a  burger they have a sign with burger, fry and drink on it $12.99 I think wow this isnt too bad. Wrong does not include drink in small writing says add a coke. Who the hell makes a sign so misleading, we get a small cup of water.

The fries are the worse fries I have ever had. I dont know how they screw up fries but they were hard tasted bad. The burger was as bad as the fries really bad. I had gotten mine with chicken fingers on it. chicken fingers hard and had fat.No quality control most go in garbage.

13.We were eating it started raining slightly, meaning all the rides off again. They were off at least 1/2 hour.

14. Didnt do anything after that looked at the sleeping animals they looked really sad.Tiger was vibrating like it was sick who knows.

15. Left at 6:00 the heat is unbareable. Very little spray coolers and only saw one water fountain.

This Busch Gardens needs to shut down. In 15 years it has gotten much worse, unless you like coasters there is nothing to do here. In fact the safara ride in the jeeps is gone since last time I was here. 

Signs saying dont throw items on track really dangerous.

Play fake animal sounds that are annoying & repetive since the animals are so docile they could never make noise.

They have a lot of land for animals not even used. I have been here in the past 20 years maybe even longer. The land use for the few animals they do have is a waste of real estate. 20 plus years and no changes.

They have an app its the website.Should have alert when things are closed, hell no just walk in circles.

Bush Gardens is by far one of my best experiences when going to an amusement park, from the cooling fun of water rides, to the peaceful serene feeling of walking through a forest. The beautiful birds fascinated me and I related way too much to the lazy sloth. "Crotters Inn Charge", one of the shows, was very interesting. I can't imagine how anyone could train an animal so well. The band show was also very intriguing. The dancers and singers looked like they were have a lot of fun on stage which brought a new kind of light to the audience's faces. I would love to go again with my husband around Christmas to see the lights again. They were placed beautifully around the park bringing an early Christmas spirit to all who witnessed.

We visited on Monday June 10 and Damien at Falcons fury was amazing! His hospitality was unparalleled since we were there at the end of the evening. He made the end of the day perfect! Phil at Dragon Fire was also wonderful, very helpful and amazing guest service! We had a rocky start with some food service staff and Phil really made up for it all. Busch Gardens is wonderful and we can't wait to come back! Amanda and Rodrick at Sheikra handle the shut down well too! Guests are not  easy and they kept a smile on their face! Zambia smokehouse leaves more to be desired the staff was uninterested and short with us, honestly we couldn't have been more disappointed with their level of service based on the quality we received elsewhere. All in all the majority of the team at Busch Gardens is wonderful!!! I just wish I got to see more giraffes

What I loved most about Busch Gardens is the fact that all the animals are almost in their own natural habitat, at least as much as they can be in captivity.  I like that you can drink there and bring your own stuff as long as there is no glass involved! Water and drinks are super expensive so please bring your own drinks or bring your refill mugs and popcorn holders to get unlimited 99$ re-fills. There is No WiFi, sorry kiddos! Do not wear anything but your tennis shoes or flip-flops here because you will regret it!! Lots of walking involved. I also recommend that you wear an bring sunblock and bring sunglasses and a cap to cover your face.

I love Busch Gardens, especially since I am retired and live about 15 minutes away. We usually go 3 times a month, and during the week, and of course I have an annual pass. The pass gives you free parking vs $25, and 10% off food and everything else. There's also two 7 ounce free samples of beer available at either the Serengeti Outlook Cafe or the Garden Gate Cafe. We also belong to the brew club where we can get 20 ounce beers for $2.87 including tax, and including a special Stein stored on premise. We don't do coasters, but we love the train ride which rides through the Serengeti, viewing up close, giraffes, zebras, rhinos, and the like. We like eating the bbq in Stanleyville, and the sampler platter is plenty for both of us. If you're not aware, water and sparkling water is free throughout the park, and we bring in insulated containers for that. The food and wine festival is great, the beerfest, and all the special activities year round, including free concerts. No, we don't get bored of the animals, and it's better exercise than a treadmill!
The funnel cake is good, but expensive. Toppings can include ice cream and strawberries. Although it is good, I still prefer ordering it at the state fair. Better prices & served hot.

Four of us drove over 4 hours to go to Busch Gardens on July 18. I have a fun card while one member in our group has a gold pass. We get to the park around 10:30 and see wait times over 50 minutes. We all decide to buy unlimited quick queues and a Serengeti adventure. Combined, we all spent well over $500. We get the opportunity to do ONE ride with the quick queue before our Seregenti tour. After the tour, the park was closed due to poor weather conditions. We waited over an hour before we decided we didn't want to waste the rest of our day, since we drove so far, waiting to see if the rides will ever reopen. When we proceed to get our rain check tickets, we asked for a refund or a rain check ticket for the quick queue. How is it we spend over $500 at your park and two of us pay you annually and you don't do the slightest to help your guests who spent $90 per person buying a rip off quick queue we used ONCE. Unless your guest service gets better, you're losing at least 4 guests and two pass holders. We'll drive to Orlando next time and go to Universal. Thanks for nothing.

I have been coming to this Busch Gardens for a few years. The experience every single time is consistent and I would highly recommend to and individual. 

They have plenty of animal exhibits from elephants -my favorite - to gorillas to snakes and even penguins. Almost all of the animal enclosures have a "Meet the keeper" option where there is feeding and a time to ask questions about a particular animal and their enclosure. 

They have a variety of rides from coasters to the sky ride to the train. Both the train and the sky ride are good for those that cannot ride the coasters or the crazier rides. 

They have plenty of parking in the lot and you can select regular parking and use the tram or select preferred and be closer to the park entrance. There is a fee involved and I'm not sure what the fee is. There is also disabled parking available. 

Look online before you come, it can be expensive to the average family but the monthly pass, if you live in Florida, is a great deal!
Love all the rides!! Lines weren't bad at all during the week. The price of the park is really economical. Parking is a little crazy but it's an amusement park. Love all the animals

Busch Gardens is a great spot to take family in from out of town. It has lots of stuff for all ages. The rides are a lot of fun. And the animals are always interesting and fun to see. It's always really neat to step into different "worlds" where the environment feels like you are completely somewhere else. The Egypt style section of the park is probably my favorite.

I should've expected today to go horrible as soon as I saw the parking. Took 1 hour to park. One hour to get a temperature screening and 30 mins to get through the security check since I already had my passes. I get to the Cheetah Hunt ride to see the wait time is 120 mins. Waited about that amount of time. Go over Cobras Curse. Also a wait time of 120 mins. But the Cobras Curse was only moving 6 to 12 feet per 10 to 20 mins since they heavily favored the Quick Queue. If you wanted to buy Quick Queue it was starting $150 and the Unlimited was $170. Way to price gouge Busch Gardens. 
To get popcorn or drinks the lines were 20 mins easily! Most food and drink stands were closed. Some rides in Elmo land closed early for some reason. It was a horrible day.

very rude and anti free American employee at the parks train station. Purchased the all you can eat meal pass, the restaurant that meet our dietary needs was closed and we were not able to get water more
than once an hour. Sure didn't work out well for us at all. Had to eat when we left the park even after checking menu options prior to purchase. 3 of their biggest rides were closed, very disappointing experience for nearly a $1000 price tag for  our family. Money would have been much better spend elsewhere. We won't be back.

We have been pass holders for over a year and pay month to month. We were very excited once we heard Busch Gardens was reopening after the closure for Covid-19. They kept us informed throughout the closure and told us the days closed would be added to our passes and they upgraded our pass to the next tier. It all sounded great.

We made our plans to drive over 4 hrs from Homestead, FL. To then only be left totally disappointed with the park. I had reserved Saturday and Monday for Busch Gardens. We were leaning towards to go more on Monday since possibly less people. A few days before leaving I get an email that they no longer open Mondays. Ok fine so we went on Saturday. The park seemed pretty packed considering there's a pandemic going on. We took advantage of our first "upgrade" which was preferred parking. Which I guess now everyone has that and it was packed and end up walking more than regular parking. We get to the kiosks to get our second "upgrade" which was the Serengeti tour. The machine wouldn't lets us so went to a window and was told that all animal encounters are cancelled because of COVID-19. Hmm ok. So we enter the park and head to our 1st ride, Cheetah Hunt. What do we arrive to? 3 people standing at the entrance telling us it's closed all day. Ok so next ride.. Cobras curse.. 60 min wait.. next ride Kumba.. 90 min wait.. Tigris 60.. and so on. While trying to look for a ride to go on, we saw no personnel advising people about their masks. Everyone was wearing them incorrectly making us feel very unsafe at this point so we left.

On our way out we visited customer service to advise of our experience. They just gave me a card with an email and address. I sent an email.. no response to this date. We called customer service to cancel our passes and get our money back for the months closed because this was not what we signed up for. No one is willing to help us over the phone. You can't even reach someone when you call. You have to request a callback which is like 4 hours later. We have been on the phone we're the re just says they can't do anything and place us on mute and disappear. Very disappointing that Busch Gardens is doing business this way.

I was not expecting to have the best experience, as many of the reviews recently have been negative, however I actually had an extremely good time. Most of what people have been saying is false. The only issue that really effected me was the lack of beverage/snack bars, however it is understandable seeing as we are coming out of a pandemic, and they are Lilly short staffed. There were still some snack places opened periodically around the park, however the majority of them were closed. All of the staff working were extremely nice, and I didn't see any staff without masks (that is not to say that none of them weren't wearing masks, I just didn't see any without one). Also, many of the lines for rides (with the exception of cheetah hunt, one of the most popular rides) had extremely short wait times. During the 5 hours me and my group were there, we got to go on 6 rides (we did not have fast passes, however we decided not to go on cheetah hunt). Not many of the people who were there (not including staff) were wearing a mask, however if you think that would bother you, just wait until COVID is behind us. If you feel safe enough to be around people without masks, then I'm sure you will have a great time.

I can remember going to Busch Gardens when the big thrill attractions were the Scorpion and the Python, which seems laughably ludicrous now. It's been fascinating to watch how the park continues to update and change itself. When they do add new items they are world-class attractions. When the first dive coaster to be placed in the United States was constructed where did it go? That would be Sheikra. Where is the tallest freestanding drop tower in North America? That's Falcon's Fury. What's great about Bush Gardens is that even if you aren't a thrillseeker there is still lots of entertainment. I've brought older people here who were thrilled with riding the train, viewing the animals, and seeing the shows. I've brought young children here who enjoyed all of that, as well as the children's area. And of course I've come here with thrillseekers, who have lots of options for going on rides. The Kumba was the first "real" roller coaster that I ever went on, so it holds a special place in my heart (even though I thought I was going to have a heart attack the first time I rode it). Montu is a still thrilling coaster where you hang beneath the track. Sheikra loves to torture you as it dangles you on the edge of a drop that is almost straight down from a ridiculously tall height. Cheetah Hunt is my favorite roller coaster by far. On three separate occasions it launches you and in multiple places you get amazing airtime. The only huge misstep I feel that the park has made was with the wooden coaster Gwazi. I absolutely hated that ride the one and only time I rode it because it was so painful. I am thrilled that they are getting rid of it and am I looking forward to seeing what will replace it.

Busch Gardens also does a great job with their special events. Howl-o-scream at Halloween seems to get better every year. I like the wide variety of themes that the haunted houses have, from crazy clowns to voodoo inspired bayous. They go above and beyond with the theming for these events.  My favorite this year was the employees dressed as plants who would hide in the bushes to scare people walking by. They got me when I was exiting a ride and I couldn't stop laughing afterwards. Christmas town is a wonderful way to end the year. I love looking at Christmas lights, of which there are thousands and thousands in the park during this event.

The only complaint I have about how the park is run is with the ride photos. The employees will reprimand you if you try and take a photo of the proof of you on a ride. It is such a stark contrast with how Disney operates. Disney not only lets you take cell phone pictures of the proofs, but they also let you look at them online. Sometimes I want to spend money and buy one, but sometimes I just want a crappy cell phone shot of it. Having the picture police yell at me makes me never want to buy them here. That is a minor complaint that doesn't detract from my love of this wonderful park. I'm looking forward to my next visit to Busch Gardens.

I rarely leave reviews but this place has inspired me to write yet another. I had a horrible experience this Saturday night for Howl-O-Scream, to start it off, very few people were wearing their masks and even less were wearing it correctly. The mask policy was barely enforced and the social distancing guidelines were blatantly disregarded, lines were back to back with less than a foot between parties and people with their masks down right up on your back vaping in lines. Speaking of lines, the lines for each ride went well over 150 minutes per ride, literally 2 and a half hours to ride a single rollercoaster when there are supposed to be reservations (reservations that no one even looked at when we went through the gate or bought a parking ticket!). What is the point of reservations if the park doesn't care if there are several thousand people rubbing up on each other in every line spreading the virus everywhere. Worst experience I have ever had at Busch gardens and I will never recommend the park to anyone again after last nights shit show.

I have two season passes to bush gardens and after looking at my account info we had a problem.  

Andrea contacted me and resolved the issue along with a great compensation.  

Thank you Andrea for all your help.

This is a great theme park in Florida that has a lot to offer.  From roller coasters to animals to safari adventures there is something for everyone.  

The park has definitely evolved over the decades but it is still a lot of fun for kids and adults of all ages.  

What I like the most are the roller coasters and the animals.  They also treat injured animals from the wild, and you can see them at work in the facility where they do diagnostics and surgery.  

In the old days, they allowed you to sample beers, but today you have to buy them.  They actually have some craft beers too in the park.  They are expensive but they do taste nice paired with a pretzel or BBQ if thats your thing.  

Ive been coming to this park close to 40 years now, and still enjoy it.  My kids had a blast on this last visit.  We came on a Monday after Spring Break was over and there was no lines.  The weather was overcast and no rain, perfect theme park weather.  

Tickets can be pricey, so if you are coming with a group you can save money by buying an annual pass and getting guest passes for 50% off, and you also get free parking.  For the 5 of us, we saved around $100 vs buying 5 regular priced tickets.  

Overall, this is a great park, which definitely rivals the big parks in Orlando.  Its arguably better in a lot of ways.  Definitely worth the visit.

Park opens at 10a. We parked at 10:10 it is 3:42 and my kids have only been on 3 rides. Every restaurant has at least an hour or longer wait never ever again! Tampa resident BTW.  Kids are starving and there's nowhere to grab food in less than an hour. Do not recommend it! Go to a public park or beach and bring your own food and enjoy the lovely weather we have here in Florida because this is not the way to enjoy our beautiful state!
Fuck your business, auto renew a season pass after the year is over to start another year. Can't get anyone on the phone to cancel. Fuck this park who abuses the animals and is not covid safe

I use Yelp all the time as a guide, when I travel. I have maybe reviewed 3 venues, in my years of using Yelp. This place is awful. I don't mind throwing down too much money for food. The food here is garbage. I spent $92 on 3 lunch meals that were disgusting.
It took 2 hours to get into the park from .2 miles away. 
I get that it's limited capacity, but that is ridiculous. Add more staff. I understand the waits. I'm not dumb, but this place is a total waste of time and money.
I was at Disney yesterday. I spent the same amount of money on 3 meals and they were yummy. It took 15 minutes to get into Disney. Yes, Disney costs way more, but I also got on 3 times as many rides, and was able to actually eat my food. 
My kids were hungry all day because every thing we bought, other than churros and ice cream, was disgusting. I will NEVER come here again.

My wife and I love going to Busch Gardens for the zoo features of the park. The keepers here do a great job of taking care of the animals and the habitat is as nice or nicer than many zoos.

However, we remain concerned about the pandemic. The park limits entry via a registration process and the number of visitors is definitely limited.

The park posts notices throughout regarding the requirement to wear a mask. However, we have noticed many instances where a visitor is not wearing a mask. However there are not a sufficient number of park employees present throughout the park to enforce the rule. 

In one instance, two people not wearing a mask walked right by a park security person and said hello to the employee and he said nothing to the visitors! This is ridiculous!

This was the best experience!   It was during holiday time and the park was decorated with lots of beautiful holiday decorations.  We also went to the ice skating Shaw at the Moroccan palace.  It was phenomenal!   A great experience overall and recommended!

Well now I know if I want to go to a Busch gardens I will move to Williamsburg as they treat people with respect. My nephew and I are platinum members and this year wanted to go to howl o scream. I read the website before going and it said the first weekend and the dates of the 20/21/22. When we got there after driving an hour and a half on the 22nd we were told that there was no event that night. A security guard even mentioned that a few more people had said it was supposed to be that night. I am extremely dissatisfied as this was a treat for me and my nephew as we are not able to afford to go because we can't pay the high prices and be able to eat or even shop. Thanks Busch gardens for ruining what was supposed to be a fun trip and wasting gas in my car.

The only good thing about this park is the animals. We saw them via the train. I think it's terrible the actual safari is $40 a person. The train was free and we got pretty close to some of the animals. 

The park itself looked run down and like it was struggling. We took the sky tram, which was a waste. Didn't see much and the line was long. The rest of the rides has very long lines.

Took the family to Orlando and decided to drive to Tampa to go to Busch Gardens since we have never been there. So after looking forward to something new, this is my opinion.........

Pros:

Nice animals to look at.
Big park
Carnival games
Lines moved fast
Air conditioned shows

Cons:

Over $100 to get in, plus $20 to park!

Not that many rides for for kids aged 6-11. This park is better for older kids!

Food is expensive- $45 for one hamburger, two small chicken tenders, fries, ham sandwich & strawberries. Really??

One cashier at restaurant with over 50 people in line?? Had to wait in line to pay 15 minutes AFTER I got my food, standing in line with it to pay on a Saturday!  CRAZY

Employees do not seem happy to work there. Totally different attitude then you see any Disney!

*************Probably will never go back. More negatives than positives. If you have children under the age of 12, I would recommend Animal Kingdom over Busch Gardens. Same concept but MUCH better in my opinion!

Hey not a bad park at all!! Lines aren't too long, lots of cool rides, zoo nice touch for when rides shut down down for storms and such. Lots of shade, cooling sprayers, places to sit and get refreshment. I'm not a ride person- family is- so the side amenities matter to me. It's clean, well maintained, staff is helpful bag friendly. Lots of good people watching. Food-- avoid the all you can eat deal unless you eat like a pig and care not for quality. Clearly cuisine from a can- edible but just so.  Nicer food around but don't honor the feed bag deal!!

Total Disappointment! Horrible wait times at the Ticket center.  Waited one and half hours standing in sun after a 5 hour trip to get to The park. Very disorganized process, slow lines and 4 windows open to attend customer needs. This park has gone bad. when it comes to keeping up with the social distance guidelines in lieu of COVID. I witness crowds with no social distance, people not wearing masks and walking around inside park. Bathrooms in disarray and filthy. The lines at the restaurants were insanely long and no social distance at all. Hardly few people working as masks enforcers... I will strongly recommend you to go somewhere else.  Perhaps Universal Studios or Islands of adventures if you want to enjoy your day in a safer and more pleasant way.

Too many rules. Too many rude employees. Too easily panicked over weather.

This is not the park it used to be and for all the wrong and bad reasons.

Parking is too expensive, food is too expensive, lines are too long. The park is far too hot with too little amenities to cool off.

What a fitting way to end 2020. 

Zero social distancing. No one had a mask on and the "mask police" didn't enforce it.

There were like 2 open restaurants for the whole park. 1 hour for food. They can pack the park full of guests like sardines but they can't pay a few people minimum wage to run an extra food hut? 

I can't wait to cancel my membership.
One of my favorite places. I've been about 10 times over the past 2 years. The Christmas lights two years ago were my favorite. Parking is easy
Loved it! A zoo and an adventure in one place? Genius! We had the best time. Covid measures were taken seriously. Lines were not too bad. I hope it stays like this so we can come again!

I have been to Busch Gardens Williamsburg several times and LOVED it.  My husband's job moved us to Orlando 2 years ago and we have visited Sea World with the kids, ages 1 and, 8 and loved it!  September 2020 came and my husband lost his job and has been unemployed since.  We got a little money, and will now have the funds to move back home to live with family until work comes and we can get back out on our own.  With the pressures we have been under for so long since COVID, we decided that we would give our children a lifetime memory and forget about struggles for awhile.  With a bit of assistance from friends, we purchased single day tickets, two UNLIMITED Quick Queues, two all day meal plans for our kids (now 3 and 10), and of course, parking.  
Upon entrance, there was no clear direction from anyone to let us know what ticketing counter to report to for prepaid tickets.  Crowds were close.  I wonder it it was an overstaffed issue or a capacity issue, but the ratio of park attendants to guests was horrible.  My kids got one turkey leg that they shared and two drinks each for the price of two meal plans due to the lack of options and long waits.  Paper maps aren't given, the app won't load them, and phone pictures of the map are difficult to use adequately, so much of our day was lost to being lost.  When attendants could be found, no one seemed to know how to tell you where to go.
My daughter has asked all week when she was going to get to see the animals.  She is obsessed and I couldn't wait to experience this place with her.  The only animals we were able to find were birds that you couldn't interact with and a couple giraffes after dark on a the train ride (that we spent an hour trying to ride.  I am heartbroken.  Especially since she didn't get to see the big cats she has been hung up on for quite some time.
My son is on the autistic spectrum, but there is something about roller coasters that transforms him.  I pumped up everything about BG because I really believed it.  After spending around $120 per person for the Unlimited Quick Queues, we could not wait to see that side of a kid we have worked hard to pull from the lure of depression.  After being at the park from 12:00-9:00, my son had managed only to ride the Tigris because of  wait lines in other areas of the park.  He had a small drawstring bag he was able to store in every ride at SeaWorld, but was not allowed at sister park, Busch Gardens?  Hummm... this turned into a nightmare for our kid who had to lose his place in line and then go through waiting in the Quick Queue AGAIN.  
By the time we were able to make it to the exit, there was nobody available to help us at customer service, since it was after closing time.  Customer service wait times are ridiculous and there isn't much that can be done online.  They could at least hire customer service chat reps.
Anyway, I am disappointed and ashamed of myself.  I should have held onto the money spent here and used it for necessities, but I felt we all needed a break from reality for our mental health and wellbeing.  Who knows, we may never get another chance to do something like this as a family again..  We felt that the memories we make together can never be taken away.  I just wish everything could have been happier!  My kids got used birthday presents and we gave them  one cheap gift each this year for their birthday. 
 They have been my warriors.  They DESERVED to be regular kids for a day. Around $800 later and there is nothing but regret.
I wish I could have a do-over.
Visited  3/19/22

Spent the day at Busch Gardens on 5/29. My boyfriend, a Marine Veteran received a free ticket through the waves of honor program. We had a blast. Upon entering the park we decided to purchase a water bottle for 14.99 in which you could refill for 99¢ throughout the park. We are very glad we did because a water is $4-5 and it was a HOT day!! Our only complaint is it was very hard to find the places to fill it up, and when we did the line was insanely long. The wait times were long, but we expected it. We did watch the ice skating show and it was AMAZING!! Overall a great day!!

I honestly can't complain about a theme park that offers Florida resident passes for the price of a one-day admission and is located DIRECTLY ACROSS THE STREET FROM MY APARTMENT. Shizzz, I'm a fan!

Yeah, it's kinda small. But that's what's nice about BG. It's got a small-time, not too commercialized, not overwhelming feel. I can go here, spend two or three hours walking around and be happy. And then come back the next day. And the next. And.... you get the picture. I have no life. That's okay.

My favorite ride is SheiKra (duh) but I also love the beautiful animals and African theme. This place is a must for animal lovers. I do feel a little bad that they have to be surrounded by annoying tourists and ear-splitting "theme" music all day... but I do know they are well cared-for and that's most important.

Sometimes this place is hit-or-miss. Most recently, we came on a Thursday afternoon and the place was dead and all the vendors were closed. They closed the rides when it started raining. AKA absolutely nothing to do. We spent most of our time at the Crown Colony restaurant, which is one of my favorite food places along with the candy store. Despite everything else being closed I still just liked being there. Where else can you say that?

So, in conclusion: buy a resident pass and go here. Ride the rides. Spend money (Florida's economy needs it, and BG is one of the best things Tampa's got going for itself let's be honest). Have fun. Take pictures of the animals, get some exercise walking around and learn something new. Don't take it all too seriously, just enjoy!

Great park and fun rides but  a NIGHTMARE customer service experience. They overcharged my girlfriend and I outrageously. My bank statement showed multiple charges totaling to $500.00 for just 1 day at the park. What a complete JOKE. I have called, emailed, and left voicemails multiple times with no response. I understand the complications with COVID, but this is unacceptable

I wish I had read some of these reviews before planning this trip. We love Busch Gardens and have been here many times. However, if you are concerned about COViD, it's the worst place to be. It made me infuriated to see the lack of enforcement of the social distancing or mask policies. The place was full of people who wore their masks under their nose, on their chins or even around their necks. I did not see a single employee enforcing proper mask wearing. It is not a political thing. If this is the park rule, ones beliefs should not supersede the rules. It is not fair to those of us who made the trip because we're were informed that there were proper precautions in place. It made me so uncomfortable being there. 

Also, the place was so crowded. There is supposed to be a reservation system to limit the park attendance. So much for that! They didn't even check if we had reservations, which we did, when we came in. 

We went to Sea World San Diego a few months ago and were so pleased with the precautions they were taking there that we assumed it would be the same at Busch Gardens. WRONG! If you are concerned about COVID, don't go to Busch Gardens right now.

The two stars are big ones - one star for the care that they give the animals and one for the performers - especially the ice skaters.  The three "not stars":  One for the crowds and inability to manage them through increasing ride frequency.  The sky ride was closed so the train was the only transportation available.  Only one train running and a half hour wait for it.  During the ride, the engine had an issue getting up an extremely slight grade, spinning its wheels, making the wait even longer (was the engineer brand new or was it the first time the train was this loaded?).  Second is the attitude of the non-performers.  The people at the food areas were sour and unfriendly.  Third is the cost.  The basic ticket prices were expensive enough, they they screw you for $25 to park.  Really?  Granted we went during the Christmas crush (the lights were beautiful), but you'd think after all these years, they would be prepared for the crowds.

Absolutely love Busch gardens! I have been a pass holder for many years. I've gotten the pre school pass for my daughter the past few years and it's been great, we will miss it next year when she's too old for it but will definitely still be coming. The rides are great and our favorite is Christmas Town, we come multiple times it's that good!
Its a Shit! Awfull. Buy ticktes on-line, and doesnt work. Dirt place, bad supervisor... so, bad bad

We have certainly been to Busch Gardens before as it is one of our favorite places for roller coasters. This time was not a good visit. In six hours we managed to ride one roller coaster. The rest of the time we waited when there was not been much of a line.   It was a hot summer day but not as hot as it had been for the previous week. They were running roller coasters empty according to young man on duty. Doing quality controls I suppose.  After waiting for the better part of 30 minutes with no line we finally got on and road Sheikra. At our second roller coaster there was a sudden downpour of rain without lightning. No one was able to ride for an hour. A number of rides were closed down and there were many indoor attractions that were closed.  Another hour past by and we Heard an announcement overhead that due to weather concerns that all rides were being canceled. People started going into shops and the weather never materialized. So eventually we decided to leave. For the six hours we were there, we went on one ride.  When we passed by the office when we were leaving, it was closed up tight so we couldn't even ask for a rain check for another day. We paid $80 a person to go on one roller coaster plus $25 parking. . Very disappointing.

Busch Gardens has the best of all worlds.  I love how there are shows, games, animals, rides and roller coasters. Enough entertainment for the whole family or even a date weekend. The food options are far from gourmet but it gets you through the day.  The price for a one day admission is the same as the Fun Pass which allows you to go back multiple times until 12/31. It is definitely one of the best valued parks around. Sometimes there are even groupon deals as well.  You can't beat that!! 

My favorite roller coaster is Montu.  I also enjoy the newer coaster Cheetah Hunt. Sheikra is one of the most unique roller coasters I have ever been on!!!  I love seeing the different animals. 

There is a cool app that even tells you wait times and an interactive map. Make sure your phone is charged :) 

Overall it's a fun time for all and well worth it!

this is the place with the worst customer service ever known to people! since everything was closed due to covid last year i was unable to use mu quick que pass for the rides. i returned this year in feb 2021. a manager was kind enough to extend my quick que in the computer for 6 months until aug 1st 2021. so, since today, july 18th, 2021 is my birthday, i said why not go to busch gardens! i love roller coasters and my quick que is good until august! 
wrong!!! get to back of park and quick que not accepted. have to travel allll the way back to the front entrance, to customer service, then sit there in the heat for 1.5 hours to finally get a manager to look at my annual pass (which was extended same time in feb 2021) and have them tell me no matter what manager did 5.5 months ago is irrelevant and they don't care if it's my birthday. if i want a quick que, (after 1.5 hours of arguing they finally offer a 1 day one) or i can pay $500 (almost double what it used to be) to get another one!?!?!?!?!?!

now, part 2...not ada handicap compliant!!! get there at 1130 am, have our own special busch garden cups from february and no place open to fill them!!! get told,
"go to sernegeti restaurant.  theres an elevator for ecv. cart."
ok, take elevator to 2nd floor, no automatic door at all!!! how is this ada legal/compliant??? my wife and i are both handicap and on ecv so all we can do is sit outside and stare at closed door that opens out untilnsomeone takes pity and holds door for us!!!! i am half tempted to never come back and stop any and all payments to this horrid service!!!  maybe if enough people who follow my social media and yelp will see this the word will spread rapidly that busch gardens does not 

1.) honor their own things they give you. (extended quick que)

2.) do not care about you the customer at all even when they admit they are wrong about quick que and should be good till aug 1st.

3.) dont care if they ruin your birthday with family! 

4.) dont give a flying monkeys butt about handicapped patrons!

i have never ever in my life been so humiliated and treated as borribly as i have been by busch gardens!!!

at this point if they want ro make things right (which i seriously doubt and doubt they even care!) they would reach out with a 1 year quick que pass at no cost or at least a 75% discount of 1 year price!!! but i doubt it. because all we are is another dollar in their pocket...like a fuedal lord collecting from the serfs! we shall see. i will not be returning unless something changes! just keep mind busch gardens, this is florida! i couldve gone to anyyyy number of places for my birthday that i also hold annual passes at. such as disney, universal studious, zoo, anywhere. but instead i chose to come to your tampa park to get humiliated and made.to feel like a 3rd class citizen!!!
thanks and happy freakin birthday to me huh!!!

I had the opportunity to visit Busch Gardens Tampa for the first time back in April, I've been a coaster enthusiast for 7 years and this park had been on my bucket list for a long time and I was not disappointed. This was my first time in the state of Florida and I came down specifically for BGT. Out of the almost dozen parks I've visited so far, this was the most picturesque. Every area of the park is beautifully and extensively themed, I would even say it's just a step below Universal level theming. Pantopia is an especially gorgeous area and the park is just covered in greenery. Now let's talk about the coasters. Specifically the B&M coasters; Kumba, Montu, and Sheikra. Kumba was one of my most anticipated coasters on this trip and it was my first sitdown model from B&M, I absolutely loved every second of it!! It is incredibly forceful, it's generally very smooth given its age, there's just a certain way of making a B&M smoother but I did not find it to be rough at all. I love all the inversions including the interlocking corkscrews and the zero g roll aptly nicknamed the hell roll, ridiculous amount of whip especially in the back row, during my short two day visit, I rode Kumba 14 times, absolutely phenomenal coaster! Now for Montu, the B&M invert. This is now my favorite invert and for good reason, it's also incredibly forceful and fast paced, the highlight inversion being the batwing. The way it pulls you into it in the back row is crazy, in fact none of my rides on Montu or Kumba were anywhere but the back row. And the fact that they had to add a trim brake before the batwing must've meant it was initially too intense for riders. This was also my first invert with an immelmann, those are super fun inversions especially on inverts, I got 16 rides on Montu during my visit and it's going to be hard to top it as my favorite invert at least until I have the opportunity to ride inverts overseas. Last but not least is the dive coaster Sheikra, america's first dive coaster. This was my second dive coaster overall, the first being Valravn at Cedar Point and I definitely preferred Sheikra. Valravn may be taller and feature more inversions but one of B&M's best characteristics is airtime and the newer vest restraints tend to hinder the airtime you could be getting while the traditional restraints on Sheikra allow for max airtime on the drops, once again, especially in the back row. 7 rides on Sheikra in  2 days, 5 back row rides. You really can't go wrong with this park. Even if you don't like coasters, there's so much else to see and do, and it wouldn't be a Busch park without the animals and there are plenty of those. And let's not forget, for the extreme thrill seekers; you can't pass up an opportunity to ride Falcon's Fury, not many places can you get a face first dive especially from a height of 335ft. As you can probably tell by this lengthy review, I absolutely enjoyed every second of my visit to Busch Gardens and will definitely return also to check out Iron Gwazi. Thank you to the staff at BGT for making this such an amazing place to visit. Highly recommend this park to anyone!!

If you like roller coasters this is the place for you.  Lots of em.  Fast ones.

I'm not too much of a roller coaster person, so I really come for the ambiance and the animals.  I like being up close to them and being around the scenery.

You know what, I cannot write about the food right now. . .too upsetting.  Maybe another time when I'm not as affected.  It's just not right.

I will just have to visit again and re-write this some other time.  More than one ride was shut down when we tried to ride.

  It was super cold the day I went, and did not ride much because I did not want to be on anything that would create wind.

I had to get used to paying for things here too.  I mean, the tickets are not cheap, and it seems you have to keep paying to ride certain things too.  IDK, I just need a do over for this park.

Very disappointed. Even with reservations and a platinum card I stood in line for one ride for 40 minutes. I don't know if it's the or the lack of employees but nothing was open unable to interact with animals no shows were available you couldn't cool off and most of the key ossas were all closed again very disappointed. Even though I hold a platinum card with free guest pass it doesn't do any good when you come to Busch Gardens and nothing is available. At least let us know on the website that yes we're open but only to buy are expensive food and sit in hot weather.
Very very disappointed.  No one should have to wear masks outside and hundred and two degree Heat. And the only time you can take them off this to smoke a cigarette and eat. I'm either going to die of covid-19 or lung cancer.
This is literally animal kingdom times 100 so many cool exhibits and coasters to go along. Great for wide varieties of families!

I was very disappointed that precautions for Covid were not being followed. I LOVE this place, is probably my favorite theme park. However, people were all packed up, pretty close to each other during lines with long waiting times... I was pretty sure I would pick up Covid from the park that day and bring it home. Some staff were asking people to put their masks, but not all the time. Some people were not wearing their masks.

We made the mistake of going during a holiday weekend and Covid.  Bad decision!!  Last minute decision while on vacation. Waited 2 hours just to wait in line for tickets and get into the park. Once in ticket line we discovered 4 of the major rides were closed. With others half capacity lines were too long. 2 hours in some cases. 
Bad decision!  We have been to all the parks and Busch gardens is not as clean, up to date, and rides are just ok. 

It's an ok park if you live close but I would not go out of my way to visit.  The price does not reflect the parks experience compared to others that cost the same or less.

Terrible covid precaution
They weren't scanning people in one tent
Line to get in 2 hour and a half
Line to get food 1 hour and a half
30 minutes to wolf down some extremely mediocre bbq 
Line waiting to ride sheikra 1 hour then they said they were experiencing difficulties
Finally rode our first ride 6 hours and 18 minutes after parking the car.
I sat down and did the exact math
Another hour wait for every ride thereafter until it was about to close then it was 30 minute waits but by then after 9 hours standing in lines we were over it

MIDWESTERNERS BEWARE: this is NO Cedar Point. I was very excited to visit here while on vacation, but found it to be severely lacking. The roller coasters were simply okay. Some of them were closed for seemingly no reason. The place is also a maze with random dead ends and scarce signage to help you navigate the park. Doesn't flow well and makes it hard to find the things you want to do, even when looking a their maps on the website. The food was overpriced, as expected for an amusement park, but was also terrible!! Our food was burnt and the worker lied about it even though we could see the dark brown/black spots. The animals scattered throughout the park were honestly sad to see. Don't get me wrong, I love animal exhibits as much as the next person, but them placed right by busy rides and games makes no sense. Overall this is not worth the money alone. Buy the citypass to save your coins and go when the parking is free if you want to check it out.
Although I live in Orlando, this is one of my favorite theme parks. It is great fun for children and adults. A great balance of the African wildlife and thrilling rides.
Awful Howl-o-scream experience, very boring, nothing to do. Not worth the 50.00 plus 25.00 for parking... barely any rides open and it was lame. Will not be coming back. Miss the normalcy.
