Love this place. But, long lines of 40 minutes or more...Rides are good. Theme park is my favorite, Sesame Street. However, food is not good and its very pricey. Other than that, is a good place to enjoy with family and friends.

First time ever visiting today, we are season pass holders now. The lines have been crazy long, and most (not all) employees have been crazy rude about masks. My mask fell off during a ride and I was talked to very rudely. 
Hoping next time is a better experience. 

The locker prices are crazy for what we pay for the tickets.

For someone who doesn't like roller coasters, and that is really what Busch Gardens are known for, you would think that the day could get boring, but not at all. First of all, admittance. You can buy an annual pass for as little as $12 a month, pretty nice if you live in the Tampa or St Pete. area. If you are from out of state, I'm not sure on what a one day ticket cost per person, but I'd say somewhere around $100 most likely. Right now its a busier time than normal because of Howl- 0- Scream going on until the end of October. For animal lovers, there is a lot to do and see, definitely bring a quality camera with you. The 65 mile Serengeti  Safari is a lot of fun and the animals are very well cared for. There are a few very large roller coasters, you could not pay me enough to even try that out, but if you like coasters, they do have those here too. The Congo river rapids are a lot of fun, prepare to get wet, its basically like going whitewater rafting in the west, but in a controlled environment. My favorite thing to do at any theme park is to try out a different dining experience each time. There is a new Giraffe bar where you can watch the Giraffes as you eat. The Dragon Fire grill and pub restaurant seems to be the most popular, they had pizzas, chicken platters, Asian cuisine, really good desserts. The only downside to Tampa this time of year is the heat, you have no protection from the sun and it is 100 degrees until November, so it would be best to come here during the winter, you will have more energy and feel better walking around, because it is miles and miles of walking.
They constantly harass you about mask and threaten to kick you out if you don't it can be 90° weather they still don't give a shit they need better management.

Bought tickets to the food and wine fest and 38 Special.  Called and specifically asked if we needed day passes as well.  Was told no, just parking and food and wine fest tix.  NOT THE CASE.  Got there and was told we needed to spend an additional $200 for 2 day passes to get in.  Supposed to be getting a refund on all monies spent.  In addition, lots of folks in line and on the tram NOT wearing masks.

Solo traveler here! Found a Groupon deal for admission plus all day dining. Can't get much better than that! 

On a Thursday, I arrived early to the park (prepaid $25 for parking) and they let us in right around 0950. I came with an agenda and I was able to ride all the big rides (except Kumba which was down for maintenance) in 2 1/2 hours!! I even rode a few of them twice! 

Everyone had to wear a mask and I definitely heard staff reminding people to wear them properly more than once. Hand sanitizer is also everywhere! Social distancing was enforced as they left seats open between parties. A few rides I got to ride all by myself literally. The ride with the longest wait was Cheetah hunt, but it was TOTALLY worth it!! Every other ride was pretty much a walk-on earlier in the day. Never had to wait more than about 5 minutes. 

The animals are beautiful. The park is beautiful. I had a REALLY fun time and I'll for sure be back. Can't wait to conquer Iron Gwazi!

Pictures were very misleading , a lot of the rides or shows weren't even open. The food was bland, overcooked, and overpriced. We had the all day dining deal and it wasn't even worth it to go to a different food place only to find out they are serving the exact same thing, it's like going to your kids school and grabbing cafeteria food. In animal habitats, the animals look depressed and overheated. Habitats are really small and just overall cruel to creatures who need more space to roam and do what they were naturally born to do. They also look very lonely and bored, most habitats have one animal inside which is what probably causes them to be depressed. They need interaction with more of their own kind. Busch Gardens Tampa is terrible in comparison to the one in Williamsburg, VA where you can have twice as much fun and the conditions are better in all areas compared to Tampa. Don't waste your money paying almost as much as you would pay for Disney or Universal studios! Also, social distancing and covid ? That does not exist at all, if you aren't fully vaccinated stay at home and be safe, not ONE PERSON was wearing a mask. Never coming back again.
Covid times is ridiculous here - lines took forever for a mild attempt of checking a box of distancing and cleaning. Regretting the season pass already!

*Rating based solely off of Food service * 
Let me start out by saying Busch Gardens has the worst food in Tampa . I know it's a theme park so it mostly know for it attractions and Animals but you'd think such a major park would provide better food . I purchased two meal plans costing me over $80 only to receive hamburgers on soggy bread with stale fries . I was even told by one worker that it's the same food they serve to employee in the back for $2 . The lack of variety is shameful and the level of food they serve to paying customers really needs some attention brought to it IMMEDIATELY! As I mention earlier this review is solely based off food .

They cram as many people in this place as they can while claiming to limit the capacity.  The traffic to get in was horrendous.  In order to get on any rides we had to pay $129.99 PER PERSON for quick queue.  What a rip off.  All day dine was a joke.  An hour and a half wait for a plate of bad food.

NO COVID PRECAUTIONS WHATSOEVER! If you care about your own life don't come here or waste your money. The park took two whole hours to fully open up after 10am. No one follows COVID guidelines or social distances. Every other person you see isn't wearing a mask and no one is enforcing it or seeming to care. I saw countless employees without masks. Everyone in line in two inches away from you and there is no social distancing in place in the entire park. You have to ride right next to other guests and sit next to other strangers. Half of the rides are closed and having technical difficulties. We wanted to buy a water at 11:30 and we were told we can't because the stores are not open yet. THIS IS DEFINITELY A COVID HOTSPOT DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY!

Busch gardens has a few safety measures in place for the pandemic. Masks are required by everyone two years and up. And they somehow take everyone's temperature by having us walk in a tent--Cool technology. 

The self service ticket lines are a little long because every other one is closed for social distancing, so arrive early if you need to get tickets printed. 

This is the first amusement park/attraction I've been to since Covid, so I'm not sure what other places are doing, but I was hoping to see rides and trams sanitized after each use. Or maybe even someone giving hand sanitizer to the guests before they got on the ride to keep it as clean as possible.

I wish there were more shows available, our only options were music and Sesame Street on a Saturday. But we mostly came to see animas with the kiddos on this trip, so they were happy.

The food we had was sub par with a hefty price tag, like other theme parks. We all had chicken strips or chicken sandwiches. The chicken was dry, and the fries were not warm or flavorful. Definitely take advantage of the Food and Wine options if you can, we will be trying that out next time!

YELP REVIEW #1100

Busch Gardens has been a 5-star experience for me ever since I was a little kid and visiting the Tampa area during summer vacations with my family. My grandparents used to live in the small town of Wildwood north of Ocala, and our summer vacations consisted of trips to see them followed by days at the beach and days at Busch Gardens.

The park opened way before my time in 1959 as a special hospitality area for Anheuser-Busch of Tampa, with it's famed tasting room and bird sanctuary. In 1965 Busch Gardens opened the area known as Serengeti Plains, and stocked the Plains with African wildlife which were allowed to roam freely. Over the years, Busch Gardens has continued to focus on its tropical landscape, exotic animals, and thrill ride amusements to draw visitors.

Busch Gardens is a relatively small park with 335 acres inside their fences. That includes 25 total rides, of which 8 are classified as roller coasters, and 3 are water attractions. The park hosted well over 4 million people last year, placing in the Top 20 of the most-visited theme parks in the US and in the Top 25 worldwide.

Florida Resident annual passes cost $156 for Busch Gardens, and that includes free parking, discounts on dining, shopping, and special admission events, and no blackout dates. In my book this is THE best value for any amusement park in Florida, and one of the best amusement park experiences in the country.

Yes, it has changed a lot over the years -- fan favorites such as the Anheuser-Busch tasting room and Rhino Rally are long gone, and the Park has confirmed that the Gwazi wooden roller coaster is coming down soon. In their place, new attractions such as SheiKra, Cheetah Hunt, and Falcon's Fury have sprung up around the park. Today Busch Gardens is a combination African wildlife exhibit, thrill ride / coaster junkie experience, and some high quality song / dance / ice skating / acrobatic production shows.

Busch Gardens has over ten different themed areas within the park, and more than a dozen animal attraction spots. There is now an Animal Care Center on the premises, and park visitors are welcome to watch the veterinarians as they perform exams and medical procedures on the wildlife. The park has some behind-the-scenes tours which allow visitors to venture out onto the Serengeti on specially-built Busch Gardens vehicles, and feed some of the animals.  

As for the thrill rides, hang on to your seats because Busch Gardens is one of the best coaster-junkie meccas in America. Rides such as Kumba and Montu, are now joined by Cheetah Hunt, SheiKra, and Falcon's Fury for screaming good times by all. Busch Gardens still has the Skyride and the Serengeti Railway for those who enjoy a slightly tamer ride.

If you prefer live-action shows then you'll find a constantly-changing number of family-friendly productions featuring costumed characters, live animals, singing, dancing, and acrobatic performers. The shows change by season, so make sure that you check the daily schedule to see what's happening.

Throughout the year Busch Gardens has a number of special events for their guests, and those include Christmas Town, Howl-O-Scream, the Real Music Series, Bands, Brew & BBQ, Viva La Musica!, Summer Nights, and a Food & Wine Festival to name a few.

Busch Gardens has been incredibly generous to the Tampa Bay Yelp community for the past several years, offering us a limited number of free VIP admission tickets and front-of-the-line passes during the Holiday season, and for Howl-O-Scream. They are class people, running a fantastic home-town amusement park.
Always a great place to take a lap and watch the animals. They have great walking paths with markers which make it a great place to go get out for the day and stretch your legs.

Not as good as it used to be in recent memory when Anheuser Busch was running the show. The Entertainment alone is worth a visit, the rides are overall fun as well. But I have become very disappointed in how they are running things, the vibe has changed dramatically. Not only have they been nickel and dimming the public but the customer service has taken a dive. They used to hand out free beer to the adults, those days are over... The food quality is not up to par considering the hefty price tag. I recently called customer service to verify when my annual card would expire, they provide me with the date making me believe they would stop charging my account, two months go by and I realize my account was still be charged, I call customer service thinking this was just an honest mistake I'm sure they'll reimburse me. Lol, never happened, they just said I should've been aware of the change after signing up, sorry. So what was the point of my original call??? Doesn't matter anymore, I felt misled and promised myself I'd never get the pass again. Bring the kids, I'm sure they'll love it. Just feel that the magic that used to be Busch Gardens is no longer there. My two cents.

awesome park!!! we went on every coaster they had there. omg, it was scary, thrilling & fun at the same time. my favorites were montu, kumba & sheikra. holy molly they were high as hell lol. i skipped the phoenix & the falcon's fury (hey a girl gots her limits). the serengeti train was pretty cool. at the end of the day they had fireworks. had lots of fun here will definitely visit in the near future.
Horrible and rude customer service from the workers today.  Especially Aries and Kayla working at the Cheetah Run entrance queue.

We went to the Christmas town at Busch Gardens in Tampa 12/20. Most the rides were closed and the ones that were open had 1-2 hour waits. Lights were pretty , but it was a $200 plus evening once you buy the tickets pay to park get a bottled water. We went close to dusk so we could enjoy the park and lights. We never even got to ride one  ride! I feel I basically paid for a walk through a park with Christmas lights and a 20 minute ice skating show ( show was excellent).  Way over priced for what was there. I'll never go again and I definitely don't recommend. I know Covid takes a toll, but put it on the website so people have an option to decide if 1-2 hour waits for the 1-3 open rides is worth the cost. We do one Christmas event and choose this one. Immensely disappointing!! Never ever again.

So online you had to make a reservation online , buy the tickets and then make a reservation for a parking spot. Once we arrived , we noticed they were letting in people who did not make a reservation for parking , did not buy a ticket as well. What is the point of a reservation and buying it online if you are going to let anyone inside? 

My bf and I had the quick passes and the lines for those were about 40mins to an hour. So it felt like a regular line. There are spots in the park for people to buy quick passes as well throughout the park any time they would like which is why I took so long. 

The food and wine festival there was my favorite part. You did have to purchase that separate. 

You have to wear masks at ALL times except eating or drinking. They will not start a ride unless everyone puts it on. 

There is social distancing on the rides as well.

This was my first time here and I had so much fun! The park was very clean, the workers were very friendly, and the rides were so fun! I went with a friend who had gotten our tickets already but honestly I probably wouldn't pay the park fee to come back again. I wouldn't spend all of that money just to ride a 30 second ride.

I do have to admit that the lines ran pretty fast and efficiently. The longest I waited today was 30 minutes tops. The majority of the workers kept the coasters moving quickly, resulting in the line moving quickly. 

My favorite coaster was Cheetah Hunt! In my opinion, it had the most twists & turns & drops & just seemed like the longest! I loved it! 

Overall, I give the park a 4/5 since I got in cheaply, however if I were to pay the park price, I probably would rate it a 3/5.
One of our favorite places to go w the kids!  We always get season passes.  There's so much for the kids to do and a ton of age friendly rides.  Also, Its clean and always a great time!

This park is at full capacity before it should be. It was so crowded and no staff to support that size crowd. We waited in a line to do literally everything- including over 45 minutes to just get from the main road to a parking spot. We were there nearly 12 hours and only got to ride 3 rides. They are taking none of the Covid pro-cations listed on their website. There is tape on the ground to mark six feet but that doesn't matter when there is too many people. You can social distance from the people in front of you but someone will be on your butt no matter what. None of the employees cared what you did & no body was stopped for not wearing masks.

Meh.... I don't know but maybe I'm jaded from the childhood memories of this place but it was kinda difficult to navigate. One of our family members is disabled & had crutches so we signed up for the program that helps cut wait time.... it was ridiculous. We literally had to check in at every ride just to be told to come back later to ride without the wait.... which required more walking (including my pregnant cousin) we ended up splitting up just to accomplish this efficiently. Not a great way to look out for disabled vets 

The food was pretty good. I would suggest trying the all day food pass but definitely plan out times in conjunction with ride wait times or you'll miss out.

What a disappointment! I've wanted to come here for years but never got around to it but I recently got the chance to go to howl o scream. I researched it online and I was super excited to see all the haunted houses, there were like 10 advertised. When we got there, we quickly found out that there were NO haunted houses, and that most of the rides were closed.  I know Busch gardens will say they disclosed this on the website, but I visited the website a few times and it was not conspicuous at all. The place had "scare zones" which were basically a couple people dressed up hiding in bushes along the pathway. The food options were also closed. As a first impression, this place was terrible! Our entire group of four was so disappointed, we wanted to leave after 20 minutes.  During this pandemic, people are savoring their social experiences and really expect to at least get their money's worth. Busch Gardens is welcome to reach out to me for info regarding a refund.

Not sure if it was because I was there on a Saturday or if the place is always this bad. Paid for two full price tickets and got to go on a total of 3 rides for the day. Waited on several lines for over an hour only to have the ride shut down, apparently this is a common occurrence. The park itself is no comparison to either Disney or universal. Wait times for rides are very long. The cost of a speed pass nearly doubles the cost of a ticket and you still have to wait on line. There are no single rider lines like a lot of other parks and everything is super expensive. Good choices are limited to greasy burgers and deep fried crap...nothing good!  Upper management here obviously has no clue about how this park operates.

Came here for the 1st time ever on New Years Eve with the wife and child(4 yr old girl). We thought it was really cool to combine a zoo & theme park, as we've never been to or seen anything like it. So as not to restate what the previous 200+ reviews have said, I'll simply list the highlights and what we liked.

1. Having a four year old is tough at some parks because they're usually too small for everything. We loved the Sesame Street area because it was just her size and there was plenty to do. This is where we spent a lot of our day. There were a few other rides in a couple of other places in the park for the 42in & under visitors as well.

2. You're closer to the animals here than I've ever been at ANY zoo(to include San Diego). The tigers(white & regular) came up to the glass and stared down the guests, and they also paced back & forth right in front of the nets outside(I could hear their breathing and footsteps). I also liked the little space where you climbed up the ladder into the glass box that they were sitting on and around. We also saw the giraffes and elephants too, but missed the other creatures(lions, gorillas, etc) because we didn't think to go see them before it got dark. The safari train during the day probably would have been cooler than when we went at night(we saw nothing).

3. The food at the BBQ place(Zambia Smokehouse) was GOOD! I actually wrote a separate review on that page for it. The short version is lots of food & delicious!

We didn't ride any of the coasters, but ended up spending a full day between shows(the Madagascar one is HILARIOUS!!) and the rides for the little one. We also got a caricature drawing and saw part of the band performance featuring LSU & Iowa. And did I mention this was all free(for military with dependents once per year)! We are actually looking at getting annual passes here, because I can think of way worse ways to spend a Saturday. If you've never been here, you've got to check this place out at least once.

I love this park! It's very clean and they are doing a great job during Covid. My only issue is one of the rides was closed and we asked if it was going to reopen that day and the lady called my friend a dumbass for asking. She said it after we walked away to another employee but we heard her. Also the park said it closed at 10 pm. At 8 pm the rides started closing!! They closed the rides in the back of the park to push you to the front and push you out! Then the lines at the rides at the front were very long. You should state that the park is open until 10 but rides stop at 8! They closed all of the rides except 2 and didn't tell anyone so you wasted your time walking to them.

Horrific experience visiting this park. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND. We got to go on 2 rides within 5 hours of visiting.  They kept shutting down the rides after we were waiting an hour in line.  Call center was extremely unhelpful and no email response.   Not to mention $6 for a small Powerade.  The place is a joke.

This place is bad. Got there when it opened and not a single ride was operational for the first two hours we were there before we left. What a waste of money! Not to mention the price we paid for preferred parking. Don't waste your time or money at this place! Highly disappointed to say the least! I would give it zero stars if I could.

I am a Tampa Native for 16+ years, I've grown up coming to Busch gardens.  Multiple family members have worked here. Overall lifetime rating I'll give it a happy 5 stars after my 30+ visits. 

Today however, this is easily one of top 3 busiest I've ever seen it, absolutely no way today was 50% capacity as mentioned and promoted by BG. 
They were not prepared at all for this volume of guest, from the 2-3 trolleys struggling, rude staff (just overwhelmed) to the 2 1/2 hour plus lines at multiple rides (haven't waited in line that long since the day after sheikra opened!!) 
 It Took 8 hours to ride 3 rides, Walk to a from and eat a quick lunch... WOW. 

POSITIVE: masks were strictly enforced, PLENTY of sanitizer throughout park, good precautions for Covid. Tigris was very thrilling! Christmas town was very well managed and organized!

I took my eight year old to Busch Garden this year (2016). She was hurt two times on the rides. The first one was on the very old ride called Scorpion. Her neck was injured and 8 months later she still has on an off pain. The second time she was injured was on the Blimpy Water Ride. This ride has no safety belt and I was sitting behind her. When it came down the water drop, I was pushed on her and she hurt her adult front tooth by hitting it on the seat in front of her.  Her tooth was moved to the front. I decided to report the incident this time. I should have reported the first incident on the Scorpion as well.  I told the risk management that these rides should be shut down due to not being safe, specially for the small kids. They only said if her permanent tooth needs work they will pay for it. That is all. I never heard back with a follow up even though the incident was reported to their risk control department. She has pain eating hard food now and the Dentist told us she might lose her otherwise healthy front tooth one they down the road.  I no longer trust Busch Garden and refuse to take my daughter on the old rides. I came to the conclusion that this company is greedy and only cares about making profits.

Wasn't too busy, but was mostly closed! Face painting closed, many bars and snack bars closed. A lot of rides either under construction or closed. Cheetah hunt, cobra coaster unsure of name didn't get to go. Iron grawa they advertise all over say it's opening this year but no definite answer anywhere and they don't have it posted on site only online, you can buy a map for $13 or use your phone for free. Food is average and not worth anything they close to what they charge. You can't bring a cooler or food in like you can at other parks. The day pass is more than a fun pass and if you live in the area you can get a annual pass $12 a month included free parking guest passes and extra perks.

If I could give them 0 stars I would. They keep animals in prisons. Big cats cannot run in tiny containment areas, elephants cannot roam in a miniature fake valley, 10+ alligators cannot comfortably live in a tiny fake pond area. The animals are prisoners captive. It's also owned by Sea World which is notorious for the emotional and physical abuse of their captured animals, with a orca tank minuscule in comparison to the parking lot. A sad, disgusting chain of "enetertaintment".

Busch Gardens is a main attraction for the Tampa Bay Area. I love going there on the non seasonal days. During the summer it brutal and hot but a great place to take family members who are traveling to the area. The food there is pretty good and if you need to get some sun for a couple of hours it's great for that as well.

Last year, I rated the park 5 stars on Tripadvisor, now I have an update.  We are Platinum members visiting at least twice monthly.  Last year, the all day dining experience allowed 2 for 1 beers and snacks along with meals every hour.  They no longer offer they 2 for 1 so I will no longer purchase the all day dining package.

My trip was amazing, went on a ton of thrilling rides and christmas town was just beautiful! All the animals were a sight to see and I just had so my fun. 

I was gonna buy my  sister a sweater for christmas and I sent her a picture but I already bought it cause i thought she'd like it, but I was wrong. She didn't want it so i thought I could just return it. I went to one store to return it and they said they needed their Supervisor to complete the transaction and that I would have to go to the other half of the park to find him. We had to leave around that time so we tried another store and they called the supervisor to come to us which was very sweet cause the other store told us to go to him when we didn't have time to. So Supervisor Zeke came to the rescue and gladly took care of us and completed the return smoothly and nicely. I have so much gratitude for him because he took care of us w/ a positive attitude, unlike the other store. Happy Holidays everyone, there are great people in the world. 

Thank you again Supervisor Zeke

First time here.
Christmas decorations were nice.
Food so so
Christmas music blasting from intercom all day and all night. Very loud. 
Relaxing train ride at night to view christmas lights ruined by blasting loud song of feliz navidad from train speakers. So loud couldnt talk 
Bathrooms were filthy.
Most had wet floors and garbage overflowing onto wet dirty floors. Yuck

I'm going straight to the roller coaster talk because why not? That's what you come to Busch Gardens for, the insane looping, twisting turning, gut-wrenching speed demons. 

First and foremost:
Cheetah Hunt! Cheetah Hunt! Cheetah Hunt! This is the BEST roller coaster in the park! Honestly, it's one of the Top 3 coasters I've ever ridden, and that includes ones in Six Flags. I've come to this park 4 times now, and the previous 3, I never saw Cheetah Hunt. So I did a search and saw it opened in 2011, 1 year after my last time here. Well, it was a pleasant surprise and lived up to its name...Cheetah. This is a FAST ride. But it doesn't just have one speed, it literally goes from fast to faster. It reminded me of those Mario Kart games where when you rode through the mystery box and got the speed boost. My girlfriend and I got off the ride, and just kept looking at each other for 5 mins asking "What just happened?". I never had a roller coaster shake me up, but I definitely felt my nerves, in a good way, after coming off.

It's funny seeing how age and time have changed me. When I came here in high school, Kumba and Montu were everything to me. But after riding them this time (which I did after Cheetah Hunt), they didn't wow me like before. Sheikra still is very cool, it has 1 of the most intense drops you'll ever experience, but it's also the shortest ride you'll experience. If I had to stand on a long line for it, I'd be disappointed, but going on a Tuesday and getting on within 5 mins, was so worth it and the ride was short but sweet!

Busch Gardens' jungle vibe is cool and exotic, and the rides are all designed appropriately to the park's theme. Being part zoo adds some extra fun, and I think I'll be really excited to return with my kids one day for these reasons. The train and sky ride are also great alternatives for when you get tired of walking. All in all, Busch Gardens is one of the many great parks we have here in Florida!

I love the rides but Busch gardens Tamp Bay could take a lesson from Universal studies about time efficiency for loading And checking the rides. 10 min to check passengers sometimes 3-4 times before letting the ride go. 2 cashiers in each restaurant causing the lines to be excessive. No tables available causing actual physical fights to occur. This Place has become very ghetto.  Waited in line for almost 80 minutes to order basic burgers and fries since you aren't allowed to bring food into the park. Take your money somewhere else not worth the lines and aggravation.

I don't even know where to start. No food anywhere. We found a churro. Dirty, no employees anywhere, no rides running except kiddie rides, too much money for basically a carnival that's about to be shut down. Save your money and don't go here.

My party and I parked on the far end by the water park. The water park is closed until next season but there's a trolly that transports people go the main gate. Parking is $25 dollars all day no in and out. We had passes which were quickly scanned. There is a rental center where you can rent manual and electric wheels chairs, strollers, for a discount if you are a pass holder otherwise it's about $5-$10 more. The first ride called Montu was not memorable. We took a train which took us through small fields of animals. The different areas were labeled referencing different countries. We visited animals in Nairobi then got off near the rides. the second called Sheirka was exciting and has two steep drops that I wasn't ready for lol. The Tiger ride was super fast and exhilarating while upside down. The final ride that I visited was the free fall. This was my all time favorite. The thrill of dangling in the sky and just falling left me shook for five minutes and the wait was only 30 minutes as opposed to the two hour wait for the others. Word of advice COME EARLY or pay the extra money for the skip line. Do not eat at the food court. I ordered chicken strips and fries. The fries were cold , the strips weren't even chicken and the drink was watered down. Other than that the park was great.

This park might have nice attractions but their app and overall experience sucked big time. A big fat F  for user experience. Too much people even in Speed pass lanes:(( Also horrible signage. They need a user experience team to help them fix this absolute mess!!!

The free beer is back! So that's another star. Tram is crowded, but it's doable to just walk to gate. Lines to get a ticket in front are long. Rest of the park is still amusing if you can find a discounted price.

COVID Gardens - Went in hopes they would have some semblance of caution and social distancing, but it is nonexistent. Many walking around with no mask "because they have a water??"  

Lines have no distancing.

All haunted houses are CLOSED! They did not state this clearly when you buy your tickets on their website. This is such a huge waste of money and the scare zones suck. Do not come!  Huge waste of money when you come with friends that don't ride roller coasters.

Tampa's African Safari amusement park! Whenever I've came to Busch Gardens, it's mainly to see the animals. I would go as far as to say that they're not known for their rides. Don't get me wrong, they have some pretty fun rollercoasters, such as the Sheikra( My favorite) and Montu, but the main attraction are all the animal exhibits and tours. 

We decided to go on the Serengeti Safari Tour! Whew I had a BLAST. We saw all types of animals, but being as giraffes are one of my favorite animals, I jumped at the chance to feed one. They were so calm and sweet.  I honestly don't think they gave a damn about us being there, they were more so interested in the wedges of lettuce the Safari Instructor handed to us to feed them. They also had a cameraman on our truck to take out photos which were available for ridiculously high prices after the tour. 

One thing I will say is that although I always have a blast here, it sure will cost you a pretty for just about everything. In my opinion, the only way to make Busch Gardens worth it is to buy the a citypass and visit multiple places in addition to Busch gardens because it costs most as much to get into the park. 

Also the tours can really add up in price as the safari tour was an extra $40 per person and you had to reserve your seats days in advance! 

Seems like I'm talking about money a lot but I just wouldn't want anyone to come here expecting a deal on anything haha. Otherwise it's fun for just about anyone regardless of age. I'd definitely come back if I were to visit Tampa again!

Fantastic theme park. Amazing roller coasters and pretty awesome safari attractions. 

Definitely go on an off day for short line waits. Also double check the weather. They will shut down everything at the sight of rain.

Wow. Forgot how great this park is, and so close to home. They do it right . For the Veterans Day weekend they offered half price admission for veterans and their family. 

Active duty personnel got free admission, families included.

Combine our great Florida weather, great rides, great attractions, and the all day dining pass, which includes 2 for 1 beers and u have a super fun day.

By the way u never know who you'll bump into at this great place, remember El Duque. He was there enjoying this great park.
Omg terrible park very dirty! Old spices! No missing your money in that park !! almost all the attractions closed not because of COVID but due to maintenance of how old they are !!

Price gouging.....$169.99 for a quick queue?!?! 
We loved Busch Gardens last year 2020 but this year it felt like they were taking pricing consultations from Disney!

Hello. Visiting from out of town .. went to one of the recommended rides , while waiting in line . Figured out a lot of things /rides / attractions wasn't working as I waited in line,  me and guest waited  70 mins . Unacceptable .. when we ask for fast pass,. definitely was more then the Price I came last time . Overall come to have a good time with family and friends.

What a bunch of uncaring people this corporation is.  The fireworks being blown off nightly when people have to work.  The veterans that have ptsd, the animals that live with fear.  You could have some respect and do it once a year, perhaps on the 4th of July,  not every single night through the summer. Just sad.

DOUBLE BILLING EZPAY CUSTOMERS!!
CHECK YOU BANK ACCOUNT!! 
They did this to us two years ago and refunded us immediately said it was taken care of. 
MARCH I noticed they hit my bank account call they owe us $1,232.34! 
It's NOVEMBER and still waiting. 
Funny they can continue to take $85 out of my account each month but can't refund even after 9 months of calling. Orders will be handled as they are received.

I have so many memories as a child - and adult - at Busch Gardens. Even though I never got to sample the free beer...it still ranks highly on my theme park list. Looking forward to attending one of the Hallow Scream events one of these years.....

The animals are nice, but you come here for roller coasters.

Montu - Probably one of my favorite coasters - of all time. Feet dangling, couple inversions - great ride. My wife actually went on it twice, and I think this is the coaster that got her to like (read: tolerate) coasters. I remember me and a buddy got to go on it like 8 times straight, front row back at a field trip in high school.

Sheikra - I'll admit I am scared of heights and this one goes high, but the biggest shock is the 90 degree (or nearly 90) drop down. That little pause at the top, then the drop. I hate it in a: man, I love it kinda way.

Kumba - My favorite....when I was in 5th grade. The old timer is still doing good and is still super fast even in today's "super coaster" world. Fond memories of Kumba.

Gwazi - The only wooden coaster in the park will do a number on your neck as it whips your head back and fourth faster than Willow Smith.

Haven't done cheetah yet, but I will next time.

Then there's the non-coasters that really round it out:

Congo River Rapids - Will leave you SOAKED! Make sure you have a change of clothes, or don't mind being dripping wet after riding this one.

Tidal Wave - So much fun here as a kid. We literally stood on the bridge for an hour, getting wave after wave to the face. Skip the ride, enjoy the bridge - especially for the kiddies.

Rhino Rally - A little boring, but still able to get somewhat close to some animals. It's worth it if there isn't a long wait.

Very disappointed today. In years past it was very fun. Half the stuff was closed. People using fast passes when the lines are already long enough because of everyone being afraid of a virus. Then online it says $20 fast pass but when you click it, it jumps to $59.99 a person. This is by far the WORSE experience I've EVER HAD. For the price of what we paid. The hours are cut. This was so disappointing. I will NOT recommend anyone coming to bush gardens again. At least during the Corona scare. It is ridiculous.

Little tip when you go to Busch Gardens if you have children and a stroller get the preferred parking and then tell them you have a stroller because that will knock you down back to the normal price but you will still be considered a preferred parking so I'll be back to $18 which is nice especially at the end of the day when your children are having a fit and you just want to get them to the car

To talk about getting in the way it wasn't horrible my mother paid for our tickets and also for the arm wrist band where you get all-you-can-eat meals which really means that you can get one meal with one side per hour at certain spots in the park and then if you go to the snack bar you can get buy one snack get one free like ice cream or popcorn or something like that which at the end of the day it pays to do that because it's pretty much an arm and a leg to pay for any kind of food

No the food itself it was decent the pictures showed it to be amazing and have a party in your mouth but I didn't have much of a party in my mouth and said I had just food in my mouth because I was hungry and that was the extent of that

It was pretty fantastic to see the animals like two year old son had a blast with train my daughter had a blast feeding the drafts on the Safari personally my favorite part was seeing the elephants and then also seeing the rhinos and the tigers and lions those guys were pretty cool

Make sure you have some good walking shoes some layering just in case it gets cold out be cool enough where you are able to stay cool clothes that are not see through when they get wet just in case you go on any what rides and if you do hold a small child make sure you bring a stroller you're going to need it was a lot of walking if not bigger than the Virginia Busch Gardens make sure you drink lots of water hydrate hydrate hydrate 

I would go back and I plan to go back it was a fun experience

I must say this experience today at your park was awful. I have been a pass holder for years and today makes me want to cancel and share just how awful this park is being ran. First, your website in purchasing tickets under my pass with 50% off didn't work so we purchased them under my partners. I called and spoke to customer service who said we needed to speak to customer service when we got to the park, and that she would note the account so they know that we did call them. She made reservations but we never received the email. We also purchased all day dining for most of our party. We got to the park and went to customer service only to be told there is nothing they can do but my 50% off tickets are there to be used at another time. We waited 50 min for food at the cafe by the front of the line because they had one side open. No soda, beer, bbq sauce. We purchased front of the line passes for 8 of us at that point due to lines. So you know we have spent a lot of money at this park! We tried eating at the smokehouse around 435 only to be turned away saying they closed at 430...even though the park closes at 6. We walked to the front of the park to ride cobras curse one last time. I tried getting a beer only to be told they close at 5 but there is another stand up front open. We walked up front as some of our party rode the ride and waited 10 min in line. Finally at the register at 535, we are told beer sales stop at 530. This entire experience was awful and would love for something to be done to show appreciation for our loyalty and wasted money today at the park.

This place has grown so much over the years. As a local the value of the annual Fun card is amazing! As they say pay for a day and play all year!! They also offer a free "preschool" Card for children ages 3-5. I would also recommend that one adult in your party upgrades from the fun pass to an annual pass as the annual pass will save you money! The annual pass offers free parking as well as a 20% discount on food and gift shops in the park. 
My favorite place to eat is at the Zambia Smoke house in Stanley Ville. It has the best pulled pork and coleslaw!! It is also very close to Sesame Street safari play area where we spend most of our time. This play area has tons to do, plenty of kids rides and a large rope bridge style jungle gym for the kids to climb over the entire area! 
Jungala is another fun area for kids as it has a tree top area for kids to explore as well as 2 splash pads (there is one splash area in Sesame Street play area as well). So it's a good idea to bring bathing suits even if your kids are too small for water rides.
Since this place is half theme park and half zoo we like to spend half our time in Africa!! This is where you can go to see the lions, elephants and hyenas! My favorite animal to visit is the hippopotamus!! This hippopotamus area is the best I have ever seen as it has both an above Water exhibit and an aquarium style area where you can see the hippopotamus swim with the fish and ducks! 
We come here very frequently, especially during the weekdays when there are less crowds! They have many events through the year with live music and fancy food pairings that can't be missed! Oh and try the fudge at sultans sweets it's amazing!!

This place is so fun, and I will always come back to Busch Gardens. But the employees there obviously hate their jobs. There was only 2 staff members that were actually nice. Everyone else was just rude . They need to take some lessons from Disney. If you can train people to operate the machines there, you should train them to smile and actually be happy. People don't pay money to be treated like crap.

Came here from Canada with the family and it did not disappoint. We got quick passes so the kids didn't wait more then a minute or two per ride! There was no problem social distancing since there was hardly any people there! Was so glad we took advantage of travelling while most won't right now! All the rides were awesome!! I made sure to read other reviews and read people leaving bad reviews cause people weren't wearing masks properly! Lol if you're that worried don't come to a theme park people! Highly recommend and will definitely be coming back especially if it's at less then half capacity

After 6 years we r back. We came during the pandemic and at first I was skeptical but overall it was very safe. Everyone had their masks on, so i felt safe. We also went during the food and wine. YUMMY! I got to see 38 special and Vanilla ice live in concert. What a treat that was. We experienced Tigris (WOW). The new ride Gwanzi still wasent open. There is always next year. yay!  Love Busch Gardens, its such an amazing park.

Who doesn't love a theme park? Theme parks are fun but they can also be exhausting. While visiting Tampa my family and I took my girls to Busch Gardens for a few hours. I don't even think we managed to get through the entire park. It was hot and honestly after we did all the kiddie rides we left. We were original suppose to go on a Saturday but it rained so they allowed my mom to move the tickets to Sunday. I will say they provide good customer service. However, their kiddie section wasn't that big and some of the rides were down. I understand some of the rides being down but the majority of them should be working of you charging people regular price. I feel if so many aren't working on a particular day, the price should be reduced for that day because essentially what are people paying for? The rides that the kids did get to ride they enjoyed. My youngest was too short to ride some of the rides but overall the girls had a blast! After so long, I think they were hot and we were all ready to go. Busch Gardens is a pretty big park. Like most amusement parks, be prepared to walk. The only other thing I did not like was the rides seemed so spaced apart. I know this may sound weird because you're thinking rides and they are huge, but something about the distance 3 rides took up/covered seemed off. Overall, it's a typical amusement park. I don't think it's anything special, but you can certainly have fun!

All rides down all day except one coaster and the drop ride. Got hooked into the drop ride and then it shut down. Waited an hour for the coaster right by it, then it shut down. Only a couple kiddie rides were going and not all of those, so even the little ones lost out. An extremely expensive day to walk around in the heat and be disappointed and see some animals and birds. Love the flamingos.  So call first to not waste your money.

This park is only getting three stars for just being an ok park. Things I loved about the park was the roller coasters were great!!!!! This is the only reason they are getting three stars and the only reason I would come back. BUT the park seemed dirty, the staff were mediocre and nothing sparked any joy other then the coasters. We had 2 kids under ten and most all the kids rides were shut down. This park could turn things around by training your staff to make a more memorable experience for their guest. And clean up a little.

Awesome coasters if you are a fan!! Sheika and Montu were great! Ticket bargains can be found online and an all day dining pass is a great deal. Be sure to take advantage of the b1 get 1 free alcohol with your dining pass. Lines can be very long for food and displayed ride wait times are sometimes way off. We are looking at you Cheetah coaster!!! All and all a good visit with a few just okay things. No intermittent rides for non coaster fans and food quality at some outlets really needs some improvement. The food and wine festival was a bust as drinks were minuscule in comparison the the other parks' similar festivals in the area.

First, I want to thank Bush Gardens for giving my family and I the Veteran's Appreciation passes for two years in a row! You rock! The whole park is awesome, the rides are awesome, and the animals are beyond beautiful. Someday I really want to do the Safari with my family to get a backstage view of the animal side and all that happens to take care of and preserve the wildlife. 
BG is doing their best to protect their patrons from CV-19, from requiring masks throughout the park, to social distancing, and to sanitizing the rides. But, this also cuts down on the time you can enjoy the park. On this day, Saturday, we were only able to enjoy two rides due to the extremely long wait. If you really want to enjoy riding as much as you can I would purchase the fast pass for $20. If not, you will be waiting 1.5 to 2 hours for one ride and currently the park hours are only 8 hours. Eating, walking between rides and attractions, and waiting in lines your time for enjoying rides is extremely prohibited. But, BG is doing the best they can and you need to plan accordingly. 
Thank you again BG for your attentiveness and safety measures but more importantly for your appreciation for veterans and our families.

Definitely no capacity limit or social distancing at all !!!!! 
Staffs DO NOT CARE ! I went to Disney and during this pandemic it was amazing staffs are always making sure everyone is SOCIAL DISTANCING And they DO have a capacity limit it's extremely smooth....  When you are walking towards the temperature screening everyone is just on top of everyone literally on your back once again no employees to direct the crowd, but Busch garden WOW ! Horrible! The marking on the floor 6 feet apart do not matter In line they might but like 5 people in between those lines. I did not feel save. Barely any employees it was a total mess. People skipping lines and employees just turn there heads. I big portion of the employees have a negative attitude like they don't want to be there and help they look at you with a face it's suppose to be fun and when you go to amusement parks and the employees just give you a face and don't greet you it will automatically give a bad expression of the park they represent the park. Not sure I will visit again it was so packed I got there at 10:30am and left at 7pm and got on 2 rides. Busch gardens that's why you can compare to Disney not even close because you don't run your company well. Island and universal does a better job.

As a longtime resident of central Florida I've been to Busch Gardens a lot over the years and it has changed a great deal since my first visit. We became annual passholders a few years ago because of the Sesame Street offerings at Sea World and Bush Gardens.  
My child loves the Sesame Street Safari of Fun.  There are tons of rides for him to enjoy.  One of his favorites is the swings and he has been riding them by himself since he was 15 months old.  Next to them is a Bird Egg ride which we can ride together.  They also have a "Dumbo" style ride with Snuffy, the cutest little log flume, a carousel, Count's cars, and a kiddie roller coaster.  Plus, they do a show and story time in the Sesame Street theatre and there is  a large splash pad.  Seriously, I can and have just come with my kid to this area for 2-3 hours and then we leave because he is wiped out.  
The cool part is that there other rides for little ones elsewhere in the park too.  Near Falcon's Fury you can find a train, motorcycles, airplanes, and another carousel for the little ones.  We usually take the train to this part of the park and that adds yet another thing my child loves because not only does he get to ride the train, but also look at the animals.  
For those who like thrill rides Bush Gardens has some of the best.  Sheikra is one of my favorite roller coasters anywhere.  That 90 degree drop is amazing.  I'm also a huge fan of the Cheetah Hunt roller coaster.  My favorite ride though is probably Falcon's Fury.  It's just a straight drop while looking at the ground.  Talk about getting your adrenaline pumping!
Food is your average theme park food and as such prices are pretty high for what you get.  I particularly like the place near Falcon's Fury because it's food court style so there are at least a good variety of options.  
Occasionally, they do special dining events.  My son and I did a Sesame Street breakfast around Christmas 2019 and we loved it.  
They also hold some great festivals like their Food and Wine Festival and Mardi Gras Festival which bring in some pretty cool concerts and musical artists.  
The only real downside of Busch Gardens for me is the layout.  It is essentially a big circle.  Maybe this layout is because of the animals, which is fair, but it does lead to some issues in the park.  I was at the park with friends and we were going to see a concert as part of the Food and Wine Festival.  We were at the wrong end of the park and there wasn't an easy way to back to the Festival area so we missed the first couple minutes of the show.  Secondly, when visiting with a little one it's a long way between the Safari of Fun and the area with the other kid rides.  If we do both we basically end up walking the entire park which a toddler/preschooler can't really handle.  So, if I push to do both it usually ends in meltdown, so I usually have to make a choice between the two.  
We love Busch Gardens and will continue to enjoy our passes.

I have been going to Bush Gardens every few years since they still had the brewery on the property, I have not been to the park in the last three years and not sure if I will be returning. I have seen a steady decline in the park since Anheuser Bush sold their business and sold the parks to another company as well. First thing was many of the attractions in the park were still closed, I understand this because of Covid, but all the large food vendors and   stores were open....then the worst part was the food, this had to be the worst dinning experience I have ever had, there is park food and then there is just terrible, this fell into the later category, the only thing that was not terrible were the fries, but come on, people are paying a lot of money for this, at least make an effort to make the food edible , but that was not the case....then there was the park, it was dirty and is beginning to look run down, few years back this was not the case, it (the park) is just not what it once was, defiantly second rate at this point....the rides are great as to be expected and I am guessing that this is what they are banking on, but the older I get the less I am riding the coasters, anyway, at the current decline rate of this park and the increasing cost to visit I can't see this place doing well...

I live near Busch Gardens and enjoy going during Christmas. The lights are spectacular. The lines are long so I don't ride much. I will not pay for the fast pass. I feel people pay enough to get in the park. To pay additional monies for a fast pass is ridiculous. They need a better process. But the lighted tree and musical entertainment is excellent.

Im giving this park 2 stars because literally half the rides weren't working because of "technical difficulty".....this was on a Friday.  Other then half the rides not working, the positive was all the employees were nice lol

Did not like it because they added in Blockout Days to where you have to wait for 50 minutes just for what? For you to have to pay an extra $25 for each person. And when you buy the passes they don't even give you a disclosure or even mention blockout days

While I love the rides at Busch Gardens and my boys and I did manage to have a fun-filled day of thrill rides, the COVID safety and enforcement of the park leaves a lot to be desired. While the lines were clearly marked and had people followed the "wait here" marks, people would have been staggered throughout the lines and social distancing would have been followed effectively. While I know that Busch Gardens cannot be held entirely responsible for the carelessness of its visitors, there was zero enforcement of rules while people waited in line. Only Falcon's Fury repeatedly announced the mask policy and made an attempt to space people the best they could. Other rides were just a cluster. People were too close - many didn't wear their masks (at all or properly covering their noses). I honestly only felt remotely OK because I paid $99 per person for the quick queue unlimited; waiting two hours in the conditions we saw would have been unbearable. And on some rides, rows were skipped and people were space nicely...while others had row after row of people and not any additional spacing between rows. Additionally, many of the sanitizer stations were empty and I questioned what was in the ones that were filled - as they were very thin and runny. I'd definitely recommend bringing your own sanitizer and lowering your expectations for a COVID safe experience. Overall, we had fun thanks to premium pricing but I was still disappointed with the level of enforcement, which made for an oftentimes stressful experience. Great rides, though, and we'll be happy to come back post COVID!
The Christmas Town lights will blow you away. We had. A fantastic day at the park and enjoyed all of the festive holiday activities.
The food is terrible the workers are very rude I have not enjoyed my time here...go drive two hours to Disney better than this place...

Not sure about this place yet, going to try it again and see what we really think.   The big problem is the layout, it is on par with an escape room.  You really have no idea what to do to get where you need to be.  There are no paper maps and the billboard type of maps were confusing at best!  There were also a LOT of rides closed down on the day we were there, (10/05/21).   Our grandchildren enjoyed it for the most part so we will give it another visit but honestly, I'm a little skeptical!

Overall a great experience!!!

Arrive at 915 930 to park, get on tram and get to park entrance. Get through metal detectors. 

Then... Pass Morocco and beautiful gardens as you go to left and get to Sheikra area by the flamingos. They make you wait til 1030 but RUN to Sheikra so you can ride it once early in the day with a limited line. 

This park has less open hours than Disney and Universal. If you like roller coasters though... It's a MUST. I'd recommend coming here for a Day 1 of a trip if you are also going to Disney or Universal because it is not as nice (what can compare to Disney?!) but again so many roller coasters so it's totes worth it!

Busch Gardens Tampa is probably the most underrated park in Florida- it's also my favorite. The park has a solid roller coaster lineup, as well as plenty of more leisurely activities in between, such as shows and animal encounters.

We will likely never come back to Busch Gardens after our experience today! It's like all the rudest people chose THIS day, the day we decided to attend, to also go to the park. It started with a group of 10 or so kids blatantly cutting from the very beginning of the cheetah, walking all the way through as close to the front one at a time (to be sneaky like) and stop right in front of us. When we called them out on it they just waited the jumped over the rope later to cut This sort of thing happened all day. On another ride (Cobra's Curse) there were 3 groups of two that violently pushed their way to the front of Cobra's Curse. If you dare stop them, they're ready to throw down! When you let staff know, they don't acknowledge the issue. Why bother posting signs that patrons will be removed from the park for cutting off there's no follow through? These patrons know that won't happen! 

Food is overpriced and eh. No one, literally no one, hardly wears masks! And it's no longer enforced. If that bothers you, stay home. People are up in your bubble in line. Social distancing is a thing of the past. At Busch Gardens, covid no longer exists! It appears they're open at full capacity as the parking lot was nearly entirely full when we arrived at noon. 

Lines are over an hour long in most cases and the park is only open from 8-10. You can purchase passes $30 per person per ride (essentially a fastpass) but even those lines aren't super quick. For that price I better get right on!

There's hardly any quiet spaces to sit and people watch, or just relax. 

The tables are gross and filthy. Cleaning seems to have stopped as well. 

Busch Gardens, you REALLY need to up your game! Yuck! Not worth the money!

FOOD AND WINE FEST REVIEW!

This was my first time coming to this event here. I appreciated how all the booths were kinda close together. Yes at times it got a little crowded however you do not have to walk very far in between. You can hear the concert music playing while you are at the tents for food and wine. That was nice. The free concerts are a big plus!! 

The lines were not near as long as the lines at Epcot for the food and wine fest!! A much more manageable size! Although Epcot's food is better in my opinion. There were some hits and some misses here. 

Another complaint I have is they were out of a lot of things we wanted to try. We did not get there right at the beginning so as we were walking around a lot of booths were already out of what we wanted. That was disappointing. 

I would return to this event again for the free concert and some beer. The wine and food was just OK but not worth the price in my opinion.

Love this park!!! Having a great time, but a little annoyed that I paid an extra $100 for the Fast Passes and it doesn't include the bumper cars or the train .  For the Scorpion ride the quick line was moving just as fast as the regular one.

My husband used his waves of honor vouchers to take us during spring break. For that we are very grateful. The kids got on the rides and had a blast. We had a bit of a wait for each ride but that was expected. If you're Looking to get on quick buy the quick que to cut the line. Most rides were open. However a lot of stores were closed and some rides too. We were a bit upset with lunch. We dined at the dragon or whatever it's called. I waited at the table while my husband took the kids to get the food. When he came back he said they made us throw away food we wanted. The cashier had said they could only get one side with a meal. He said ok I'll pay for the rest separate and she said no that he could only purchase the meal. No one or no sign said that before getting the food. He said ok well just go out it back. She said no it had to be thrown away! There was already a trash can full of uneaten food. What a waste!!!! I can't believe how much money and food just thrown away. The tables were cleaned as soon as people got up from the table. So bravo on keeping clean. They were pretty good with making sure people followed the mask rules. They also weren't super strict about it either. Other than the food waste, we had a good time don't know if we'll be back as we are from out of town but I hope they can open up more and fix the dining situation. I'm very happy that we were able to enjoy ourselves for free. The military family's really love this and appreciate it very much. There was a very patient and kind worker in the Sesame Street gift shop by the Sesame Street part of the park that was very kind and patient with me and all my kids wish I remembered her name.

I could give 0 start but unfortunately i can't. 
Bush gardens sucks. They are going so deep about the COVID teme by creating more restrictions, you are not allow to bring food or water into the park even if you want to eat a healthy food. The park is huge with just few fast Food kiosks with an extremely bad services. Today I'm here in the park started raining like crazy we decided to leave the park and surprise!! We have to leave by walking because they ordered to all the trains to stop because of the rain. They don't care for pregnants, kids or persons with special needs. 
I don't recommend to visit this park.....

Busch gardens has North America's first Dive coaster - Sheikra AND North America's tallest free-standing drop tower!!! That's Falcons fury! must-rides.

Whether you're 7 or 97 they have something for you! The zoo, fun rides, and shows - my favorite show is Opening night critters, the animals' performance is mind-blowing! There are a couple of rides where you can get wet but you'll be fine with breathable fast drying clothes or bring a waterproof jacket or poncho if you want to remain completely dry. 

There is a splash area for kids and an area under one of the rides that splashes water that a lot of people like to go to, you could take a bathing suit for that if you'd like. Also, you can rent a locker that's transferrable throughout the park, and there are lockers by most rides. 

There is (theme park priced) food and ice cream around the park. As well as some other things like face painting and caricaturing. You can feed animals like birds and kangaroos, and go on sort of a safari with the train. 

They also have fun events, like summer nights going on right now; they close late, have special summer menus, and end the nights with fireworks. The ticket prices are great, especially if you buy an annual pass, you get Busch Gardens, Adventure Island, parking and discounts included. 

Regular parking is far no matter how early you go; you would have to take the tram. If you have If you have babies/ strollers, you should be able to park close to the entrance. It can get crowded but it's usually less crowded during the week. Be sure to check the weather too as you usually can't go on rides when theres thunder close by. 

All in all, best theme park in Tampa!

Darn good place.. I love the roller coasters and bbn looking at the animals. I have a pass for Busch Gardens and Adventure Island and I only pay $13.60 per month through their Ez-Pay program.. It is worth every bit of that..

Busch Gardens is such an underrated theme park in Florida. I just got the annual pass and I have to tell you - you will NOT regret it! It's all the fun without the long waits or rude staff members. Every employee always has a smile and is extremely helpful. You would genuinely have no idea that you were in the heart of Tampa because of the atmosphere. Parking was a breeze and the dining was incredible! Busch Gardens is a MUST every holiday season! Howloscream was so much fun and their Christmas attraction is beautifully set up - great for pictures!
We waited in maybe one, five minute line, but that was the extent of our time in lines, the rest was quick and exciting! Honestly, don't waste your money on a fast pass here. The lines are short enough as it is.
STUDENTS: get your pass at the park for cheap and go all year long! My friends and I go for a few hours after classes and it's empty! I definitely recommend it!

Visited the park during this whole covid nonsense and it was dreadful! They expect guests to wear masks not only indoors, but ALL over the park- yes that means outside 12/7. So unless you are tolerable with the heat, humidity, mask combo I don't recommend. A lot of rides were closed, the main playgrounds for kids were closed. A lot of the smaller beverage and food places were closed. A lot of side vendors like face painting were closed. Parking is $25 and it seems as though that is always rising. Some pulled brisket and overcooked waffle fries was $19??? Lol. 

Just save your money and go elsewhere- no matter how "good" the deal might be advertised. This visit wasn't worth more than $50 in quality.

Seemed like a lot of rides were under repair.  There are attractions inside and there are extra charges for them, even like small games. The clientele appeared to be like thugs. People were cutting line and didn't care about anyone. This place is no Disney world and is a cheap imitation. Too bad as it used to be nice.  They need to step up their security and bring back the families.

Hands down, one of my favorite theme parks. I feel like there's a lot for everyone to do, since it's part thrill rides, part zoo. Fave coasters include Cheetah Hunt, Sheikra and Montu. I love that in the middle of a hot day you can also jump on a train and travel through the Serengheti Plains and see loads of animals, big and small. It's a nice little break in the day and always cool to have zebras walking alongside you.

As with most theme parks, food prices are steep. But, one of the things BG does have working for it is that some of the food is actually good. The BBQ place by Sheikra is good. Smoked meats, lots of variety and good side dishes. Also, the Colonial House over by Cheetah Hunt is a fave of mine when I want sit down service. You're in the A/C, overlooking the animals, and get decent food. Can't go wrong.

The shows at BG are also nice. Right now in the Moroccan Theater they have an ice skating show. Talented performers and it's fun to watch. Also, I forget the name of it, but in Pantopia there the animal show, with LOADS of animals that do tricks (dogs, cats, birds, horse, more birds, pigs, more birds, and even a mouse). My 7 year old LOVES this. Belly busting laughs!!

Regarding service in BG, everyone's friendly. The couple of times I've gone in the last year I've noticed they seem short staffed in some areas. For example they used to have people stationed periodically throughout long lines. They don't anymore, and the last few times I've seen a lot of line jumpers, and no one around to do anything about it :( Also, it's a bummer when you go on a weekday and not all the food stations are open. I get it, if it's not populated, why have the extra workers. BUT from the customer perspective, it stinks when half the food carts or locations are closed.

If you're local, it's a better deal to get the Annual Pass. Between the monthly offers and free parking, it pays itself off very quickly!

Fun Park, great roller coasters, but still needs work when it comes to handling large crowds....
After being at Disney World two weeks ago and seeing how organized and efficient way they run and manage huge crowds, I was disappointed in many ways with their inability to do the same. 
From the time we tried to find parking, there was confusion. Temporary signs had been used to point people to overflow parking that was very confusing and had many people stopping in the middle of the road to turn around.  
Line management was lacking and unclear, causing confusion in what line to get In, often times having.a lot of extra people lined up
For rides in the platform.
Too many intermittent technical closures of rides.
Trolley broke down, blocking traffic & preventing all other trolleys from leaving the front of the park, causing us to have to walk 3/4 of a mile to go to the next trolley stop bcuz they directed those arriving earliest to park in overflow parking (islands of adventure parking, at least a mile from the park entrance) while the main parking lot sat empty, only filling up later in the day.  
Lots of unnecessary frustration, but STILL good times had by all...

This was a fun place to go for our family, and a pretty good value for the money. Highlights for us were feeding kangaroos, train ride seeing animals, the circus, and the ice skating show. Food seemed better than expected for the money for a theme park, though my expectations were low. Free Beer! A few glitches with park opening at 10:00 am not really meaning things are "open" like the kangaroos and sesame-street-land (10:30 am for us).

Highly suggest you find something else to do with your family. Only gets a 2 star bc my toddler enjoyed the rides. She didn't enjoy the little water park so much, kids much bigger than her were not playing nice. Parents weren't watching their kids at the water park so we had to go before it became a problem there. As far as rides for adults.... A COMPLETE WASTE OF MONEY AND TIME. $300 down the drain. Long wait times, nothing is open. Food tastes HORRRRRIIIBLE.

I've been coming to Busch Gardens for over 20 years. Since the days Anheuser-Busch had a stable for the Budweiser Clydesdale horses and a brewery on site that provided two free samples of beer. I was here when they featured a lonely albino alligator and when the shows were more impressive than the rides. I've seen rides come and go and have done everything there is to do and rode everything there is to ride. Yet I'm always excited to return. I came so often at one point that we were season pass holders living in a different state!

Why? Busch Gardens to me feels like going to a really awesome public park. I know it's a theme park, but it feels like a festival. The combination of theme park, water park, landscaped gardens and zoo with a variety of theatrical shows thrown into the mix give me that childhood comfort of spending the day at jazz festivals with my family. Honestly, if I never rode one ride the entire day I'd be okay with it. I just like being here.


THINGS TO DO

I love the excitement of watching my tween children rush to be the first on a new attraction, like Cheetah Hunt, which is now in my top 10 list of favorite coasters. I love that my grandson finds joy in the toddler-friendly play areas and experiences awe and wonder in the bird sanctuary where beautiful lorikeets hang out on your finger as you feed them nectar. I adore the talent of the performers in the ice show and quality of the animal shows. As a matter of fact, animals ARE the show!

Everywhere you turn animals are on display. Giant tortoises, lazy Florida gators, cheetahs, elephants, playful orangutans opening their Christmas presents and white tigers who seem more comfortable in water than on land. You can feed kangaroos, sloths, lemurs, and experience the animals of Africa and Australia up close.


THE RIDES

My top favorite rides are:
1) Cheetah Hunt
2) Sheekra
3) Falcon's Fury
4) Kumba
5) Serengeti Railway


THE FOOD

Busch Gardens and SeaWorld seem to put more effort into their food than many other theme parks, which makes for a nicer experience. Turkey Legs are still our families favorite treat. Just seems like they go with the entire theme park experience.



FINAL THOUGHTS

Combined with the Serengeti safari atmosphere, new coasters being added every year and awesome shows, Busch Gardens gives you an ever-changing good bang for your family buck! Get the multi-park pass to Seaworld for only $10 or so more for 2 days of great adventures.


2016/52

Terrible park. 
Filthy and full of trash. 
Rides are always closed. 
They shut down the rides when a lightning bolt strikes in Orlando. 
The rides are worn out and out dated. 
They removed lots of benches. 
Smoking areas are not far enough away and patrons have to walk through the smoke.

To top it all off, they require masks despite City of Tampa, Hillsborough County and the ENTIRE STATE OF FLORIDA does not have a mask order. 
The park is a clown show.

I came here this past weekend for Howl-O-Scream and had a blast! It's not as busy as other theme parks which is great because it gave us more time to hit all the rides and houses. Scare zones and houses were good, and the overall wait times were short. Also, all of the rides are open which included the new ones. It was my bf's first time going and he loved it. My only complaint was that they charged more for parking for the event, but I guess that's with all  theme parks.

Do not spend your money here. Half the exhibits and snack places are closed. Very few animals are out. You must wear a mask but no such thing as social distance in ride lines which are all over 60 minutes. It might get better after spring break but why not have exhibits open when they are so busy. Worst waste of money I've spent in Florida.

Great time with the family and friends always lots to do and good food to eat. Show up early for good parking and quick ticket pick up. It gets hot so sun Reem is always a must if you have a child that can't ride by themselves they will give you a skip the line ticket.

Save your time and money.  Zero social distancing in long lines, but running rides at half capacity....makes no sense.  Only a handful of food stands were open, and over an hour standing wait for fries and burgers.    Biggest waste of time

The rides that we were able to get on were fun (that's the one star). They REALLY need help. Hire more staff and until then have a cap for the day until people decide to get off their rear ends and start working again. Their wait times were WAY off! A 15 minute wait  ride would take an hour. 30 minutes was 2 hours. Really wish we could've afforded the speed passes, but the price isn't worth it for Busch gardens.

Back in the 80's this was THE place to be. Now it's an old has been. 
Rust on the flume ride is unacceptable. Cracked sidewalks, closed vendors and depressed workers. Walking past the flamingos was a horrific stench.  You would expect some smells but this was gross.  
Stayed a couple of hours and left. Complete waste of money.

They don't actually check your temp, masks aren't enforced at all most people weren't wearing one, they make you make a reservation so you think there's a limit to capacity but there is none. Took us over an hour to get in with how long the lines were & absolutely no social distancing. Also most rides were shut down or had 2 hour wait times

I only gave a star because i had to. This whole family of parks completely suck: busch, seaworld, aquatica. They don't give a flying f about the customer. No one competent works here and they just let their teenage employees be rude and sarcastic while they tell you complete lies and send you to different counters where you have to repeat your story and still not get helped.

Why sell a photo pass if more than half of the rides on the list are either not running or the camera is broken and why in the hell would you make the customer have to remember when they went on the ride so these undertrained pisspoor child laborers have to search the database for it?? And why can't anyone just give a stupid refund? How are you going to have absolutely no manager in the area each shift to process refunds when managers can only work in their section??  And if someone is having a bad time at your stupid parks why tf would you offer them free return passes? Not a single person wants to return to this purgatory.

I have been to a lot of amusement parks in the last year so I feel like I can make an accurate assessment and this is by far one of the best parks I have been to in a while. Not only were the rides epic and thrilling but the animals were amazing. This parks is perfect. It has everything from kids zones, plunging coasters, exotic animals, to live shows and safari expeditions. Thanks to the waves of honor military program my family and I received free tickets and discounted tickets for a return trip. 

The park was not as crowded as we expected which was nice. Lines were still a bit long so we invested in a quick pass. Best decision ever. No lines and we were able to ride all the coasters multiple times. This park was wonderful and we are already planning a return trip in the spring.

Was a bit weary of coming here during Covid, but I had such a good experience that I don't regret it.
