Rides were periodically spritz with sanitation sprays and then went through a ride cycle without any riders to allow the seats to dry off. Handrails were wiped by employees and temps were taken when you first entered the park. 

Another perk was that we went on a Thursday early on in the day and stayed until about 3pm and managed to ride all the rides we wanted to and some even more than once. The lines were much more bearable - typical wait was about 5-10 minutes.

This park is run by Seaworld!! 

Park was fun, glad I got to ride Sheikra, however the food was awful and I had an unpleasant experience with guest services. Also, the animals looked extremely sad compared to the animals at the Lowry Park Zoo where I'm sure there is a tremendous difference in conservation efforts between the two.

I purchased a "two-park pass" during the "memorial day weekend sale" 50% off. Of course under the fine print the exact weekend the sale was advertising was blacked out. I was let in to Busch Gardens in the morning however was turned away at Adventure Island Water Park. I was told by Gabby at Adventure Island that I could get my two park pass refunded however when I returned to Busch Gardens for the refund Marilyn who seemed to be the manager was rude and not very accommodating to my situation. The situation could have been handled better on the ground level and could have been avoided entirely without the expected shady business practices of Seaworld.

All in all, If you are dying to ride some rollercoasters it could be fun but unless eating an overpriced dogmeat hot dog and looking at depressed komodo dragons integrated with your rollercoaster experience is your thing go to the beach instead. Not returning.

Awesome park and it's great if you're a coaster junkie (as of making this review, Iron Gwazibstill isn't open and the park chain manager has said nothing. Especially since Velocicoaster opened at Universal Orlando. So keep that in mind) other than that the park as a whole is fantastic. The animals are great to look at and the park as a whole is clean

So much to say.  Great place for kids and adults.  I got annual passes so I can come and go as I please.  Parking is easy.  During week it is dead so I avoid the weekends.  My 4 year old loves it.  

Lots of Florida specials.  I also got a preschool card which means my son is free all year.  

Food options healthy ones too.  Ton of walking though so beware of that!

This is a very good amusement park. It's big, but not obscenely large and the rides are top notch especially if you like roller coasters and thrill rides. 

I love theme parks and I've wanted to go for years so now that I've finally gone I'd totally go back again. 

For me the thing that stood out is how awesome the attractions were and the focus on the coasters was surely welcome, but the feeling that the modern conveniences and finishes that you tend to see at places like Universal or Disney were missing here. 

Lockers for rides cost .50 per use as opposed to the electronic ones you can use at other parks for free. The bathrooms were dated and in need of updating as well. These aren't deal-breaker issues, but I'd like to see the addressed at some point.

The rides are AMAZING. The footprint of the park is such that they don't make you walk a ton from one attraction to another like other parks. You won't be exhausted the way you can be with a lot of negative spaces between rides, and therefore you can easily do the whole park in a day.

A fun, but not overcrowded, theme park and zoo! I loved wandering around and seeing the animals one minute and flying around on a roller coaster the next. I was not prepared for all the spinning on the coasters, but that's my own fault for doing a few of them all in a row. Since my girlfriend used to work here with the animals, I got an even more detailed tour. I will definitely be back in the future!

Loved this park when I was a kid, but as of now don't waste your money here. Went here for my birthday today, and half of everything was closed when we went. Pretty much all of the decent food vendors were closed, and we bought the "all day dining pass." More like the all day sh** your pants pass. This turned out to be a huge mistake. You are only allowed 4 food vendors, and all of them have food reminiscent of a county jail and like 2 options of dishes. Seriously the worst food I've ever had a tiny school lunch pizza is $15. And I'm sorry but WHY IS A WHITE CLAW $10?!?! Anyways don't waste your money until COVID is over.

I would say the best time to go is M-F if you want to be able to get on all the rides without waiting 1-2 hours for a ride unless you get the fast passes. Getting the silver yearly pass is worth the $$ for sure :) cobra curse is definitely a fun little ride to get on. The atmosphere is nice but the only downside is that the bathrooms aren't in the best shape haha but what can
Food service is criminally mismanaged. Never in my life have I seen such horrible customer service.

This review is specifically for the Christmas Town event.

Whoever handles logistics for this failed miserably. The lines for each food and drink stand are too long and slow, because each is understaffed. Also, each food stand should also offer a drink. That will reduce the number of booths that people have to go to.

We got there at 7:30 and a lot of the booths were out of parts of their menu. You didn't expect it to be busy on a Saturday night?

To make matters worse, there was no communication about items being sold out. I only found out that what I wanted was gone after standing in line for 20+ minutes. That happened twice. It's not hard to put a note that says "sold out" on the sign.

The lights are pretty, though.
I love this amusement park because the rides are thrilling and a great way to spend your weekend.

Well I have been going to this place since 1977. I have seen this place change over the years. I have never seen this place so very frustrating to go to. I truly believe when you open your place of business it should be completely opened.  You get there the parking lot opens about 9:30am. You pay $28.00 U.S. or $14 if a pass holder. The ticket for 1 day at the gate is $109. So you go to stand in line to get in. At 10:00 am you go in the gates. Can you ride the rides, go to sesame street, or go see animals, no you cannot. You have to wait till 10:30am for some of the earlier attractions to open, even the concession stands aren't open. If you want to ride some of the rides, you have to wait till noon. Some places don't even open till a line forms and the attendant has to finish with another ride. This is Florida it's very hot and humid. If your handicapped and have a parking permit you can get kinda close to the gates sometimes. They are painting the parking lot which could be done at night. Be prepared to go a football field distance before you get to the only gates to enter. Your being robbed of so much when the WHOLE park isn't opened all the way.
If they treat paying customers this way, how are the animals and employees treated?
 Don't give a "standard" reply about contacting at an email or a premade answer, like you have done to so many before. Just fix the problem.

We went on August 9th 2020 and we Totally regret it!! We were there about an hour and they had to shut the park down due to a Thunderstorm. We were already disappointed when we arrived because we paid $25 for parking and they closed almost the whole lot so we had to drive around till someone left! When we got here we couldn't even find all the animals, the website is so deceiving they show 17 animals and all we saw was a flamingos, tiger and orangutan. And a whole lot of bird exhibits. We paid $90 a person and we didn't get to ride any rides or see hardly any animals, what a joke! Also there was no enforcing the Mandatory face coverings, hardly saw any employees except in the store or ride entrance but when it started to storm you couldn't find an employee anywhere. Please don't waste your money, we wish we would've just added another day to Disney World, Way More Fun and they enforce the mask rule! Sent in a complaint to at least get some money back for being such a disappointment, they replied back a month after I wrote it saying tickets are non refundable but we can go back?? Not ever going to happen even if it was free!

Not much to do unless you LOVE roller coasters and don't mind a long line.  We bought cups to refill drinks all day for 15 dollars...once you got in the park there wasn't a place to fill them up!  All the vendors were shut down except the ones that sold bottled drinks!  All the animals seemed miserable!  It was so hot and they were all sitting by their doors almost pleading to get out of the heat! There were also very few animals.  Seemed like a confused theme.  Is this park animal based or ride based.  If it's about rides you need to add a variety of them.  If it's about animals you need more of them and you need to treat them better!

My family have annual passes to Busch Gardens Williamsburg, so we took advantage of the 50% rate for annual passholders at BG in Tampa. Otherwise I would have spent $300 for single day passes. This place is huge, so one day won't be enough for first timers.

BG Tampa is very large and hard to navigate. I literally had to ask for help to find my way out of certain areas. Things are not clearly marked. While we went a week before Christmas, this place was PACKED. I guess that's the bad thing about a Florida theme park, there's never an off season. 

By far the best part of BG Tampa are the animals. You must take the train, as it winds it way through an open zoo without fences. BG does a better job with their african animals than Disney does with their Animal Kingdom safari.

The downside to BG Tampa are the rides that break down often. Cobra's Curse spent more time broken than actually running and my daughter never did get to ride it. The size of the park is too large to see in one day. BG Williamsburg is tiny in comparison. There was a lot I didn't see and wished I could, but the crowds dissuade me from ever returning.

BG Tampa is well worth the visit, but plan on at least two days. Avoid going at christmas time and summertime, as the crowds and heat in Florida are beastly, respectively.

Always a great option, just to walk around, fun activities, beautiful lights and shows. There's something for everyone! I'd recommend getting a fast pass it's definitely worth it. Plan to go early to get the most out of the experience!

Let the kids skip school, and went on a Friday. The crowds weren't bad. Frustrating though because they closed at 6pm and the restaurants start closing at 430pm!  Do not waste your money on the all day food pass!  The quick que was worth it. The employees are not very friendly.

Busch Gardens was definitely fun and would like to return on a less busy day. We went on a Wednesday during the Christmas Holiday season and they did not seem ready for it. Restaurants remained closed, causing longer than usual lines for food. Lines for coasters were typical for a theme park. I look forward to returning and exploring more of the park, as 1 day is not enough to do everything.

Less of a review of the park (or which would be a 4+ star mostly glowing review) and more about the parks handling of Covid safety procedures.

This was our sixth park in six days (Sea World Orlando & the four Disney parks preceded this one) and over 30 visits last year to my home park (Six Flags Great Adventure) and this was by far the most lax when it came to enforcing procedures. 

Early in the day there were employees stationed in pathways directly reminding guests to wear masks properly but by 2pm there were none to be seen.

The absolute worst (trained or caring, not sure) was the Tigris crew. We were in line for over 35 minutes and it wasn't until we were in the station that any announcement was made reminding people of mask usage. More than a quarter of the line either had their mask under their nose, on their chin or completely off for almost the entire time in line, including when they were directed to rows and seated on the ride. One of the crew members had their mask under their nose and she was checking restraints. What's amazing is this was the only ride we encountered throughout the day that was disinfected while we were in line (though in hindsight, despite the announced delay, it could have been for cleaning for more a more common reason on a coaster), which made the lack of acknowledgement of guests incorrectly or not wearing masks surprising.

Fortunately, this issue wasn't encountered to this extent on other ride lines and most of the food locations were running well, with Zambia Smokehouse being the one exception due to staffing. To exit the food line to to cashier you had to navigate through the line entering the food line. Sea World solved this problem by having an employee hold guests at one part of the line to prevent crowding and that would have been a big improvement here.

One other major thing missing throughout the park was plexiglass between narrow switchbacks in lines that couldn't be spaced out. Most lines were moving fairly quickly, but the areas that couldn't be spaced out also tended to be the most congested. Another area that could be improved with better staffing.

Overall, it's still a great park, but maybe not one you want to visit right away without a Covid vaccine.

We loved our day at Busch gardens despite not being roller coaster people. The ice show, critter show and train ride were our favorite attractions. There are lots of animals, cute shops, decent food for a theme park... parking is steep (25$) , especially after buying tickets, it should be included.

Amazingly you wouldn't know you were in the middle of Tampa with all the foliage. 
   Lot of coasters but enough rides for all ages. Nice how the animals are located throughout the park. The train circles around the park and goes through the Serengeti so you can see the animals roaming. 
   Went during the week after school started back and basically empty,  best time to go if you can. 
Park clean and bathrooms kept well.

Well, this is going to be an interesting post to write. I'll start by laying out the time frame I went in, which was Spring Break.

 The lines were as expected, long but they moved at a good pace. The crowds wasn't to bothersome or unruly. Everyone wanted to get in the park, go get on rides and enjoy the many adventures Busch Gardens had to offer. 

I got in free on this occasion due to my job but if I had had to pay I would definitely be giving this review a star or two less. 

Reason being, most of the food vendors either ran out of food, which we didn't find out until standing in line for 30 minutes or so. Or they didn't have enough staff to move the product efficiently. 

Another thing that blew my mind was that it was spring break and as we got off one ride expecting to get on another roller-coaster ride. We find out that it's shut down. Okay...... on to the next. The next one was shut down too. Luckily they had little carnival style games to play while I figured out what course of action to take while I wait for one of the rides to open up. We ended up finding the more so kiddy roller-coaster rides, which finished up the day for me after about eight hours of standing up and walking around. 

I'm not sure if I would go back or not. I will say that I've been to a few parks that seemed a lot better up kept, better customer service and the rides kept going.

First of all, PLEASE please, ignore bad reviews!!  Busch Gardens is an amazing park.  Also remember that the animals came before the rides, so don't try to compare this to a regular theme park.  We first visited Busch Gardens 11 years ago, and hadn't visited since.  I was excited to see what's new.  We were really amazed with how themed and expansive the park had become.  Everything was clean and brightly colored.  The animal exhibits are incredible.  You get to be so close to so many amazing creatures.  Make sure you see the cheetah run while you're there, that was awesome!!  Man they're fast!!  I also highly recommend doing the add-on safari tour, where you'll get SUPER close to giraffes.  It was AMAZING!!!  It was like sensory overload, we felt like little kids again.  Also the giraffe bar was really nice!!  Great cocktails, with an amazing savannah view.  Make sure you feed the lorikeets.  Well worth the money!  They are so stinkin adorable.  My husband had 1 on his head, 1 on his shoulder and 1 on his arm.  They were licking his ear, pecking his hat, and trying to nibble his hair.  It was so funny and cute.  We love so much about this park.  As far as the rides go, I'm 38, my husband is 40...we don't really care for roller coasters much anymore.  I get headaches so going upside down has become a no no for me.  But the rides look really cool!!  We did go on a couple tamer ones, including the carousel, hahaha, and had fun.  So if you're 40+, you will definitely enjoy this park, even without the rides.  We also really enjoyed the train ride through the savannah, it offered views you can't see anywhere else in the park.  If you have food allergies like me, I recommend the smokehouse.  And if you want to save $$ on drinks, buy the refillable cup, it's free refills on the day you purchase it.  We had fun refilling at the create-your-own Coca Cola fountains.  I recommend 2 days in this park, even if you don't go on the roller coasters.  There's just so much to see, you don't want to rush it.  And wear good walking shoes!!  We walked about 14 miles the two days we were there.  Also do yourself a favor and purchase the preferred parking, it's definitely worth it. Save that walking for inside the park.  Now go get those Busch Gardens tickets!

The bacon burger from all over Busch Gardens is disgusting. I paid $80 for a meal pass and all we got to eat was pizza and a disgusting cheese burger since the lines were ridiculous for everything. I wish I could get my $80 back since the food they provided us was not nutritious at all. Sweating and being dehydrated and then eating pizza and fries made me want to throw up. The meat in the burgers should not be allowed. I feel like I ate dog food.

I like their rides way better than Universal's. I don't recommend spending the NYE there, because it's very unorganized when it comes to food and the trams for the parking lots. 

I also think that the space for the elephants it's too small, which makes me very depressed when I walk by their area. Same for the kangaroos: there're way too many of them for a tiny space.

Otherwise, it's a good spot.

We have always loved Busch Gardens when compared to all other FL theme parks.  We went there today hoping to be able to be in a safe environment with COVID protocols.  It was horrible.   Half the people there do not wear their masks or wear them under their noses.  No one says anything to them.  By the end of the day we were definitely in the minority of masks wearers.  If you want to be safe stick with Disney.

Came here on Veterans weekend to use my free ticket. Always appreciate that they've given military and their dependents free entrance since 2004. You get the tickets through Waves of Honor. 

We got there at about 1pm, they place was packed and they were out of preferred parking. They were only open until 7pm sadly. 

We did get to ride many of the rides but 6 hours doesn't give you enough time to make it through the park because the roller coaster lines are ridiculously long. 

I highly recommend paying the $12 to feed the kangaroos! They were super cute and photogenic. You can also arrange a sloth interaction. Recommend booking ahead online, they only have 6 slots per day and only 1 time. Needless to say, we missed that.

Cheetah Ride....wait in line for at least an hr.

I am built like a linebacker.  Not fat.  I did not feel comfortable sitting in the ride chair and the connect strap was an inch short.

I did not ride the ride....We left.

$25 for parking plus ticket cost for zero rides.....not my happy place.

Save your money and go to Disney.

I'm a little surprised at some of the reviews I saw with only one or two stars. The only line that had a long wait all day was cheetah. We did quick queue passes, so we didn't wait hardly at all, but the lines were only about 15 minutes, at the longest. Cheetah had 95 minute wait. I was disappointed that the kids area was only half open; the big tree house play area was closed. Food was very expensive, but we expected that, and a lot of the small kiosks were closed. It was hooooooot! But, it's Florida in the summertime, so duh. Water rides were a blessing! A lot of fun to be had.

Wer Achterbahnen liebt, ist hier genau richtig (ich glaub, es gibt ca. 9 Rollercoaster in diesem Park). Damals war gerade die Achterbahn "Sheikra" neu. Auch der afrikanische Flair ist einfach toll. Hier kann man viele Tiere sehen und eine kleine Safari machen. Also auch eine Mischung aus Zoo und Rollercoaster-Paradies. Bisher habe ich diesen Freizeitpark 2x besucht. Auch wenn es schon viele Jahre her ist, erinnere ich mich immer wieder gerne daran zurück und würde ihm immer wieder einen Besuch abstatten. Der Eintritt liegt mittlerweile bei 86 $ (Online Ticket, Sparwert 25 $)
Visitors beware and check ride closures before visiting - extremely disappointed -most of the rides were not operating.   I recommend Lowry Park Zoo over BG!!

This is your typical amusement park. We went on a Tuesday so it was not too crowded. We had to wear a mask the entire time and they did a temperature check upon entry. This place could use a facelift! It felt kinda old and rundown. My kids were able to ride a lot of rides while there. The food was overpriced as with any amusement park. I really enjoyed the train ride to see all the animals. That was the highlight of the whole park for me.
Very friendly theme park with lots of rides, dining options, and animals. If you like animals or thrill rides this a must visit place. Great for family big and small.

This was a horrible experience. We went on a Wednesday, and all I can say is prepare to wait. I hope you bring food or snacks because there were entire sections with nothing open. The employees treated this place like a job, doing the bare minimum to get paid. If you go on a weekday, spend the extra money on a quick queue and skip the dining pass. The time you save will be worth the wait, and use the dining funds to pick up meals before and after you go to the park.

LOOK OUT!!!
Dine All Day doesn't include Beer or DIPPIN Dots or churros or pretzels.......
NO MORE BUY ONE GET ONE ANYTHING!!!as of December 31st!!!
No one told me of the changes when I bought my pass went to customer service was refunded.
Cut out saving for guests to be able to pay employees $15.00 hr minimum wage soon.

Busch Gardens is a great value for your money. There's something for everyone! They have great rides especially for the thrill seekers who like roller coasters. If you are like me and don't care too much for the rides, there are plenty of awesome animal exhibits to see and shoes. They have some great interactive activities like feeding wallabies and the bird aviary. Also, the food in the park is pretty good; I recommend the Zambia Smokehouse near Sheikra

So I went to Busch Gardens and as soon as we got there people was telling us the park was closed and we was trying to figure out why because we had to pay 25 dollars for parking so then we walked to get in line  to get to the gate and the line was so long it took about 30 minutes then when we finally got in it was so many people it took some time trying to find rides and we only got to get on 3 rides and we been there since 11 o clock am the rides line was so long it was either 1 or 2 or 3 hour wait then the parked closed at 9 and a lot of other people said they only got on 3 rides two. I been to Busch gardens plenty of times and it was amazing but this time it was just ok. I recommend not going until COVID-19 is over

So, funny story, went to Howloscream during a tropical storm (Nestor). Greatest time of my life. Was helped by so many folks, first and foremost thank you for having ponchos kinda when you walked in at the entrance ($10) best damn thing I bought while I was there. Got a souvenir cup with a cocktail for $15.99; refills for the cups were $9.99 (alcohol only for them cups) awesome. Went to bayou haunted house, the slaughter one, black pierl? I am not sure and ended the night with Fiends. I was happy with the fact some of the workers decided to be outside to scare us even during a tropical storm. Those folks who did that need some recognition.

We had a great time.  We took friends with us who had never been before.  They had kids our kids ages and they just enjoyed riding everything together.  The staff is abundant and helpful.  The park is clean and functional.  They keep investing in the park and so it seems like it is planning on being around for a while longer.  The summer nights are fun.  We actually had a tailgate party in the parking lot around dinner.  The kids went back in to ride one more coaster before it closed.  We sat and watched the fireworks from the parking lot as the kids made their way back to the car.  The getting in and out was relatively simple and non frustrating.  Except the $25 to pay for parking.  That isn't fun...but cheaper than Disney I think.  It clearly isn't Disney but man, not being in the mad chaos of Disney is super sweet too.  If your kids like coasters or if you do, this is a great place to go...lots of unique coasters I haven't ever seen before.  Well worth it in my book.

I've been going to Busch Gardens for most of my life. I've always loved coming here. I love getting to see the animals and hear what the trainers have to say. The rides are great and employees are enthusiastic and friendly.
I'm sad to see that a few rides I grew up with have been closed but I can't wait to see what they do with the space.
Food here is fairly pricey. They have awesome deals on drinks though! If you buy a plastic Park drink cup (that's a nice size) you get free drinks for the rest of the day. And when you come back another day you only pay $0.99 per drink refill (includes icees). Definitely worth getting!

I'm not sure what this amusement park is like in a non-Covid world, but in this current world it is not a very fun place to visit. They are requiring that you wear a mask at all times which is a major health issue. It was about 85° the day we went and within a couple of hours our masks were completely wet. I know that a lot of the workers were pulling their mask down below their nose is as well and all were suffering equally.  The park had a number of rides that were not operating including the skyline, the iron kwanzi coaster, raft water ride, And none of the shows were open. The hours were 10 to 6 with most of the roller coasters not opening until 1030 or 11. If we did not have fast passes we probably would not have got to ride all the rides are would've spent the entire day standing in line to try to beat the 6 o'clock deadline.  We also noted that there were not very many food stands open along the way which caused us to have to find places to eat they were not convenient. We just did not feel like we had a fool amusement park experience and based on all the complicity we have seen on this park over the years it did not live up to our expectations.  I'm not sure we will be going back because I think our money would be better spent maybe at one of the Orlando theme parks.

First, it is obvious that this park lacks in reinvestment.  Many rides are not running at their optimal cycle times.  Rides were designed for 2 or 3 loading stations but they only run 1 or 2, respectively, increasing the ride wait times.  This is most likely due to lack of maintenance dollars to keep all stations running and cannibalizing parts or just shear unwillingness to staff the ride appropriately.  Another potential is that they are trying to drive add-on business by selling more quick queues.  

Ride wait times are very inaccurate never on the good side.  Cedar Fair, Disney and Universal do this much better.  

I paid $200 for 2 quick queues and still struggled to have a great time not due to wait times obviously but mostly due to other reasons.  I am referencing wait times based on talks with people who did wait in line and asking them their wait experience.

Many rides are dated in a bad way.  Not in a nostalgic wooden roller coaster way.  There are 4 that we really liked: chakeira, Tigris, cheetah hunt and Mantu.  These however fail to compare to the mega coaster era but are fun.  

The worst part, you buy a cup that is refillable but the stations to refill them are far and few between.  And once you get there, you have to wait in a 15 minute line to pay $1.00 for your refill.  Here is a pro tip, automate the coke freestyle machines and put them out more frequently.

Locker rentals are $8 a day.  Ok, nickel and dime you but expected.  Food is terrible and expensive.  The pizza was the worst.  The BBQ is mediocre but extremely expensive.  $12 for a turkey leg is highway robbery.  

If the President of the company were to follow a day in the life of the average attendee, they would realize the folly of their business.  I will fly down and share the experience with the president, so that they can see how dismal it is at all their parks I visited: Busch Gardens, Sea World and Aquatica.  

Sea World was by far the worst experience, again even with quick queue.  The penguin ride was hotter than hades waiting in a tunnel of fake ice and no air movement.  At gardens, the cobras curse is a stroke away from a law suit.  No air movement, hotter inside than outside.  All to cut costs.  

Cut costs is all I saw at all three parks.  If that is the memory you want left in the mind of your visitors, well done... well done.

Busch Gardens: Hear me roar!  Ok, you won't really hear me roar but you might hear a lion roar.
This place is awesome.  The best two things about this park: the all-day-dining deal and the animals including the safari.  
If you are planning on going to Busch Gardens this summer, purchase the all-day-dining deal.  It's totally worth it and not only can you eat all you want all day long, you get 50% off of the outdoor vendor kiosks.  So a bottle of water for $1.25, not bad, huh?  The other thing I suggest is the quick queue unlimited or what I like to call: the skip the line pass.  This works on just about every ride and is only $55/person.  You just show the attendant your wrist band and you walk right up to the front of the line.  The most I waited all day was approx. 15 min. in the Montu line and this was b/c I wanted to sit in the front for this free form coaster.  Which, by the way, was sick!  If you are going to ride the Montu, sit in the front.  I also suggest sitting in the front for the Cheetah Hunt.  I sat in the middle the first time and then sat in the front the second time.  Have you ever had key lime pie from a diner and key lime pie from Key West?  If so, you know what I am talking about.  If not, your life is not yet complete and please  visit Key West immediately.  Now back to the quick queue...the pass pays for itself just by not waiting in the Cheetah Hunt line.  That line was almost an hour long and I walked right up and rode it both times waiting no more than 5 min. and that was to stil in the front.  Just buy the pass.  Enough said.
As for the animals and the safari, absolutely incredible.  My wife and I took part in the sunset safari which was phenomenal and the guide (Kelsey, I think) was so knowledgable and friendly.  You get to see the animals up close and personal not to mention you pretty much have a beer in your hand the entire time since you have to be 21 to book this safari and they give you 2-3 beers per person depending on if others want their beer, how many they bring, etc.  Just an incredibly fun experience and nothing like I have ever done before.
As for the rides, the Momtu was the best coaster and the rolling rapids was the best water ride.  For the rapids, remember to bring a bar of soap b/c you will get soaked so you might as well get clean all at the same time.
If you live in Florida and haven't been to this park yet, go now!  Spend a weekend in the Tampa area and experience all that Busch Gardens has to offer.  You won't be disappointed.
It was so fun. We went on a Wednesday so it was almost empty but i love not having to be in lines. The animals were beautiful!!! Loved the elephants and the water slides!!

This place is pretty awesome and i have to admit that I wish I had more guts to ride everything! I grew up hearing about Busch Gardens, but never have I been till now. A beer company that developed a legacy that is like an adult disney. But unfortunately with less beer now.

The park is a good size and divided into sections of countries. They have Africa, Egypt, Asia, Australia and much more! It is basically a zoo with crazy roller coasters everywhere! Animals from around the world and a lot to learn about them too. Then you get to go on all that nonsense and throw your brains up. I refused to get on about 70% of the stuff. It is way too intense for me. But to all you daredevils this is heaven for you!  I went at the perfect time where every wait time was only 5-10 minutes! My friend rode everything and i did not have to wait long at all! The Florida one-day pass was the same price as an annual pass so I may return later this year. Get a picture with Elmo, feed the Kangaroos, and scream your heads off!

Being born and raised in Florida I've never came to Busch Gardens before and it was until I saw their BOGO deal that it was a sign to finally visit. Tickets are usually $80 + tax. So the BOGO deal was definitely worth the price.I came on a Sunday morning at around 11am (park opens at 10) and parking was pretty busy especially since there is traffic coming from both sides of the street. After parking you can get on a tram to get to the front of the theme park. The park has a mixture of roller coasters, mini rides from younger children, and zoo spread out throughout the park. There are animals such as tigers, lions, cheetahs, orangutans, rhinos, penguins, and more! It's cool to walk from different roller coasters and see these animals casually living their lives. The rides had decent waiting times and you definitely get an adrenaline rush after riding them. 

On this day, it did end up raining around 3pm that lasted 2 hours causing the rides to close down for safety reasons. My group was concerned because we came to Tampa for this one day and it was being wasted by the rain, but! We were in line for guest relations and BG has a rain policy which meant they gave us tickets that we can use on another day!! I can't wait to go back to ride the coasters that I didn't get to go on due to the rain n

Super clean and nice, great day today 72 degrees, park almost empty, animals all easily viewed no lines and no crowds!!! A lot of rides, nice train ride through park one way and cable car ride back, trams run quickly and parking was a snap!!
Awesome! Such a fun place. Not as crazy as Disney. More manageable for small children who get tired easy.

5 stars for Busch Gardens Tampa Bay! A Tampa Bay classic attraction, tons of exotic animals to see and interact with, great roller coaster rides and (before COVID/hopefully soon), great shows to see! The park is massive so download the app on your phone prior to your visit as they currently aren't giving out paper versions. This is an all day attraction so come when they open if you want to do everything and beat the crowds. I recommend doing at least one of the VIP animal experiences as well - the kangaroo one was really cool, will be returning and hopefully doing the Hippo one next!
Cant believe they dont have a security around and no one is enforcing wearing masks. I wont be back for a long time. My last season pass

I've never been so unhappy at a theme park in my entire life. Complete waste of a day. Spent the entire day waiting in line due to Covid cleanups and ride breakdowns.
Definitely not worth going at all.

I should have read the reviews before going but I had been to busch gardens Tampa a few years ago and it was amazing. I guess they're trying to make back their revenue losses from covid... 

$100 a ticket, paid $45 for preferred parking online only to arrive and be told that parking was full and i'd have to go get a refund. Why would they keep selling preferred parking when they knew it was full? Plus once in the park they didn't even give me a refund, but a $20 park credit which I ended up spending on ONE (1) nasty hotdog and some bottles of water. If they actually cared about customers they'd have water bottle filling stations. The only other food I purchased was 4 chicken tenders and cold fries costing $15. 

Here's the kicker: The entire day, never stepped foot on a ride. Some rides had over two hour waits and all others were shut down. On top of that, now you have to PAY to leave your belongings in a locker in order to get on any ride, either $8 for the whole day or $2 a ride I think. It's a small thing but it really made me feel that the park was trying to squeeze out every penny they could. Even the sky ride was closed. I wouldn't be upset if I knew any of this beforehand. Also, bird exhibit where the birds come and land on you: gone. 

The day was spent walking around sweating our butts off looking for literally anything to do. 
Such a huge waste of so much money and the day.

Family members are psd holders.. we went on a Monday in the middle of summer.. not smart I know.. but we did. The park was not busy. We did the Safari for Animal Encounter. I am a huge giraffe fan so that's the one we did. LOVED it is an understatement.. if this review was based off that alone it would be a 5 star for sure. Amazing amazing amazing and totally recommend everyone do it. However it only got 4 stars because it is not plus size friendly for rides. I get there is safety regulations that must be meet but the rollercoasters are not designed at al with a "plus size" person in mind. Didn't bother me much but bothered my 11 yr old nephew who wanted me to ride rides with him but couldn't.

I have been to Busch Gardens quite a few times, however this past weekend was the first time I decided to suck it up and brave the roller coasters. My partner in crime is a coaster fanatic, while I am unfortunately very susceptible to motion sickness. So I armed myself with Sea Bands, non-drowsy Dramamine and lots of courage and decided that I was not going to get sick.  For roller coaster enthusiasts, Busch Gardens is hands down the best amusement park in the Central Florida area. No other park, not even Islands of Adventure, can top the sheer amount of coasters Busch has. 

With that said, this weekend was either a really bad weekend for Busch or the economy is getting to their maintenance team. The brand new coaster, Cheetah, was malfunctioning half the day, as were Montu (we couldn't even ride it, it was always broken) and several of the other coasters were having issues. We arrived promptly at 8:30 AM (the park opened at 9:30 AM) expecting to beat the crowds to the rides, heading straight for Cheetah as soon as the doors were opened (which, by the way, they don't do until exactly on time...more on this later). Cheetah was not working from the beginning, we waited an hour at the front of the line, which hundreds lined up behind us, waiting for them to fix it. We finally did, and it was worth every second of wait. Me, the anti-coaster half of our team, was smiling and loving every second of the ride. I did end up feeling dizzy after, but Cheetah really is smooth and enjoyable. Plus it is LLLOOOONNNNGGG! If you look at the map, Cheetah snakes through almost a quarter of the park. 

The other coasters were a little too rough for me, especially the wooden coaster, Sheikra. That one was the beginning of the end for me. If there is one thing I learned from our day, it is that no amount of Sea Bands and Dramamine can keep away motion sickness when you're being jostled around at insane speeds. But I maintain that Cheetah is a great ride for just about everyone. 

#1 Tip: Arrive early, really early...like an hour before the park opens. You will have to wait the entire hour, but you'll be in front of all the other people waiting much farther behind you. The parking lot doesn't open until 30 minutes before park opening, but a line of cars forms in front of the entrance. We had a lot of fun people and car watching while waiting. And we got an amazing parking spot. 

#2 Tip: Print your tickets at home. Make sure you have a clear barcode to scan at the self-service turnstiles and you'll easily get your tickets and get into the park as quickly as possible. The turnstiles open early, they just rope off the actual front of the park until opening time. Make sure to get a little pushy and get as far front as possible. Have a gameplan in place and go directly to your #1 attraction, especially if choosing one of the newer coasters. 20 minutes after park opening and Cheetah already had a two hour wait. 

#3 Tip: If you have the extra money, the passes that allow you to skip the line are absolutely worth it. Instead of a 2 hour wait, you'll have maybe a 15-20 minute wait. 

#4 Tip: The Zambia Smokehouse has the best smoked chicken and macaroni n'cheese I've had in a very long time. Delicious.

We arrived at 9AM, but found out that the park did not open until 10AM. We came back at 10AM & most of the animal exhibits were closed i.e bird gardens, etc. Also, Sesame Street Safari of Fun was closed until 11AM!!!  Most vendor locations were closed until 11AM, too. It was 90 degree heat & couldn't find any vendor open to sell cold water!!! We brought my 4 year old granddaughter to see the animals in the zoo, but could not find anything open until 11AM. We saw orangutans, apes, a tiger, penguins & went on the train to the Serengeti Plains. If I had not 
recently purchased a gold & bronze season pass, I would not come back to the park! Why do you open at 10AM, but most of the park is closed until 11AM????? Unacceptable, Annoying & Not Worth the MONEY!!!! David Joffe

Two hours on the street just to park.Total of 4 hours in line just to enter the park and get 1 diet coke. No rides and wanted food but after the line moving only about 3 feet in 1 hour (thanks to people giving up and walking away) at the zagoria (?) I decided to go hungry as to not make children suffer any longer than necessary. Saw gorillas, went to the train and was told there would be an hour wait. Went home. Spoke with dozens of other in my many hours of waiting. Not one person was happy about the experience. And many had young crying children. Literally child abuse as there were children and adults sleeping on benches. These poor parentss could have taken their children to the beach or a park for free. Instead a family of four could easily be out $800.00 and received nothing in return. Busch gardens stole a lot of money and a Saturday from me and thousands of others. I was robbed and the fun pass useless because I will never ever return. I considered calling and demanding a refund. But he the truth is I'll probably have to wait hrs for a manager.  So ill have to accept defeat knowing I was scammed and can't do anything about it. A very well or orchestrated SCAM. Please don't waist your time and hard earned money!!! BTW no shows same outrageous price. 1st safty measure was herding humans into a very crowded tent for a tempature check with NO social distancing at all. Neither the mask or social distancing policy's were being endorced at all. The only time a made it thru a line was where they had drinks, turkey legs, popcorn. One employee LONG line. Did not have time to breath. So hand washing wasn't even an option for this poor guy.

If you're worried about covid I would HIGHLY suggest not coming here until after the pandemic. They don't take even a quarter of the precautions Disney and Universal do. People wear masks if they feel like it and aren't told to put them on EVER! Seriously saw employees talk to guests without a mask or their mask on their chin and not say anything.

There is absolutely no social distancing in lines AT ALL, I was so uncomfortable because every line I got in was packed with people, EVERY TIME I was in line the person behind me left not even a foot of space between us and ignored floor markings, which was again ignored and not enforced by employees.

The park seemed to be full of the type of people who think masks are a political thing- there was even an altercation while i was in line between an anti masker family and a black family that made myself and the people around me EXTREMELY uncomfortable.

As for the rides:
Lines were pretty long, averaging at about an hour of each of the coasters minus kumba which is closed for refurbishment.

I'd recommend purchasing quick queue tickets if/when you go, but make sure to do so online, as it took an hour and a half for me to get through the line for the ticket window.

Overall wouldn't recommend visiting at this time. Give it a few months to a year, or just go to the parks in Orlando.

Went on a Saturday. Had to wait before going in for 30 min so they could validate a guest pass. Arrived at 1pm and left at 8 pm. Only was able to go on 4 rides as the wait times were so extensive. Waited 2 and 1/2 hours to get on Sheikra. They oversold skip the line passes to the point where the express line was longer than the normal line and they were doing 2 fills from that line for every 1 from the regular line. 

They also attempted to keep people from requesting the front row. Imagine waiting for 2 and a half hours for a ride to be put in the back row by force. Rides were fun, but spent 80% of the day in line.

Nine of us were very excited to go to Busch Gardens at the beginning of January. Regardless of the cooler weather, we dressed appropriately and knew that the park would have fewer people, as students were back in school and the weather was not the best.  We were correct. However, rides were not opened throughout the day. They opened for brief periods of time and we were told due to "technical" reasons. It happened on at least 7 adult rides (not including water rides or children's). This forced long lineups on a day where there should have been literally no wait time. Some of us waited two hours for the Cheetah Run, when it actually opened.  The decision to open and close rides was done, in our opinion, due to staffing and fiscal reasons - NOT what was best for the customer.  Disappointing and not the service expected for over $110 per person.

I will say going here all my life and I loved it here the rides , the food, and the animals plus the Halloween horror nights! But this year I was very disappointed with what they did this year for Halloween horror nights. Every ride I attempted to get in line for was 70 min wait time or more. Only like 4 scare zones and no haunted houses. I'm trying to be understanding towards the fact that covid is going on but this was supposed to be exciting and fun time to get out the house, I should've not wasted the money on going and rented a scary movie it would probably make me jump more than I did at this place. Hopefully next year is a lot better.
Exceeded my expectations. The park was very clean. Everyone was very friendly. No wait times. Glad we made it when it wasn't busy-we almost got to ride everything.

What I loved most about Busch Gardens is the fact that all the animals are almost in their own natural habitat, at least as much as they can be in captivity.  I like that you can drink there and bring your own stuff as long as there is no glass involved! Water and drinks are super expensive so please bring your own drinks or bring your refill mugs and popcorn holders to get unlimited 99$ re-fills. There is No WiFi, sorry kiddos! Do not wear anything but your tennis shoes or flip-flops here because you will regret it!! Lots of walking involved. I also recommend that you wear an bring sunblock and bring sunglasses and a cap to cover your head!

Not for young kids.  It's all roller coasters.  The roller coasters are all awesome and quite long.  The all day dining is a hoax.  They make you go to to certain food stands to get a bracelet.  So if you don't want to eat there you still need to wait in line to get the bracelet and then you can go to the place you want to eat at.  What a joke.  The Smoke House for food was not good.  All the meats were to salty to eat.  The fries were good.  The whole pickles were good.  The chocolate cake was decent.  The pulled pork sandwich was not great.  The sausage was the only thing worth eating there.  The park map is impossible to follow.  We had a group of adults with the kids and all of us could not figure out how to get around.  Terrible layout. The safari was terrible.  Cool animals but you spend more time on the train not looking at animals than you do looking at them.  If you love roller coasters then it's worth the money otherwise you should probably stay away.  Also beware a lot of the rides your child needs to be 54".  My 9 year old could only do half of the rides.

Beware of Bad weather at Busch Gardens!!!!

I  went to Busch Gardens Tampa Bay on August 2nd with my husband and 4 teenagers, who were excited to experience the roller coasters.  We arrived shortly after the park opened and it rained intermittently in the morning.  Not a single ride was operating during this time.  We purchased drink bottles and ate lunch believing a ride would open at some point (because according to the app, the rides were open and had short wait times).  Eventually we heard the sound of a roller coaster being tested, so we got on line.  It sounded like a stampede of excited park goers racing toward the lines.  Suddenly, a storm began & the ride never actually boarded passengers.  At 5:30, we finally gave up & got on the guest services line to attempt to get a refund, but the customer service supervisor, Heather, was rude and condescending and did not care that we spent over $500 to NOT RIDE A SINGLE RIDE.  She said since our tickets were scanned, all she could offer was a rainy day return ticket.  I inquired as to why they wouldn't warn people that no rides were operable & explained that we felt we had been scammed.  She was completely unsympathetic.  Additionally, she said since we bought tickets from AAA...(gasp, the horror...a 3rd party....) we would need to take our issues up with them.  How would AAA know how bad our experience was at the park?  Anyone could call & claim that something went wrong on their visit.  If you accept a ticket & the name of your organization is on a ticket, you should be responsible for dissatisfied customers at your own park.  I've been to many Six Flags parks, Disney & Universal and NEVER experienced anything like this.  I'm very angry because my husband and I work hard for our money and did not deserve to be treated this way and conned out of $500.  We wasted a whole day of our vacation being miserable at your park and then we were mistreated by customer service.

I shall start by saying....this is hands down, the best theme park I've ever been to in my.life! I grew up in theme parks basically so I know a good one...they are taking great safety precautions after covid opening and I feel very safe there! 

The staff is so welcoming and friendly, the rides are top notch (but #MontuisBoss) and I love visiting all the beautiful animals! This place literally changed my life and got me out of a very bad spot. I will always love you Busch Gardens. I even turned down a job out of state just bc I still want you in my life lol crazy, maybe, but I listened to my intuition & my heart. Every day there is always better than the last...why would I ever want to give that up!?
It's a pretty good park - good roller coasters and the animal shows are really good - if you get a pass and go in the evening wait times on the rides are short

Worst amusement park experience EVER!!!

Spent almost $400 for tickets to ride 3 rides in 7 hours?!?  

Half the rides were closed for hours after a rain delay....we waited in line over an hour for Cobras Curse but didn't get to ride due to "technical difficulties" (the ride never reopened for the day). 

Park officially closed at 7pm which was crazy considering its August, in addition, many food stations and rides were "closed" 10-20 minutes before 7pm. 

The icing on the cake happened as we were walking towards the entrance when they announced the last tram would be leaving for the parking lots...really?!?

We traveled almost 1,000 miles for a complete let down!

Although the concept is very intriguing and the pricing is fair, the fact that none of the roller coasters worked was a huge bummer. We were sitting waiting for Sheikra for about a half an hour (which isn't horrible) the coaster broke down, we thought okay. Stuff happens. About 30 minutes later it was back up and running. Then, we went to Falcon's Fury and that coaster broke down. We asked for a Supervisor and Brandon the Supervisor came over and was helpful. Allowed us to go first once Falcon Fury was fixed plus he gave us a pass for another coaster (Tigris). We were okay with this, however, when we got to Tigris that coaster was now broken. We have now spent over half of our day just trying to get on a roller coaster. The Supervisor on that ride (Cassie) was absolutely fantastic and gave us a couple of passes for Quick Queue. We really appreciated that as the next three rides we tried; Mantu, Cheetah Hunt, and Cobra Curse were all broken. Thus why I am writing this review. The people and the food were fantastic and the concept is there. The excuse that they run these machines yearly is not an excuse. Also, one of the workers told us that the machines break about twice daily and the customer service person said it was a weird day and that was the issue. I mean if you want to spend your money to stand in a line... then go ahead. I do not think we will be returning.

Have been at the park for four hours and gone on two rides. Waited over an hour and a half at Cobra when the ride closed for technical difficulties when we were next. Waited the line at Falcons Fury and the ride was closed again when we were next. Unacceptable for the price of admission.

SHOCKING behavior BEWARE
My daughter made a single ticket purchase online and within 20 minutes found out that she had to cancel. 
She called and after 35 minutes of poor and demeaning customer service...they refused a refund stating the only reasonable way was confirmation of a death in the family of corona-virus!  REALLY! 
I was shocked too!
Busch Gardens used to be a GREAT place to go for a fun day...NO LONGER!
They literally drove my daughter to tears!
Busch Gardens...GOODBYE!

My girlfriend got lucky n had a random Friday off n she rather i take control of planning. So i checked my silver pass member car free guest tickets status n bam! I had three left. So invited her n my mom for a girl day out of Shenanigans at BG. I noticed today was the preview of The xmas stuff n i was hopping the place wasn't nuked. On a friday? It's actually not bad. No clumping, hardly no lines. Parking wasn't full at all either. We went around 12pm it was perfect day. Rides were most under 20min waits. Got in by 1:54 plenty of time to catch the first ice skating show! I got lucky n saw my favorite dancer perform there. I been watching this guy do his magic for the past 5-9 years. I got a second favorite but this guy is so passionate n really good translating his feelings n energy through dancing on ice. He's a show runner. I hardly ever see them both on the same stage. Meaning they have become the main Dawgs in different dates. Do i know him? Yeah, personally nope. He has videos in the social media. Im good at remembering people by how they move, found him by luck. Yeah i know i sound like a stalker but a las no. Im not lol I don't ever forget beautiful n moving things. The Day was great it was cloudy all day no rain. I went with my swimsuit under a fishing hoody. I was practically naked n prepared for rain. I rode some rides just fine but age is making me sicker faster so I couldn't ride everything, also the elephant in the room (cancer) is still kicking my ass! We got on the rapids n got hella wet! Did the bumper cars n enjoy sone road rage lol Then got silly n rode the cute little roller coaster by the horse's n yup! Jump right on them to afterwards. Mom joined us. Nothing more fun than three adults riding horsies! Lol  we shopped a little n ended the night happily. My girls needed a day like this. Watching my mother smile n my girlfriend be happy is all a gal like me needs. I am content n despite how tired i feel from my sickness. It is all i ever want for my life. My girls are happy n i get to pretend I'm alright for another day. I huge thank you to the hard working performers, ride attendants, restaurants workers n everybody that create beautiful n magical moments for us guests (especially the animals n their care tackers!). Thank you n blessings to all!

Went here on a Friday, not busy at all! Must make reservations ahead of time. They also take masks very seriously so if you don't like wearing one--don't come! Also they take temps on your way in the gate. 10/10 recommend getting the all day dine wristband. If you have a AAA membership you can practically get it for free with the purchase of a daily ticket. Didn't experience any ride closures due to covid. They also sanitize the rides frequently.
Been waiting in line for 45mins just to buy a ticket. Decided to start my review while I wait. (Only 20 people in front of me & nobody is moving.)  I'll  adjust this review as It progresses.

We visited on April 8, 2021- and it was by far not worth the money. Due to covid, there were very few good options available with long lines, and they made no adjustment to allow for patrons to bring food and drink inside the park. Poor decision on their end. 70% Of the staff are rude and completely Ignorant of what to do. When told to management staff-we were told"well they are in training". But I see no quality check system
In place- anywhere. The masks when walking around is completely a joke! I can see in line or indoors make sense. Look, if we are dealing with a pandemic, then some adjustments need to be made for patrons for cheaper or more  options on water and food or allowing patrons to bring food in. We had to experience guest services due to some issues with my parents platinum annual membership and they had no idea what to do to help and told them to email customer service. It's just sad that the guest services aren't equipped to provide a WOW customer experience. For the current cost of a day pass and the pandemic- I WOULD NOT recommend this atttractjon while visiting.

This review took a little longer to get done than I'd have liked, but I had so much fun here I wanted to make sure I finished detailing all of the individual rides first. 

The first time you visit a theme park you've never been to before is always something special. New rides, new attractions, all sorts of surprises around every corner. Busch Gardens gave me this feeling and then some. I've been to Universal Studios a few times in the past couple years, and while that's always been fun it's a different type of experience. Universal has a focus on 3D/4D motion rides, which again not complaining, but they only have two real roller coasters at the moment. Well, full disclosure, this Yelper right here is roller coaster fanatic, and as soon as I walked in the gates at Busch Gardens I looked at the park map and got a childlike giddiness I haven't had in a while. This place was my playground for the day and I couldn't have been happier. 

Busch Gardens Tampa is themed around African places and environments. The Cobra's Curse is in Egypt, while the Cheetah Hunt is in The Edge of Africa and Kumba runs through Congo, with the Serengeti Express running around the whole park. The park does an extremely good job giving off the appropriate vibe for the area they're imitating. Sure there are snack carts and restroom signs, but it's more immersive than just about any other park I've visited. (They're sister park in Williamsburg, VA does the same thing with a European countries idea instead of African theme here.) What I'm trying to say is this place is beautiful. It's an enormous theme park with world class roller coasters and more impressive animal enclosures than your typical zoo. There's almost too much to mention about this wonderful place but I'll try and go for the highlights.

 ROLLER COASTERS! Seven incredible coasters with another two being built before 2020. I've visited theme parks all up and down the east coast and some of these stand out among the best. The Cobra's Curse with it's independently rotating carts and crazy elevator lift is easily the most unique coaster I've ever been on, the giant wing and true vertical drop of Sheikra was exhilarating and Cheetah Hunt's crazy launch system, smooth ride and amazing views make it extremely well rounded and a real contender for favorite coaster of all time. 

ANIMALS! I know the topic of zoo's can be polarizing for some, and I'm no wildlife expert, but in my humble opinion they handle the idea of animals in captivity better than most places. Alligators, Tigers, Elephants, Flamingos, Kangaroos, Gorillas, Orangutans, Giraffes. Every enclosure is massive and more than allows for the animals to move about and enjoy themselves. (The Serengeti Plain "exhibit" is practically a third of the whole park.) They're are at least three different areas of the park where you can get very intimate with tropical birds (while supervised by park staff). I can't say I've been anywhere else that I've been inches away from a brilliant Peacock and later the same day get bit by a Parakeet and watch a Kookaburra nesting. It really is something special. 

It's also worth mentioning that my visit was just before Christmas and when the sun goes down you get to see just how elaborate their lights and decorations are for the season. Traditional Christmas bulbs adorned the train station while tunnels of elaborate LEDs illuminated the paths between park sections and projectors display giant snowflakes over the gates. They go above and beyond to feel festive. 

If there is anything that could be described as a "con" against the massive list of "pros" to this place it would be that they do fall victim to the curse of theme park food. Our small samplings during the day were fairly tasty, but the prices are a bit steep, the exception being the all day unlimited refill souvenir cup (which was a life saver). 

Busch Gardens may not be the most famous Florida theme park, but just because the pair of giants down in Orlando get all the attention doesn't mean this place can't stand on its own. It depends on what you're looking for in a theme park experience, but for me the cheaper ticket prices, far superior roller coaster selection and the plethora of animals make this place an instant win. I fully intend to make this place a recurring destination.

I love this place. They have amazing roller coasters and park staff are really nice. My favorite ride is Cheetah Hunt ,it is fast and scary. We have annual passes and they are a great deal. There is almost always no wait times.

Had I known so many things would be closed, I wouldn't have come. I saw like 3 rides closed online, but when I got here way more was closed. Waiting in long lines is to be expected. What's also to be expected it to have places to get drinks and snacks.  I'd say 90% of the "snack shacks" were closed. I have more pictures of stuff that was closed (food, rides, exhibits) then of things that were open. I waited over an hour for a coke, waffle cone, and a funnel cake. The long food lines wouldn't be so bad if more places were open. I am highly disappointed with this trip. I'd say the best part was the bacon cheeseburger and I could've gotten just as good for a fraction of the cost outside the park. I spent over $700 on a $100 worth day.

**BG got back to my husband on Facebook and we are going to go tomorrow and try again, so two days for the price of one.**

As a family we had a great time for the 4th at Bush Gardens.  This amusement park is geared for families so everyone has something to do and look forward to.  My only issue is with loading on the tram to get back to your vehicle.  Hopefully in the future they will get more staff there to make sure that the people next in line do not get ran over by the people behind them!

I'm be been to Busch Gardens for over 8 years and I always enjoy it. Nothing like riding the train back to the park entrance at the end of the day. It's basically like a train ride through an open Zoo. 

Do preferred parking if you planned a whole day extravaganza! When the day is over it's so much easier to just walk to your car. 

I'm always excited to return! This park is second to Ocean Park in Hong Kong to me. But by far number 1 in the US. The combination of zoo, theme park, water park, and manicured gardens is spectacular! 

This time Sheikra oddly had no line and we rode it twice in less than 20-25 minutes. Amazing!

Had some great BBQ too at Zambia Smokehouse. 

Overall, I don't know if a better well rounded park in the US. Can't wait for the little one to be able to walk and do some rides! Can't wait to come back and see all the new rides that were under construction. Always something new each time we go.

My wife went to school in Tampa (we live in California now) and told me about all the fun she had at Busch Gardens. When we finally visited, most of the rides were shutdown. We got in at 11am and waited two hours on Cheetah Hunt. Once we were about to get on, the ride experienced technical difficulties and shut down and all guests were recommended to leave. So frustrating but we figured we would go to the next ride and come back to Cheetah Hunt later. 

We decided on Kumba next and once we got to the line we were told the ride was shut down. The park pretty much just opened and the first two rides were busts. We ended up running back and forth through the park using the Busch Gardens app trying to catch open rides only to find them "closed temporarily". We were mainly hoping on riding Cheetah Hunt and the Skyride. Both were closed. We ended up spending 9 hours there and only going on two rollercoasters, the log ride, and the train. Major bust if you ask me and sort of a waste of one of the days of our vacation. 

I would avoid this place until they get it together. I don't know if I'll make another trip here.

I was expecting amazing animal exhibits...instead greeted by a Lion exhibit that was small, rundown and boring.   A large male Lion sitting by the window sucking his own tail.  Next the poor porcupine....he was in a very small enclosure with dirty water.  He was spinning by the wall due to boredom.  The lemurs were in small exhibits and had no stimulation.  The windows of the exhibits were dirty and covered in hand prints.  The only exhibits that looked refreshed were the active bird exhibit and the orangoutang exhibit.   Busch gardens is a million dollar company and I would have expected so much more.  I would not return and not recommend until some of the profits were used for the animal enclosures.  The executives may want to take note of the Bronx Zoo and the wonderful exhibits and animal care..

I'm a FL resident and have been coming here for over a decade. Even with my discount, I'll never be returning. This place is an absolute MESS. Getting in the park took an hour due to no line for will call , but an influx of people trying to figure out where to go to enter. When I tell you the "line" was 10 people wide and we were all trying to merge into some formation for 30-40 minutes, I'm serious. No one was even trying to direct us in the correct location, we were just playing follow the leader. Also,  The machines were not working once we got to the correct entrance to scan our codes, and then lines over 70-90 minutes long for rides once inside. I understand this park is one of the only ones without a mask mandate and they are well sought out because of that, but they cannot handle the amount of business they are getting, and instead of placing a capacity limit, they waste everyone's time. Not only were lines so long, multiple rides were out of use, getting stuck, and one ride told us the ride was closed while we had been waiting in line for over 30 minutes!!! I was in the park for 5 hours and rode one ride. Save your money and go to a park that actually cares about your experience. This place used to be the cheap but fun version of Orlando's parks. Not anymore. It is extremely overpriced and cannot handle their own business. And can I say they still have animals there? I saw a single tiger in a enclosure alone that was well underweight and at least 10 penguins in a lukewarm pool the size of hot tub. I did not know they still had animals due to not going in years. It's 2021, Do better Tampa.

(COVID UPDATED) 
Although the park reduced its capacity by half, the park still seemed awfully crowded to me ... however, the staff did enforce the six feet rule and the face mask rule very strictly, mind you must keep your face mask (covering your nose and mouth completely) on, even when you're riding the rides. The only time where you're allowed to take them off is when you reach certain "relaxation spots", which are placed around the entire park.
The stores are opened and some restaurants (not all), however the food seems limited/ reduced. 
My main complain is that most of the workers were very rude, I did not happen to come across a single nice staff member, which is kinda sad (bc this is coming from a kid) .

Don't fall for the Quick Queue trick. They making ride wait times nearly two hours long with no explanation whatsoever. 50% capacity and not cleaning seats or skipping seats/row DOES NOT equal longer wait times!  I haven't been to Busch Gardens in nearly 20 years, brought my daughter for the first time and this is by far the worst experience I've ever had. But wait, there's more. I decided to stay the night in a hotel and return the next day since we didn't get to do but a few rides yesterday. Saw online that the Quick Queue passes were $20 each but I wanted to rush to park when they opened. We get to the park, they scan our passes, then make us stand in a 2' x 3' box area saying their was a problem with my daughters pass and no further explanation. I ask whats wrong and they just said "please wait sir". 10 min later a manager comes back, hands the pass back and says you're ok. I asked what the problem was and she said the card shows it was scanned twice but its "no big deal, maybe someone has the same card number". WHAT???  She walked away and that was that. So, I decided to buy the Quick Queue passes at the park so my family and i can enjoy the day that was already starting out bad and to my SURPRISE the passes are now $70 EACH, for 4 of us!!! Customer service said "Thats the price when you don't buy them in advance". WHAT?!! Did the Quick Queue line suddenly get faster today and thats why the price is higher??? 

Note: We've been in the park 20 minutes since park opening and the rides are already 45 min to 60 min wait time and there's barely anyone here in the park. Good job in scheming people to buy Quick Queue passes

I'm giving a 1 star rating to Busch Gardens for their lack of customer service and scheming skills. I would give less but the app only allows a minimum of 1

I will like to say I like this place but I can't. I mean I figure out that this summer is like a couple more hundreds dollars then usual. I recommend coming at October - May. Sorry to break the new it's okay if you don't believe me but I am just helping you out.

Busch Gardens is like the Big Lots of amusement parks....I was really upset that the smoking area is right next to the ticketing counter where we are forced to wait (with children). So wonderful that we have to inhale all the second hand smoke. I went here on a Saturday and I waited in the ticketing line for at least 55 minutes. They were not fully staffed, as all booths were not open. They didn't even have fans to help circulate the air in a crowded space! Another issue was the fast pass! I paid over 150 for 3 fast passes and sometimes had to wait 15 minutes to get on a ride, despite there being no line except the general line. What's the point of paying extra....


Pros: stroller parking & tram 

Cons: parking $25, lines are horrendous

It pains me to write this. I have always loved this place since I was a child. 
I had a friend come from out of town and I took the family for the day. 
It starts with 25 bucks to park the car, which is absurd.
Then at the minimum 100 bucks apiece for all five of us.
I have no problem with that. Where the problems begin is that most the park is closed.
I felt like they sold us tickets to a closed amusement park. Most the rides are shut down and the bier garden was even closed and almost all concessions.
I found it strange that the employees were very strict  about us wearing out masks even though one of my kids has Asthma but they weren't cleaning anything. 
Not even wiping down rollercoaster grips.  Two of our family members ended up with with strep throat. 
There wasn't really even any animals to see really and the ones we did see looked sad.
I understand Covid is scary but either open all the way or close.
Don't charge all of us full price for a quarter of the experience.
It was upsetting at best and I hope you people can figure it out. Universal studios has. That's a fact. 
Don't get me wrong. I love Busch Gardens, just not at this juncture in time. 
And please check on the crocodile near the penguins. He has cataracts and his aquarium seems unkept. He's an endangered species.
Heartbreaking.

Now this Busch gardens is Africa themed but reminds me more of Arabian nights or something.  It's way bigger than the one in Williamsburg VA and you will get lost even with the map and signs. I followed all the directions and still walked for about an hour before I encountered another ride. This one also is very crowded.  I imagine because its florida the sunshine state where the weather is perfect like all the time so prepare for long lines even on off days.

I will say the food was way better at this Busch gardens. I really enjoyed the Zambia smokehouse. Expensive as hell but that's to be expected. I went during the holiday special on the 30th before nye and all the Christmas lights were up and it was beautiful.  They had tons of shows for little kids with all the Christmas characters.  This Busch gardens also had some type of animal exhibit with hippos,  lions, penguins etc...like a damn zoo lol so that was interesting for a theme park.

After being a Florida resident for 5+ years, I was thrilled to finally have the opportunity to visit Busch Gardens!

I specifically visited in the evening, so I can't speak much to the daytime activities, which includes most of the animal focused attractions and viewing areas. As a theme park, I found this place a good time!

Compared to most of the parks in the Central Florida area, this park packs a high concentration of roller coasters and thrill rides into one theme park. If that's your speed, then you'll have  great time. If you're not big on these types of thrill rides, you might be better off skipping this park. Honestly, I can't say that I saw many rides that wouldn't classify as BIG thrills. For me, that was a win though! We were able to ride all the coasters as well as Falcon's Fury, the brand new face-down drop tower, in one evening!

The park seems well-cared for and while we didn't eat in the park, it seemed like there were a lot of different options, in addition to standard theme park fare. The layout of this park was a little less organized to me than other theme parks I've visited, but that could just be because I've spent more times in the Orlando parks!

I had a fantastic time at Busch Gardens and hope to visit for a full day to take advantage of more of the animal related attractions.
I have been a Busch Gardens fan and pass holder for more then twenty years. I love the shows and rides and Food!!!

Busch Gardens is a great tourist attraction, with enough roller coasters and lines to keep you occupied for most of the day. The theme park experiences a very different number of visitors each day, so some days you may not have to wait at all for rides, then other days you may be waiting for an hour or maybe more time than that.

The season passes are a pretty good deal, but you will get tired of the rides pretty quick, and it's hot everywhere around this park, it's mostly outdoors. There's a big section for little kids to play in, the biggest playground I have ever seen. 

Service is pretty decent in the park and you really do not need to interact with workers too much, unless you are buying something to eat. The shows that they have are great for tourists or if you need to cool down under the air conditioning.

The food is delicious, but you'll have to fork over a ton of money for it. My favorite thing to get is the corn dogs and french fries in Timbuktu with a drink, which can total seven to ten dollars. They also have a restaurant inside this huge establishment that is pretty good, though still pretty expensive. They adopted an awesome buffet about a year ago.

The biggest attraction is the fairly new ride Sheikra. It is pretty exciting the first couple of times you ride it, especially the first time so don't miss it. Kumba and Montu follow in ride quality. The main thing people like about Montu is your feet hang so it feels different.

Though it was hot, it was a great time. The lines were not as bad as expected.they need to offer more seating around the rollercoaster exits though. People were using the example seats to sit in, so people could not check to see if the bars would close. The staff were super friendly even going out of their way to assist people. Food was okay, I've had better at amusement parks, but did not go for the food. The 14.99 souvenir cup was well worth the money. To be able to get drinks all day for free, or 99 cents on any other visit pays for itself.

I love the park have been going since childhood. Always a great time, fun rides, and kind employees. The rides are kept very safe, and the different shows and activities keep the experience fresh every time. Today however, there were some slow transportation times from the tram but this happens. Still always look forward to going!
Busch Gardens is the perfect mix of adventure with animals. They are practicing COVID precautions the best that could be expected. Something for everyone here and a Must Do while in Tampa.

I'm so upset cause I used to love this place as a kid. I thought I could save a few dollars from purchasing the all you can eat. Worst choice ever. The food options are worst than prison. How do I know this? I've been to prison. They clearly state that each place you go to will have desert. They didn't mention that each place has the same two items. A cardboard cheese cake and a cookie probably from the dollar store. The food is so bad if you get the all you can eat. I guess the best option to get is the circle pizza. Hopefully things will get better after covid.

Fun for the whole family and friends!
