Being able to enjoy the amusement of awesome roller coasters, the fun of the games, and the delicious tastings of their Food and Wine festival has been a nice return to normalcy. Even with their currently being no shows and a few rides down for Covid safety measures, the staff are very genuine, helpful, and understanding.

This was an unpleasant experience. Several rides "broke down" after we had been waiting in line for a long time (30 min +). We got the all-day food pass and learned the quality of the food is on par with prison gruel. 

The staff enforced none of the rules. I saw people walking around the park and on rides barefoot. People were allowed to bring bags and water bottles on the rides causing them to go flying everywhere constantly. 

The animals were emaciated and some appeared starving and sad. Everything was horrible about this park. We should've gone back to Universal Studios instead. 

Don't go here unless you find a way to go free and they give you an all-day alcohol pass for free. You'll need a buzz to get through this one.

I was happy to be one of 11 chaperones escorting 59 middle-school students to Busch Gardens, for a Symphony Band Field Trip.  Because of the bus schedules, we left late; and, didn't get to the park until noon.  We had about 5 hours in the park; and, we were able to ride all of the "big" rides, as well as some others.  Cobra's Curse was awesome; we went on that quite a few times. Kumba is the biggest and the best... well, for roller coasters.  We did Falcon's Fury, which is really something else!  Cheeta Run was awesome; it's the first thing we did; and, most of the group went along for the ride.  That is, before we split into smaller groups. Sheikra was great... food and drink were good; we ate at the Savannah Terrace, overlooking the wildlife park. There weren't very many animals out at all.
Me encantó el parque,aunq estemos en covid todavía y tenemos q usar máscara todo el tiempo.

Today, December 29th 2020 we went to Busch Garden and we really feel the new administration of these old time great park!.

The Transportation from the Parking lot to the park was no working.
Everybody was walking to the park.
The lines to go into the park were horrible, and we understand that the pandemic created certain changes but the way that the new administration organize everything was terrible.

We purchase two "all day dining" tickets, and we went to the park at 12:00 pm. At 3:00 pm we were in lines trying to purchase food.

They decrease the number of employees and and the lines were very long.
We could not eat in Three hours.

We decided to go to customer relations and ask for the refund of the "all day dining tickets".
They did not proceed.

They increased the price of the drinks to a level of Stadiums.
One draft beer cost $11.00 dollars.

This new administration (I was told, Chinese Investors) keep charging the annual pass, even when the park was close. 
Aproximately 3 months.

We have the annual pass for 7 years, but since they sold Busch Garden to another investors is not the same anymore.

Unfortunately, I am cancelling my membership.  
The quality of this park have been decrease enormously.
Awesome theme park always have new rides. I recommend getting fast pass for a better experience. The best roller coaster is the cheetah. The food is also pretty good.
It was a very boring experience, most of the riders were close, not fare all the money spend for nothing really

The customer service at this park is horrible. They are strictly money driven, not people driven. They are located in a high crime neighborhood in Tampa and it is not safe. If you truly want to take your family to a safe, fun entertainment venue, go to Orlando.

We went yesterday and it sucked.  The wait time for the rides was ridiculous considering they limit the amount of guests in the park.  It was 100 degrees and the mask Nazis were in full force.  There is no way people can wear masks in Florida walking around in 100 degree heat in the summer time. It's just a matter of time before someone dies of heat exhaustion.  Will never go back.  Rides were closed and they didn't have any maps to give out when you first walk in.  Wouldn't go again if you paid me!

Okay so if we are adding value for purchases my review would be three stars because the food is meh and you pay RIDICULOUS prices! BUT, I'm a passholder and I use that pass. I mean I've been probably 35 times so far in 2019. We use BG as our PM cardio. Power walking to the coasters with a purpose!

We are SO LUCKY to have the best roller coasters ever in our own backyard! 
I'll get to those in a second. 

First, I would like to give some honorable mentions to staff: the lady that checks your tickets with bleach blonde pigtails, girl you keep doing you! You're pleasant. I like you. Ty from Tigris! You make that ride! Seriously. Ty puts his face paint on, ears and tail and he is just a complete mood. We love Ty! Honorable mention from Tigris, the gentleman with the prosthesis, you're also a complete mood! Lovely! Genesis and Diamond that operate SheiKra, and the guy that looks like that one guy from Black Panther. I don't know your name, but all of you. Also the guy that dances in SheiKra control room. Yas! I see you! 

Kumba staff is a little uptight. I get it. Kumba needs a retrack. It's loud af and I would definitely have an attitude if they made me operate Kumba as well. Overlooked. 

Now to the coasters: order of operations is IMPORTANT in deciding your action plan, but this is how we usually roll: two montu rides. Sky ride to SheiKra. Ride SheiKra like 2-5 times depending on waits. Then maybe ride Tigris, maybe go ride Kumba. Then my child nags for drinks and we are lame so we don't have the cups. I definitely need to invest in the cups for .99 refills. For sure. Then we go wait in line for Cheetah Hunt, then sometimes we go ride Cobra's Curse because it's hilarious, and definitely end our night with more Montu rides because Montu is amazing! The other day we even went vintage and rode Scorpion. Totally bruised up over that one. 

In order:

1) SheiKra 
2) Tigris 
3) Cheetah Hunt
4) Montu
5) Cobra's Curse
6) Kumba. Can we get a retrack please!? Kumba would be incredible if it was smooth. Too bad it is SO. LOUD. AND. VIOLENT. 
7) Scorpion
8) that one yellow one that I never go on. Mehhh. 

Never again: Falcon's Fury. I've been once. I'm good. 

Also never again: eating at any of the restaurants there in the park. There's a Pizza Hut, ihop and Olive Garden nearby. There's no way in hell I'm paying $50 for four sandwiches and some waters ever again. Pub subs and re enter? Maybe! 

Either way, BG is my absolute favorite place in Tampa. Hands down. Catch me there like 2-3 nights a week. It's my favorite!!!

went here with a group of 2 on a tuesday afternoon. don't feel like anything of the traditional busch gardens experience was missing and will actually say i preferred it to pre-covid busch gardens. lines were short 15-25 minute wait times and most were significantly shorter than posted time, fairly empty park, all patrons and employees were respectful of mask guidelines and rude sanitation seemed like BG was taking precautions. The only things i would recommend is bringing hand sanitizer to sanitize after touching high volume surfaces such as coaster bars and wear a cloth face ask as the medical grade ones tend to get very moist and uncomfortable in the park. many other reviews complain about long wait times and as rides are running at half capacity i would expect to see longer wait times so if that is a concern to you then i would recommend going during the week if you can. overall great experience especially given the lack of things to do in the area during the pandemic!

Got a veterans special of 4 tickets for the family. We went today (Saturday) let me start by saying the lines to get to the parking area wore 45 min long, the lines to get to the park wore hours long (2-3) just to get in, luckily people with the tickets purchased wore going through a gate left open on the side and I went in, still waited 35 min to get the the main entrance. No one wears masks. It's not mandatory. The food lines incredibly long over 30 min. We did reservations online, looked like you really did not need them at all, I would say their wore over thousands of people their. Most sanitation stations do not have alcohol. We wore unable to ride any ride as the lines wore over 2 hours of wait. We rode the train and was good. Kids only got to ride 1 ride overall. The food was extremely expensive. 2 chicken tenders and 1 burger plus 2 fountain drinks $52. Wtf??? 1 beer, 2 ice creams $29 wtf?????? 2 coffees 1 cookie $29 wtf???? I could of went to a fancy restaurant for a couple more bucks.. their wore so many people you could not walk without being bumped into... some people skipping with their kids...some smoking wore they weren't suppose too. The lines are out of control because their aren't people directing. I barely saw any workers around the park, if you are lost you are on you're own. Would not come waste my time again.

Bush Gardens is pretty awesome but most of the fans are correct do not expect the Disney Magical Experience here. Also when the web site has ride updates and say 1 ride is not working it's a lie. When we went there was 4 rides that were not working including the only one I really wanted to ride was the Skyway carts. 

This park is loaded with poor animals listening to roller coasters and screams all day long, however the park is elite and expansive and has lots of cool options to eat, ride, chill, and hang out. The Brazilian chanting girls are the reason for knocking off a star, Disney took care of this problem and you guys should to it's highly annoying. 

The food at some grill in Patagonia was way to expensive for the quality and what your actually getting it's almost extortion as well as not having gluten-free bread anywhere in this park is the reason for knocking off another star. It shouldn't be hard to have a gluten free accommodation especially when you have these "allergy cards" that explain let a chef know.

Also if you want to get the $50 fast pass unlimited be sure you get it at the beginning of the park because you can not get it at the back of the park for some unknown reason, but I know! They do offer $30.99 at the back of the park for one fast pass but not the unlimited so we had to walk all the way back to the front of the park to get these fast passes. These did pay off however most of the staff didn't even care and don't double check you once you get in the fast line we witnessed a bunch of kids jumping under the line and no one to check them.

Plastic Animal Making Machines are 5+ and a relic of Seaworld which I love. The elephants, cats, sloths, make this place a 5 star park. The rides are also great, and this park is a good way to spend the day. You really only need about 4-5 hours at a brisk walk to knock this park out. It didn't take THAT long.. I'd come back here with family, or friends in the future but with Disney World being so close it's hard to make that call.

Great park! Lines can get a little long sometimes but if you catch the right day, you'll just walk straight up to the ride. It's nice because Disney and universal are a little further out of the way, this allows for the family and friends to have a park in town. Plus they have animals.

Literally everything is closed.  What a waste of money and $25 for parking.  Just keep the whole park closed if you can't open things.    Almost every rice and food vendor was closed.  Can I get my money back?

Plus size person review: I searched for a few days ahead of going looking for anything about being heavier and being able to ride the rollercoasters and came up empty handed. So I went with friends in town visiting excited to spend the day with them. I am 5'6 265 I could go on one ride in the entire park. Every ride had the signs below but refused to show there are size restrictions prior to purchasing tickets: I think to not post what size exclusions you have in your ride summary is wrong. Busch gardens is willing to take your money but won't give full disclosure so you can plan if your going to be able to ride any rides. I spent the day trying to get my real human size hips into seats all day but instead had to be the non rider and hold the bags all day.  I am Very disappointed  
If you are plus size or your kids or family members please be aware it's embarrassing to be excited to ride rides but get there and you can't.

As a long-time pass holder I was treated rudely today by staff because I forgot to check the NEW calendar for their new blackout dates! We were turned away at the gate, and when I went to their cashiers, they were NOT HELPFUL. When I complained on an email, I was treated curtly, and apparently no one cares that I had 4.. FOUR children, with me who all were supportive of their mom, and told me to just go. The worst part is that it was obviously a low turnout day, and that it was already 2:30pm, so they close at 8, and they decided it was prudent to send us away. Thanks. A lot.

I always expect theme parks to have long lines and be quite expensive, but this was by far the worst experience I've had yet.

I made my reservation and tried to buy my tickets online ahead of time, but the 1/2-off coupons would only work at the self-service ticketing. When I arrived and tried this, the machines wouldn't take them, and I had to wait 45+ minutes in the ticket line. When I finally arrived at the window to get my tickets and the Unlimited Quick Que pass, the employee informed me that the QQ price had been increased to $130 each! On their website and in all their advertising, QQ's are listed as only $20. Nowhere online does it say that their prices are subject to change or that they WILL jack up the prices on busy days.

When we finally got to our first ride, I was told that I couldn't bring/wear my cross-body bag in line and would need to purchase a locker! Bags are allowed in the park, but they removed the bins outside rides for loose items, so you are forced to pay even more to store your belongings once inside the park!

After 2+ hours getting tickets, finding out I couldn't have a bag, going back to my car to ditch it, then getting back into the park, we finally reached the roller coasters only to find out that even with the Quick Que ticket, we had to wait 45+ for the rides. Never in my life have we had to wait this long with Quick Q/Fast Pass tickets and because of the lines, we couldn't even take full advantage of the Unlimited Quick Que!

We've been here several times, with Covid the crowds were down substantially. The stay off at Busch Gardens and the facility are always pleasant and relaxing.

We were working on a adjustment because of Covid on senior passes. If you ever have a customer service problem or question with any of the sea world parks, go to Busch Gardens and ask for Raven, LOL, in all seriousness she is about one of the best customer service manager if you could have

This was a much worse experience than ZooTampa.  

We were really looking forward to it thinking it would be a lot like SeaWorld since they have the same ownership now.  It is much different and more poorly run.  

First of all - don't waste your money on the food pass what a rip!  There are only 3-4 restaurants where you can use it and they each have an hour or more line.   They had way too few employees - we finally left because we were so hungry.  

We went on a little safari ride where we got to feed giraffes - that was fun.  Other than that don't waste your money.   

I will not go back and I want a refund on the food pass.

Do not go if you are worried about Covid or don't want to get ripped off.  There is no such thing as social distancing and they aren't encouraging it other than their PR stands with recommendations to stay safe. It was packed. Definitely not 50% capacity.  The staff was at maybe 25% and was confirmed by an employee complaint that Austen's weren't working and not enough help. We bought the all day dining. The restaurants that offered it only had one line in and literally people were stacked in a zig zag line once you got through the massive single file line also stacked with people behind you, we waited Ilan average an hour pet food line and all of the food options is the same - basically fried chicken tenders even the ones that were designated on the map offering different foods. If you don't buy the $130 Quick Que option then don't bother going because you will wait in each line 80-130 minutes. We bought the quick que thankfully and rode most of the roller coasters and that took us 8 hours.  Don't go during winter break or you will be miserable like everyone else that was there with the same frustrations.

We went for our first time on Labor day weekend which was definitely a mistake. I thought because of COVID, things would be better but the lines were SO LONG. They definitely falsely advertise that they are not allowing max capacity. If that was 50% capacity then I never ever want to know what that place looks like if it's busy. 

First we waited about 35 mins in line for the tram car to get to the gate, then when you get to the gate there is another line for temperature checks. This line was no joke all the way down the street and probably about an hour wait outside in the heat. I understand the necessity of temp checks but why not have multiple stations or have ppl checking in the parking lot before you park, or before you get on the tram? THEN after you get through that line you of course have to wait in the 45 minute 3rd line to get into the park. 

Some of the rides were not up and running,  it started down pouring and they have like 2 restaurants in the whole park to sit in to get out of the rain, one roller coaster we waited for 25 mins and then never got to go on bc it had technical difficulties. Then we went to get food at ONE of the restaurants open, and it was legitimately a 1.5 hour wait in line for the food. When I say we spent 75% of the day just standing around in the heat, this is not an exaggeration.  Will not be returning here and will be advising my friends of the same.

I was totally disappointed with my over priced experience. I went on New Year's Eve and the cos cost of the ticket was $40 more and nothing was open, NOTHING! I had to walk all the from the back of the park to the main gate to get a water on an 85 degree day and that vendor was just opening, it was 10:45 and the park opens at 9am. Rides, shops, shows and other attractions were also shut down. Food quality, if you could find an open place, wasn't suitable for a starving pig and way over priced. Those that purchased the eat all day ticket really got screwed. Honestly, what I enjoyed most was leaving the park knowing I'll never return. I don't care about social distancing and mask, but for those that do, prepare yourself for the Bush Gardens mask patrol. They have your safety in mind but not as much as your wallet. In my humble opinion, waste of money all around.

Do NOT waste your money on this place during peak times of year. I was looking to give my daughters a fun trip on their spring break during an incredibly difficult year, and thought Busch Gardens would be a great spot along with visiting Tampa. Spent $300 on tickets for 3 and then another $200 within the park between food and drinks and everything they gouge you on. We were there six hours in high temps and did TWO rides.
Crowds were insane. ZERO capacity restrictions. Wait times on EVERY ride were 1-2 hours. 
This place should be for federally regulated with the zero regard for public safety and amount of price gouging that goes on during incredibly difficult times.

The absolute worst time I have had in an amusement park in my entire life. Decided to go to the park because of memories of fun times had when I was younger and also the fact the park has 4 out of 10 soon to be 5 out of 10 (Gwazi opening soon) roller coaster rides in Florida. Inside tip is if rides get shutdown due to weather you can get a free day at the park, but you need to ask at guest services. They do not just hand it out. I understand closing rides due to lightning metal tracks cars and everything. Rides broke down twice while in line. The last ride we were in line for was Cobra's Curse. We got in line at 5 pm and the que was 20 minutes. At 545pm they closed the ride due to maintenance. We were given a front of line pass for the inconvenience along with the 30 other people in line. Went straight to Cheetah Hunt and were told it was closed. So at 546 pm they shut it down and we could not make it to another ride with the pass we were given. So our last experience at the park was a longer then listed que, which showed 20 minutes the entire time we were in the que. So the times are not updated enough. The next item that was disappointing was how the employees appeared to be miserable. Forced to wave at a passing train each time. The que employees did not have a great attitude and just were going through the motions. Maybe mix in a hello or have a great ride sometimes. Another item that is a what the.. is the Congo River Rapids. I have been on lazy rivers that are longer than this ride. It is a circle a long que to ride in a circle with small drops that are not very rapid. I understand if it was rapid the ride would be even shorter. Longest time was loading and unloading of the ride. To end the day I waited with my family to get the ride back to the general parking area and as the tram prior to ours was leaving we were told due to lightning in the area the tram would not be running. We were told to walk. So as the rain came down I was thinking it must not be safe to be on the tram during this time. As we left I saw the trams off to the side of a parking area and the driver and second driver sitting in this lightning magnet chatting. If it is so dangerous for people that paid for so much in a day at the park, how can the park not be concerned with the employees to save them from the horrible fate. Needless to say this park needs major improvement of staff and ride maintenance. Money spent for tickets are cheaper then the mouse or Universal, but in this case you get what you pay for. I will really need to read more reviews in the future prior to taking my family for what was to be the big vacation of the year and have it be to a park that is resting on its coaster laurels and not doing anything that goes above and beyond. Get better please.

Attended Howl o Scream. There was a lack of staff and the directions on how to get to the attractions were very confusing. To top it off when we left at 1AM we had to wait in the parking lot for over an hour. We were at a stand still; it was a parking lot. I will give them credit. The haunted houses were very good as were the actors. To me the negatives outweighed the positives so I can't see myself coming back anytime soon.

Busch Gardens is a pretty impressive theme park that mixes a solid amount of high excitement roller coasters and exotic animal exhibits throughout the entire property. 

They offer a few great options for Florida residents. You can pay for 1 day and get free entry for the rest of that year (if you buy it in the first few months of the year) or they also offer the EZ pay option to pay a minimal fee of $10-$15/month to get in all year. The EZ pay options also has nice bonuses including free parking and discounts on food and in the merchandise stores.

When it comes to Busch Gardens, i'm more about seeing the animals and the bird exhibit than I am about most of the rides. The bird exhibit is really neat because you can go into their habitat and experience feeding them, which I found to be pretty neat and of course they have all kinds of  safari animals including antelope, giraffes, gorillas, elephants, etc.

As far as rides go, Kumba is not very smooth and usually gives me a headache. Gwazi is even worse, since it's an older wooden roller coaster it's so bumpy and rattling I have to check and make sure my head is still attached when I get off the ride :p. Sheikra is a fun ride with an impressive nearly 90 degree drop straight down at the beginning. I also like the Cheetah Hunt ride because it's smooth, quick and doesn't have too many crazy loops and twists. Some people might find that "boring", but I like to get off the ride and not feel sick lol. The water rides are nothing extremely impressive, but I like them all just fine.

Also, there are a few good shows here that they rotate and those are always a nice way to sit down and relax with some entertainment after walking around the park for so long. In addition, there is a special kiddies zone with a play area, kid friendly rides and meet and greets with various characters.

There are 2 special highlight events they do here every year: Howl-O-Scream and Christmas Town. I have been to both events once each. Howl-O-Scream is a fun night of terror, haunted houses and rides (see my separate review of that event). Christmas Town is my absolute favorite, with winter wonderland decorations, special winter animal exhibits and of course fake snow for us floridians who never get the real deal. 

One thing I really wish they would bring back the anheuser busch beer house, cause that was a place to get some darn delicious beer samples while strolling though the park. *le sigh*

Overall it's a fun place to go for adults, kids and families alike.

I came here on Christmas Day, it was about an hour from where we were staying. The staff here was extremely friendly. The theme park is a decent size but does focus more on animals - which is okay with me. My two favorite rides were Falcons Fury (best drop tower I've ever been on!) and Cheetah's Run (I think that's the name). The staff was extremely good at keeping everything clean and due to this, yes the waits were pretty long but at least everything was sanitary. I will say I went to the Dragon Fire Grill for dinner which was the wrong decision. I ordered a Slushee, Beef with Broccoli and a piece of Raspberry Cheesecake and it was almost $30. My husband ordered a Burger with Fries, Soda and a Cookie and his was almost $30. The portions weren't even that big! I've been to Six Flags and they have OUTRAGEOUS prices but never even spent that much at Six Flags for a meal like that. I wouldn't go back to that grill, that's for sure. I was going to get a magnet or some sort of souvenir but after that dinner, no thanks. Regardless, it was a really nice park. Would I come back? Probably not. Would I recommend? Yes.
make sure you know that they changed their days that they are closed. bought tickets worth 400 dollars a month before they changed their days and now we don't know what to do.

Busch Gardens Is my favorite local theme park. It has everything to keep both adults and children occupied. Busch gardens is constantly renovating rides and making new ones. We were not able to ride any roller coasters this visit as the children were present, but we love Busch Gardens so much that we bought year passes. This park is fairly large but easy to navigate. It is stroller and child friendly with smoking areas tucked away from all the foot traffic. We had great luck with the animals on this visit, they were all up close and personal which the kids really enjoyed. The Sesame Street area was great for my toddler and was a wonderful introduction for me as I am still getting used to taking her to theme parks. I also thought the food was pretty good for "theme park food." The children enjoyed it as well. We will definitely be back again and again this year.. with and without the kids!!

horrible lines because half the park closed. tiny park. hardly any food places open. wasted half the day in line for lunch. i'm not one to bash places, but if i could rate negative stars i would. 10/10 waste of money and time. workers seemed to work extremely lazily and slow. half of the people here aren't wearing masks, and zero workers seem to ask them to put it on.

Come to get treated like animals! Their mask mandates are ridiculous and nonsensical. They yell at all people the entire day to wear masks properly even when on a ride, outside, socially distanced. Ride operators that are barely out of high school are yelling at functioning adults as though we the customers are wayward monkeys that they are training. I was told by a park photographer that they have special cameras that only will recognize faces wearing masks! Wth! Their bathrooms were atrocious but let's make sure we have our masks on. Your mask won't protect you in those disgusting unkept restrooms.

DO NOT VISIT RIGHT NOW!  We bought passes on January 3rd, this was our first visit using our passes and they do not follow any of the safety protocols they list online.  Once you are through the gate, they have your money and they don't care about you!

1 - When we got to the security checkpoint no one was paying attention to social distancing. There was a sign but no one reminding people to observe the stickers that were on the ground. It was at this point my wife said, "This might have been a bad idea." But we hoped this was only because it was the very front of the park and there wasn't a lot of room.
2 - We walked back to SheiKra and started noticing people not wearing masks while walking through the park. SkeiKra was closed so we decided to take the train around to Cheetah Chase.
3 - No one was observing the stickers on the ground for social distancing and there was no one asking people to observe it. They were just standing off to the side in front of the station.
4 - We got into line at Cheetah Chase. We had to wait in a line outside the entrance where no one was observing social distancing.
5 - When we entered the line the young woman at the front didn't remind us to stay on the stickers or keep our masks on. She simply said, "Go ahead."
6 - We waited in line for an hour with NO ONE following safety protocols. I have two pictures and a video to prove this. We tried to be mindful of the people in front of us but the people behind us were inches away, even touching us at times.
7 - There were multiple people who were not wearing masks in line.
8 - There was no reminder coming over the intercom while we were in line that reminded people of social distancing or wearing a mask.
9 - There was no one going through the line making sure people were social distancing or wearing their masks.
10 - Even when we got to the front, the employees ignored people getting on the rise not wearing masks! 11 - After we got off the ride we walked around to other rides and every single line had the same issues.

We entered the park around 11:30am, by 3:30pm we were already leaving because of the issues above.
I have reached out to their customer service number who told me that there was absolutely nothing I could do. I used the pass and it was done. I left work early on Friday to go to the park and talk to customer service who told me they had the ability to refund customers stripped away because there had been so many similar complaints but gave me an email, BGA.GuestInformation@BuschGardens.com , but told me messaging the park on Facebook messenger was the best way to actually speak with someone. He was right but after explaining it again to them about these issues and asked for a refund because they are not following the protocols that they promised people. You don't know that they are lying on their webpage until after you visit the park, and even if you walk in and then walk out because you see that they are not following their own safety protocols they will only give you back 50% of your purchase because you have used your pass.

It is a scam.

What other theme park let's Florida residents "pay for a day and play all year"?!  Purchase your one-day theme park ticket by May 31st and you can come to the park for free for the rest of the year. 

I'm a theme park junkie and will never get sick of Busch Garden's roller coasters!  They actually have more roller coasters than most of the big theme parks in Orlando.  One of my all-time favorite roller coasters is Sheikra, which is a floorless, thrill ride that takes you over the edge of a 90-degree drop then stops for a few seconds as you stare straight down before dropping.  I wait in the extra long line for the front row because I love that "I can't breathe" feeling from the top of the coaster!  

This park has it all... it's like a mini zoo with a safari ride, zebras and tigers... shows for both the young and old... a kid's area with kiddie rides and games... and all-you-can-eat-and-drink for $29.99 (adults).

Minus one star for Anheuser-Busch no longer owning the park and doing away with free beer and beer school.  Party pooper.

Busch Gardens has always been one of my favorite places to go while in Tampa. I worked here for almost 2 years and enjoyed every minute of it. They have updated a few of the rollercoaster rides out there but my favorite have always been the Montu and Kumba rollercoasters. I'm not sure if they still do it but the best deal was always the all day dining wristband. It lets you eat a meal at any restaurant for a flat upfront price of about 40 dollars. You could also get buy one get one beers at participating restaurants. You also must stop at Twisted Tails for a salted pretzel/bacon pretzel/sausage pretzel! They are freshly made, and taste absolutely delicious!

Christmas town was fun to experience! Since I went late at night lines and parking were not bad. My daughter enjoyed everything there despite her being tired. I just hate how expensive Busch gardens is for their food and beverages.

First time to Busch Gardens Tampa in about 5 years. Bought a special $99 two park ticket with plans on going to SeaWorld and Aquatica. Had an amazing day at SeaWorld. Woke up next morning to go to Aquatica and decided it was going to be too chilly most of day - barely breaking 70 degrees. So we quickly changed plans and went to Busch Gardens. Quick one hour drive from Orlando. Parking needs some work. Parking lots were really disorganized and crazy. Staff could care less. Tram was clean and quick. Got into park quick and started our day. Overall, had a good day. Looks like Busch is putting tons of money into Roller Coasters. Some really amazing ones. Shame they done take care of other areas of park. If you were in an area near one of the roller coasters, the area was nice - Clean - taken care of. If you were in an area that did not have a coaster, you felt like you were in a cheap carnival. Lots of stupid games you had to pay for, overflowing trash cans - just not the nice areas. We even saw a sign at one ride with words misspelled. Come on Busch Gardens Tampa - get your act together! Maybe hire a quality control team who simply walks around and documents issues - radios them in to a team of people to help fix these issues. Slap some paint on a few things. Clean a few things? Oh, and your staff? Most staff we came in contact with were just not interested and miserable. It's a shame. Let's talk food - we ate at some huge place - Fire Grill? It used to be the big German Fest Place. First off - take or two rows of tables away! The tables and benches are so tight, people were literally walking on benches to get to areas to sit? Secondly, get rid of the stage and cheesy rock n roll show - reconfigure the different food areas. We waited in disorganized lines - people thought they were lining up for Asian and found out they were in the Italian. We waited a solid 45 minutes in line - only to deal with the two most miserable staff at the Mexican Cantina line. They could care less what we wanted to eat - they were the slowest people ever! Our family was next to order and three times they ran out of something - ran out of cheese, lettuce, chips and don't try to order the taco salad - we don't do those taco shells anymore - the one we advertised when you got in this line. You need expediters to help replenish / maintain food from kitchen to front line. Quality control? Again, get rid of that stage, reconfigure and make it a fantastic food court.

You have to reserve a day due to capacity limitations , and you have to wear a mask. They stop they rides maybe every hour or so to sanitize. We went on a Sunday and there were very few people there. You could zip right through the lines. A few attractions weren't open. 
The roller coasters were great! The drop tower was amazing.

I had an experience at Busch Gardens today with my friends. The amenities including the Christmas lights, food, and rides were great. However, the workers were rude, un-informative, and short with myself and others I watched them encounter. I will not be coming back just because of the workers.

Busch Gardens is always a good time!  We went on a Wednesday & still busy.  Best rides are the Shiekra & Montu.  Best deal for a 1 day ticket is online for $50.  Have been also in Williamsburg..will be back

What a waste of money folks, two of the BIG rides were closed as well as most of the shops and eatery. I know COVID is still a thing but that didn't stop them from charging full price for tickets for half a park.

We visited Busch Gardens for the Winter Christmas last night and the entire experience was lack-luster.  First, we ordered annual passes on-line, but then had to talk to the call center to correct the passes.  To say the call center experience was painful would be a HUGE understatement.  Then we arrived at the park around 6 PM, but the trams from the parking lot were limited, so a very long walk with a 3 year old was faster than the trams.  At the ticket window, there were only about 10 groups of people in front of us, but the process took about 30 minutes.  When it was finally our turn at the window to exchange our on-line passes for an annual pass, we found that the call center had made an error and put two passes under the same, but wrong name.  The employee at the ticket window was very helpful, which is the only reason for 2 stars instead of 1 star.  Finally, we were in the park, which was nice, but getting food was another painful experience.  Even though the park was nowhere near capacity, the food lines were long and painfully slow.  We finally decided on a shorter (but still long) line and got sliders and beer cheese soup.  Beside the slider being over-cooked and cold, have you ever tried eating soup with a fork?  Yep, no spoons and a passive aggressive employee response of take the fork for soup, or you get nothing.

After a long walk back to the car because the trams were still running very slow, we wrapped up the evening being very disappointed.  I know that Busch Gardens is an institution in Tampa and my review, and others, won't make much of a difference to park management.  But maybe it will cause them to step up their game (at least a little), such as exiting the call center that creates nothing but frustration for customers.

Went to Busch Gardens Today. We had reservations,we are season pass holders. After we paid to park. We proceeded to main gate and was told it would be 3 hours before we could enter the park. We arrive at 1:00. 
We had reservations and was not told while paying for parking that there was a three hour wait. They really had no idea what was going on or what they were doing. Beware if you make reservations and buy tickets you can get in when there. Stupid Stupid.

Was excited 2 take my kid n his wife there while on leave from the army. Was disappointed! Lines for rides were 3hrs long unless u pay more  to jump line. Which that was almost twice per person what we paid for tickets.  So only got 2 get on 1 coastet.Then after 1/2 the day is gone found out its extra 4 everything they wanted to do.. I thought it was like the old days where u paid the ticket price n everything was included.. how wrong I was. Very disappointed n it ruined my kids trip.

I understand lines on rides, but long lines at restaurants are ridiculous. Why are so many of the food places closed? 

I also understand that they cannot enforce everyone but the mask wearing rules are non-existent here if you're worried about it. Even employees are without masks.

WE HAD A BLAST!! It was a a lot of fun, no long lines, perfect weather. The longest line we waited in was 30 min. Went on a Monday though. The WORST part was you had to wear a mask the entire time. We took ours off when we could. Also did the giraffe feeding encounter again it was awesome!! But we had to wear our masks for the entire time even during pictures. But it was worth it to feed and be that close to giraffes!!
One of the best places to go. It is cheaper then Disney. I can looking forward to taking my little kid here.

Worst customer service! The short version is Busch Gardens made a mistake, it was THEIR mistake, they cancelled our tickets accidentally. So to get tickets, we had to pay current prices, which were more than the previous prices we originally got. TERRIBLE SERVICE!

Adults and older kids can ride Rollercoasters, adults and grandparents can watch shows, and young kids can enjoy all the rides at Sesame Street Safari of Fun! I've been going to Busch Gardens years, ever since I was a little kid! I liked Busch Gardens better when Anheuser-Busch was operating it and gave free beer, fireworks, and snacks. Busch Gardens was also better in 2018 but it's also maybe unfair to judge the park now with reduced capacity, covid restrictions, and the unemployment benefits crisis due to people being paid more not to work than to work.

While Universal's Islands of Adventure is better for  older kids and adults, Busch Gardens really offers a lot more rides for younger kids. Busch Garden's Sesame Street Safari of Fun is much bigger than Dr Seus Land at Universal. Most of Disney's Magic Kingdom is pretty young kid friendly with exception of their Rollercoasters just like Busch Gardens also has the added benefit of lots of animals on display kinda like Disney's Animal Kingdom! Universal and Disney has Busch Gardens beat for innovative food selections, movie tie-in, ride quality, theming and overrall feel. Busch Gardens food selections need a lot of work as most places just have subpar overpriced burgers, Pizza, and hot dogs aside from the seasonal festival foods. However, Disney & Universal theme parks are comparatively much more expensive for annual passes but only a little more for a one time pass. Busch Gardens let's you come back all year with a fun pass for the price of a 1 day admission! Unfortunately, Busch Gardens is way too spread out and it requires way too much walking in comparison to other theme parks in Orlando. 

I really hope Busch Gardens management can bring back more live shows at the Pantopia Theater and Pantopia Dragon Fire Theater, bring more popular concerts, offer a greater variety of foods at restaurants, offer a greater variety of foods at festivals, and offer more types of rides than just Rollercoasters like 4D Rides! If managment could duplicate all the international food offerings at the superior International Food & Wine fest of Busch Gardens Williamsburg VA that would be awesome!

Best to go Early AM
 

If you are going to the park to see the animals it is best to arrive early and head straight to the serengeti portion of hte park. All of the animals are more active in the early am and late day (usually after the park closes) Staff at the park starts arriving at 4 AM so these critters are up early to. By 11-noon they are all ready for their naps and you will find many just bing lazy and napping. Not always fun for the kids. Best time of year to visit is the winter as there are less crowds (except during holidays).

Ticket counter lady didn't know how to handle seasons passes and guest tickets. Entire sections of park are closed--I mean whole sections of the park!  Kids play area in Sesame Street section is mostly closed. The little rides are open but there was one operator who was working two rides (but can only do one at a time) so there was a good bit of waiting here. The kids can't play in the tree house either. Pretty sure I haven't see more sour faces on my kids at a park like this before. First time we ever left a park without buying toys (they couldn't find any in the shops that were open). Waste of time for young kids during COVID restrictions. 

The roller coaster lines seems short, but none of my kids are old/tall enough for these yet.
The park should up their food menu the food sucks hire some good chefs, taste like cafeteria food .  Adventure island really wasn't that clean they should renovate it.

Today's park experience was the worst. Two and a half hours to get into the parking lot.  Then two hours at the Zambia Smokehouse to get food.  Only two lanes open. Only three cashiers open. Food cold.  I am not a happy customer.

I was hoping to get more pictures but I was too busy riding the rides. The park is pretty large and unfortunately the full train line was down for maintenance as was the sky ride so I definitely got a workout. The pluses you can experience both animals and extreme rides all on one place. I had already been to the zoo but there are a few items here not at the zoo like lions. The cost as part of the Tampa city pass which I bought for $100 and included this as a place to visit is a great deal. Even if your paying full price it's no more than comparable parks. There are many great coasters. I rode all that were operational. I would note several are in the top ten globally in terms of number of inversions with two having 7. Also one coaster is in the top ten for longest track. The lines were non existent on this day which was another plus. Note I visited during the week on a Monday in October. They have plenty of lockers to put your valuables which is another reason I didn't get many pictures as these coasters I would advise putting the phone in the locker while riding.

There are several shows but we were focused on rides. With no lines we easily rode all coasters by 3 pm and took a 1 hr lunch break in the giant pizza hall. The food was ok while I had a pizza that tasted pretty good the mozzarella cheese sticks had sat under the heat lamp too long and had firmed back up. The cup for soda is pretty essential while it's around $15 you get free refills all day you buy it. The best part is that there is a coco cola freestyle machine that provided all the choices I like in soda. 

The first ride Sheikra was amazing. It takes you up the incline and then suspends you briefly at the edge before the drop. It was very smooth and a good ride. I liked it and felt it was in the top coasters I've ridden. Also Montu felt like I was in a fighter jet with inversions leading into tight turns. 

The park of course is beautifully landscaped. The only negative is the layout is very difficult to navigate there are several dead ends and a few areas where you'll backtrack to get to another area. They do have an app with gps to tell you where to go but it doesn't habe bathrooms on it. Like other parks the bathrooms will be well hidden and difficult to find so be warned try and go way before you need to as you may not be near one or you'll have trouble finding one in some parts of the park because they are well disguised to blend into the buildings.

Busch Gardens is not like it use to be. I think the old gardens is nicer. They use to have the safari Jeep ride instead we have to paid extra to get into the safari. Now the safari is a train ride through the animal area. The use to have two free beer gardens. Now just one. And the beer only limit to two small cup. 

The show at Busch Gardens is still good. The animal show, singing show, popular Elmo show, ice skating show are attraction to the audiences. I like the cheetah run. They show a live cheetah at their top speed to go after the pray. 

If you go near the Christmas time, they have the Christmas town. The entire park lit up at night. It is beautiful to see from the sky lift. I still like the bumper car ride. They now has some crazy roller coasters. It definitely shake your stomach and brain.

Busch Gardens is part of the City Pass program which helped make our trip to Tampa very affordable. We arrived Friday midmorning. I'd recommend preferred parking if your not on a tight budget. Although there is a tram for general parking, preferred is a reasonable walk to the entrance at only a few dollars more.

Rain had a large impact on our experience within the park. I understand Tampa is an area with daily rain. That said I expected an amusement park built there to take that into account and have measures in place to make a rainy day still enjoyable. My expectations were not met. The most surprising was the park has major issues with water drainage. Many walkways flood and pool water. I noticed the roofs had no gutter system and therefor poured water on to guests. In addition, many outdoor exhibits had leaks so even if you found cover from rain you may still get wet. With rain comes lightning, then ride shutdowns. In fact, we only were able to experience the park safari train as all other rides of interest were shutdown. That primarily left food and shops still open; which of course cost more money.

The park appeared very clean and it wasn't crowded. One aspect that made the experience more enjoyable was the opportunities to get very up close views of animals. Some really great photo opportunities exist in this park. I was the closest I've ever been in my life to lions, gorillas, hippos, and birds. It was a great experience.

If you have ever been you know how much fun it is.   If you have not.  You are truly missing a good time.   The food is okay.  Very expensive.  I  would suggest you eat before you come and bring snacks and drinks. Well, off I go.  Rollercoaster here I come!!!

went on a saturday. big mistake. insanely packed. 2 hr wait for rides. all day dining thing is a rip off. 1 hr or more wait for crappy food. nowhere else really to eat. many things still shutdown. def not as cool as i remember as a kid. and what happened to the beer tents? did i imagine that from years ago or did seaworld do away with it when busch beers sold it? waste of $300. ended up at a pizza hut

My wife and I are annual pass holders and we really enjoy spending as much time at Busch as possible. We will typically visit once a month for four or five hours. We rarely ride any of the rides (my wife will ride them more often than I do) because we mostly prefer to check out the animals, shows, and food. 

I really love the meal plan here as well. It's $35 and it allows you to have an entre, side or dessert, and a drink once per hour. My wife and I will usually share each meal, and we typically will get two meals while there. Another benefit of the meal plan is that you can have unlimited bottles of free water from any of the snack stands, as well as buy one get one on snacks and boozy drinks. All that kind of stuff adds up quickly in a theme park, so the one time $35 purchase is well worth it.

The animals are great as well and the trainers are super knowledgeable. We recently got to see one of the trainers giving some of the tigers a snack, and she was super helpful in explaining the ins and outs of taking care of tigers in captivity.

All in all, this is a great park. So why do I only give it three stars? It's not consistent. Several times in the last couple of months there have been unexpected closures of various snack booths (the tea shop, the frozen cocktail station) during the middle of park hours. Those are things that I look forward to and we haven't been able to enjoy them as we would like. Additionally, the last time we were there, the Dragon Fire Grille was closed for a private event. I get that those private events happen, but there was no signage earlier in the day letting folks know that it was going to close early. We walked by around 2:00 PM and saw things functioning normally, but when we stopped back by at 5:00 PM, there was a sign showing it was closed. A sign at 2:00 PM letting folks know that it was closing early would have been appreciated.

Don't get me wrong, this isn't going to stop me from coming back. However, it is disappointing to keep seeing things that are closed with little or no warning.

Was on a trip in Florida but didn't want to deal with Disney and since we are mostly into roller coasters, this was a much better spot for us. Came on a Thursday in early March. Parking was easy, but was surprised they were only running one tram to the main gate (at half capacity due to COVID), so we ended up hoofing it. 

Didn't take too long to get in since we pre-purchased tickets online. The park is a bit meandering and kind of tough to walk through but is also a big loop. We knew it was going to be a bit of an atypical experience because of COVID and came with an open mind. Like everyone probably does we started the day at Cheetah hunt and a 45 minute line. We were worried the rest of the day would be like this so from our phones bought the speed pass (which is more the day of than purchasing in advance). We ended up skipping this line, but the rest of the park had relatively minimal lines (as did Cheetah Hunt later in the day).

Much of walking though the part was a bit strange due to how little was open. They had some food and beverage stations, but through the whole park only three full restaurants were operating. Unfortunately we didn't realize this so ended up walking halfway around the park at lunch time. 

Since I have family in the area, I'm sure we'll come back again one day, but likely not for a very long time.

This is a theme park, so be prepared to get just that! It's pretty fake, with lots of tall roller coasters, some of them quite fun, and many themed areas. 

The real selling point for people of all ages here, are the interactive animal experiences. From having birds land on me to petting and feeding wallabies and kangaroos to just watching the more exotic apes, tigers, lions etc. play in their very well crafted and maintained environments; this place is hard not to fall in love with.

There are all kinds of shows there, as well. From street shows with break dancing and magic to free live shows (like their jungle on ice skates show which is super weird and fake but beautiful) you will probably find something you enjoy.

I went on a mildly rainy day, which in my experience is the best day for any theme park. 5 minute waits on rides, little lines and not too crowded everywhere, which is really nice. Don't miss Sheikra!

We attended Busch gardens Halloween party for children (with Sesame Street and Elmo) they gave away candy and had arts and crafts for children to play. The candy for trick or treaters was extremely stingy! I'm talking ONE individually wrapped gummy bear was handed out! I think the premise of this was to compete with mickeys not so scary Halloween party but I have to say, they couldn't compete. The crafts were coloring sheets and a silly dance party. I feel our local library does a better job comparatively. We hope next year they take our feedback into account. The park in general has become lackluster as the years have gone by (have held annual passes since 1996) however the prices seem to keep creeping up.
Busch Gardens SUCKS! I have honestly never been to a worse amusement park. I would rather swallow my own fist than go here ever again!!!!!.... RUN WHILE YOU CAN!

I visited this park with my daughter, we drove from Miami FL.  We got there early before park opens to secure good parking and to ride the rides early. Thank God we did because after 2 pm the park starts getting crowded.  

The food was ok and the beers where awesome .

This place is awful. We got there and every ride was down except two. We waited in line for the Cheetah Hunt for 1 hour just to find out they were shutting the rides down. We rode 2 rides in a matter of 4 hours. When we walked out of the park we saw that the park was still accepting tickets instead of kindly warning them that the rides were all shut down. Once we got out they had shut down the tram and we had to walk all the way back to our vehicle. Overall it was a wasted 300 dollars. Now we are able to see why tickets are on sale because of the rides being closed. I would not recommend visiting the park. There were some animals but they all looked hot I just don't recommend it. Don't come here.

Mostly happy here but my issue is standing in line for so long & seeing empty seats on the ride. Why not ask for single riders &
sometimes 2 to take the spots? I watched 1-2-3 seats left empty...in a row. Please improve this, it will move the lines quicker!

Why 2 stars?  Because there are 2 good rides.

   ---   ---   ---

I'm probably spoiled from growing up in Houston (Six Flags Astroworld) and spending many summers in Cleveland (Cedar Point.)  Astroworld was unfortunately closed down in 2005, but they had about 12 big thrill rides before going under.  Cedar Point is the #1 park in the world with 17 roller coasters and a handful of other thrill rides.  Busch Gardens has 5 roller coasters, and 3 of them are either boring or just painful.  

Gwazi: 1/5 *****

Do not ever ride this.  It hurts.  It is not fun in any way, shape or form.  There is a sign outside of the ride that says, "New smoother track installed for 2011."  I don't want to call this a lie, but it's completely untrue.  Is that a nicer way of saying it?  The track feels like it was installed in 1968 and has never once even been sprayed with an ounce of WD-40.  I would actually give this ride a negative rating, because you will need a deep tissue massage when you're done with it.

Kumba 2/5 *****

It's not painful, but it's a ride that you could fall asleep on.  It's incredibly boring as there are no feelings of "G-Force" at any point.

Montu 2/5 *****

Similar to Kumba, but slightly more exciting.  There are no G-Force moments, but it has the slight edge over Kumba.  We'll officially give Montu 2.2 stars.

Shiekra 5/5 *****

Shiekra is a great ride.  Being suspended at the top of the hill as you stare down at your death is awesome.  It's even at about a 110 degree inverse angle to add to the horror.  No matter how many times I ride it, I am nervous waiting in line.  That's when you know the ride is good.  I got a couple of butterflies just thinking about it.

Cheetah Hunt 5/5 *****

Cheetah Hunt is a pioneer in the new generation of roller coasters.  As we move forward, the days of the 200, 300 and 400 foot hills will slowly dissolve with new thrill rides.  Cheetah Hunt does not have any huge hills, but the ride is all about precision of the turns and placement of quicker, smaller hills with speed boosters built in.  The G-Forces are plentiful in this ride despite its biggest drop only being 130 feet.

Animal Exhibits 4/5 *****

The Lion area was definitely the highlight of any animal sightings.  There was a large window into one of the Lion's den that was gathering a huge crowd.  One of the Lions was standing on the ledge trying to directly interact with the people watching.  He/she was standing upright and pawing at the window in a non-aggressive manner, and it was a sight to be seen.  

The animal exhibits are a nice touch to the park, but they definitely create an incredible amount of walking space to get from one attraction to the next.  Be prepared for a ton of walking.  In terms of any animal related attractions, Lowry Park Zoo is a much cheaper alternative.  LPZ is only a couple of miles from Busch Gardens and has just about everything you would find at Busch.

The bottom line is that Busch Gardens is essentially good for two roller coasters.  You could walk in, ride Cheetah Hunt, ride Shiekra and leave.  Unfortunately it's a pricey ticket for a couple hours of line waiting and four minutes of coaster riding.

Ever been a bit more than pleasantly surprised? I am vacationing with teen boys... yes, the hard to please demographic. Ugh! aww man! I dragged them out of bed this morning, hustled them to get into the car. Sped to the complimentary bus pick up point (bus almost left us - note the bus was pulling out exactly ON TIME!). The dreaded looks I got on the hour ride from Orlando.

So you see five stars right? Those skeptics I dragged out of bed this morning had the time of their lives!

The assumption was "gardens and animals with one or 2 mediocre rides." Now they can't say one bad thing. The thrills of the rollercoasters, the shows, the train ride through the mini safari, the food, the deserts (the deserts were GONE before I could get a pic), no complaints.

So I would STRONGLY advise first time visitors like myself to get there for the 10am park opening and head to Cheetah Hunt rollercoaster FIRST. We got there at about 10:45 and the wait was already 50 minutes. Next, the Cobra's Curse - that was 45 minutes. All other rides were 15 to 30 sometimes less. I was told by a regular, those lengthy wait times happen because those rides are the first to open. So best to get there early, get them done, then cruise through the rest of the park.

The event/shows schedule can be picked up with the nap at the front gate. Super easy to plan your entire day so that you see all you want to see and do all you want to do.

Rides for all age groups. Exciting atmosphere. And the lights at night are beautiful. 

Truly a fun day with teenage boys!  Will return next year same time with the entire family!

This place has grown so much over the years. As a local the value of the annual Fun card is amazing! As they say pay for a day and play all year!! The annual pass offers free parking as well as a 20% discount on food and gift shops in the park. 
My favorite place to eat is at the Zambia Smoke house in Stanley Ville. It has the best pulled pork and coleslaw!! It is also very close to Sesame Street safari play area where we spend most of our time. This play area has tons to do, plenty of kids rides and a large rope bridge style jungle gym for the kids to climb over the entire area! 
Jungala is another fun area for kids as it has a tree top area for kids to explore as well as 2 splash pads (there is one splash area in Sesame Street play area as well). So it's a good idea to bring bathing suits even if your kids are too small for water rides.
Since this place is half theme park and half zoo we like to spend half our time in Africa!! This is where you can go to see the lions, elephants and hyenas! My favorite animal to visit is the hippopotamus!! This hippopotamus area is the best I have ever seen as it has both an above Water exhibit and an aquarium style area where you can see the hippopotamus swim with the fish and ducks! 
We come here very frequently, especially during the weekdays when there are less crowds! They have many events through the year with live music and fancy food pairings that can't be missed! Oh and try the fudge at sultans sweets it's amazing!!
It was a great experience we did the Safari saw all the animals and got chance to feed the giraffes

I went with my nieces on a Tuesday. Most of roller coasters weren't working, the kiosks for refreshments were closed. Only two restaurants were open, the food sucks, it wasn't hot, just warm. Soda was $4.20 the beer was $12.00 for about 16 ounces.

I like Busch Gardens Tampa Bay but I feel like the cost is a little excessive. We went on two different occasions and the first time there was an no school day For local kids so it was extremely busy and even quick queue was 45 minutes. The second time was much better although we ways to 20 bucks on quick Queues per person lol can't win but I do feel food and drinks were over priced

My Home Town theme park. What's not to love? You've got a world class zoo, you've got excellent song and dance show. You've got killer rides like Sheikra, Cheetah Hunt and Montu.. All of this and then you've got the special events that they have all year round: Musica Latina, Bands, Brews and BBQ, Summer Nights & Kinetics and of course Howl-O-Scream.  There's nothing like this park in the world. I LOVE IT!

Terrible experience beginning with the inability to park vehicles in a timely and professional manner. Mgt standing around while new help is not trained properly. Many of the booths at the food and wine festival were closed, not staffed, including at least 2 of the wine booths. I have seen a continuing decline in the overall operations and guest experience in the last several years.

Busch gardens in itself is great. BUT I feel like their pricing is outrageous. When you compare a ticket price from Busch gardens to Disney.. Disney is a few dollars more. I think that Busch gardens needs to lower their prices. Especially for people with small children. The Sesame Street areas nice but not too big and mostly over crowded since it's the only spot in the park that is geared towards little kids.

Over crowded and understaffed. That sums up the entire experience. It is a given that there will be lines at parks, but the lines were exceptionally longer than what should be allowed. All lines are more than 60 minutes long.....to include lines for food and water. 1 hour wait for chicken strips?? C'mon. We arrived at 10am and by 2 pm we rode 1 roller coaster, got one drink, and got to ride the train for only half the distance, as they force you off. We paid to wait in lines and nothing more. Not all of the food places were open, which led to more overcrowding at the couple places open. In fact, most were closed.

Zero covid protocol enforcement, except when it comes to skipping seats on rides. As long as you have a mask on the ride, you can walk about freely without wearing a mask. This includes the minimum employees who are barely working. All photos were taken from a position where an employee was standing watching and not enforcing anything.

Bathrooms needed serious attention, as did all of the over flowing trash cans within the park.

Do NOT waste your money until they can hire more employees, otherwise prepare yourself to pay money to stand in sunny lines, suffer heat stroke and dehydration all while getting maybe 3 rides in for the day.
This place doesn't do much for any less than 54 inches. Kids couldn't ride much,kiddie  land too babyish. 4-5 rides were down all day, place is ghetto

What a disappointment. Tried to come for beer fest, but apparently it's only on the weekends. They don't tell u that until ur in the park already. Came on a Wednesday and even though there weren't a lot of people which was perfect for me, hardly nothing was open, lots of the rides were close and the entire park closes at 5. Don't waist your money and come on the weekdays, definitely not worth it! Honestly don't even waist you money to come here unless you get a really good deal of 50 dollars or less per person for the entry. This place has really gone down!
Too many rides & attractions were shut down - my family was disappointed. NOT worth the money. Not at all.

Love Busch Gardens! Been coming here for years. Being Florida resident, I feel like I get a good deal for my money. Because of the variety of things the park offers, one can have fun every time. Today, for example, we were in the area, so popped in for a stroll and looked at the animals. Spent a couple of hours and had a pleasant day. When we have more time or feeling up to it, we'll come back and ride the coasters. Speaking of, they are building a new ride at the moment. I feel, like they are always adding more rides or updating/improving the old ones. Good times every time. We don't have kids, but we see many families with small children. There's a whole area dedicated just for them. Small kids friendly rides and all.

Alright.  I have been to Busch Gardens many times since living in Tampa Bay and always a good experience.

Let me start by prefacing that I am a chicken.  The Sheikra is NOT my thing.  I would prefer to stay on the ground and gnaw on a turkey leg while drinking a beer and watch the monkeys play.  Now that that information is out of the way, here is my review:

Great theme park at a good price.  There is a lil sumpin sumpin for everyone at Busch Gardens.  If you are a thrill seeker, there are several roller coasters.  My favorite is Montu (because I'm a wimp and this one doesn't have a big drop), but I've been on all of them at one time or another.  Cheetah Hunt is a very smooth and awesome ride, too.

If you are into animals, there are quite a few.  I was bummed that they shut down the African Safari ride last time I went there (yes, I know it was a kids ride, but I LIKED it).

The shows are really great, too.  Last time we were there we checked out the sing off show and the Sesame Street show (am I a child?).

All in all...  BG is where it's at for an inexpensive and fun day at a theme park.

Just renewed my platinum annual pass to all parks, already visited park and they are very organized with this COVID-19 pandemic. You must wear mask at all times (except eating/drinking), employees remind you as well, they do have smoking and relaxed non mask areas throughout park. Not crowed at all longest wait time was 60 mins for Tigris new coaster. No shows happening yet though:( hopefully soon. Definitely buy the $14.99 refillable bottle worth it for 99 cent refills all year! Rides are cleaned after every few rides, will definitely be back! Me and my group felt safe!

I have been here a few times, and I am a platinum passholder. Today I will give it one star. They are so full, yet only about 1/4 of the food serving places are open. 1&1/2 hours to wait to pay for 4 star prices for 2 star food=1Star.
Check out this Yelp review for Busch Gardens Pet Kennel! https://www.yelp.com/biz/busch-gardens-pet-kennel-tampa?hrid=zAhophhF-R04OTRteELgyw&utm_source=ishare&utm_campaign=ios_review_share_postreview
Good rides, the waits weren't too bad. Pretty much comparable to the Williamsburg one but this one has a lot more animals which makes it feel like you're at the safari which is an added plus.

We are so lucky to have Busch Gardens down the street from us. I grew up in Virginia Beach, VA and the Williamsburg location was always a joy to go to as a child. I'm glad that my kids and I have this option. The meal deal is totally worth it. We stayed until closing and the weather was perfect! I highly recommend buying all tickets online before showing up. The premium parking is not much different than general when bought online.
Busch Gardens does not care about people with PTSD or the animals. They do fireworks most nights during the summer. They have NO respect for the people that live in the community or the animals.
Great time great place iam a annual pass hold can't complain. Plus live in Tampa so I go every chance I can. Fun times for me my friends and family.

Had a really good time. 

We started with one person leaving their pass home. Customer service was stellar helping us thru the issue. 

The park was packed yesterday. We purchased the Quick passes. They were worth every penny. Rides with 90-120 min wait times were shortened to
10-15 mins. We rode every ride and saw all the shows. The passes made a HUGE difference. 

Why 4 stars? The bathrooms are disgusting. Nasty dirty water everywhere as the hand towels are across from the sinks. Toilets and stalls need updating.

Been several times during Covid and felt very safe. We get there right when they open and leave as it gets more crowded. They are limiting guests so you must get a reservation online before coming. 

With a preschooler, we look at the animals, ride the train and spend time at the Sesame area. 

Parties are seated every other seat on the train and at the Sesame shows. 

Hand sanitizer stations are prevalent throughout the park (especially the Sesame area). 

Masks are enforced unless you're eating/drinking for anyone over the age of 2. And yes, I did see an employee tell a family to put on their masks!  

Only exception is at the splash pad. But easy to social distance while we've been there.

I've been going to this park for years, and love it. I understand Covid is impacting every business, including the parks in Fl. The park was not crowded, lines for rides were reasonable even given many rides were not open. They seemed to rotate opening & closing rides, which was fine. The park was clean, and the staff was nice. 
Many of the food courts were closed and again that was ok, Except the food that was available was absolutely Terrible. We paid almost $50 for 2 meals, Asian fusion- chicken teriyaki and it was disgusting. It was tossed in trash. 
I would recommend packing PB & J sandwiches to take in. Save yourself.

LOVE this place! Absolutely a great place to visit when in Tampa, you won't regret it. The prices for admission are fair and the staff is knowledgeable. I love the theme and environment; a mix of nature and fun. Which is what their logo symbolizes! It's a roller coaster tree, pretty interesting. The park has some interesting history behind it. I also like how it's a nice park but it's not overly big and not very small. With events throughout the year it makes coming to Busch Gardens exciting every time!

Great place! Good food stands and the like to choose from. Plenty to see and do. Full of thrill rides, which are my favorite, so it's one of my favorite amusement parks to visit. Dippin Dots and riding Montu a ton of times just makes for a fantastic day

Let's start  by saying that I realize this isn't Disney or universal studios, however for the price of admission you would think it is! The quick que there version of a fast pass is a complete rip off. (Supposed to get first  in line with it at  all the major rides for an additional $30 per ticket) the ride attendants just seem to ignore it at first. The bathrooms are disgusting. Food is not fresh. No one working any of the games and most of the attractions are closed. Save your money for a legit park.

This amusement park has something for everyone, young & old. It's best when the weather is mild - temperatures over 85° can be unbearable. You definitely get your exercise, walking from ride to attraction to animal enclosure and back again. The months of February & March were the best times to visit this year - good shows & cool temperatures with no rain. We also enjoyed going when the park first opened in the morning, for the best parking places and when the crowds were thin. 

I've lived in the Tampa area since 1959, when the park was free and the parrot shows, brewery tour, & free beer were the highlights of the park. It's grown, and so much of the park is wonderful to just look at as you walk around. If you are a couple, to save money consider buying one annual gold pass and one annual fun pass. The annual gold pass includes complimentary preferred parking, digital photo pass, 2 complimentary passes during non-blackout dates, and a complimentary safari.  It pays for itself!

Busch Gardens during normal times has a bad tendency to be a bit of a mess with poorly dispatched rides, non existent service at F&B locations and a park that requires you to go way out of your way to get anywhere.  Unfortunately during Covid times they have taken it down a notch with no enforcement at all of their own rules.  

Tons of guests with no masks and no one wearing them properly and we never heard anyone working enforcing it.   No social distancing of any kind in the ride or food lines and employees not even trying to encourage guests to do it even though they had markers on the ground. It's like Covid doesn't exist at Busch Gardens - and that's not a good thing.

As someone who has been to Disney World three times in the past year and every other theme park in Florida at least once, I like to think I'm pretty good at reviewing theme parks. Please note that this review is basked on when I went, on a Sunday during Food and Wine Festival on a concert (Cole Swindell) day, so there was probably more people in the park than most other days of the year. 
PROS:
-CHEAP.
 One day (Friday-Sunday) pass to Disney- $122. 
Three day pass to any of the follow parks for any days: SeaWorld Orlando, Aquatica Orlando, Busch Gardens Tampa or Adventure Island Tampa- $110 (Undercover Tourist).
You can not beat that price!!! 
-Short Lines
Because of the amount of attractions and the size of the park there most lines are short. The longest line I waited in (Cheetah Hunt) was 40 minutes. At Universal or Disney this would be seen as a short wait. 
CONS:
-Rides Break a lot.
Both times I have gone to Busch Gardens, my experience has been effected by rides breaking down. It really puts a strain on the day when you have it planned out which rides you are going to when, and  you get there are two rides in a row are broken! Seems like a big issue there. 
- Food is nothing to ride home about.
Although I did not purchase it, my mom and brother purchased the meal plan. for $20 they could eat once an hour and have up to 24 drinks (non alch) a day. THIS IS A GREAT DEAL. I did not buy it, and paid $18 on just one meal: Entree and desert. For the rest of the day we all shared food because of the meal plan. Also, it was nice to be able to go get bottled water whenever. I would highly recommend this and will be purchasing it if I ever go again. BUT: The food is nothing great. You can tell all of it is frozen, pre-made, and made in HUGE quantities. But to be fair, I experience this in all theme parks except for Animal Kingdom and Epcot.
 

All in all, I would highly recommend Busch Gardens to a family looking for a day of inexpensive theme park fun. But remember! The best deal for multi day, multi park tickets is on Undercover Tourist!

Don't even think about coming between October and February. Over 6 rides are closed and the few others that are open only have one car operating making the wait times insane. This makes the relatively low crowds seem a lot worse because of the single car operation. Shekra and Montu have swarming wasps that stung several people at the top of the track. Overall I wish I could get a refund for a day wasted sitting unnecessary lines. The only good thing was the new Chick-fil-A.

I love this park!  fun rides and amazing animals I'm a passholder and I have been since I was a child and I have so many amazing memories. It's a great place to visit and now with all this crazy covid stuff they are handling it nicely lots of cleaning and mask enforcement in the parks. It's a must visit when you come to Florida!!!

A day of misery.  Over an hour in line to get to parking lot.  Another hour and half to stand in line to get to entrance.  I'm not kidding..lOnly the major restaurants open, very few small food carts open so forget grabbing a dippin dots, or water or whatever.  Waited about an hour at bbq place, gave up, went to the Serengeti overlook restaurant.  Lines even worse and slower.  Waited about hour and half and never even got close to door.  Feeling like we were going to die, headed back to bbq place.  Line even longer.  Hour and half later, gave up to just head home.  Don't even buy the day of meals cuz you would just be standing in lines for hours and hours.  Unacceptable.  Sorry we went.  Seeing the animals was nice, the safari train was good and the lines in the kiddie area weren't bad at all.  It was the Friday before Easter, but they require reservations to buy tickets so they knew full well how many people would be there.  Never again for us.

We have had annual passes for 3 years now and enjoy going on a monthly basis.   We love going to the animal keeper talks and learning more about the animals.   The "hospital" is a great stop in the morning as you get to see a lot of different procedures on a variety of animals.
