I recall writing a review about the numerous times I've taken my daughter to Busch Gardens. I'm a fan but not as much as I am of Disney. We always had a great time. It's a full day of rides and libations. I don't drink when I have children in my care. Hahaha. I did back then. 

You can enjoy Busch Gardens as an adult. I went with my boyfriend for a day. Naturally it's all about the beer. It's a beautiful place. I'm sure I can find photos to post. I think you're better off visiting if you're staying in the Tampa area. Definitely visit if you're a beer lover. Beer was always my weakness! 

Bring your wallet full of cash and credit cards. That's my best advice!

I feel terrible updating my review to a 1 star from a 5 star, but I feel like I have to based on our experience on Saturday. There is definitely a safer way to operate during Covid and nearby theme parks are doing it right. (Rating drop was due to Covid safety precautions, park cleanliness, ride wait times, food line wait times, etc) 

We made reservations well in advance and purchased passes for Saturday, 11/28/2020. We are aware that Covid is out there, but have felt safe during our Disney World visits and assumed that Busch Gardens would be taking their safety measures on their website seriously.  We were wrong and disappointed. The park was packed. It was the second busiest we've seen in 20 years of being passholders. We saw probably 25%+ of people without masks and no staff was asking people to wear them. 

Due to the park being so crowded, the rides that were open had 65 min wait to 140 min waits. (A lot of rides were closed while we were there, so call ahead). 

All in all, we won't be returning anytime soon. The risk for us isn't worth it.

I love Bush gardens. We had such a great weekend and the weather was perfect for November. If you don't purchase the ride pass expect long waits. We only rode one ride beside of the long lines but we didn't want to pay 200 for a pass either. We just enjoyed walking and seeing the sites and different shops around the park. Will definitely go back!

Don't arrive when they open.  Lines a mile long. Not an exaggeration. Preferred parking actually a negative as it drops you off at ticket gate entrance but line to enter stretches almost to remote parking lot. 
So your day at Busch Gardens starts with horrific line. 
Sea World better alternative. Better organized.

I just finished my first year pass for Busch Gardens and Sea World.
It was the best gift that anyone's ever given to me.
I went to all the special holiday events and shows.
I saw all the concerts on all the stages and the different ice shows.
The sky view is really fun to go over the park and see everything.
The animal park is huge !!
The animals are well cared for and well fed
I took the train many many times to see the Animal Park.
My favorite meal are the plate of baby back ribs -- it's big enough for two people.
Before leaving I would pick out a carmel apple or have a huge ice cream waffle coone.
I used a meter to count my steps and used the park as a work out to be active

Horrible...apparently they let a lot of people go and now the park is not operating at full capacity and there are lines everywhere, worst than pre-covid!!

Restaurants are partly closed and food selections are worst... no healthy options for adults or kids.

It's like if you were to combine carowinds and a really cool zoo. Everything is clean and kept up with. The animals look healthy and happy for the most part. 

There is a petting zoo with kangaroos and birdies that you can feed and pet. There are also two aviaries that you can walk through. One of them you can buy a tiny cup of juice and the lorikeets will land on you and be your best buddy until the juice is gone. Be warned though birds like to perch and give little love bites.

There are elephants, lions, a cheetah, a tiger, and a bunch of other animals. Pretty much everywhere there isn't a shop or a ride there is more zoo. It's the best use of space I've ever seen in an amusement park.

The rides are fun and well maintained. The queue system is a bit odd. There is a quick queue ticket line and the regular line but once you get to the end of the line it's kind of a free for all. I was surprised at how well behaved the other park goers were even though it was a mix of different languages and cultures everyone waited their turn respectfully, with one exception. 

There was one jerk who tried to use the express line without a pass and the attendant was nice to him. When he started to yell at her she turned very sarcastic while still being very professional. When he finally gave up she apologized to us and we went on our merry way. It was neat to see someone remain cool under that kind of pressure.

At night around 5 parts of the park closed but it was lit up for Christmas. The train ride changed to a sing along Carol train. From Skyride cable cars you can pretty much see all of the lights and pretty decorations. Kiddy area is also all decked out.

This park gave me so much to do that I forgot to take pictures and check in. It was overwhelming and amazing and this is probably my favorite amusement park now. I'm a sucker for birds though so I might be a bit bias.
Sigh.  Screaming and banging on things is Not scarry.  WTF was that fiend show?  A disaster.

Yalllllll. I always have a blast here, PERIODT.


We have season passes (which we spent WAYYY too much on but we don't care- it's fun). 

Firstly, we have passes so we have preferred parking. Sometimes if the park closes at like 6and we pop in at 3-4, they don't even have an attendant for parking and you can go on thru no matter if you have a pass for all.

They take your temp.

You must make reservations due to COVID19. If you're buying at the gate put "0000000000000" as hour ticket number for reservations.

Then it's go time! We go to the back of the pro first to Tigris, then we work our way thru.

This isn't Disney and it's not Universal... it's not magical and employees aren't giving you the best experience ever..but if you take it for what it's worth it's sssooo fun

When I lived in FL, I used to come to BG very often.  This place is great.  It seems they keep expanding the park more and more.  I chose to come during the week because it would be a little less crowded.  We got there and immediately started doing some of the rides.  The lines were not that long, some waits were only about 10 minutes.  One of the new things they offer was the Serengeti Safari.  We met in a designated spot 15 minutes before the start of the tour.  They will explain what will happen, then they ask you to put your belongings in a locker.  After they walk you to the area where a truck is waiting for you.  This is a standing tour, you will stand in the bed of the truck for the whole tour.  It was awesome.  You see some of the animals very closely and we even fed and petted a giraffe.  How awesome is that.  I love the Congo River rapids ride, it's the big yellow one that seats about 12 people.  This ride used to be a little drier back in the day, but now, people can wet you from the sides while you pass.  My friends' thought they were going to end up dry, however almost at the end of the ride got soaked.  It was so much fun.  I don't do roller coasters, but my husband and my little girl did Kumba, which is one of the worst.  Even my girlfriend, who loves them said that this one leaves you rattled.  Yikes!  My little boy and I stayed safe and sound on firm land.  There was so much to do, we were not able to do everything, you probably need a couple of days at least to do most.  We were there for 7 of the 8 hours they are open.

Rides were fun. Staff was VERY unhappy/unfriendly, with the exception of Chief on one of the kiddie rides. The place looks rundown and is in need of some major upkeep - paint, cleaning, etc. Even the animal viewings were mediocre. Just overall disappointed in what I remember Busch Gardens used to be like 20 years ago.

Busch Gardens overall experience was good.  The issue I have was waiting in lines for their "Dine All Day" option.  When you pay for this option, one should be able to get some food when and where you want.  That isn't how it worked. In fact, last night at the Smomehouse Restauran, we were in line for 50 mins when the employee created a new line since it was so crowded.  Good idea, terrible execution...they took everyone at the back of the line (who just arrived and hadn't been waiting for 50 mins) and put them in the new line.  Every single person who had already waited 50 mins had to wait an extra 20 mins while these folks who just showed up waited 5 or 10 and got their food.  We were so frustrated!

Bush Gardens leaves much to be desired. From its lack of staff, to dining options, to the much needed park renovation... I wouldn't go back! 

Tons of rides are closed, or temporarily closed due to maintenance or mechanical issues... dining plan sucks!

If you're for thrill rides, Busch Gardens will not disappoint. 

We purchased a fun pass back in July when we visited & was able to use it once during our stay, which is good until the end of the year. We did this because we planned to come back during the holidays to use it again, so we were able to get 2 more uses out of it. 

Parking is $30, unless you have some sort of annual pass where general parking is covered. You then get in line for a shuttle to bring you to the park from the parking lot, but honestly, sometimes just walking to the park without the shuttle will get you there even faster, especially when it's crowded & lines are long. They could use a few more of these shuttles to keep the lines & waits shorter. 

Lines can be long & hectic, so best to plan accordingly. We didn't look into it, but I believe you can purchase some sort of fast queue to shorten or bypass the general line. Not sure how this works, or how much, but info should be listed on their site. I do know they have limited quantities on this. So if you're short on time, or just don't want to wait in the long lines, you may want to take advantage of this. 

We've rode Cheetah Hunt, which is our favorite so far. We even got to ride it one evening where they did the fireworks show, so it was a great experience to ride this while fireworks were going in the background. 

We've also rode Montu. For some reason, this ride is usually our first ride of the day & then we just make our way through the rest of the park. Tigris was also fun & we have tried to ride Cobra's curse 3x on all 3 different occasions, but either there is always maintenance going on, or the line was over 2 hrs. 

Most of the times aren't always accurate. I feel like we get through the line faster than what is displayed. 

We also enjoy disneyworld, but when it comes to thrill rides, I highly recommend Busch Gardens. 

I heard Iron Gwazi is being built & should be open to ride sometime in March of 2022 & will be known as North America's tallest hybrid coaster & the fastest & steepest hybrid coaster in the WORLD!

I love Busch gardens so much but today I felt transfer my life when one of the skaters had to call her fiancé because she thought I was watching the show too many times a day because of her it wasn't because of her I was watching the show four times every time I go to the park because I love it is Christmas on ice but some certain skater took it personal and called her fiancé to come to the show today at 2 o'clock and I could even watch a show at all today because of that I will be going back to Busch Gardens tomorrow because I love Christmas so nice I love Christmas town and I love Busch Gardens

Our family has had annual passes for years and enjoy going to BG. They have all sort of things for everyone in the family---kiddie rides and Sesame Street area for youngsters, roller coasters for thrill seekers, train rides, ice show, animal safari encounters, animal viewing and educational areas. They even cater to school field trips. The park is so big that you could spend a full day there. They have shuttles available to take you to and from the park to the parking lot. Handicap and stroller parking available. Food is just ok with plenty of options. They have a good stuffed pretzel place and bbq place. But other options are just typical theme park food quality. They also are good about doing monthly promotions for pass holders. 

We've gone on the animal safari before which is an additional cost on top of annual pass or regular admission but reasonable. And it's quite the adventure. They take you out on a safari truck and you can actually feed the giraffes! Amazing experience and highly recommend this. Including so pictures of that. 

Rating 4 stars as I'd like to see the restrooms cleaner. They tend to smell like they mop the floors with urine.

Why 4 stars? Because my first review was unfair.

   ---   ---   ---

I think I was just too used to living near a park that's known for super thrill rides. 2 stars, Busch Gardens does not deserve, though.

When you compare it to all of the other parks in Florida, and most around the country, BG is great, and probably the best value in Florida.

A one day pass at Disney costs $95. $95 at BG lets you come back all year. BG is also significantly more fun than Disney.

BG doesn't have the amount of thrill rides that Cedar Point does, but no park in the country can claim that.

BG also has a freakin zoo, and cool events like Howl-O-Scream and Christmas Town.

I don't really know what I was thinking with my original review.

The traffic and crowds made this visit a challenging day. All things said and done it was definitely not enjoyable.  

We arrived half an hour before the park opened and traffic was snarled in every direction.  It took well over an hour to get into the parking lot.  By that time most people around suffered from various forms of road rage and anxiety issues.  We had preferred parking so we didn't have to do the tram thing.  

The flow was heavy going into the park but security did a good job of getting everyone through at a good rate.  We grabbed a beer and headed to the nearest roller coaster.  The Montu line wasn't too bad.  45 minutes.   Over to the cobras curse for an hour and 45 minute wait.  The only thing making it bearable were the air-conditioned portions of the line.  

Headed to the dragon fire grill and the lines were horrible.  The food court was jam packed with people.  We chose from the Oriental bar and nothing was remarkable or impressive.   Thank goodness it's owned by a beer company and you can find beer around every corner.

We headed for the Shiekra and then the sound that you never want to hear sounded in the background.  Thunder.   Yup.  It took about 15 minutes and the only ride left open was the carousel.  The radar looked like it might slide by so we found some cover (with a beer of course) and waited for the rain which never happened.   

Boredom persisted so we went to go view the animals.   Halfway through our walk we heard the announcement that the rides would not be reopened.  To the parking lot we all went.

After spending alot of money on tickets, AirBnB , etc....  We got to ride four rides, eat lacklustre food, pay for overpriced beer, all in the midst of Lord knows how many thousand angry, agitated, and ornery people.  It just wasn't a positive experience for me.  Hopefully you'll have better luck. 

Thanks for the read click a button below and let me know what you thought.

I like Busch Gardens, but the park is pretty small compared to other amusement parks so that is why I would only rate it three stars.  That said, Busch Gardens has vastly improved over the years.

While Disney ticket prices have increased Busch Garden tickets have decreased dramatically.  You can now get a season pass for practically the same price as a day pass!  Busch Gardens most recent additions have been the Shiekra roller coaster, Cheetah Hunt roller coaster, Rhino Ralley, more shows, and more animals.

My favorite roller coasters are the Kumba and the Montu so I always try to ride them at the beginning of the day so I can avoid the long lines.  As I get older the Shiekra gives me panic attacks and I can no longer ride it, but if you are a thrill seeker you will love it!  The Cheetah Hunt is one of the more tame roller coasters and I can usually convince my mom to ride with me.  AVOID THE GWAZI!!!!  This is the worst ride in the park and will toss you around until you either get a headache or throw up.  Chiropractic adjustments are required after you ride!!!!  If you must ride this roller coaster save it for the end of the day or you will feel terrible for the rest of the day at the park.

For the 21+ adults there is a fun Busch beer class.  The class is about an hour long and you get to try a ton of free beer samples.  

I only think Busch Gardens will get better over the years.  They own a ton of land that they haven't developed yet so they can easily double the size of the park when they are ready.
Always a good time. Always changing seasons and things to see especially around the holidays. Christmas time gives Florida the Christmas feel without the cold. Win!
When they stopped giving away free beer, I stopped coming to Busch Gardens. Fair is fair.

I will start by saying simply, don't go here. 
The park food was terrible. The layout of the park was confusing and disorienting. The staff enforced zero rules. We watched people walk around the park and get on rides barefoot. The staff were unable to count and incorrectly put the right number of people on rides causing others to have to return to the line. The park was generally dirty and in disrepair. Rides would "break down" after we had been in line 30 minutes for them. The animals looked sickly and sad.

We love Busch Gardens!  We visit the park often, as we are annual passholders (includes parking). We love the rides, the entertainment, the animals and just the atmosphere. 
We have spent days just doing thrill rides and other days just walking around and trying to see the shows. The bottom line is one day just isn't enough. 
We were there yesterday at opening and had a 30 minute wait at Cheetah Hunt. From there, we did Montu (10 min wait), falcon's Fury (5 min), Scorpion (20 min), serpent roller coaster (25 min), Kumba (10 min) and Congo River Rapids (50 min). Right after the Congo, all rides were shut down due to lightning, so we decided to check out Iceplorations. Kids and adults enjoyed this show... And it was inside. A great place to relax In the AC. 
We ate lunch at the restaurant near the Scorpion and were able to watch the show. The food was better than expected. Specifically, the rotisserie chicken. Kids meal portion was small with three very small (think McDonalds size) chicken nuggets. 
We purchased the refillable thermos with .99 refills (ice water refills are free) and cup can be used throughout the year. 
I truly don't think you can see/ride everything in a day, so buy a pass and enjoy your time.

Coming from CA, I couldn't help but compare Busch Gardens to Great America. 

Both parks have:

- relatively cheap tickets, and with Busch Gardens, military get in for free once a year!
- short lines during low season
- Top Gun = Montu = favorite rides
- Rip Roaring Rapids = Congo River Rapids 
- expensive food
- cheesy themed kids zones

Busch Gardens does have the zoo aspect, but I feel Great America has more roller coasters. Overall great fun for roller coaster thrill seekers.

The park should be investigated for criminal behavior. They charge full price but do not disclose that more than half of the park's rides and restaurants are closed. They pack more people in than the park can accommodate at current service level. 
On the website, they show two rides down for maintenance, but once you get in, you'll find that only two roller coasters are running, and they have 160-190 minutes wait time. We wanted to take the train through the zoo. We waited for over three hours to get on. By the time we got on the train, it was dark. The train operator joked that we won't get to see anything, it's basically just a form of transportation now.
On the website it states you can eat at six+ restaurants with your meal deal, but once in the park, you'll find that only 1 restaurant is open and it has two-hour wait time for a soggy slice of pizza.
We were unable to see any shows, people were lined up to see the show after the next show. No thanks.
This park is a hellish nightmare. I would not go again if it was free.

Things are getting out dated and it is not as clean as it used to be, it is becoming run down and service is extremely slow, took us an hour and a half to wait in line and get lunch. I am sure all of this is based on their staffing shortages though.

Had a great time ! They were good about mask mandate .( especially for the ones still fearing no masks don't worry they enforced it ) the lines weren't too long about 30-40 minutes . Can't wait to come back

It's a lot of fun for the kids and family. For the summer nights they used to perform an awesome late night show with fireworks at the end but they changed it corner pit stops with DJ and drinks. I prefer the show and fireworks.

So, here's the thing. If you have grown up in Southern California and been a frequent visitor of the San Diego Zoo and the San Diego Wild Animal park, then the "zoo" aspect of Busch Gardens is pretty lacking. And if you have grown up going to Disneyland and Magic Mountain, then the roller coaster aspect of Busch Gardens is also pretty lame, as nothing is "themed" out at all and the coasters aren't as good. So, compared to these other parks, Busch Gardens is mediocre at best. If you have NOT been to these other parks, then it will probably seem pretty cool. 

I was also little surprised at the cost (especially considering the fact that this park is so mediocre) - $77 per adult ticket, plus a $5 fee per person (WTF?). That is on top of the $13 for parking. That puts them at $6 more per ticket than Disneyland and $43 MORE per ticket than the San Diego Zoo. WAY overpriced. And the park isn't even that big. So, we were pretty disappointed.
